original: po yi ge hri brgyad bkod la de las byung ba'i kha dog dkar po 'od zer rnams kyis bsgrub bya'i lus las dug bkug la yi ge aa la 'jug cing khu tshur gyis sdud pa'i rim gyis sa la bskul bar bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: po yi ge hri brgyad bkod la de las byung ba'i kha dog dkar po 'od zer rnams kyis bsgrub bya'i lus las dug bkug la yi ge aa la 'jug cing khu tshur gyis sdud pa'i rim gyis sa la bskul bar bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine that by the process of gathering with the fist, it is expelled into the earth.

original: de'i dgug pa la kha dog @99b dkar po dang dug rengs pa la nag po bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de'i dgug pa la kha dog @99b dkar po dang dug rengs pa la nag po bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: It is taught that for summoning it, one should meditate on the color white, and for paralyzing poison, on the color black.

original: nyi ma'i dug ces bya ba nas nad las thar bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'i bar du ni phyi dang nang gi nad rnams sos pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: nyi ma'i dug ces bya ba nas nad las thar bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'i bar du ni phyi dang nang gi nad rnams sos pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: From “the poison of the sun” up to “will be freed from illness” teaches the healing of outer and inner illnesses.

original: mtshon cha la sogs pa glo bur gyi rgyu las byung ba dang zhes pa ni mtshon cha brgyab pa las byung ba dang / sems can dang sems can ma yin pas byas pa'i nad rnams so //
analyzed: mtshon cha la sogs pa glo bur gyi rgyu las byung ba dang zhes pa ni mtshon cha brgyab pa las byung ba dang / sems can dang sems can ma yin pas byas pa'i nad rnams so //
translated: “Arisen from the causes of sudden weapons and so on” refers to those arisen from being struck by weapons and illnesses created by sentient and non-sentient beings.

original: mngon spyod kyi rgyu las byung ba ni zhes pa la /
analyzed: mngon spyod kyi rgyu las byung ba ni zhes pa la /
translated: “Arisen from the causes of killing” refers to

original: de bzhin du sngags la mkhas pa'i pha rol po'i drag po'i las las byung ba gang yin pa de rnams phyi'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sngags la mkhas pa'i pha rol po'i drag po'i las las byung ba gang yin pa de rnams phyi'o //
translated: Likewise, those that arise from the fierce actions of an opponent who is skilled in mantra are external.🔽Those that arise from the causes of discordant elements, impurities, and food are internal.

original: khams dang dri ma dang kha zas mi mthun pa'i rgyu las byung ba ni nang gi'o zhes pa ni khams kyi skyon ni rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan dang 'dus pa rnams kyis bya ba'o //
analyzed: khams dang dri ma dang kha zas mi mthun pa'i rgyu las byung ba ni nang gi'o zhes pa ni khams kyi skyon ni rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan dang 'dus pa rnams kyis bya ba'o //
translated: The faults of the elements are done by wind, bile, phlegm, and their combinations.

original: dri ma ni dri ma bsdu ba las byung ba skran la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dri ma ni dri ma bsdu ba las byung ba skran la sogs pa'o //
translated: Impurities are the collection of impurities arising from tumors and so on.

original: kha zas mi mthun pa ni nyung pa'am lhag pa ste de la nyung ba la skem nad la sogs pa dang / hag pa las ma zhu ba la sogs pa de rnams nang gi'o //
analyzed: kha zas mi mthun pa ni nyung pa'am lhag pa ste de la nyung ba la skem nad la sogs pa dang / hag pa las ma zhu ba la sogs pa de rnams nang gi'o //
translated: Discordant food is insufficient or excessive. Among those, insufficient food causes emaciation and so on, and excessive food causes indigestion and so on. Those are internal.

original: de rnams gzhom pa'i phyir re zhig dang po rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa gsum gyi nad pa'i lte bar yi ge h'um yongs su gyur ba las rdo rje gnod sbyin mche ba rnams par gtsigs pa drag cing rno ba g-yas brkyang pa las gnas pa /
analyzed: de rnams gzhom pa'i phyir re zhig dang po rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa gsum gyi nad pa'i lte bar yi ge h'um yongs su gyur ba las rdo rje gnod sbyin mche ba rnams par gtsigs pa drag cing rno ba g-yas brkyang pa las gnas pa /
translated: In order to destroy them, first visualize three beings, Vairocana and so forth, and in the navel of each is a syllable hūṃ, which completely transforms into Vajrayakṣa, with bared fangs, fierce and sharp, standing with right leg straight.

original: sdigs mdzub dang rdo rje gsor bar byed pa bsams te /
analyzed: sdigs mdzub dang rdo rje gsor bar byed pa bsams te /
translated: He makes a threatening gesture and brandishes a vajra.🔽From the syllable kaṃ, which arises from the heart of the patient, visualize the disease in any suitable form, such as emanating and so forth, and draw it out from the patient’s mouth.

original: des yi ge kam las byung ba bsgrub bya'i snying ga'i phyogs su spro ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa gang yang rung ba'i nad drangs pa'i kha nas byung ba mdun du rdo rje gnod sbyin de nyid kyis rdo rje brgyab pas phye mar btags la rang gi lag
analyzed: des yi ge kam las byung ba bsgrub bya'i snying ga'i phyogs su spro ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa gang yang rung ba'i nad drangs pa'i kha nas byung ba mdun du rdo rje gnod sbyin de nyid kyis rdo rje brgyab pas phye mar btags la rang gi lag
translated: In front of the patient, Vajrayakṣa strikes it with a vajra and reduces it to dust.

original: pa la gnas pa'i 'bar ba'i rdo rje la sogs pa'i me'i 'od kyis bsregs par 'gyur zhing thal bar gyur par bya'o //
analyzed: pa la gnas pa'i 'bar ba'i rdo rje la sogs pa'i me'i 'od kyis bsregs par 'gyur zhing thal bar gyur par bya'o //
translated: Burn it with the blazing vajra fire and so forth, which is in your hand, and reduce it to ashes.

original: de'i tshe nad rnams 'joms par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe nad rnams 'joms par 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time the diseases will be destroyed.

original: de'i 'og tu ye shes sems dpa'i 'od zer gyi tshogs kyi gzugs can rnam par snang mdzad dang spyan ma la sogs pa'i tshogs spros la /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ye shes sems dpa'i 'od zer gyi tshogs kyi gzugs can rnam par snang mdzad dang spyan ma la sogs pa'i tshogs spros la /
translated: Then, one should imagine that the host of light rays of the gnosis being in the form of Vairocana, Locanā, and so forth emanate,

original: snyoms par zhugs pa las byung ba'i byang chub sems kyi rgyun gyis de rnams la dbang bskur zhing bsgrub bya'i lus por 'od zer gyi sgo nas mar la mar bzhin thim par gyur par bsam par bya'o //🔽de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa @100a * //
analyzed: snyoms par zhugs pa las byung ba'i byang chub sems kyi rgyun gyis de rnams la dbang bskur zhing bsgrub bya'i lus por 'od zer gyi sgo nas mar la mar bzhin thim par gyur par bsam par bya'o // de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa @100a * //
translated: and that the stream of bodhicitta arising from their union confers empowerment on them, and that the object of the rite dissolves into them through the door of light rays, like water into water.

original: thams cad kyis byin gyis brlabs pas bsgrub bya rdo rje'i sku lta bur 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //🔽rdzogs pa'i rim pa la gnas pa //
analyzed: thams cad kyis byin gyis brlabs pas bsgrub bya rdo rje'i sku lta bur 'gyur ro zhes bstan to // rdzogs pa'i rim pa la gnas pa //
translated: At that time, all the tathāgatas bless the object of the rite, and he becomes like a vajra body.🔽One who abides in the stage of completion

original: zhes bya ba nas /🔽rdo rje sems dpa' gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba nas /🔽rdo rje sems dpa' gsungs pa'o //
translated: and so on up to:🔽This is the speech of Vajrasattva.🔽

original: zhes pa'i bar du ni phyi dang nang gi nad rnams kyis dkrugs pa'i dbang po dang phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams mdun du dmigs la rdo rje 'chang chen po la sogs pa'i gang yang rung ba'i rnal 'byor pas sems rnam par dag pas thob par
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du ni phyi dang nang gi nad rnams kyis dkrugs pa'i dbang po dang phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams mdun du dmigs la rdo rje 'chang chen po la sogs pa'i gang yang rung ba'i rnal 'byor pas sems rnam par dag pas thob par
translated: and so on, should meditate on the clear light that is to be attained by means of a pure mind.

original: bya ba'i 'od gsal bar bsgoms pas dkyil 'khor rnams las g-yas pa dang g-yon pa g-yon pa gnyis dang dal bus dman par rgyu ba dmar po la sogs pa'i 'od zer gyi tshogs spros la dkyil 'khor re re la dgu brgya dgu brgya bzlas pas nyin mo dang
analyzed: bya ba'i 'od gsal bar bsgoms pas dkyil 'khor rnams las g-yas pa dang g-yon pa g-yon pa gnyis dang dal bus dman par rgyu ba dmar po la sogs pa'i 'od zer gyi tshogs spros la dkyil 'khor re re la dgu brgya dgu brgya bzlas pas nyin mo dang
translated: Having emanated from the maṇḍalas a mass of light rays, red and so on, moving slowly and gently to the right and left, to the right and left, the yogī/nī should repeat each maṇḍala nine hundred times during the day🔽and six hundred times at night.

original: mtshan mor nyi khri chig stong dag gis drug brgya bzlas nas gdong gi sna'i rtse mor 'od zer gyi thig le 'dzin na de'i tshe nad pa'i nad grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshan mor nyi khri chig stong dag gis drug brgya bzlas nas gdong gi sna'i rtse mor 'od zer gyi thig le 'dzin na de'i tshe nad pa'i nad grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the yogī/nī holds the drop of light rays at the tip of the nose on the face, at that time the disease of the patient will be released.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: ya yi don gyi gang ci 'ang rung //
analyzed: ya yi don gyi gang ci 'ang rung //
translated: Whatever the meaning of ya is,

original: dngos grub 'dod pas bya ba ste //
analyzed: dngos grub 'dod pas bya ba ste //
translated: One who desires power should do this.

original: ra la sogs pa gsum nyid kyis //
analyzed: ra la sogs pa gsum nyid kyis //
translated: By the three, Ra and so on,

original: 'gro ba'i don la rab tu 'jug / me dang rlung dang dbang chen dang // chu yi dkyil 'khor re re la //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i don la rab tu 'jug / me dang rlung dang dbang chen dang // chu yi dkyil 'khor re re la //
translated: one engages in the welfare of the world.

original: thun ni phyed phyed dus su ni //
analyzed: thun ni phyed phyed dus su ni //
translated: In each half-period,

original: las ni gnyis gnyis byed par 'gyur //🔽zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: las ni gnyis gnyis byed par 'gyur // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: two actions are performed,🔽in the maṇḍalas of fire, wind, earth, and water.

original: de ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pas nad las thar ba'o //
analyzed: de ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pas nad las thar ba'o //
translated: This is the liberation from illness through the stage of vajra repetition.

original: de bzhin 'od gsal ba las cig car du ye shes kyi sku 'am rdo rje'i sku spros la /
analyzed: de bzhin 'od gsal ba las cig car du ye shes kyi sku 'am rdo rje'i sku spros la /
translated: In the same way, one should emanate the gnosis body or vajra body all at once from clear light,

original: ba spu'i bu ga thams cad las 'od zer gyi 'khor lo spros la de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam pa can gyi 'od des nad pa'i lus nad med par byas nas de nyid du 'jug par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: ba spu'i bu ga thams cad las 'od zer gyi 'khor lo spros la de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam pa can gyi 'od des nad pa'i lus nad med par byas nas de nyid du 'jug par bsam par bya'o //
translated: and emanate a circle of light rays from all the pores, and imagine that the light in the aspect of a tathāgata cures the illness of the patient’s body and enters there.

original: de'i tshe bsgrub bya ni nad med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe bsgrub bya ni nad med par 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, the one to be benefited will become free from illness.

original: de sa ni bdag la byin gyis brlab ba dang zung du 'jug pa dag gis nad med par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de sa ni bdag la byin gyis brlab ba dang zung du 'jug pa dag gis nad med par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: He becomes free of disease by means of the consecration of oneself and union.

original: de ltar rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i spyod pa dang ldan pas pha rol rnams kyi nad 'joms par byed de /
analyzed: de ltar rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i spyod pa dang ldan pas pha rol rnams kyi nad 'joms par byed de /
translated: Thus, one who is endowed with the conduct of the completion stage conquers the diseases of others.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba nas dngos so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag po rdo rje 'chang gi sgyu ma lta bu'i dngos po rmi lam gyi dbe'i  sgo nas so sor snang ba tsam gyi snying por gyur pa la
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba nas dngos so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag po rdo rje 'chang gi sgyu ma lta bu'i dngos po rmi lam gyi dbe'i  sgo nas so sor snang ba tsam gyi snying por gyur pa la
translated: Thus, up to “entity” means that the entity of the illusion-like Vajradhara, the lord of all tathāgatas, is the mere appearance of the essence of the dream deer through the door of the dream deer.

original: rtag pa dang chad pa'i 'khrul pa yod do zhes @100b gsungs so //
analyzed: rtag pa dang chad pa'i 'khrul pa yod do zhes @100b gsungs so //
translated: It is said that there is the error of eternalism and nihilism.

original: sgrub pa po rnam pa gnyis kyis zhes pa ni rdzogs pa dang ma rdzogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: sgrub pa po rnam pa gnyis kyis zhes pa ni rdzogs pa dang ma rdzogs pa rnams so //
translated: The two types of adepts are those who are complete and those who are incomplete.

original: mtshan ma dang bcas pa dang mtshan ma med pa'i dbye bas zhes pa ni rtog pa dang bcas pa dang rtog pa med pa'i rgyus rmi lam mthong ba'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma dang bcas pa dang mtshan ma med pa'i dbye bas zhes pa ni rtog pa dang bcas pa dang rtog pa med pa'i rgyus rmi lam mthong ba'o //
translated: The division into those with signs and those without signs is seeing dreams through the cause of conceptualization and nonconceptualization.

original: rnam pa gnyis kyis de nyid kyi 'bras bu dang 'brel ba yin no //🔽de la zhes bya ba nas mngon gsum du byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim par 'od gsal ba thob nas de las byung ba'i ye shes kyi sku dang de bzhin du mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pas 'od
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis kyis de nyid kyi 'bras bu dang 'brel ba yin no // de la zhes bya ba nas mngon gsum du byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim par 'od gsal ba thob nas de las byung ba'i ye shes kyi sku dang de bzhin du mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pas 'od
translated: By two aspects, one is connected with the result of that.🔽There, up to “one will manifest” means that, having attained clear light in the stage of mind isolation, one will manifest the gnosis body that arises from that, and likewise, by entering clear light in the stage of manifest enlightenment, one will manifest the vajra body that arises from that.

original: gsal ba la 'jug pas rdo rje'i sku brgya byin la sogs pa'i 'jig rten pa sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i 'jig rten las 'das pas mchod par 'gyur ba bdag nyid rmi lam du mthong na de'i tshe myur du phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob par
analyzed: gsal ba la 'jug pas rdo rje'i sku brgya byin la sogs pa'i 'jig rten pa sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i 'jig rten las 'das pas mchod par 'gyur ba bdag nyid rmi lam du mthong na de'i tshe myur du phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob par
translated: If one sees in a dream that one is worshipped by worldly beings such as Indra and so forth and by supramundane beings such as buddhas and bodhisattvas, then at that time one will quickly attain the spiritual power of the great seal.

original: 'gyur ro // sems can chen po zhes bya ba nas rmi lam gyi 'bras bu'o zhes pa'i bar du ni thugs rdo rje la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rnam pa can sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pas mchod par gyur pa de'i tshe pha rol rnams
analyzed: 'gyur ro // sems can chen po zhes bya ba nas rmi lam gyi 'bras bu'o zhes pa'i bar du ni thugs rdo rje la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rnam pa can sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pas mchod par gyur pa de'i tshe pha rol rnams
translated: “Great being” up to “dream result” means that when the five tathāgatas in the aspect of Cittavajra and so on are worshiped by buddhas, bodhisattvas, and so on, at that time the opponents🔽

original: la yang de'i rnam pa ster ba la nus pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: la yang de'i rnam pa ster ba la nus pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: “Great being” up to “dream result” teaches that when the five thus-gone ones such as Cittavajra and so on are worshipped by buddhas, bodhisattvas, and so on, at that time the yogin becomes empowered to bestow their forms on others.

original: rgyan rnams thams cad ces bya ba nas rig par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni lha'i bu mo gzugs bzang ba legs par brgyan pa dang de bzhin du mi la sogs pa'i bu mo dang khye'u rnal 'byor pa la mchod pa byed pa mthong na de
analyzed: rgyan rnams thams cad ces bya ba nas rig par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni lha'i bu mo gzugs bzang ba legs par brgyan pa dang de bzhin du mi la sogs pa'i bu mo dang khye'u rnal 'byor pa la mchod pa byed pa mthong na de
translated: “All ornaments” up to “will be known” teaches that when the yogin sees divine maidens of beautiful form and excellent ornaments, and likewise human maidens and boys worshipping him,

original: zhi ba la sogs pa'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: zhi ba la sogs pa'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: he will attain the powers of pacification and so on.

original: khye'u dang bu mo ni shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin yin pas so //
analyzed: khye'u dang bu mo ni shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin yin pas so //
translated: Boys and girls are the nature of wisdom and method.

original: phyogs bcu zhes bya ba nas rmi lam mthong ba'i 'bras bu zhes pa'i bar du ni rnal 'byor ba gang zhig sangs rgyas kyi zhing la gnas pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshogs mthong ba dang / de bzhin du gang la bcom ldan 'das ma la sogs pa'i shes rab kyi glegs bam de bzhin gshegs pas lag tu stsol ba dang /
analyzed: phyogs bcu zhes bya ba nas rmi lam mthong ba'i 'bras bu zhes pa'i bar du ni rnal 'byor ba gang zhig sangs rgyas kyi zhing la gnas pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshogs mthong ba dang / de bzhin du gang la bcom ldan 'das ma la sogs pa'i shes rab kyi glegs bam de bzhin gshegs pas lag tu stsol ba dang /
translated: From “the ten directions” up to “the result of seeing dreams” teaches that any yogin who sees a gathering of tathāgatas in a buddha field and likewise sees the Bhagavatī Prajñāpāramitā placed in his hand by a tathāgata,

original: gang zhig seng ge'i khri la bzhugs pa chos ston pa la rtsol ba sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpas yongs su bskor bar bdag nyid mthong na des @101a * //
analyzed: gang zhig seng ge'i khri la bzhugs pa chos ston pa la rtsol ba sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpas yongs su bskor bar bdag nyid mthong na des @101a * //
translated: and who sees himself seated on a lion throne teaching the dharma surrounded by buddhas and bodhisattvas,

original: phyag rgya chen po'i 'bras bu thong bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po'i 'bras bu thong bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: will attain the result of mahāmudrā.

original: kun dga' ra ba nas rmi lam gyi 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ro zhes kyang gsungs so zhes pa'i bar du ni lha'i bu dang bu mos brgyan pa kun dga' ra ba dang nags tshal la sogs pa bskyed pa'i rim pa ni /
analyzed: kun dga' ra ba nas rmi lam gyi 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ro zhes kyang gsungs so zhes pa'i bar du ni lha'i bu dang bu mos brgyan pa kun dga' ra ba dang nags tshal la sogs pa bskyed pa'i rim pa ni /
translated: And from the pleasure grove, one will obtain the fruit of the dream.

original: rnal 'byor pa gang zhig mthong ba des ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa gang zhig mthong ba des ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: Up to this point, it is taught that any yogi who sees the celestial boys and girls, the creation of the pleasure grove, forest, and so forth, will obtain the powers of pacification and so forth.

original: de bzhin du sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dbang bskur ba gang zhig mthong ba de ni rig pa 'dzin pa'i gtso bor 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin du sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dbang bskur ba gang zhig mthong ba de ni rig pa 'dzin pa'i gtso bor 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: And likewise, any one who sees the consecration of the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas will become the chief of the knowledge-bearers.

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i rmi lam zhes bya ba nas grub cing thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni sngar bshad pa'i dge ba'i rmi lam gyis phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i rmi lam zhes bya ba nas grub cing thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni sngar bshad pa'i dge ba'i rmi lam gyis phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: It is taught that one who has the desired dream, up to the attainment of the accomplishment, will obtain the power of the Great Seal by the virtuous dream explained above.

original: gdol ba zhes bya ba nas bar du'o zhes pa'i bar du ni rnal 'byor pa gang zhig gdol pa la sogs pa'i rigs ngan dang de bzhin du gzugs 'jigs pa spre dang yi dags la sogs par mi lam du mthong na des nges par dam tshig nyams pa🔽yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gdol ba zhes bya ba nas bar du'o zhes pa'i bar du ni rnal 'byor pa gang zhig gdol pa la sogs pa'i rigs ngan dang de bzhin du gzugs 'jigs pa spre dang yi dags la sogs par mi lam du mthong na des nges par dam tshig nyams pa yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: The passage from “outcaste” up to “in the middle” teaches that if a yogin sees in a dream an outcaste or other low-caste person, or likewise a frightening form, a monkey, a ghost, and so on, then he has definitely damaged his commitments.

original: dam tshig stong pa'i rgyu des dngos grub sgrub pa la 'jug par 'gyur na nad la sogs pas lus zil gyis mnan par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: dam tshig stong pa'i rgyu des dngos grub sgrub pa la 'jug par 'gyur na nad la sogs pas lus zil gyis mnan par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: The passage from “If he enters into the practice of siddhis” up to “he will be overcome by disease and so on” teaches that if he enters into the practice of siddhis due to the cause of his empty commitments, he will be overcome by disease and so on.

original: de la de kho na nyid bsgrub pa zhes bya ba nas chos nyid med pa'o zhes pa'i bar du ni brtan pa dang / g-yo ba'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po rnams rang gi sems kyi snang ba tsam las ldog pa ni med de /
analyzed: de la de kho na nyid bsgrub pa zhes bya ba nas chos nyid med pa'o zhes pa'i bar du ni brtan pa dang / g-yo ba'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po rnams rang gi sems kyi snang ba tsam las ldog pa ni med de /
translated: The passage from “The accomplishment of reality” up to “there is no reality” teaches that the nature of things, whether animate or inanimate, is nothing other than the mere appearance of one’s mind,

original: rmi lam dang 'dra bas so //
analyzed: rmi lam dang 'dra bas so //
translated: because they are like dreams.

original: sems kyang rnam par dpyad na 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin yin pas so ;
analyzed: sems kyang rnam par dpyad na 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin yin pas so ;
translated: And the mind, when analyzed, is the nature of clear light.

original: /'od gsal ba yang rnam par mi rtog pa'i gnas skabs su 'di nyid dang bdag nyid du mi dmigs te rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: /'od gsal ba yang rnam par mi rtog pa'i gnas skabs su 'di nyid dang bdag nyid du mi dmigs te rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Also, luminosity is not observed as this or that, as self or other, in the state of nonconceptuality, because it is nonconceptual.

original: de ltar chos can dang chos nyid gnyi ga yang rnal 'byor pa'i mngon sum gyi tshad mas mi dmigs te /🔽'ba' zhig dri ma med pas byang chub tsam la /
analyzed: de ltar chos can dang chos nyid gnyi ga yang rnal 'byor pa'i mngon sum gyi tshad mas mi dmigs te / 'ba' zhig dri ma med pas byang chub tsam la /
translated: Thus, both the basis of characteristics and the nature of phenomena are not observed by the valid cognition of the yogi's direct perception.

original: gnas pa'i rgyu dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnam gnyis mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas pa'i rgyu dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnam gnyis mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the two types of yogis who possess the cause of abiding in the mere stainless enlightenment do not observe them.🔽The conceptualization of things with aspects

original: rnam bcas dngos po'i rtog pa dang // rnam pa med pa'i rtog pa ste //
analyzed: rnam bcas dngos po'i rtog pa dang // rnam pa med pa'i rtog pa ste //
translated: and the conceptualization of the absence of aspects

original: gcig tu byas nas gang spyod pa //
analyzed: gcig tu byas nas gang spyod pa //
translated: are combined into one,

original: de ni zung 'jug bshad pa yin //
analyzed: de ni zung 'jug bshad pa yin //
translated: and that is explained as union.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de bzhin khams dang zhes bya ba @101b la sogs pa la dbang po dang rnam par shes pa nye bar bsdus pa'i bdag nyid can gyi shes pa gnyis po ni snang ba dang snang ba mched pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin khams dang zhes bya ba @101b la sogs pa la dbang po dang rnam par shes pa nye bar bsdus pa'i bdag nyid can gyi shes pa gnyis po ni snang ba dang snang ba mched pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Similarly, the two types of consciousness that have the nature of including the sense faculties and consciousness are called appearance and expanded appearance.

original: legs 'dus pa ni rtag tu so sor snang bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: legs 'dus pa ni rtag tu so sor snang bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The “well-combined” is always perceived individually.

original: stong chen nyid 'gyur ni snang ba nye bar thob pa'i ye shes yod na'o //
analyzed: stong chen nyid 'gyur ni snang ba nye bar thob pa'i ye shes yod na'o //
translated: The “great emptiness” is when the wisdom of the attainment of light is present.

original: rlung la brten pa ni rlung gi tshogs kyi dbang gis so //
analyzed: rlung la brten pa ni rlung gi tshogs kyi dbang gis so //
translated: The “wind-based” is by the power of the wind-collection.

original: nges par rmi lam mthong ba zhes pa ni sad pa'i gnas skabs su mthong ba gang yin pa de rmi lam du mthong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: nges par rmi lam mthong ba zhes pa ni sad pa'i gnas skabs su mthong ba gang yin pa de rmi lam du mthong bar 'gyur te /
translated: The “definite dream-seer” is one who sees in the waking state what he saw in the dream.

original: rtog pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of conceptualization.

original: gang zhig rmi lam dang mtshungs pa'i chos rnams yongs su shes pas 'bras bu 'dod pa'i 'od gsal ba'i go 'phang mngon du byed pa'i rnal 'byor pa des kun brtags pa ni rmi lam dang sad pa la bye brag mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig rmi lam dang mtshungs pa'i chos rnams yongs su shes pas 'bras bu 'dod pa'i 'od gsal ba'i go 'phang mngon du byed pa'i rnal 'byor pa des kun brtags pa ni rmi lam dang sad pa la bye brag mi rtog pa'o //
translated: The yogi who, by knowing phenomena to be like dreams, manifests the desired result, the state of clear light, does not distinguish between the imagined and the dream.

original: chos rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnal 'byor pa de nyid kyis brdzun dang bden pa las grol ba dngos po rmi lam dang mtshungs pa snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnal 'byor pa de nyid kyis brdzun dang bden pa las grol ba dngos po rmi lam dang mtshungs pa snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By “phenomena” and so forth, that very yogi, liberated from truth and falsity, sees things as like dreams.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As is said:

original: gnyid log pa dang sad pa zhes //
analyzed: gnyid log pa dang sad pa zhes //
translated: “Sleep and waking”

original: de dag rtogs ni gnyis spangs pa'i //
analyzed: de dag rtogs ni gnyis spangs pa'i //
translated: are the two concepts to be abandoned.

original: ston pas zung 'jug gsungs pa ste //🔽gnyid log sad dang rnam bral ba'o //
analyzed: ston pas zung 'jug gsungs pa ste // gnyid log sad dang rnam bral ba'o //
translated: The Teacher has taught the union🔽of sleep and waking,

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: free from sleep and waking.

original: de ltar yi ge gsum tsam la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor ba rtog pa dang bcas par 'gyur bas rmi lam mthong ba dang 'od gsal ba la 'jug pas cung zad mthong ngo //
analyzed: de ltar yi ge gsum tsam la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor ba rtog pa dang bcas par 'gyur bas rmi lam mthong ba dang 'od gsal ba la 'jug pas cung zad mthong ngo //
translated: Thus, the yogī who abides in just the three syllables, having concepts, sees a little by seeing dreams and entering luminosity.

original: 'on kyang gnyid log pa dang sad pa dang 'dra bar dngos po'i ngo bo mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'on kyang gnyid log pa dang sad pa dang 'dra bar dngos po'i ngo bo mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: However, like sleep and waking, he sees the nature of things. This is the meaning.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas dngos po rnams sgyu ma lta bur shes nas ngo bo med par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas dngos po rnams sgyu ma lta bur shes nas ngo bo med par 'gyur na /
translated: Then, having understood things as illusion-like, they become essenceless.

original: rmi lam dang rmi lam gyi 'bras bu de rnams gang las 'gyur zhes bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa dang / ngo mtshar ba dang rmad du byung ba thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rmi lam dang rmi lam gyi 'bras bu de rnams gang las 'gyur zhes bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa dang / ngo mtshar ba dang rmad du byung ba thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: Then, they ask the Bhagavān, “From what do dreams and the results of dreams arise?” and he teaches, “One attains the marvelous and the wondrous.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dgongs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas 'od gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo med pa nyid bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dgongs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas 'od gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo med pa nyid bstan to //
translated: The meaning of the words “the transcendent lords’ intention” and so forth up to “the nature of clear light” is the non-entityness of things.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa bod pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa bod pa'o //
translated: “ All transcendent lords” refers to Akṣhobhya and so forth.

original: bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni sems dang ldan pa dang sems dang mi @102a * //🔽ldan ba'i bdag nyid kyi dngos pos so //
analyzed: bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni sems dang ldan pa dang sems dang mi @102a * // ldan ba'i bdag nyid kyi dngos pos so //
translated: “ Pots, cloth, and so forth” refers to things that are sentient and non-sentient.

original: mi ldan pa ni gcig gi ngo bo ma yin te tha dad pa nyid du snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi ldan pa ni gcig gi ngo bo ma yin te tha dad pa nyid du snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “ Non-endowed” means not having a single nature, because they appear as different.

original: de la bum pa la sogs pa dngos po rnams ni 'dus byas te /
analyzed: de la bum pa la sogs pa dngos po rnams ni 'dus byas te /
translated: Among them, “pots and so forth” are things that are compounded.

original: rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are produced by causes and conditions.

original: nam mkha' ni 'dus ma byas pa ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' ni 'dus ma byas pa ste /
translated: “ Space” is uncompounded.

original: rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is without causes.

original: gzugs dang ldan pa dang gzugs med pa nyid kyis bum pa la sogs pa dang nam mkha' ni tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs dang ldan pa dang gzugs med pa nyid kyis bum pa la sogs pa dang nam mkha' ni tha dad pa yin no //
translated: A pot, etc. and space are different because of having form and being formless, respectively.

original: mi ldan pa yang ma yin te ldan pa kho na'o //
analyzed: mi ldan pa yang ma yin te ldan pa kho na'o //
translated: Nor is it non-possession, but rather possession.

original: dngos po thams cad ces pa ni sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten gyi bdag nyid kyi de'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni nam mkha' ni dngos po thams cad kyi nang du chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad ces pa ni sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten gyi bdag nyid kyi de'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni nam mkha' ni dngos po thams cad kyi nang du chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: All things means that it is the nature of the sentient and inanimate worlds, because space is included within all things.

original: khyab pa ni nam mkha' khyab par byed pa ste /
analyzed: khyab pa ni nam mkha' khyab par byed pa ste /
translated: Pervasion is the pervader of space.

original: me dro ba'i reg pa bzhin no //
analyzed: me dro ba'i reg pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the heat of fire.

original: ngo bo nyid la gnas pa zhes pa ni dngos po rnams la med par mi 'byung bas gnas pa ste /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid la gnas pa zhes pa ni dngos po rnams la med par mi 'byung bas gnas pa ste /
translated: Abiding in its own nature means that it abides because it does not occur in the absence of things.

original: dngos po ni 'byung ba chen po lnga'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po ni 'byung ba chen po lnga'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because things are by nature the five great elements.

original: gnyis po de dag ni khyab par byed pa dang mthong ba med pa nyid do //
analyzed: gnyis po de dag ni khyab par byed pa dang mthong ba med pa nyid do //
translated: Those two are the absence of a pervader and the absence of a seer.

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal yang zhes pa ni sems pa med de /
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal yang zhes pa ni sems pa med de /
translated: Also, pride means that it is not thought.

original: de bems po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bems po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is an inanimate thing.

original: nam mkha' de zhes bya ba la sogs pas de nyid bsdu bar byed de /
analyzed: nam mkha' de zhes bya ba la sogs pas de nyid bsdu bar byed de /
translated: That very thing is summarized by “space” and so on.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpe bstan nas dpe las byung ba bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpe bstan nas dpe las byung ba bstan par bya ste /
translated: Having taught the example with “in that way” and so on, he teaches the example:

original: ji ltar nam mkha' la bum pa la sogs pas ldan pa dang mi ldan pa med pa de bzhin du rmi lam dang de'i 'bras bu dag la yang ldan pa dang mi ldan pa dag med do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' la bum pa la sogs pas ldan pa dang mi ldan pa med pa de bzhin du rmi lam dang de'i 'bras bu dag la yang ldan pa dang mi ldan pa dag med do zhes bstan to //
translated: Just as space is neither conjoined nor disjoined with a pot and so on, so also a dream and its result are neither conjoined nor disjoined.

original: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The intention is this:

original: re zhig rmi lam ni don med pa rang gi rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags las 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: re zhig rmi lam ni don med pa rang gi rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags las 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: First, a dream arises from the latent propensities of meaningless conceptualization.

original: de'i 'bras bu dang 'brel bas ga las 'gyur zhes bya ba nas rmi lam dang 'bras bu dag mi ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu dang 'brel bas ga las 'gyur zhes bya ba nas rmi lam dang 'bras bu dag mi ldan pa'o //
translated: How could it be related to its result? Therefore, a dream and its result are not conjoined.

original: 'on kyang rnam par mi rtog pa nyid rmi lam ltar so sor snang ba'i 'bras bu'i rnam par snang bar 'gyur ro zhes de dag dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang rnam par mi rtog pa nyid rmi lam ltar so sor snang ba'i 'bras bu'i rnam par snang bar 'gyur ro zhes de dag dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Nevertheless, non-conceptuality itself appears as the result of the individual appearances, like a dream.

original: de nyid kyi rnam par dag pa zhes pa ni nam mkha'i de kho na nyid bstan to //
analyzed: de nyid kyi rnam par dag pa zhes pa ni nam mkha'i de kho na nyid bstan to //
translated: The purity of that itself is the teaching of the reality of space.

original: ji lta ji ltar nam mkha' la mthong ba med pa dang thos pa med pa nyid yod pa de bzhin du dngos po thams cad so sor snang ba ste /
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar nam mkha' la mthong ba med pa dang thos pa med pa nyid yod pa de bzhin du dngos po thams cad so sor snang ba ste /
translated: Just as there is no seeing and no hearing in space, so there are the individual appearances of all things.

original: rang bzhin med @102b pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin med @102b pa'o //
translated: They are without intrinsic nature.

original: ci dgos zhes bya ba la sogs pas rmi lam de'i 'bras bu dag ngo bo med pa yang ma yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: ci dgos zhes bya ba la sogs pas rmi lam de'i 'bras bu dag ngo bo med pa yang ma yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: The phrase what is the use? and so forth teaches that the result of that dream is not non-existent.

original: brtags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is imagined.

original: chos thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pas sems can gyi 'jig rten dang snod kyi 'jig rten dang khams gsum la gnas pa'i ngag gi spros pa de dag thams cad sems kyi rang bzhin kho na dang de bzhin du sems kyi rnam pa so sor snang ba
analyzed: chos thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pas sems can gyi 'jig rten dang snod kyi 'jig rten dang khams gsum la gnas pa'i ngag gi spros pa de dag thams cad sems kyi rang bzhin kho na dang de bzhin du sems kyi rnam pa so sor snang ba
translated: All phenomena and so forth refers to the proliferation of speech that exists in the three realms of the world of sentient beings and the world of the environment. All of those are the nature of mind and, likewise, the individual appearances of the aspects of mind.

original: lus dang ngag dang sems dang phung po dang / khams dang skye mched kyi chos thams cad gang yin pa de rnams la khyab par byed pa nam mkha' dang khyab par bya ba'i sems can gyi rigs bzhi'i dbye bas gnas pa de dang thams cad ji ltar sngar bshad pa'i rigs pas /
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang sems dang phung po dang / khams dang skye mched kyi chos thams cad gang yin pa de rnams la khyab par byed pa nam mkha' dang khyab par bya ba'i sems can gyi rigs bzhi'i dbye bas gnas pa de dang thams cad ji ltar sngar bshad pa'i rigs pas /
translated: The body, speech, mind, aggregates, elements, and sense bases are all phenomena. They are pervaded by space and the four types of sentient beings that are pervaded by space. All of those are like space.

original: nam mkha' dang 'dra ba bzhin du chos thams cad bskyed pa dang / gnas pa dang 'jig pa med pas 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang 'dra ba bzhin du chos thams cad bskyed pa dang / gnas pa dang 'jig pa med pas 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: As was explained above, since all phenomena are devoid of arising, abiding, and destruction, they are the nature of luminosity.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pas sgyu ma'i skus dngos po rnams sgyu ma lta bu nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pas sgyu ma'i skus dngos po rnams sgyu ma lta bu nyid du bstan to //
translated: The phrase all tathāgatas and so forth indicates that all things are like illusions by means of the illusory body.

original: dus gsum du gshegs pa zhes pa ni 'das pa la sogs pa'i dus gsum la bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: dus gsum du gshegs pa zhes pa ni 'das pa la sogs pa'i dus gsum la bzhugs pa'o //
translated: The phrase gone to the three times means that they abide in the three times, the past and so forth.

original: de rnams kyi ye shes kyi sku'o zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba las cig car du 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi ye shes kyi sku'o zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba las cig car du 'byung ba'o //
translated: The phrase their gnosis body means that they arise simultaneously from clear light.

original: de 'byung bar byed pa zhes pa ni ye shes kyi sku skyed par byed pa rdo rje'i gnas lta bu ni mi phyed pa'i gzhi'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de 'byung bar byed pa zhes pa ni ye shes kyi sku skyed par byed pa rdo rje'i gnas lta bu ni mi phyed pa'i gzhi'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The phrase arising from that means that the vajra-like stage, which is the cause of the arising of the gnosis body, is the nature of the basis that is indivisible.

original: byang chub kyi sems ni stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa dang / thams cad stong pa'i bdag nyid 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems ni stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa dang / thams cad stong pa'i bdag nyid 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: Awakening mind is the indivisibility of emptiness and compassion, and the clear light that is the nature of the emptiness of everything.

original: stong nyid snying rje dbyer med ni //
analyzed: stong nyid snying rje dbyer med ni //
translated: The indivisibility of emptiness and compassion

original: byang chub sems zhes bshad pa yin //🔽zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems zhes bshad pa yin //🔽zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: is explained to be awakening mind.

original: byang chub sems zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin gyi byang chub kyi sems de yang 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa la mi gnas te /
analyzed: byang chub sems zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin gyi byang chub kyi sems de yang 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa la mi gnas te /
translated: The bodhicitta of luminous nature does not abide in the desire realm, etc.

original: so sor nges pa gnas pa med pas khyab par byed pa de nyid kyi phyir de la don dam par skye ba dang 'jig pa med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: so sor nges pa gnas pa med pas khyab par byed pa de nyid kyi phyir de la don dam par skye ba dang 'jig pa med pa de bzhin du /
translated: Because it is all-pervading, without a specific location, it is unborn and unceasing in the ultimate sense.

original: chos thams cad la yang skye ba dang 'jig pa med pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad la yang skye ba dang 'jig pa med pa ste /
translated: Likewise, all phenomena are unborn and unceasing.

original: 'od gsal ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas rmi lam gyi dpes dngos po rnams ngo bo med pa @103a * //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro // de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas rmi lam gyi dpes dngos po rnams ngo bo med pa @103a * //
translated: Because they are of the nature of luminous clarity.🔽Thus, etc.

original: yin no zhes nye bar bsdus pa bstan to //
analyzed: yin no zhes nye bar bsdus pa bstan to //
translated: summarizes that things are essenceless by means of the example of a dream.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba nas khong du chud par bya'o zhes pa'i bar du ni ji ltar rmi lam dang skyes bu dag la mthong bar bya ba dang / mthong ba po'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa 'on kyang phan tshun snang bar bya ba dang snang ba po'i brdzun pa'i so sor snang ba yod pa dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba nas khong du chud par bya'o zhes pa'i bar du ni ji ltar rmi lam dang skyes bu dag la mthong bar bya ba dang / mthong ba po'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa 'on kyang phan tshun snang bar bya ba dang snang ba po'i brdzun pa'i so sor snang ba yod pa dang /
translated: The passage from “Moreover…” up to “…should be understood” teaches that just as in a dream, although there is no conceit of the seen and the seer in the dream, there is a false appearance of the object seen and the seer,

original: de bzhin du sad pa'i skabs su yang dge ba dang mi dge ba las sogs pa'i bya ba rmi lam dang 'dra ba ji ltar 'gyur ba de bzhin du rdzogs pa dang ma rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i sgyu ma lta bu'i sku dang 'dra bar dngos po thams🔽cad rtogs par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin du sad pa'i skabs su yang dge ba dang mi dge ba las sogs pa'i bya ba rmi lam dang 'dra ba ji ltar 'gyur ba de bzhin du rdzogs pa dang ma rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i sgyu ma lta bu'i sku dang 'dra bar dngos po thams cad rtogs par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: so too, in the waking state, one should understand that all things are like the illusory body of the yogi, complete or incomplete, and like the actions of virtue and nonvirtue in a dream.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas yid bzhin gyi nor bu sems can thams cad la bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pas /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas yid bzhin gyi nor bu sems can thams cad la bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pas /
translated: The passage from “In that way…” teaches that the wish-fulfilling jewel, which fulfills all the wishes of all sentient beings without conceit,

original: sbyin pa po dang sbyin par bya ba dang / len ba mi ltos pas sems can thams cad la 'dod pa'i 'bras bu ster ba de bzhin du sgyu ma lta bu'i sku dang zhi ba la sogs pa'i phrin las gang yin pa de dag 'od gsal ba'i ngo bo rdo rje 'chang chen po las 'byung ba yin
analyzed: sbyin pa po dang sbyin par bya ba dang / len ba mi ltos pas sems can thams cad la 'dod pa'i 'bras bu ster ba de bzhin du sgyu ma lta bu'i sku dang zhi ba la sogs pa'i phrin las gang yin pa de dag 'od gsal ba'i ngo bo rdo rje 'chang chen po las 'byung ba yin
translated: Likewise, whatever deeds are performed by the illusion-like body, such as pacifying, and so forth, they all arise from the essence of clear light, Great Vajradhara.🔽The passage from “the Bhagavān” up to “wondrous” indicates that through hearing the very profound dharma, Akṣobhya and the others’ eyes of wonderment expand.

original: no // bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba nas rmad du byung ba'o zhes pa'i bar du ni shin tu zab ba'i chos thos pas mi bskyod pa la sogs pa rnams kyis ngo mtshar gyi spyan rgyas pa dang 'od gsal ba las byung ba'i sgyu ma'i sku la ched du brjod🔽pa nyid bstan to //
analyzed: no // bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba nas rmad du byung ba'o zhes pa'i bar du ni shin tu zab ba'i chos thos pas mi bskyod pa la sogs pa rnams kyis ngo mtshar gyi spyan rgyas pa dang 'od gsal ba las byung ba'i sgyu ma'i sku la ched du brjod🔽pa nyid bstan to //
translated: This is the expression of delight in the illusory body that arises from clear light.

original: de nas zhes bya ba nas zhus pa'o zhes pa'i bar du ni bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la phyag 'tshal ba sngon du 'gro bar ru ru phu ru zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar gsungs pa'i sngags de dang rjes su mthun pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang sngags
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba nas zhus pa'o zhes pa'i bar du ni bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la phyag 'tshal ba sngon du 'gro bar ru ru phu ru zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar gsungs pa'i sngags de dang rjes su mthun pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang sngags
translated: The section from “Then” up to “asked” is the samādhi and mantra that is consistent with the previously mentioned mantra, such as ru ru phu ru, preceded by prostrating to the Bhagavān’s feet.🔽

original: dang ting nge 'dzin dag gis bsgrub par bya ba la sogs pa las kyi khyad par gang yin pa de dag las byung zhes zhus pa bstan to //
analyzed: dang ting nge 'dzin dag gis bsgrub par bya ba la sogs pa las kyi khyad par gang yin pa de dag las byung zhes zhus pa bstan to //
translated: The passage from “Then” up to “asked” indicates that, having first prostrated at the feet of the Bhagavān, they asked about the special activities of the mantra and samādhi that are concordant with the previously mentioned mantra, such as “ru ru phu ru,” and the activities of accomplishment and so on.

original: lan de zhes bya ba nas ngo bo nyid med par grub pa'o zhes pa'i bar du ni don dam pa'i phyogs la brten te /
analyzed: lan de zhes bya ba nas ngo bo nyid med par grub pa'o zhes pa'i bar du ni don dam pa'i phyogs la brten te /
translated: The passage from “The answer” up to “established as essenceless” indicates that, based on the ultimate perspective,

original: sngags dang ting nge 'dzin dang las kyi tshogs rnams gang du yang mi gnas gang las kyang ma byung zhes bstan to //
analyzed: sngags dang ting nge 'dzin dang las kyi tshogs rnams gang du yang mi gnas gang las kyang ma byung zhes bstan to //
translated: the collection of mantras, samādhis, and activities do not abide anywhere and do not arise from anywhere.

original: 'on kyang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The passage from “Nevertheless” up to

original: dmigs su yod do zhe na zhes pa'i bar du ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i bdag nyid can sku la @103b sogs pa dang de la dmigs pa'i sngags dang ting nge 'dzin dang las rnams kun rdzob tu yod de zhes bstan to //
analyzed: dmigs su yod do zhe na zhes pa'i bar du ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i bdag nyid can sku la @103b sogs pa dang de la dmigs pa'i sngags dang ting nge 'dzin dang las rnams kun rdzob tu yod de zhes bstan to //
translated: Up to “it is observed” teaches that the body, etc. which have the nature of conventional truth, and the mantras, meditative stabilizations, and activities that observe them, exist conventionally.

original: 'di skad bshad pa yin te rim pa gnyis kyi sku la dmigs nas de dag thams cad bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di skad bshad pa yin te rim pa gnyis kyi sku la dmigs nas de dag thams cad bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: This is explained as follows: having observed the body in the two stages, all of those should be accomplished.

original: don dam par sku ni sku ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par sku ni sku ma yin no //
translated: But ultimately, the body is not a body.

original: de bzlog par bya ba zhes pa nas rten dang brten pa dgag pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni don dam pa'i phyogs la brten te /
analyzed: de bzlog par bya ba zhes pa nas rten dang brten pa dgag pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni don dam pa'i phyogs la brten te /
translated: From “That is to be reversed” up to “the refutation of the supported and the support” is based on the ultimate position.

original: lus la sogs pa yod pa ma yin pa dang / 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa la mi gnas pa dang / sems ni lus la mi gnas so zhes pa la sogs pa phan tshun rten dang brten pa nyid med pa ste ;
analyzed: lus la sogs pa yod pa ma yin pa dang / 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa la mi gnas pa dang / sems ni lus la mi gnas so zhes pa la sogs pa phan tshun rten dang brten pa nyid med pa ste ;
translated: The body, etc. do not exist, one does not abide in the desire realm, etc., the mind does not abide in the body, etc., and there is no mutual support and supported,

original: ngo bo med pa'i phyir nam mkha' bzhin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: ngo bo med pa'i phyir nam mkha' bzhin no zhes bstan to //
translated: because they are essenceless, like space.

original: de nas zhes bya ba nas bdag nyid la gnas so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag po rdo rje 'chang gang du gnas zhes zhus pa la yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus la gnas so zhes lan no //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba nas bdag nyid la gnas so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag po rdo rje 'chang gang du gnas zhes zhus pa la yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus la gnas so zhes lan no //
translated: From Then up to abides in oneself is the question, Where does the lord of all the tathagatas, Vajradhara, abide? The answer is, He abides in the mental body.

original: yang lus la sogs pa so sor snang ba'i sems gang du gnas zhes zhus pa la /
analyzed: yang lus la sogs pa so sor snang ba'i sems gang du gnas zhes zhus pa la /
translated: Again, the question is asked, Where does the mind that individually appears as body and so on abide?

original: nam mkha' lta bu 'od gsal ba la gnas pa zhes lan bstan pa dang / 'od gsal ba ni gang du gnas zhes zhus pa la gang du 'ang mi gnas bdag nyid la gnas te chos nyid yin pas na 'od gsal ba ni thams cad la gnas so zhes bstan to //
analyzed: nam mkha' lta bu 'od gsal ba la gnas pa zhes lan bstan pa dang / 'od gsal ba ni gang du gnas zhes zhus pa la gang du 'ang mi gnas bdag nyid la gnas te chos nyid yin pas na 'od gsal ba ni thams cad la gnas so zhes bstan to //
translated: The answer is taught, It abides in the clear light that is like space, and the question is asked, Where does the clear light abide? The answer is taught, It does not abide anywhere. It abides in oneself. Since it is the intrinsic nature, the clear light abides in all.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: bu ram mngar ba me dro ba //
analyzed: bu ram mngar ba me dro ba //
translated: Sugar is sweet and fire is hot.

original: ji ltar rang bzhin yin pa ste //
analyzed: ji ltar rang bzhin yin pa ste //
translated: Just as they are by nature,

original: chos kun la ni stong pa nyid //
analyzed: chos kun la ni stong pa nyid //
translated: emptiness is in all phenomena.

original: de lta bu ni rang bzhin 'dod //🔽rnam pa du mas tha dad pa /
analyzed: de lta bu ni rang bzhin 'dod // rnam pa du mas tha dad pa /
translated: Such is asserted to be their nature.🔽Things that are different in many ways

original: dngos po rnams ni gos dang 'dra /
analyzed: dngos po rnams ni gos dang 'dra /
translated: are like clothes.

original: stong pa nyid mes bsregs gyur na //
analyzed: stong pa nyid mes bsregs gyur na //
translated: If emptiness were burned by fire,

original: thal ba'i dbye ba gang yang med //
analyzed: thal ba'i dbye ba gang yang med //
translated: there would be no division of ashes.

original: lta ba kun gyis byas ba rnams //
analyzed: lta ba kun gyis byas ba rnams //
translated: All views are created by

original: stong pa nyid ni mtha' phyir bstan //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni mtha' phyir bstan //
translated: emptiness, because it is the end.

original: zhes 'byung bas so //
analyzed: zhes 'byung bas so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de nas zhes bya ba nas mi smra bar gyur pa'o zhes pa'i bar du ni shin tu zab pa'i don thos nas rgyu dang 'bras bu dag la ngo mtshar ba rmad du gyur ba nyid thob nas de bsam pa dang bsgom pa'i nus pa rtse gcig pa nyid
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba nas mi smra bar gyur pa'o zhes pa'i bar du ni shin tu zab pa'i don thos nas rgyu dang 'bras bu dag la ngo mtshar ba rmad du gyur ba nyid thob nas de bsam pa dang bsgom pa'i nus pa rtse gcig pa nyid
translated: Then, from “Then” up to “became silent,” having heard the meaning that is extremely profound, having attained the state of wonder and amazement with regard to cause and effect, with the power of reflection and meditation, with one-pointedness,

original: kyis don de nyid dmigs pas cang mi smre bar gyur to zhes bstan to //
analyzed: kyis don de nyid dmigs pas cang mi smre bar gyur to zhes bstan to //
translated: having observed that very meaning, they became silent.

original: rgyu ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyi rdo rje 'chang dang zhib la sogs pa'i las kyi tshogs @104a * //
analyzed: rgyu ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyi rdo rje 'chang dang zhib la sogs pa'i las kyi tshogs @104a * //
translated: By “movement” and so forth, the chapter of all things, the nature of Vajradhara, and the collection of rites such as purification,

original: dang / de ston par byed pa'i gzhung gi tshogs kyi le'u yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: dang / de ston par byed pa'i gzhung gi tshogs kyi le'u yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: and the collection of texts that teach that, is taught.

original: dgongs pas bshad pa'o zhes pa ni shin tu gsal ba'i de kho na nyid 'gal ba'i tshig gi sgo nas so sor bstan pas so //
analyzed: dgongs pas bshad pa'o zhes pa ni shin tu gsal ba'i de kho na nyid 'gal ba'i tshig gi sgo nas so sor bstan pas so //
translated: The explanation by the intention is the extremely clear reality, taught individually by means of the words of the conflict.

original: sgron ma gsal bar byed pa'i 'grel ba'i t'i k'a las le'u bcva lnga pa'i rgya cher bshad pa'o /
analyzed: sgron ma gsal bar byed pa'i 'grel ba'i t'i k'a las le'u bcva lnga pa'i rgya cher bshad pa'o /
translated: This concludes the commentary on the fifteenth chapter of the Illuminating Lamp commentary.

original: // / sngar bshad pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas le'u bcu drug pa'i bshad pa brtsam par bya ste /
analyzed: // / sngar bshad pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas le'u bcu drug pa'i bshad pa brtsam par bya ste /
translated: The previously explained and so forth begin the explanation of the sixteenth chapter.

original: sngar bshad pa'i mtshan nyid ni le'u bcu gsum pa las gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i mtshan nyid ni le'u bcu gsum pa las gsungs pa'o //
translated: The previously explained characteristics are those stated in the thirteenth chapter.

original: dngos grub thams cad ces pa ni 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa ste zhib la sogs pa dang / khams la spyod pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dngos grub thams cad ces pa ni 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa ste zhib la sogs pa dang / khams la spyod pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The all powers are mundane and supramundane, such as the powers of pacification and so forth, and the powers of the elements and so forth.

original: de rnams dkyil 'khor du dbang bskur ba nyid la zhes pa ni sku dang gsung gi dkyil 'khor dag gi dbus su rdo rje slob dpon gyis yang dag par dbang bskur ba nyid la 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir zhes pa🔽ni bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams dkyil 'khor du dbang bskur ba nyid la zhes pa ni sku dang gsung gi dkyil 'khor dag gi dbus su rdo rje slob dpon gyis yang dag par dbang bskur ba nyid la 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir zhes pa ni bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase in the initiation into the maṇḍala means that the accomplishment is in the initiation into the maṇḍala of body and speech by the vajra master in the center of the maṇḍala. The phrase in order to demonstrate means in order to teach.

original: slob ma snod du bya ba'i don du zhes pa ni snod du gyur pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: slob ma snod du bya ba'i don du zhes pa ni snod du gyur pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase in order to make the disciple a vessel means in order to generate a vessel.

original: dkyil 'khor zhes pa ni sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi dkyil 'khor bsgrub pa ni de las nye bar dgongs pa ste de'i thabs su gyur ba la le'u bcu drug pa brtsam par bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor zhes pa ni sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi dkyil 'khor bsgrub pa ni de las nye bar dgongs pa ste de'i thabs su gyur ba la le'u bcu drug pa brtsam par bya'o //
translated: The phrase the maṇḍala means that the accomplishment of the maṇḍala of body, speech, and mind is intended from that, and the sixteenth chapter is undertaken as the means for that.

original: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is the intention.

original: re zhig le'u bzhi pa las thugs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga bstan to //
analyzed: re zhig le'u bzhi pa las thugs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga bstan to //
translated: First, the rite of the mind maṇḍala is taught in chapter 4.

original: 'dir ni sku dang gsung gi dkyil 'khor dag bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni sku dang gsung gi dkyil 'khor dag bstan par bya'o //
translated: Here, the maṇḍalas of body and speech are taught.

original: de nas gang zhig dbus kyi bdag por gyur pa des yang de'i dkyil 'khor yin no zhes rin chen 'byung ldan dang don yod grub pa'i dkyil 'khor rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas gang zhig dbus kyi bdag por gyur pa des yang de'i dkyil 'khor yin no zhes rin chen 'byung ldan dang don yod grub pa'i dkyil 'khor rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Then, the one who is the central lord should realize the maṇḍala of Ratnasaṃbhava and Amoghasiddhi, saying, “This is the maṇḍala of that.”

original: de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus nas sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor sum cu rtsa gnyis rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus nas sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor sum cu rtsa gnyis rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Having gathered all of them together, one should realize the maṇḍala of thirty-two, which is the nature of thirty-two.

original: dgongs pa gcig tu gyur nas zhes pa ni bsam pa gcig tu gyur nas so //
analyzed: dgongs pa gcig tu gyur nas zhes pa ni bsam pa gcig tu gyur nas so //
translated: Having become of one mind means having become of one intention.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po la zhes bya ba nas lhag ma'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga thos pa'i don du ni /
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po la zhes bya ba nas lhag ma'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga thos pa'i don du ni /
translated: From “Mahāvajra-dhara” up to “the remainder” means that for the sake of hearing the maṇḍala rite,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa kun zhi ba //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa kun zhi ba //
translated: “all tathāgatas”

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad las gsol ba 'debs pa dang / mi bskyod rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bstod pas @104b bstod cing phyi'i me tog la sogs pa dang / nang gi bdud rtsi lnga la sogs pa dang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad las gsol ba 'debs pa dang / mi bskyod rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bstod pas @104b bstod cing phyi'i me tog la sogs pa dang / nang gi bdud rtsi lnga la sogs pa dang /
translated: The outer flowers and so forth, and the inner five nectars and so forth,

original: gang ba ni yum reg bya rdo rje ma la sogs pa dang snyoms par zhugs pa'i bde bas mchod par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gang ba ni yum reg bya rdo rje ma la sogs pa dang snyoms par zhugs pa'i bde bas mchod par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: and the full is the offering of the bliss of union with the mother Sparśavajrā, and so forth.

original: rdo rje thams cad ces bya ba nas phyung pa'o zhes pa'i bar du ni sku'i dkyil 'khor gyi ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas sku'i dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: rdo rje thams cad ces bya ba nas phyung pa'o zhes pa'i bar du ni sku'i dkyil 'khor gyi ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas sku'i dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga bstan par bya ste /
translated: From “all vajras” up to “emerged” teaches the samayasattva of the body mandala, and having entered into equipoise in the samādhi of the body mandala, one should teach the rite of the body mandala.

original: de nas zhes bya ba nas dngos grub thams cad stsol ba'o zhes pa'i bar du ni bcom ldan 'das kyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la bstan pa rtsol ba bstan to //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba nas dngos grub thams cad stsol ba'o zhes pa'i bar du ni bcom ldan 'das kyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la bstan pa rtsol ba bstan to //
translated: From “then” up to “bestow all powers” teaches the teaching of the bhagavān to the tathāgatas.

original: rnam par snang mdzad kyi dkyil 'khor ni sku rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad kyi dkyil 'khor ni sku rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The mandala of Vairocana is the mandala of the vajra of body.

original: dngos grub thams cad stsol ba zhes pa ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i dngos grub ster ba'o //
analyzed: dngos grub thams cad stsol ba zhes pa ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i dngos grub ster ba'o //
translated: The phrase bestows all powers means bestows the powers of pacification, etc.

original: mi bskyod pa'i dkyil 'khor dang 'dra ba'o zhes pa ni le'u bzhi pa las gsungs pa'i thugs kyi dkyil 'khor dang 'dra ba'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa'i dkyil 'khor dang 'dra ba'o zhes pa ni le'u bzhi pa las gsungs pa'i thugs kyi dkyil 'khor dang 'dra ba'o zhes bya'o //
translated: The phrase like the mandala of Akshobhya means like the mandala of mind taught in chapter four.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just that,

original: gru bzhi la sogs pa'i yon tan gyis zhes smos so //
analyzed: gru bzhi la sogs pa'i yon tan gyis zhes smos so //
translated: he says, with the qualities of having four sides, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni sgo bzhi dang rta babs bzhi la sogs pa dang bcas pa'i mchog tu gyur pas zhes pa ni bya ba la sogs pa'i rgyud kyi dkyil 'khor la ltos pas so //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni sgo bzhi dang rta babs bzhi la sogs pa dang bcas pa'i mchog tu gyur pas zhes pa ni bya ba la sogs pa'i rgyud kyi dkyil 'khor la ltos pas so //
translated: The phrase with the qualities of having four sides, etc., means with the qualities of having four sides, four doors, four pediments, and so forth. The phrase supreme means supreme in comparison to the mandalas of the tantras of action, etc.

original: khru ni bcu drug ces pa ni sa'i khams ni khams bzhi'i ngo bo'i cha shas la ltos pas grangs bcud rug yin pas so //
analyzed: khru ni bcu drug ces pa ni sa'i khams ni khams bzhi'i ngo bo'i cha shas la ltos pas grangs bcud rug yin pas so //
translated: The phrase sixteen cubits means sixteen cubits in comparison to the four elements, which are parts of the nature of the earth element.

original: zur bzhi la ltos pa ste zhes pa ni kha cig na re kun du ngos re re khu bcu drug pa bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: zur bzhi la ltos pa ste zhes pa ni kha cig na re kun du ngos re re khu bcu drug pa bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: The four corners means that some say that each side should be sixteen cubits.

original: de yang phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa'i rgyal po dang blon po dang khyim bdag rnams la bya'o //
analyzed: de yang phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa'i rgyal po dang blon po dang khyim bdag rnams la bya'o //
translated: Moreover, it should be done for kings, ministers, and householders who are endowed with excellence.

original: tha mal pa rnams la phyogs bzhi la ltos pas so //
analyzed: tha mal pa rnams la phyogs bzhi la ltos pas so //
translated: For ordinary people, it is done in relation to the four directions.

original: zlum po ma yin zhes bya ba ni phyi'i dkyil 'khor bkag pa'o //
analyzed: zlum po ma yin zhes bya ba ni phyi'i dkyil 'khor bkag pa'o //
translated: Not round means that the outer maṇḍala is prohibited.

original: nang gi dkyil 'khor ni zlum po kho na zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi dkyil 'khor ni zlum po kho na zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The inner maṇḍala is only round, that is the intention.

original: dri ma med pa'i tshon zhes pa ni tshon dag pas so //
analyzed: dri ma med pa'i tshon zhes pa ni tshon dag pas so //
translated: Immaculate colors means with pure colors.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyis zhes pa ni sprul par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyis zhes pa ni sprul par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: All buddhas means those who will emanate.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ngo bo rdo rje 'chang gis so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ngo bo rdo rje 'chang gis so //
translated: All tathāgatas means by Vajradhara, the essence of all tathāgatas.

original: rab tu bsngags pa zhes pa ni bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu bsngags pa zhes pa ni bstan pa'o //
translated: Highly praised means taught.

original: bdag po nyid kyis mdzes par gyur pa ni gtso bos brgyan pa ste /

analyzed: dkyil 'khor ting nge 'dzin dang phyag rgya dang // sngags dang byed dang 'dug sngags sbyin sreg dang // sngags dang phyag rgya des bya 'dus pa ni // sngags kyi tshul la de nyid bcu bstan to //
translated: mantra, seal, and the assembly of those actions.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: These are the ten realities taught in the way of mantra.

original: rdo rje padma yang dag par 'dus par zhes bya ba nas sku'i dkyil 'khor 'di yin no zhes pa'i bar du ni rab tu gnas pa'i cho ga dang mchod pa'i cho ga dang slob ma 'jug pa dang / lhag par gnas pa dang dbang bskur ba la sogs pa byas nas padma dang rdo rje snyoms par zhugs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gsang ba'i mchod pas mchod la bdud rtsi lnga dang lcags kyu lngas sku'i dkyil 'khor mchod par bya'o zhes bstan to ;
analyzed: rdo rje padma yang dag par 'dus par zhes bya ba nas sku'i dkyil 'khor 'di yin no zhes pa'i bar du ni rab tu gnas pa'i cho ga dang mchod pa'i cho ga dang slob ma 'jug pa dang / lhag par gnas pa dang dbang bskur ba la sogs pa byas nas padma dang rdo rje snyoms par zhugs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gsang ba'i mchod pas mchod la bdud rtsi lnga dang lcags kyu lngas sku'i dkyil 'khor mchod par bya'o zhes bstan to ;
translated: The passage from “the correct union of the vajra and lotus” up to “this is the body mandala” teaches that after performing the consecration ritual, the worship ritual, the disciple entrance, the special abode, the consecration, and so forth, one should worship with the secret worship characterized by the union of the lotus and vajra, and worship the body mandala with the five nectars and the five hooks.

original: / de nas zhes bya ba nas de ston pa'o zhes pa'i bar du ni gsung gi dkyil 'khor bstan pa'i phyir 'od dpag tu med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa'i phyir ro //

translated: Then means after the mandala of body has been taught. Up to he taught is for the sake of teaching the mandala of speech, because the Bhagavat entered into the samadhi of Amitabha.

original: khru nyi shu zhes pa ni rnam pa bzhi'i ngag re re rnam par shes pa lnga las byung ba'i rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo yin pas so //
analyzed: khru nyi shu zhes pa ni rnam pa bzhi'i ngag re re rnam par shes pa lnga las byung ba'i rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo yin pas so //
translated: Twenty cubits means that each of the four types of speech is the nature of purity arising from the five consciousnesses.

analyzed: ngos re re zhing khru lnga lnga zhes pa ni tha mal pa rnams kyi'o //

translated: If there is wealth, twenty cubits in each direction is for kings and so forth.

original: rigs dang rjes su mthun pa bri bar bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rigs dang rjes su mthun pa bri bar bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: With the colors of the five tathagatas and so forth teaches that the center mandala should be a circle surrounded by a garland of lotuses, drawn according to the color of the family, with the chalk line having the characteristics explained above.

original: dkyil 'khor der zhes bya ba nas dgyes par 'gyur zhes pa'i bar du ni gzhi'i dkyil 'khor rdzogs na gzhi can gyi dkyil 'khor 'od dpag tu med pa bdag po lha sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis bskor bar bya'o //

translated: The passage from in that maṇḍala up to will be pleased teaches that when the fundamental maṇḍala is complete, the maṇḍala of the lord Amitābha surrounded by thirty-two deities should be made.

original: de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mnyes par 'gyur ba dang / dkyil 'khor la byin gyis brlab par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //🔽bshad gcig zhes bya ba nas 'od dpag tu med pa'i dkyil 'khor ro zhes ba'i bar du ni snga ma bzhin du rab tu gnas pa la sogs pa byas nas bdud rtsi lnga dang lcags kyu la sogs pas bdag nyi dang slob ma dang dkyil 'khor pa rnams
analyzed: de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mnyes par 'gyur ba dang / dkyil 'khor la byin gyis brlab par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to // bshad gcig zhes bya ba nas 'od dpag tu med pa'i dkyil 'khor ro zhes ba'i bar du ni snga ma bzhin du rab tu gnas pa la sogs pa byas nas bdud rtsi lnga dang lcags kyu la sogs pas bdag nyi dang slob ma dang dkyil 'khor pa rnams
translated: At that time, the tathāgatas will be pleased and will bless the maṇḍala.

original: tshim par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: tshim par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: The passage from one should explain up to the maṇḍala of Amitābha teaches that after performing consecration and so forth as before, one should satisfy oneself, the disciples, and the maṇḍala deities with the five nectars, hooks, and so on.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba nas tshul bstan par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i bar du ni le'u bzhi pa la gsungs pa'i thugs kyi dkyil 'khor dang bcas pa sku gsung thugs kyi dkyil 'khor bstan pa dang de'i 'og tu rin chen 'byung ldan dang don yod grub
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba nas tshul bstan par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i bar du ni le'u bzhi pa la gsungs pa'i thugs kyi dkyil 'khor dang bcas pa sku gsung thugs kyi dkyil 'khor bstan pa dang de'i 'og tu rin chen 'byung ldan dang don yod grub
translated: Thus up to in order to show the method teaches the maṇḍala of enlightened mind taught in chapter 4, the maṇḍala of enlightened body, speech, and mind, and below that, Ratnasaṃbhava, Amoghasiddhi,

analyzed: de ltar lha sum cu rtsa gnyis bdag nyid can gyi dkyil 'khor sum cu rtsa gnyis gcig tu bsdus nas lha stong phrag gcig dang nyi shu rtsa bzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the thirty-two maṇḍalas that have the nature of the thirty-two deities are gathered into one, becoming one set of one thousand and twenty-four deities.

original: de nas zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Then,

original: sku la sogs pa phyung ngo zhes pa'i bar du ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i dkyil 'khor pa rnams spros pas 'gro ba'i don byas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas bcom ldan 'das kyis don de nyid gsungs so zhes bstan to //

analyzed: 'on kyang rin chen 'byung ldan dang don yod grub pa'i rigs de'i nang du 'dus par 'gyur ro //
translated: However, the Ratnasaṃbhava and Amoghasiddhi families are included within that.

analyzed: de la gal te nga rgyal gti mug las byung ba yin na de'i tshe rnam par snang mdzad kyi rigs kyi nang du bsdus so //
translated: If pride arises from delusion, then it is included within the family of Vairocana.

original: gal te de nyid @106a * //
analyzed: gal te de nyid @106a * //
translated: If it arises from

analyzed: de ltar sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje'i rigs gsum la brten nas dkyil 'khor sum cu rtsa gnyis de'i rang bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, based on the three vajra families of body, speech, and mind, one should understand the thirty-two maṇḍalas to be their nature.

analyzed: sku la sogs pa'i gsang ba ni rnam pa gsum gyi dkyil 'khor la'o //

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor lo zhes pa ni bdag po dang bcas pa'i dkyil 'khor ba'i tshogs so //
translated: The wheel of the Tathagata is the assembly of the mandala with its lord.

analyzed: sems dga' bar byed pa zhes pa ni de rnams mngon du byed pa'o //

analyzed: de nyid lha yin pas zhes pa ni brjod par bya ba dang rjod pa dag dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: dkyil 'khor gsum po thig gdab pa ni dbye ba bskyed pa la nye bar dgongs pas thig ces bya'o //

analyzed: mi 'jigs pa zhes pa ni nus pa ma nyams pa ste /

original: rang gi nus pa las mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi nus pa las mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //

translated: All mantras means the essence, the close essence, the incantation, the knowledge mantra, the dharani mantra, the horizontal mantra, the seed, the dharma syllable, the snake, the headless, the endless, the collection, and so forth.

original: gnas su gyur pa ni bsdu bar gyur pas na tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnas su gyur pa ni bsdu bar gyur pas na tha tshig go //
translated: The term transformation means collection.

original: de yang sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: de yang sngar bshad zin to //

original: aom a'a: h'um zhes bya ba ni dpe bstan pa'o //
analyzed: aom a'a: h'um zhes bya ba ni dpe bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase Om, A, Hum is the teaching of the example.

translated: The phrase vajra and so on up to contemplates means that one should twist the thread consecrated with the three syllables with the mantra Anugata and so on, and having caused it to enter the space of the Tathagatas

analyzed: dang gcig tu byas te /
translated: and made it one with them,

analyzed: @106b 'dus pa las gsungs pa'i cho ga bya ba yin gyi gzhan du na dngos grub mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: It is taught that one should perform the rite as it is taught in the Compendium of Practice, otherwise there will be no attainment.

translated: The passage from “therefore” up to “should be accomplished” teaches that the vajra master should generate the pledge seal consort as the form of the goddess, pervade her with the five lineages, and then together with her cast the mandala lines.

analyzed: med ba'i gzugs su bdag nyid bskyed la /
translated: The passage from “thus” up to “the words of the compiler” teaches that the mantra practitioners who wish to draw the three mandalas of body and so forth should generate themselves in the form of Vairocana, Akshobya, and Amitabha by way of the creation stage.

original: dam tshig gi phyag rgya rnams kyang spyan ma dang gos dkar mo dang m'a ma k'i'i gzugs can snga ma bzhin du rigs lngas byin gyis brlabs par byas la /
