translated: The pledge seals should also be generated as the forms of Lochana, Mamaki, and Pandaravasini, and they should be empowered by the five lineages as before.

original: snga ma bzhin du thig gdab bar bya'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du thig gdab bar bya'o //
translated: As before, one should lay out the lines.

original: de ltar gyur ba'i thugs rdo rje la sogs pas sgrub ba po dang phyag rgya dag gis lus la 'jug cing /
analyzed: de ltar gyur ba'i thugs rdo rje la sogs pas sgrub ba po dang phyag rgya dag gis lus la 'jug cing /
translated: Thus, the heart-vajra and so forth of the practitioner and the consort enter into their bodies,

original: de'i gzugs kyis dkyil 'khor bri bar bstan to //🔽sngags kyi dngos grub ces bya ba nas rdzogs par byed pa'o zhes pa'i bar du ni dkyil 'khor bri ba rdzogs par gyur na /
analyzed: de'i gzugs kyis dkyil 'khor bri bar bstan to // sngags kyi dngos grub ces bya ba nas rdzogs par byed pa'o zhes pa'i bar du ni dkyil 'khor bri ba rdzogs par gyur na /
translated: and it is taught that one should draw the maṇḍala with their forms.

original: rang gi snying ga nas gnod mdzes kyi rgyal po spros la /
analyzed: rang gi snying ga nas gnod mdzes kyi rgyal po spros la /
translated: Having completed the drawing of the maṇḍala, from one’s heart one should emanate the king of the wrathful ones,

original: de la gsol ba gdab pa sngon du 'gro bar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dgug cing dkyil 'khor ba dang gcig tu byas te /
analyzed: de la gsol ba gdab pa sngon du 'gro bar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dgug cing dkyil 'khor ba dang gcig tu byas te /
translated: and having first made a request to him, one should summon the tathāgatas and make them one with the maṇḍala.

original: sgo bzhi la phyag 'tshal ba sngon du 'gro bar khrus la sogs pa rdzogs nas /
analyzed: sgo bzhi la phyag 'tshal ba sngon du 'gro bar khrus la sogs pa rdzogs nas /
translated: Having completed the bathing and so forth, preceded by prostrations to the four doors,

original: mchod pa rnam pa lnga yis dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dang dbyer med pas mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: mchod pa rnam pa lnga yis dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dang dbyer med pas mchod par bya'o //
translated: one should make offerings to the tathāgatas of the three times, who are inseparable from the maṇḍala, with the five offerings.

original: de'i tshe 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: At that time, one will attain mundane and supramundane powers.

original: sngags thams cad ces bya ba nas bya bar dgongs so zhes ba'i bar du ni dkyil 'khor de nyid la mchod pa'i dus su rdo rje slob dpon dang rdo rje'i spun dang / dge slong dang dge tshul dang dge bsnyen dang rnal 'byor pa dam tshig can de la gnas ba gang yin pa de rnams bshad ba la sogs pa'i sgras brdar byas ba'i 'dod pa'i yon tan ldas mchod par bya'o //🔽de med na dgag pa'i mya ngan gcod pa'i @107a * //
analyzed: sngags thams cad ces bya ba nas bya bar dgongs so zhes ba'i bar du ni dkyil 'khor de nyid la mchod pa'i dus su rdo rje slob dpon dang rdo rje'i spun dang / dge slong dang dge tshul dang dge bsnyen dang rnal 'byor pa dam tshig can de la gnas ba gang yin pa de rnams bshad ba la sogs pa'i sgras brdar byas ba'i 'dod pa'i yon tan ldas mchod par bya'o // de med na dgag pa'i mya ngan gcod pa'i @107a * //
translated: From “all mantras” up to “should be done” explains that at the time of making offerings to that very maṇḍala, one should make offerings to the vajra master, vajra siblings, bhikṣus, śrāmaṇeras, upāsakas, and yogins who abide in the commitments with the ten aspects of the enjoyments of desire, such as singing and so on.

original: chang gis tshim par bya'o //
analyzed: chang gis tshim par bya'o //
translated: If they are not present, one should satisfy them with the beer of the explanation of the Mahāyāna.

original: da ni nang gi sbyin sreg dang 'da' bar dka' ba'i dam tshig dang sdom pa de nyid yin no //
analyzed: da ni nang gi sbyin sreg dang 'da' bar dka' ba'i dam tshig dang sdom pa de nyid yin no //
translated: Now, this is the inner fire puja and the commitment and vow that are difficult to transgress.

original: des ni tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i cho ga bsgrub par bya'o zhes bstan te de yang sngar bshad zin pa'o //
analyzed: des ni tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i cho ga bsgrub par bya'o zhes bstan te de yang sngar bshad zin pa'o //
translated: This teaches that the wheel of the gaṇacakra should be accomplished, and that has been explained previously.

original: de ltar legs par bslabs pa'i phyag rgya zhes bya ba nas shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gang gi tshe dkyil 'khor gsum 'dri bar 'dod pa'i rnal 'byor pas phyag rgya med na de'i tshe bdag nyid sku'i dkyil 'khor bri ba'i dus su rnam par🔽snang mdzad bsgoms la /
analyzed: de ltar legs par bslabs pa'i phyag rgya zhes bya ba nas shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gang gi tshe dkyil 'khor gsum 'dri bar 'dod pa'i rnal 'byor pas phyag rgya med na de'i tshe bdag nyid sku'i dkyil 'khor bri ba'i dus su rnam par snang mdzad bsgoms la /
translated: Thus, the one who is well trained in the mudra, up to “should be known” is as follows: When the yogī wishes to draw the three maṇḍalas, if there is no mudrā, then at the time of drawing the maṇḍala of the body, the yogī should visualize himself as Vairocana.

original: slob ma rdo rje sems dpa' 'am bdud rtsi 'khyil bar bsam par bya'o //🔽de bzhin du gsung gi dkyil 'khor 'dri bar 'dod pas bdag nyid 'od dpag tu med par bsgoms nas slob mas rnam par snang mdzad dam bdud rtsi 'khyil bar bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: slob ma rdo rje sems dpa' 'am bdud rtsi 'khyil bar bsam par bya'o // de bzhin du gsung gi dkyil 'khor 'dri bar 'dod pas bdag nyid 'od dpag tu med par bsgoms nas slob mas rnam par snang mdzad dam bdud rtsi 'khyil bar bsam par bya'o //
translated: The disciple should be visualized as Vajrasattva or Amṛtakuṇḍali.🔽Similarly, one who wishes to draw the maṇḍala of speech should visualize himself as Amitābha, and the disciple should be visualized as Vairocana or Amṛtakuṇḍali.

original: de bzhin du thugs kyi dkyil 'khor bri bar 'dod pas bdag nyid mi bskyod par bsams la /
analyzed: de bzhin du thugs kyi dkyil 'khor bri bar 'dod pas bdag nyid mi bskyod par bsams la /
translated: Similarly, one who wishes to draw the maṇḍala of mind should visualize himself as Akṣobhya, and the disciple should be visualized as Vairocana or Amṛtakuṇḍali.

original: slob ma 'od dpag tu med pa 'am bdud rtsi 'khyil par bsam par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: slob ma 'od dpag tu med pa 'am bdud rtsi 'khyil par bsam par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: The disciples should be imagined as Amitābha or Amṛtakuṇḍali.

original: sangs rgyas rgyal po zhes bya ba nas bgrod pa dam pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni kha dog lnga dang ldan pa'i thig skud re re snal ma lnga dang ldan pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rgyal po zhes bya ba nas bgrod pa dam pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni kha dog lnga dang ldan pa'i thig skud re re snal ma lnga dang ldan pa /
translated: From “the king of buddhas” up to “the supreme path” teaches that each of the five-colored threads should have five strands.

original: de bzhin du rdul tshon rnams kyang de bzhin du byas la dkyil 'khor la thig btab pa dang bri bar bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin du rdul tshon rnams kyang de bzhin du byas la dkyil 'khor la thig btab pa dang bri bar bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: Similarly, the colored powders should be made in that way and the maṇḍala should be drawn with the lines.

original: 'dir gtso bo dang yon tan pa'i tshul gyis zhes pa ni de la thugs kyi rdo rje 'chang gcig pu yang rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa gzhan rnam pa bzhi dang dbyer med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'dir gtso bo dang yon tan pa'i tshul gyis zhes pa ni de la thugs kyi rdo rje 'chang gcig pu yang rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa gzhan rnam pa bzhi dang dbyer med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
translated: Here, “in the manner of the principal and the qualities” means that the one mind-vajra holder is the essence of the indivisibility of the four aspects, such as Vairocana,

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi cha dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi cha dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the gnosis of the dharmadhātu and so on possess the other parts.

original: de la gtso bo ni las kha cig nyon mongs pa la sogs pa rnam par dag pa la bdag po nyid do //
analyzed: de la gtso bo ni las kha cig nyon mongs pa la sogs pa rnam par dag pa la bdag po nyid do //
translated: The principal one is that some actions are the dominant condition for the purification of the afflictions, etc.

original: yon tan pa ni phrin las gzhan ma la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: yon tan pa ni phrin las gzhan ma la sogs pa la'o //
translated: The virtuous one is for the other actions, etc.

original: de'i nus pa de med pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: de'i nus pa de med pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: That potency is not absent,

original: ye shes lnga ni nus pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes lnga ni nus pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the five gnoses have all potencies.

original: ji skad du /🔽gdul bya'i bsam pa'i dbye ba yis //
analyzed: ji skad du / gdul bya'i bsam pa'i dbye ba yis //
translated: As it is said:🔽The virtuous one and the principal one are imagined

original: yon tan pa dang gtso bor brtags //
analyzed: yon tan pa dang gtso bor brtags //
translated: by the divisions of the thoughts of those to be tamed.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi ye shes lnga //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi ye shes lnga //
translated: The five gnoses of the buddhas

original: nus pa kun dang ldan pa yin //🔽zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: nus pa kun dang ldan pa yin // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: have all potencies.

original: dkyil 'khor bri ba'i dus su zhes bya ba nas bgegs byed par mi nus sa so zhes @107b bya ba'i bar du ni gang gi tshe dkyil 'khor bri bar 'dod par brtsams nas sa dang chu dang rlung dang me dang nam mkhas byas pa'i bgegs 'byung bar 'gyur
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bri ba'i dus su zhes bya ba nas bgegs byed par mi nus sa so zhes @107b bya ba'i bar du ni gang gi tshe dkyil 'khor bri bar 'dod par brtsams nas sa dang chu dang rlung dang me dang nam mkhas byas pa'i bgegs 'byung bar 'gyur
translated: When it says “at the time of drawing the maṇḍala” up to “cannot create obstacles,” when one begins to draw the maṇḍala, obstacles created by earth, water, wind, fire, and space arise.

original: na de'i tshe bdag nyid rdo rje h'um mdzad zhal gsum pa phyag drug pa sku mdog nag po spyan gsum pa g-yas pa dang g-yon pa'i zhal dkar po dang dmar po mnga' ba /
analyzed: na de'i tshe bdag nyid rdo rje h'um mdzad zhal gsum pa phyag drug pa sku mdog nag po spyan gsum pa g-yas pa dang g-yon pa'i zhal dkar po dang dmar po mnga' ba /
translated: He has a right and left face that are white and red, respectively.🔽He holds a vajra, wheel, lotus, and bell in his right hands, and a jewel and sword in his left hands.

original: rdo rje dang 'khor lo dang padma dang dril bu dang / nor bu dang ral gri bsnams pa g-yon brkyang ba mche ba rnam par gtsigs pa bsgoms te /
analyzed: rdo rje dang 'khor lo dang padma dang dril bu dang / nor bu dang ral gri bsnams pa g-yon brkyang ba mche ba rnam par gtsigs pa bsgoms te /
translated: He stands with his left leg straight, and his fangs are bared.

original: rdo rje lcags kyu 'god pa'i rkang pa dag gis dkyil 'khor gyi sa gzhi'i phyogs kun du 'khor bas sngags brjod cing yid kyis chos thams cad stong pa nyid du bsgoms la /
analyzed: rdo rje lcags kyu 'god pa'i rkang pa dag gis dkyil 'khor gyi sa gzhi'i phyogs kun du 'khor bas sngags brjod cing yid kyis chos thams cad stong pa nyid du bsgoms la /
translated: With the two lines “Vajra hook, arranging the ground of the mandala,” one should recite the mantra while circumambulating the ground of the mandala with one’s mind, meditating on all phenomena as emptiness.

original: rang gi phyag mtshan las 'byung ba'i ra bar ba'i tshogs kyis bgegs de rnams bsregs shing thal bar gyur par bsams la thal ba yang rlung drag pos khyer bar gyur par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi phyag mtshan las 'byung ba'i ra bar ba'i tshogs kyis bgegs de rnams bsregs shing thal bar gyur par bsams la thal ba yang rlung drag pos khyer bar gyur par bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine that the assembly of blazing vajras that arise from one’s hand implements burns the obstructors and reduces them to ashes. One should imagine that a strong wind blows away the ashes.

original: de'i tshe bde bas dkyil 'khor rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de'i tshe bde bas dkyil 'khor rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: At that time, the mandala is complete with bliss.

original: rdo rje bum pa bzhag pa zhes bya ba nas ji lta ba bzhin du gzhag par bya'o zhes pa'i bar du ni de kho na nyid 'dus pa'i rgyud la mngon par brtson pa'i sgrub pa pos rnam par rgyal ba la sogs pa'i bum pa rnams dkyil 'khor ba'i
analyzed: rdo rje bum pa bzhag pa zhes bya ba nas ji lta ba bzhin du gzhag par bya'o zhes pa'i bar du ni de kho na nyid 'dus pa'i rgyud la mngon par brtson pa'i sgrub pa pos rnam par rgyal ba la sogs pa'i bum pa rnams dkyil 'khor ba'i
translated: From “the vajra vase is placed” up to “should be placed just as it is,” the practitioner who is diligent in the Tattvasamgraha Tantra should place the vases of the victorious ones and so on, which are thirty-two in number according to the number of deities in the mandala,🔽and the all-activity vase. If those are not available, there should be at least nine vases of the tathāgatas and goddesses and the all-activity vase.

original: grangs kyis sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / las thams cad pa'i bum pa de ma 'tshogs na de bzhin gshegs pa dang lha mo'i bum pa ste dgu dang / las thams cad kyi bum pa ste bcu las nyung par mi bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs pas bsdus pa de rnams kyang mgrin pa ring ba lto ba rgyas pa /
analyzed: grangs kyis sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / las thams cad pa'i bum pa de ma 'tshogs na de bzhin gshegs pa dang lha mo'i bum pa ste dgu dang / las thams cad kyi bum pa ste bcu las nyung par mi bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs pas bsdus pa de rnams kyang mgrin pa ring ba lto ba rgyas pa /
translated: Those vases should be tall and full,

original: nag po dang rtsa ba med pa'i shing gi yal ga dang / ras kyis mgrin par brgyan pa /
analyzed: nag po dang rtsa ba med pa'i shing gi yal ga dang / ras kyis mgrin par brgyan pa /
translated: with branches of black or rootless trees and decorated at the neck with cloth.

original: ha sa de ba dang / kanda ka ri dang / bri ha ti dang / bha la mu ta dang / dandotpa la ste sman lnga'i snying po can dang / de bzhin du aindra n'i la dang / mar gad dang / padma r'a ga dang /
analyzed: ha sa de ba dang / kanda ka ri dang / bri ha ti dang / bha la mu ta dang / dandotpa la ste sman lnga'i snying po can dang / de bzhin du aindra n'i la dang / mar gad dang / padma r'a ga dang /
translated: The five medicines are hāṣa deva, kaṇḍakari, bṛhatī, balamūtri, and dandotpala.

original: beed'urya dang / shel te rin po che lnga dang ldan pa /🔽nas dang / til dang ma sha dang / so ba dang / gro ste 'bru lnga dang ldan pa dri bzangs kyi chus yongs su gang ba /
analyzed: beed'urya dang / shel te rin po che lnga dang ldan pa / nas dang / til dang ma sha dang / so ba dang / gro ste 'bru lnga dang ldan pa dri bzangs kyi chus yongs su gang ba /
translated: The five precious substances are sapphire, emerald, ruby,🔽cat’s eye, and crystal.🔽The five grains are barley, sesame, māṣa, wheat, and rice.🔽The vase is filled with water scented with saffron and is adorned with a vase filled with rice, ginger, sugarcane, betel nut,🔽and nutmeg.

original: 'og tu 'bras dang gla gor zho sha dang bil ba dang / dz'a ti pha la dang / tarka ka dang / pa ni dang bcas pa'i snod gang bas brgyan pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i mchod pa rnam pa ldas mchod par @108a * //
analyzed: 'og tu 'bras dang gla gor zho sha dang bil ba dang / dz'a ti pha la dang / tarka ka dang / pa ni dang bcas pa'i snod gang bas brgyan pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i mchod pa rnam pa ldas mchod par @108a * //
translated: Make offerings with the five branches of offerings.

original: byas pa me tog gi phreng ba dad dar dbyangs kyis brgyan pa legs par bdugs pas rang rang gi rigs kyi chos kyi yi ges mtshan pa shar la sogs pa phyogs dang mtshams dang mdun dang g-yas phyogs su gzhag par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: byas pa me tog gi phreng ba dad dar dbyangs kyis brgyan pa legs par bdugs pas rang rang gi rigs kyi chos kyi yi ges mtshan pa shar la sogs pa phyogs dang mtshams dang mdun dang g-yas phyogs su gzhag par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: Having thus completed the mandala,

original: de ltar dkyil 'khor yongs su rdzogs nas zhes bya ba 'dis rgyud kyi tshig rnams mdo spros byas nas dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga thams cad rdzogs la /
analyzed: de ltar dkyil 'khor yongs su rdzogs nas zhes bya ba 'dis rgyud kyi tshig rnams mdo spros byas nas dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga thams cad rdzogs la /
translated: having expanded the words of the tantra, all the rites of the mandala are complete.🔽Then one should perform the burnt offerings,🔽in order to satisfy the mantra deities,🔽and likewise in order to pacify the obstructors,

original: de nas sbyin sreg bya'o zhes bya ba 'dis sngags kyi lha rnams tshim par bya ba'i phyir dang / de bzhin du bgegs rnams zhi bar bya ba'i phyir dang / slob ma'i tshogs dang rgyal po la sogs pa dang / skye dgu rnams la zhi ba'i phyir sbyin sreg bya ste /
analyzed: de nas sbyin sreg bya'o zhes bya ba 'dis sngags kyi lha rnams tshim par bya ba'i phyir dang / de bzhin du bgegs rnams zhi bar bya ba'i phyir dang / slob ma'i tshogs dang rgyal po la sogs pa dang / skye dgu rnams la zhi ba'i phyir sbyin sreg bya ste /
translated: and in order to pacify the host of disciples, the king, and so on, and the people.

original: dam tshig gi me lha'i zhal nas ye shes kyi me lha dang dkyil 'khor pa rnams tshim par bya'o zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: dam tshig gi me lha'i zhal nas ye shes kyi me lha dang dkyil 'khor pa rnams tshim par bya'o zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The fire god of the sacred commitment is visualized as saying, “Satisfy the fire god of pristine awareness and the maṇḍala.”

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: ma bzlas pas ni sngags mi 'grub //
analyzed: ma bzlas pas ni sngags mi 'grub //
translated: Without recitation, the mantra is not accomplished.

original: sbyin sreg ma byas 'bras mi 'byin //
analyzed: sbyin sreg ma byas 'bras mi 'byin //
translated: Without fire sacrifice, the result is not produced.

original: de phyir las rnams thams cad la //
analyzed: de phyir las rnams thams cad la //
translated: Therefore, in all rites,

original: sbyin sreg las ni rab tu 'dod //
analyzed: sbyin sreg las ni rab tu 'dod //
translated: the rite of fire sacrifice is highly recommended.

original: char dkon dus su ji ltar 'bru //
analyzed: char dkon dus su ji ltar 'bru //
translated: Just as in a time of little rain

original: skams pa char gyis tshim gyur pa //
analyzed: skams pa char gyis tshim gyur pa //
translated: the dry land is satisfied by rain,

original: de bzhin skye dgu thams cad ni //
analyzed: de bzhin skye dgu thams cad ni //
translated: so all living beings

original: sbyin sreg gis ni tshim par 'gyur //🔽zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sbyin sreg gis ni tshim par 'gyur // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: are satisfied by fire sacrifice.

original: de la me thab ni /
analyzed: de la me thab ni /
translated: As for the hearth,

original: gdul bya'i dbang gis mtha' yas pa //
analyzed: gdul bya'i dbang gis mtha' yas pa //
translated: it is limitless due to the power of those to be tamed.

original: rigs kyi dbye ba rnam pa lnga //
analyzed: rigs kyi dbye ba rnam pa lnga //
translated: The division of the family is fivefold.

original: las kyi dbye bas bzhi yin te //
analyzed: las kyi dbye bas bzhi yin te //
translated: The division of the rite is fourfold.

original: me thab de ltar gtan la dbab //
analyzed: me thab de ltar gtan la dbab //
translated: The hearth is determined in that way.

original: zhi ba la ni zlum po dkar //
analyzed: zhi ba la ni zlum po dkar //
translated: For pacifying, it is round and white.

original: rgyas par ser po gru bzhi pa //
analyzed: rgyas par ser po gru bzhi pa //
translated: For increasing, it is yellow and square.

original: dbang la dmar po gru gsum pa //
analyzed: dbang la dmar po gru gsum pa //
translated: For controlling, it is red and triangular.

original: gsod la nag po gzhu bzhin no //
analyzed: gsod la nag po gzhu bzhin no //
translated: For killing, it is black and bow-shaped.

original: de rnams kyi rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du dkyus dang dpangs su khru gcig dang khru phyed dang khru gnyis dang khru bzhi dang lhag ma rnams de dang 'dra ba /
analyzed: de rnams kyi rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du dkyus dang dpangs su khru gcig dang khru phyed dang khru gnyis dang khru bzhi dang lhag ma rnams de dang 'dra ba /
translated: Their dimensions are one cubit, one and a half cubits, two cubits, four cubits, and the rest are similar.

original: khru bzhi pa dang / khru gnyis pa dang / khru brgyad pa dang / khru bzhi pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: khru bzhi pa dang / khru gnyis pa dang / khru brgyad pa dang / khru bzhi pa zhes bya'o //
translated: [They are called] four cubits, two cubits, eight cubits, and four cubits.

original: khru gang gi tshad tsam gyis me thab las sor bzhi dpangs te /
analyzed: khru gang gi tshad tsam gyis me thab las sor bzhi dpangs te /
translated: The hearth is the size of one cubit, four fingerbreadths in height.

original: dpangs dang dkyus su kha khyer sor bzhi pa de 'dra bar bya'o //
analyzed: dpangs dang dkyus su kha khyer sor bzhi pa de 'dra bar bya'o //
translated: The lip is four fingerbreadths in height and width.

original: de bzhin du brgyad dang bcu drug ces bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du brgyad dang bcu drug ces bya'o //
translated: Similarly, [they are called] eight and sixteen.

original: me thab thams cad kyi rang rang dang 'dra ba'i kha khyer bya'o //
analyzed: me thab thams cad kyi rang rang dang 'dra ba'i kha khyer bya'o //
translated: The lips are similar to each of the hearths.

original: me thab thams cad kyi phyi rol du gru bzhi pa dang sgo bzhi'i dkyil 'khor du thig btab nas shar gyi sgo la sogs pa la lcags kyu dang zhags pa @108b dang lcags sgrog dang dril bu rnams kyi phyag mtshan bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: me thab thams cad kyi phyi rol du gru bzhi pa dang sgo bzhi'i dkyil 'khor du thig btab nas shar gyi sgo la sogs pa la lcags kyu dang zhags pa @108b dang lcags sgrog dang dril bu rnams kyi phyag mtshan bri bar bya'o //
translated: Outside all the hearths, having laid out a square and four-doored maṇḍala, one should draw the emblems of the hook, noose, shackles, and bell at the eastern door, and so forth.

analyzed: nub kyi snam bu la 'khor lo dang / ral gri dang / phub dang / mdung dang / be con te lnga'o //

original: yang na las thams cad pa ni zlum po kho na ste /

analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //

translated: Likewise, one who is angry should be adorned with blue garments and so forth, and with garments wet with blood and water, and should stand on the corpse in the squatting position, with the left foot on the right foot, and with unmoving eyes, gnashing the teeth.

analyzed: de ni sgrub pa po'i tshogs pa'o //

analyzed: de nas rang gi 'dod pa'i lha'i rnal 'byor ji ltar gsungs pa las dang rjes su mthun pa byas te /
translated: Then, one should perform the yoga of one's chosen deity as taught, in accordance with the rite.

analyzed: bgegs kyi tshogs la phur bus gdab pa dang rdo rje dra ba la sogs pa byas te /

analyzed: yi ge h'um ngam rang gi chos kyi yi ge las me thab bskyed la /

analyzed: de'i dbus kyi lte bar yi ge ram 'bar ba yongs su gyur pa las gru gsum bsams la /

translated: From those three syllables, one should generate the three wheels, lotus, and vajra, along with the seed syllables, which are the nature of the three realms of desire, form, and formlessness. In the center, one should visualize the syllable raṃ, which is fully transformed into a blazing fire.

original: phyag mtshan gsum dang yi ge ram de dag yongs su gyur pa las 'bar ba'i dbus su chu'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa dag byed kyi me lha khams gsum gyi bdag nyid zhi ba'i don tu bsgom par bya'o //

translated: From the three hand implements and the syllable raṃ, which are fully transformed, one should visualize the fire god, who resides in the middle of the blazing fire, on the water maṇḍala, for the purpose of pacifying the nature of the three realms.

original: zhi ba la dkar po zhal gcig pa spyan gsum pa phyag bzhi pa ral pa'i thor gtsug can /🔽phyag g-yas pa dag la dbyig pa dang mi 'jigs pa g-yon ba dag la phreng ba dang gundhe 'dzin pa na bza' @110a * //

translated: For pacification, one should visualize the white [fire god] with one face, three eyes, four arms, and a topknot of matted hair.

analyzed: dkar po dang rgyan dang ldan pa /

original: rgyas pa la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyas pa la yang de bzhin no //

analyzed: 'on kyang kha dog ser po gos dang rgyan la sogs pa ser pos brgyan pa /
translated: However, one should visualize the color of the fire god as yellow, adorned with yellow garments and ornaments, and so on,

original: dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor la gnas pa ye shes kyi me lha mchog sbyin gyi phyag gis sems can thams cad la stobs dang kha dog dang dbal gyis phun sum tshogs ba 'phel bar byed pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor la gnas pa ye shes kyi me lha mchog sbyin gyi phyag gis sems can thams cad la stobs dang kha dog dang dbal gyis phun sum tshogs ba 'phel bar byed pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: and dwelling in the maṇḍala of the great element of earth, and the wisdom fire god, with the hand of supreme generosity, increasing the perfection of strength, color, and splendor for all sentient beings.

original: de bzhin du dbang dang dgug pa dag la kha dog dmar po 'dod pa'i me lha me'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa na bza' dang rgyan dmar po la sogs pas brgyan pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du dbang dang dgug pa dag la kha dog dmar po 'dod pa'i me lha me'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa na bza' dang rgyan dmar po la sogs pas brgyan pa /
translated: Similarly, in the case of enthralling and summoning, one should visualize the color of the fire god as red, the fire god of passion, dwelling in the maṇḍala of fire, adorned with red garments and ornaments, and so on,

original: phyag g-yas pa dang g-yon pa dag la lcags kyu dang zhags pa 'dzin pa bsgoms te lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phyag g-yas pa dang g-yon pa dag la lcags kyu dang zhags pa 'dzin pa bsgoms te lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: holding a hook and a noose in the right and left hands, respectively, and the rest as before.

original: gsod pa la rlung gi dkyil 'khor la gnas pa kha dog nag po mche ba rnam par gtsigs pa mig g-yo ba /
analyzed: gsod pa la rlung gi dkyil 'khor la gnas pa kha dog nag po mche ba rnam par gtsigs pa mig g-yo ba /
translated: For the killing rite, one should visualize the wind-god as having a black-colored wind-mandala, bared fangs, and moving eyes.

original: yi ge h'um las byung ba kha dog nag po na bza' la sogs pas brgyan pa /
analyzed: yi ge h'um las byung ba kha dog nag po na bza' la sogs pas brgyan pa /
translated: He arises from the syllable hūṃ, is black-colored, and is adorned with garments and so forth.

original: phyag g-yas pa ral gri dang g-yon pa la sdigs mdzub 'chang ba /
analyzed: phyag g-yas pa ral gri dang g-yon pa la sdigs mdzub 'chang ba /
translated: He holds a sword in his right hand and makes a threatening gesture with his left.

original: skra 'bar ba gyen du brjes pa /
analyzed: skra 'bar ba gyen du brjes pa /
translated: His hair is blazing and stands upward.

original: 'jigs byed chen po'i 'bar ba nag pos khams gsum khyab ba rlung gi me lha bsgom par bya'o zhes me lha mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'jigs byed chen po'i 'bar ba nag pos khams gsum khyab ba rlung gi me lha bsgom par bya'o zhes me lha mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: One should visualize the wind-god as being pervaded by the great blazing black Bhairava. This is the brief explanation of the fire-god.

original: de la 'o ma can gyi shing las byung ba'am dgon pa las byung ba'am /
analyzed: de la 'o ma can gyi shing las byung ba'am dgon pa las byung ba'am /
translated: For that, one should take the fire from a tree that has sap, or from a forest,

original: rgyun chags kyi me 'am tha mal pa'i bram ze'i me zhi ba'i las la blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgyun chags kyi me 'am tha mal pa'i bram ze'i me zhi ba'i las la blang bar bya'o //
translated: or from a continuous fire, or from an ordinary brahmin's fire for the pacifying rite.

original: rgyal po'am blon po'am nags tshal lam tshang bang gi me rgyas pa la'o //
analyzed: rgyal po'am blon po'am nags tshal lam tshang bang gi me rgyas pa la'o //
translated: For the increasing rite, one should take the fire from a king, a minister, a forest, or a granary.

original: rje rigs sam smad 'tshod ma'i me ni dbang la'o //
analyzed: rje rigs sam smad 'tshod ma'i me ni dbang la'o //
translated: For the subjugating rite, one should take the fire from a kṣatriya or a caṇḍāla.

original: gar mkhan dang mtshan mkhan dang 'gron po'i me ni dgug pa la'o //
analyzed: gar mkhan dang mtshan mkhan dang 'gron po'i me ni dgug pa la'o //
translated: The fire of the dancer, the fire of the astrologer, and the fire of the traveler are for summoning.

original: dur khrod kyi me'am rdo las byung ba'i me mngon spyod la gzung bar bya'o zhes me'i ngo bo mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dur khrod kyi me'am rdo las byung ba'i me mngon spyod la gzung bar bya'o zhes me'i ngo bo mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: The fire of the charnel ground or the fire that arises from stones should be taken for the rite of assault. This is the brief presentation of the nature of fire.

original: de nas las dang rjes su mthun pa'i gser la sogs pa'i snod gnyis te /
analyzed: de nas las dang rjes su mthun pa'i gser la sogs pa'i snod gnyis te /
translated: Then there are two vessels of gold and so forth, in accordance with the rite,

original: aa rgha'i snod dang las thams cad pa'i snod do //
analyzed: aa rgha'i snod dang las thams cad pa'i snod do //
translated: the vessel of argha and the vessel for all rites.

original: gnyi ga yang dri bzang gi chus gang ba de la yang aargha'i snod ni zho dang ku sha dang 'bru la sogs pa dang ldan pa byas la gnyi ga la yang me tog dgram zhing /
analyzed: gnyi ga yang dri bzang gi chus gang ba de la yang aargha'i snod ni zho dang ku sha dang 'bru la sogs pa dang ldan pa byas la gnyi ga la yang me tog dgram zhing /
translated: Both are filled with perfumed water, and the vessel of argha is made to have curd, kuśa grass, grains, and so forth. Flowers are scattered on both,

original: aargha'i snod ni g-yon phyogs su rang gi rigs kyi lha'i sngags kyis mngon par bzlas @110b nas gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: aargha'i snod ni g-yon phyogs su rang gi rigs kyi lha'i sngags kyis mngon par bzlas @110b nas gzhag par bya'o //
translated: and the vessel of argha is placed to the left, having been enchanted with the mantra of the deity of one's family.

original: rdo rje gnod sbyin dang / rdo rje rtse mo'i sngags dag gis las thams cad pa'i snod lan nyi shu rtsa gcig mngon par bzlas nas gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje gnod sbyin dang / rdo rje rtse mo'i sngags dag gis las thams cad pa'i snod lan nyi shu rtsa gcig mngon par bzlas nas gzhag par bya'o //
translated: With the mantras of Vajrayakṣa and Vajraśekhara, one should place the vessel for all activities, having enchanted it twenty-one times.

original: aom badzra she kha re ru dra mata /🔽rdo rje khu tshur gnyis kyis mthe chung gnyis mche ba'i tshul du bstan pa ni rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: aom badzra she kha re ru dra mata / rdo rje khu tshur gnyis kyis mthe chung gnyis mche ba'i tshul du bstan pa ni rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: Oṃ vajra-śekhara-rudra-mat🔽The two vajra fists, with the two little fingers shown like fangs, is the mudrā of Vajrayakṣa.

original: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis ri bo'i tshul du bya ba ni rdo rje rtse mo'i phyag rgya ste /
analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis ri bo'i tshul du bya ba ni rdo rje rtse mo'i phyag rgya ste /
translated: The two vajra fists made like a mountain is the mudrā of Vajraśekhara.

original: aargha'i snod kyi cho ga'o //
analyzed: aargha'i snod kyi cho ga'o //
translated: This is the procedure for the argha vessel.

original: de nas yo byad thams cad g-yas phyogs su bzhag la mar dang dgang gzar dang blugs gzar mdun du'o //
analyzed: de nas yo byad thams cad g-yas phyogs su bzhag la mar dang dgang gzar dang blugs gzar mdun du'o //
translated: Then, having placed all the articles to the right, the ghee and the ladle and the spoon are in front.

original: g-yon phyogs su dril bu dang g-yas phyogs su rdo rje gzhag go //
analyzed: g-yon phyogs su dril bu dang g-yas phyogs su rdo rje gzhag go //
translated: The bell is placed to the left and the vajra to the right.

original: de nas sbyin sreg gi yo byad la sogs pa thams cad la las thams cad pa'i chus lan gsum bsang gtor bya'o //
analyzed: de nas sbyin sreg gi yo byad la sogs pa thams cad la las thams cad pa'i chus lan gsum bsang gtor bya'o //
translated: Then, all the articles for the homa, etc., should be sprinkled three times with the water for all activities.

original: de ni rdzas gzhag pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rdzas gzhag pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: This is the sequence of the substances.

original: rdzas ni yam shing mar dang ni //
analyzed: rdzas ni yam shing mar dang ni //
translated: The substances are firewood, ghee,

original: til dang 'bras dang de bzhin nas //🔽gro dang ma sha 'bras so ba //
analyzed: til dang 'bras dang de bzhin nas // gro dang ma sha 'bras so ba //
translated: sesame, rice, and likewise🔽wheat, beans, barley,🔽millet, jujube, bilva,

original: yos dang starga bil ba dang // gla gor zho sha 'o ma zho //
analyzed: yos dang starga bil ba dang // gla gor zho sha 'o ma zho //
translated: plantain, curd, milk,🔽dūrvā grass, the three fruits, long pepper,

original: d'ur ba dang ni ku sha dang // 'bras bu gsum dang sle tres dang // kha ra phye ma khar lo ma //
analyzed: d'ur ba dang ni ku sha dang // 'bras bu gsum dang sle tres dang // kha ra phye ma khar lo ma //
translated: sugar, and karavīra leaves.🔽Gold, sandalwood,🔽priyaṅgu, saffron,🔽the two types of incense, all medicines,

original: gser dang ni tsandan dang / spri yang ku dang gur kum dang // spos gnyis dang ni sman kun dang // dz'a ti pha la rin po che //
analyzed: gser dang ni tsandan dang / spri yang ku dang gur kum dang // spos gnyis dang ni sman kun dang // dz'a ti pha la rin po che //
translated: nutmeg, cloves, and jewels,

original: dar dbyangs so rtsi me tog phreng //
analyzed: dar dbyangs so rtsi me tog phreng //
translated: silk ribbons, betel, flower garlands,

original: de bzhin mchod pa rnam pa lnga //
analyzed: de bzhin mchod pa rnam pa lnga //
translated: and likewise the five offerings.

original: de ltar rnal 'byor rgyud rnams las //
analyzed: de ltar rnal 'byor rgyud rnams las //
translated: Thus, in the Yoga Tantras,

original: go rims kyis ni rdzas gsungs so //
analyzed: go rims kyis ni rdzas gsungs so //
translated: the substances are taught in sequence.

original: de ni rdzas kyi grangs kyi go rims so //
analyzed: de ni rdzas kyi grangs kyi go rims so //
translated: This is the sequence of the enumeration of substances.

original: de nas phyi rol gyi me rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi sngags dang phyag rgyas mngon par bsngags la /
analyzed: de nas phyi rol gyi me rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi sngags dang phyag rgyas mngon par bsngags la /
translated: Then, the external fire should be consecrated with the mantra and mudra of Vajrayakṣa.

original: ku sha'i rtse mo blangs pa'i chus de la lan gsum bsangs te /
analyzed: ku sha'i rtse mo blangs pa'i chus de la lan gsum bsangs te /
translated: Having taken the tip of the kuśa grass, sprinkle it with water three times.

original: gtsang mas bsgos pa'i tsa dang bcas pa me thab la bcug nas /
analyzed: gtsang mas bsgos pa'i tsa dang bcas pa me thab la bcug nas /
translated: Having placed it on the hearth, together with the ladle smeared with pure ghee,

original: aom dzva la h'um zhes bya ba sngags dang bcas pa rlung g-yab kyi rlung gis 'bar du bcug ste //
analyzed: aom dzva la h'um zhes bya ba sngags dang bcas pa rlung g-yab kyi rlung gis 'bar du bcug ste //
translated: having caused it to blaze with the wind of a fan, together with the mantra “oṃ jvala hūṃ.

original: dam tshig sems dpa'i me lta sngar bshad pa de'i dbus su bsams te /
analyzed: dam tshig sems dpa'i me lta sngar bshad pa de'i dbus su bsams te /
translated: ” Having visualized the pledge fire in the center as previously explained,

original: ye shes sems dpa'i me lta sngags dang phyag rgya 'dis dgug par byas ta /
analyzed: ye shes sems dpa'i me lta sngags dang phyag rgya 'dis dgug par byas ta /
translated: the gnosis fire is summoned with this mantra and mudra.

original: lag pa g-yas pa mi 'jigs par byas nas mthe bong gi rtse mo srid lag gi rtsa ba'i tshigs la brdab pa ni dgug pa'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: lag pa g-yas pa mi 'jigs par byas nas mthe bong gi rtse mo srid lag gi rtsa ba'i tshigs la brdab pa ni dgug pa'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: Having made the right hand into the gesture of fearlessness, the tip of the thumb is struck at the base joint of the index finger. This is the summoning mudra.

original: tshur gshegs tshur gshegs 'byung po che //
analyzed: tshur gshegs tshur gshegs 'byung po che //
translated: “Come, come, great bhūta,

original: lha yi drang srong bram ze mchog / sreg @111a * //
analyzed: lha yi drang srong bram ze mchog / sreg @111a * //
translated: supreme divine ṛṣi, brahmin,

original: blugs zhal zas bzhes slad du //
analyzed: blugs zhal zas bzhes slad du //
translated: having accepted the oblation and food,

original: 'di nyid du ni bzhugs su gsol //
analyzed: 'di nyid du ni bzhugs su gsol //
translated: please remain right here.”

original: zhes bya ba dang / aom ba k'a gna ye sv'a h'a zhi ba la'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / aom ba k'a gna ye sv'a h'a zhi ba la'o //
translated: “oṃ bhakṣa gaṇaye svāhā” is for pacifying.

original: aom ma he de b'a gna ye sv'a h'a rgyas pa la'o //
analyzed: aom ma he de b'a gna ye sv'a h'a rgyas pa la'o //
translated: Oṃ mahādeva gaṇeśvara svāhā, for prosperity.

original: aom k'a m'a gna ye sv'a h'a dbang dang dgug pa la'o //
analyzed: aom k'a m'a gna ye sv'a h'a dbang dang dgug pa la'o //
translated: Oṃ kāmagāṇeśvara svāhā, for subjugation and summoning.

original: aom kro dh'a gna ye dza he kro ta ya aa mu kam m'a ra ya h'um phat mngon spyod la'o //
analyzed: aom kro dh'a gna ye dza he kro ta ya aa mu kam m'a ra ya h'um phat mngon spyod la'o //
translated: Oṃ krodhāgāṇeśvara jahi krodha amukaṃ māraya hūṃ phaṭ, for violent action.

original: me lha byon pa la bsang gtor la sogs pa byas nas dgug pa la sogs pas dam tshig gi ma lha la 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: me lha byon pa la bsang gtor la sogs pa byas nas dgug pa la sogs pas dam tshig gi ma lha la 'jug par bya'o //
translated: Having made the oblation to the invoked fire god, one should cause the pledge deity to enter the deity with summoning and so forth.

original: de nas argha'i snod blangs la yid kyis zhabs la zhabs bsil dbul bar bya ste /
analyzed: de nas argha'i snod blangs la yid kyis zhabs la zhabs bsil dbul bar bya ste /
translated: Then, having taken the argha vessel, one should mentally offer a foot bath.

original: aom pra ba ra sa kt'a ram pra t'i tstsha sv'a h'a /🔽de nas argham ma ma ya da ta m'a gna ha na siddhi mme pra yatstsha sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom pra ba ra sa kt'a ram pra t'i tstsha sv'a h'a / de nas argham ma ma ya da ta m'a gna ha na siddhi mme pra yatstsha sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ pravarasaktāraṃ pratikaśca svāhā.

original: sngags 'dis lan gsum aargha dbul bar bya ste spyan drang ba'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: sngags 'dis lan gsum aargha dbul bar bya ste spyan drang ba'i cho ga'o //
translated: Then, with the mantra “I offer argha, please give me success,” one should offer argha three times. This is the rite of invocation.

original: de nas aom a'a:h'um ni mgo bo dang lkog ma dang snying ga'i phyogs su dkar po dang dmar po dang nag po ste sa bon gsum zla ba la gnas pa'i 'khor lo dang padma dang rdo rje'i chang gzungs la gnas pa khams gsum byin gyis brlabs nas sems
analyzed: de nas aom a'a:h'um ni mgo bo dang lkog ma dang snying ga'i phyogs su dkar po dang dmar po dang nag po ste sa bon gsum zla ba la gnas pa'i 'khor lo dang padma dang rdo rje'i chang gzungs la gnas pa khams gsum byin gyis brlabs nas sems
translated: Then, the consecration of the three seed syllables is consecrated by the consecration of the three vajras.🔽Then, the consecration of the three vajras is consecrated by the consecration of the three seed syllables.

original: ma rdo rje ma la sogs pas yid kyis dbang bskur la l'a sya la sogs ba'i mchod pa rnam pa brgyad kyis mchod la /🔽dar dpyangs dang me tog phreng ba bcings nas go cha bgos te /
analyzed: ma rdo rje ma la sogs pas yid kyis dbang bskur la l'a sya la sogs ba'i mchod pa rnam pa brgyad kyis mchod la / dar dpyangs dang me tog phreng ba bcings nas go cha bgos te /
translated: Then, the consecration of the three seed syllables is consecrated by the consecration of the three vajras.🔽Then, the consecration of the three vajras is consecrated by the consecration of the three seed syllables.🔽Then, the consecration of the three seed syllables is consecrated by the consecration of the three vajras.🔽Then, the consecration of the three vajras is consecrated by the consecration of the three seed syllables.🔽Then, the consecration of the three seed syllables is consecrated by the consecration of the three vajras.

original: me long lta bu sman thams cad la sogs pa'i sku khrus kyi yo byad kyis spos gtul ba dang dril bu dkrol ba sngon du 'gro bas rje btsun ma'i yi ge brgya pa lan cig brjod nas sku khrus bya'o //
analyzed: me long lta bu sman thams cad la sogs pa'i sku khrus kyi yo byad kyis spos gtul ba dang dril bu dkrol ba sngon du 'gro bas rje btsun ma'i yi ge brgya pa lan cig brjod nas sku khrus bya'o //
translated: Then, the consecration of the three vajras is consecrated by the consecration of the three seed syllables.🔽Then, the consecration of the three seed syllables is consecrated by the consecration of the three vajras.

original: de nas rigs kyi yum bzhi'i mngon bar sngags bzlas pa'i bum pa bzhi yis /
analyzed: de nas rigs kyi yum bzhi'i mngon bar sngags bzlas pa'i bum pa bzhi yis /
translated: Then, the consecration of the three vajras is consecrated by the consecration of the three seed syllables.🔽Then, the consecration of the three seed syllables is consecrated by the consecration of the three vajras.🔽Then, the consecration of the three vajras is consecrated by the consecration of the three seed syllables.🔽Then, the consecration of the three seed syllables is consecrated by the consecration of the three vajras.🔽Then, the consecration of the three vajras is consecrated by the consecration of the three seed syllables.

original: rang rang gi sngags dang bcas bas dbang bskur ba sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: rang rang gi sngags dang bcas bas dbang bskur ba sbyin par bya'o //
translated: One should bestow the consecration with their respective mantras.

original: de nas zhi ba la rnam par snang mdzad kyis rgyas btab pa me lha bsam par bya ba dang / rgyas pa la rin chen 'byung ldan gyis rgyas gdab pa dang / dbang la 'od dpag tu med pa'i cod pan can dang / gsod pa la mi bskyod pa'i cod pan can bsgom mo //
analyzed: de nas zhi ba la rnam par snang mdzad kyis rgyas btab pa me lha bsam par bya ba dang / rgyas pa la rin chen 'byung ldan gyis rgyas gdab pa dang / dbang la 'od dpag tu med pa'i cod pan can dang / gsod pa la mi bskyod pa'i cod pan can bsgom mo //
translated: Then, one should visualize the fire god with Vairocana's seal in the case of pacification, with Ratnasaṃbhava's seal in the case of prosperity, with an Amitābha crown in the case of power, and with an Akṣobhya crown in the case of killing.

original: de nas me lha'i bdag po'i sa bon pa god pa dang dgang gzar blugs gzar gyi rtse mor yang dgod do //
analyzed: de nas me lha'i bdag po'i sa bon pa god pa dang dgang gzar blugs gzar gyi rtse mor yang dgod do //
translated: Then, one should place the seed syllable of the lord of the fire god on the ladle and on the tip of the offering spoon.

original: de nas aom dzika sv'a h'a zhes bya bas zhi ba la mar la mngon par sngags btab pa'o //
analyzed: de nas aom dzika sv'a h'a zhes bya bas zhi ba la mar la mngon par sngags btab pa'o //
translated: Then, with Oṃ jīvak svāhā, one should enchant the ghee in the case of pacification.

original: de bzhin du rgyas pa la sogs par rin chen 'byung ldan la sogs @111b pa'i sngags rnams kyis mngon par sngags btab pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyas pa la sogs par rin chen 'byung ldan la sogs @111b pa'i sngags rnams kyis mngon par sngags btab pa'o //
translated: Similarly, in the case of prosperity, etc., one should enchant with the mantras of Ratnasaṃbhava, etc.

original: de nas dang po sbar ba'i don du blugs gzar gyis dgang blugs gsum aom dzva la dzva la h'um zhes dbul lo //
analyzed: de nas dang po sbar ba'i don du blugs gzar gyis dgang blugs gsum aom dzva la dzva la h'um zhes dbul lo //
translated: Then, in order to first ignite it, one should offer three ladings with the ladle, with (the mantra) OṀ JVALA JVALA HŪṀ.

original: de nas 'bar ba dang kha dog dang sgra la sogs pas me la bgegs med par shes nas bgegs thams cad bcing ba'i don du dang / las rdzogs pa'i don du phyogs bzhi la ku sha dgram mo //
analyzed: de nas 'bar ba dang kha dog dang sgra la sogs pas me la bgegs med par shes nas bgegs thams cad bcing ba'i don du dang / las rdzogs pa'i don du phyogs bzhi la ku sha dgram mo //
translated: Then, knowing that the fire is free from obstacles by (its) flame, color, sound, and so forth, one should spread kuśa grass in the four directions in order to bind all obstacles and in order to complete the rite.🔽This kuśa is the best of the virtuous,

original: ku sha 'di ni dge ba'i mchog / gtsang ma gtsang ma'i rgyu las byung //
analyzed: ku sha 'di ni dge ba'i mchog / gtsang ma gtsang ma'i rgyu las byung //
translated: pure, arisen from a pure cause,

original: dkon mchog gsum dga' yid 'phrog pa //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum dga' yid 'phrog pa //
translated: pleasing to the mind, delighting the Three Jewels,

original: sa'i snying po las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: sa'i snying po las skyes pa'o //
translated: arisen from the essence of the earth.

original: zhes bya ba dang / aa bighn'am ma ma sh'antim kurbantu sv'a h'a zhes bya ba'i rim pa 'dis rtsa ba las bton pa mtshan nyid dang ldan pa sngon po'i ku sha ni zhi ba dang rgyas pa la'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / aa bighn'am ma ma sh'antim kurbantu sv'a h'a zhes bya ba'i rim pa 'dis rtsa ba las bton pa mtshan nyid dang ldan pa sngon po'i ku sha ni zhi ba dang rgyas pa la'o //
translated: With (the mantra) A-BiGHNĀM MAMĀ SHĀNTIM KURU SVĀHĀ, one should spread the kuśa, which is green, extracted from the root, and endowed with characteristics, in the directions for pacifying and increasing.

original: gzhan du ni mnyam par bcad pa yon po ma yin pa'i rim pa 'dis me'i shar phyogs su shar du bltas pa dang / lho ru lho'i rtse mo dang ldan pa dang / nub tu nub kyi rtse mo dang ldan pa dang // byang du byang gi rtse mo dang ldan pa bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan du ni mnyam par bcad pa yon po ma yin pa'i rim pa 'dis me'i shar phyogs su shar du bltas pa dang / lho ru lho'i rtse mo dang ldan pa dang / nub tu nub kyi rtse mo dang ldan pa dang // byang du byang gi rtse mo dang ldan pa bya'o //
translated: Otherwise, by this method of the straight line, one should make the east side of the fire-pit facing east, the south side with the southern peak, the west side with the western peak, and the north side with the northern peak.

original: me thab kyis gzhi kun du las thams cad kyi chus bsang gtor byas la /🔽rdo rje gnod sbyin dang rdo rje rtse mos mngon par bsngags la tshon skud lnga'i skud pa dang mda' bzhi 'am brgyad mngon par bsngags la phyogs dang mtshams su bkod la tshon skud lnga'i srad bus bskor la rdo rje bcings par byas par 'gyur te ku sha dgram
analyzed: me thab kyis gzhi kun du las thams cad kyi chus bsang gtor byas la / rdo rje gnod sbyin dang rdo rje rtse mos mngon par bsngags la tshon skud lnga'i skud pa dang mda' bzhi 'am brgyad mngon par bsngags la phyogs dang mtshams su bkod la tshon skud lnga'i srad bus bskor la rdo rje bcings par byas par 'gyur te ku sha dgram
translated: Having sprinkled the entire ground of the fire-pit with water for all activities,

original: pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: one should arrange the four arrows or eight arrows, consecrated with the mantra of Vajrapāṇi and the tip of the vajra, in the directions and intermediate directions, and encircle it with a string of five colored threads. The arrangement of kuśa grass is the procedure.

original: de nas me lha'i las dang rjes su mthun pa dngul la sogs pa'i snod mdun du bsams la /
analyzed: de nas me lha'i las dang rjes su mthun pa dngul la sogs pa'i snod mdun du bsams la /
translated: Then, visualizing a vessel of silver or the like in front, in accordance with the rite of the fire deity,

original: yang aargha dang 'thor 'thung dang zhabs bsil byin nas dgang blugs dbul lo //
analyzed: yang aargha dang 'thor 'thung dang zhabs bsil byin nas dgang blugs dbul lo //
translated: Then, having given the argha, the ācamana, and the water for the feet, one should offer the ladle and spoon.

original: de'i rim pa ni bus mo'i nang du lag pa gnyis bzhag la lag pa g-yas ba'i rdo rje khu tshur gyis dgang gzar blangs te /
analyzed: de'i rim pa ni bus mo'i nang du lag pa gnyis bzhag la lag pa g-yas ba'i rdo rje khu tshur gyis dgang gzar blangs te /
translated: The procedure is as follows: Having placed the two hands in the hollow of the knees, one should take up the ladle with the right hand in a vajra fist.

original: mtho bo dang mthe chung gis brtan bor bzung la sor mo lhag ma dbyig pa'i steng du brkyang la mar gyis dgang bar byas la dgang blugs bdun nam gsum mam gcig me'i lha'i sngags kyis me lha'i zhal la dbul lo //
analyzed: mtho bo dang mthe chung gis brtan bor bzung la sor mo lhag ma dbyig pa'i steng du brkyang la mar gyis dgang bar byas la dgang blugs bdun nam gsum mam gcig me'i lha'i sngags kyis me lha'i zhal la dbul lo //
translated: Holding it firmly with the thumb and little finger, one should extend the remaining fingers over the handle, fill it with clarified butter, and offer seven, three, or one ladleful into the mouth of the fire god with the mantra of the fire god.

original: aom agna ye aa mo ka sya sh'a ntim ku ru sv'a h'a zhes de bzhin du thams cad la'o //
analyzed: aom agna ye aa mo ka sya sh'a ntim ku ru sv'a h'a zhes de bzhin du thams cad la'o //
translated: Oṃ agnaye amoghāya śāntikaṃ kuru svāhā.  In the same way, for all.

original: de nas sreg rdzas kyi rim pa bstan par bya ste /🔽dgad blugs kyi 'og tu yam shing 'od kyi dkyil @112a * //
analyzed: de nas sreg rdzas kyi rim pa bstan par bya ste / dgad blugs kyi 'og tu yam shing 'od kyi dkyil @112a * //
translated: Then, the sequence of the sacrificial substances should be taught.

original: 'khor la'o // mar ni zhal la'o //
analyzed: 'khor la'o // mar ni zhal la'o //
translated: The kindling wood is in the circle of light below the ladle and spoon. The clarified butter is in the mouth.

original: de nas til dang zho dang bcas pa'i 'bras chan ni phyag tu'o //
analyzed: de nas til dang zho dang bcas pa'i 'bras chan ni phyag tu'o //
translated: Then, the rice mixed with sesame seeds and curd is in the hands.

original: ku sha dang d'ur ba'i myu gu ni gtsug phud la'o //
analyzed: ku sha dang d'ur ba'i myu gu ni gtsug phud la'o //
translated: The sprouts of kuśa and durva grass are for the topknot.

original: nas dang gro dang 'bras so ba dang ma sha la sogs pa ni zhal du'o //
analyzed: nas dang gro dang 'bras so ba dang ma sha la sogs pa ni zhal du'o //
translated: Barley, wheat, rice, beans, and so forth are for the mouth.

original: zhu ba'i rdzas thams cad kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: zhu ba'i rdzas thams cad kyang de bzhin no //
translated: All the substances to be offered are also like that.

original: dri ni snying gar ro //
analyzed: dri ni snying gar ro //
translated: The scent is for the heart.

original: me tog ni dbu la lo //
analyzed: me tog ni dbu la lo //
translated: The flowers are for the head.

original: spos ni 'bar ba la'o //
analyzed: spos ni 'bar ba la'o //
translated: The incense is for the flame.

original: zhabs bsil ni zhabs la'o //
analyzed: zhabs bsil ni zhabs la'o //
translated: The foot-washing water is for the feet.

original: aargha dang 'thor 'thung ni phyag la'o //
analyzed: aargha dang 'thor 'thung ni phyag la'o //
translated: The argha and ācamana are for the hands.

original: mar me ni mdun du'o zhes rim pa'o //
analyzed: mar me ni mdun du'o zhes rim pa'o //
translated: The lamp is in front.

original: de nas sdig pa bsreg pa'i phyir dang por til bsreg par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas sdig pa bsreg pa'i phyir dang por til bsreg par bya ste /
translated: Then, in order to burn away sins, first sesame seeds should be burned.

original: aom sarba p'a pam da ha na badzra ye sv'a h'a til rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: aom sarba p'a pam da ha na badzra ye sv'a h'a til rnams kyi'o //
translated: Om burn all sins with the fire of the vajra svāhā.

original: yang na rdzas thams cad sngags gcig gis bsreg par bya ste /🔽aom badzra aa na la ma h'a bh'u ta dzva la dzva la sarba bha smin ku ru sarba bighn'am h'um phat /
analyzed: yang na rdzas thams cad sngags gcig gis bsreg par bya ste / aom badzra aa na la ma h'a bh'u ta dzva la dzva la sarba bha smin ku ru sarba bighn'am h'um phat /
translated: Or all the substances should be burned with one mantra:🔽Om Acala, great being, burn, burn all evil, make all obstacles hum phat.

original: aa mo ka sya sh'a ntim ku ru sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aa mo ka sya sh'a ntim ku ru sv'a h'a /
translated: Make such and such a person peaceful svāhā.

original: yang na tha dad pa'i sngags yin te /
analyzed: yang na tha dad pa'i sngags yin te /
translated: Or there are separate mantras:

original: aom badzra ya dznya sv'a h'a yam shing gi'o //
analyzed: aom badzra ya dznya sv'a h'a yam shing gi'o //
translated: Oṃ vajra-yaṣṭi svāhā.

original: aom ae gna yi sv'a h'a mar gyi'o //🔽aom sarba p'a pam da ha na badzr'a ya sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom ae gna yi sv'a h'a mar gyi'o // aom sarba p'a pam da ha na badzr'a ya sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ eka-haṃsa svāhā. 🔽 Oṃ sarva-pāpaṃ dahana-vajra svāhā.

original: aa mo ka sya p'a pam da ha sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aa mo ka sya p'a pam da ha sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ amogha-pāpaṃ dahana svāhā.

original: til dang yungs kar gyi'o //🔽sarba sam pa de sv'a h'a zho dang 'bras chan gyi'o //
analyzed: til dang yungs kar gyi'o // sarba sam pa de sv'a h'a zho dang 'bras chan gyi'o //
translated: Sesame and mustard seeds.

original: aom aa pra ti ha ta badzr'a ya sv'a h'a ku sha rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: aom aa pra ti ha ta badzr'a ya sv'a h'a ku sha rnams kyi'o //
translated: Oṃ sarva-saṃpada svāhā. 🔽 Milk and rice. 🔽 Oṃ apratihata-vajra svāhā.

original: aom badzra a'a ya she sv'a h'a d'u ra ba'i myu gu'i'o //
analyzed: aom badzra a'a ya she sv'a h'a d'u ra ba'i myu gu'i'o //
translated: Kuśa grass.

original: aom ma h'a be g'a ya sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom ma h'a be g'a ya sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ vajra-āyur-jīvitā svāhā.

original: nas rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: nas rnams kyi'o //
translated: Sprouts of barley.

original: aom badzra gha sma ra ye sv'a h'a gro 'i'o //
analyzed: aom badzra gha sma ra ye sv'a h'a gro 'i'o //
translated: Oṃ vajra-ghāsmara-ye svāhā. 🔽 Wheat.

original: aom badzra bi dza ye sv'a ha' 'bras so ba'i'o //
analyzed: aom badzra bi dza ye sv'a ha' 'bras so ba'i'o //
translated: Oṃ vajra-vijayā svāhā. 🔽 Rice.

original: aom ma h'a ba l'a ya sv'a h'a ma sha'i'o //
analyzed: aom ma h'a ba l'a ya sv'a h'a ma sha'i'o //
translated: Oṃ mahā-balāya svāhā. 🔽 Beans.

original: aom badzra pu shat ye sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom badzra pu shat ye sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ vajra-puṣṭaye svāhā. 🔽 Rice. 🔽 Oṃ mahā-śriyāya svāhā.

original: 'bras kyi'o // aom ma h'a shri ye wa ye sv'a h'a bil ba dang sta rga dang dz'a ti pha la 'i'o //
analyzed: 'bras kyi'o // aom ma h'a shri ye wa ye sv'a h'a bil ba dang sta rga dang dz'a ti pha la 'i'o //
translated: Bilva, star-gazer, and jasmine. 🔽 Oṃ vajra-puṣṭaye svāhā.

original: lha ma ni zhu ba'i rdzas thams cad me lha la rang gi sngags kyis dbul lo //
analyzed: lha ma ni zhu ba'i rdzas thams cad me lha la rang gi sngags kyis dbul lo //
translated: The goddess is to be offered all the substances for the fire sacrifice with her mantra.

original: au dumb'a ra la sogs pa'i shing gi yal ga rnams ni dang por aom dang rang rang gi ming dang sv'a h'a'i mtha' can gyi sngags kyis dbul bar bya'o zhes rim pa'o //
analyzed: au dumb'a ra la sogs pa'i shing gi yal ga rnams ni dang por aom dang rang rang gi ming dang sv'a h'a'i mtha' can gyi sngags kyis dbul bar bya'o zhes rim pa'o //
translated: The branches of the udumbara and other trees are to be offered first with the mantra consisting of OM, their individual names, and SVĀHĀ. This is the sequence.

original: de nas me lha la 'thor 'thung dang bsad gtor la sogs pa phul nas /🔽me thab tu me lha 'bar ba'i gzugs su thim par bya'o zhes kha cig zer ro //
analyzed: de nas me lha la 'thor 'thung dang bsad gtor la sogs pa phul nas / me thab tu me lha 'bar ba'i gzugs su thim par bya'o zhes kha cig zer ro //
translated: Then, having offered the sprinkling water, the oblation for the dead, and so on to the fire god,🔽some say that the fire god should be dissolved into the blazing form in the fire pit.

original: rang gi gzugs su me lha me'i mtshams su gzhag par bya'o zhes kha cig zer ro //
analyzed: rang gi gzugs su me lha me'i mtshams su gzhag par bya'o zhes kha cig zer ro //
translated: Some say that the fire god should be placed in the fire pit in one's own form.

original: kha cig na re gshegs su gsol zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re gshegs su gsol zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that he should be requested to depart.

original: kha cig na re me thab kyi nang du me'i mtshams su gzhag @112b par bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re me thab kyi nang du me'i mtshams su gzhag @112b par bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that he should be placed in the fire pit in the form of fire.

original: de ltar mang po smras te 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de ltar mang po smras te 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Thus, there are many such statements. Here, the Blessed One has said:

original: me lha'i gtso bo lha rnams ni //
analyzed: me lha'i gtso bo lha rnams ni //
translated: The chief fire gods are the gods.

original: sbyin sreg de nyid la ni gnas //
analyzed: sbyin sreg de nyid la ni gnas //
translated: Abiding in that very fire sacrifice,

original: sbyin sreg gis ni tshim byas te //
analyzed: sbyin sreg gis ni tshim byas te //
translated: having satisfied the fire god with the fire sacrifice,

original: tshim pas dngos grub ster bar 'gyur //
analyzed: tshim pas dngos grub ster bar 'gyur //
translated: he bestows the attainment through satisfaction.

original: me lha stong pa'i sbyin sreg ni //
analyzed: me lha stong pa'i sbyin sreg ni //
translated: The fire sacrifice of the empty fire god

original: ro khar bsregs bzhin 'bras med 'gyur //🔽zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ro khar bsregs bzhin 'bras med 'gyur // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: is like burning a corpse, it is fruitless.

original: gzhan las bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: gzhan las bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: And in another scripture the Lord said:

original: me yi gnas ni mi shes pas //
analyzed: me yi gnas ni mi shes pas //
translated: Because one does not know the abode of fire,

original: gang zhig sbyin sreg byed pa na //
analyzed: gang zhig sbyin sreg byed pa na //
translated: whatever fire sacrifice one performs

original: de nyid ma yin sbyang ba min //
analyzed: de nyid ma yin sbyang ba min //
translated: is not that, is not purification,

original: las kyi 'bras bur mi 'gyur ro //🔽zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: las kyi 'bras bur mi 'gyur ro // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: and is not the result of action.

original: kho bo cag gi bla ma'i zhal gyi man ngag ni chos kyi dbyings kyi yi ge yongs su gyur pa las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo las ma lus pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi me lha de'i snying
analyzed: kho bo cag gi bla ma'i zhal gyi man ngag ni chos kyi dbyings kyi yi ge yongs su gyur pa las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo las ma lus pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi me lha de'i snying
translated: Our teacher's oral instruction is that the fire god of supramundane wisdom, the essence of the perfection of wisdom, which is the transformation of the syllable of the dharmadhatu, is in the heart of the fire god.

original: ga'i padma'i steng du rang gi lha'i sa bon yongs su gyur pa las phyag mtshan las byung ba'i las dang rjes su mthun pa /
analyzed: ga'i padma'i steng du rang gi lha'i sa bon yongs su gyur pa las phyag mtshan las byung ba'i las dang rjes su mthun pa /
translated: On the lotus in the gaṃ, one’s deity arises from the seed syllable, and from the hand implement arises the pledge seal that is consistent with the activity,🔽endowed with color, ornaments, and so on, such as Vairocana, and so on.

original: kha dog dang rgyan la sogs pa dang ldan pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa dmigs la rang gi snying ga'i ye shes sems dpa'i sa bon gyi 'od zer dang rang rang gi dam tshig gi phyag rgya rnams kyis ye shes sems dpa' bkug la byang chub
analyzed: kha dog dang rgyan la sogs pa dang ldan pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa dmigs la rang gi snying ga'i ye shes sems dpa'i sa bon gyi 'od zer dang rang rang gi dam tshig gi phyag rgya rnams kyis ye shes sems dpa' bkug la byang chub
translated: One should summon the awareness beings with the light rays of the seed syllable of the awareness being in one’s heart and with one’s own pledge seal.

original: mchog gi phyag rgya bcings la /
analyzed: mchog gi phyag rgya bcings la /
translated: Form the supreme awakening mudra.

original: aom ae hye hi bha ga b'an ne ha b'akte dza sa ma ye na tsa aa rgham to //
analyzed: aom ae hye hi bha ga b'an ne ha b'akte dza sa ma ye na tsa aa rgham to //
translated: Om ehy ehi bhagavān niryātaka tejasamaye na ca arghaṃ tathā.🔽Sampra tiṣṭha svā pūjaṃ ca pe pṛṣṭha siddha mi.

original: sam pra t'i tstsha sva' p'u dzam tsa pe pra siddha mi 'dis lho phyogs su bltas te /
analyzed: sam pra t'i tstsha sva' p'u dzam tsa pe pra siddha mi 'dis lho phyogs su bltas te /
translated: By this, one should look to the south

original: badzra dh'a tu sv'a h'a zhes bya bas /
analyzed: badzra dh'a tu sv'a h'a zhes bya bas /
translated: and say vajra dhatu svāhā.

original: zhabs bsil dang / aargha phul nas l'a sye la sogs pas mchod cing rdo rje bsdams pas lcags kyu dang zhags pa dang lcags sgrog dang dril bu rnams kyis dgug ba dang gzhug pa dang bcing pa dang dbang du bya'o //
analyzed: zhabs bsil dang / aargha phul nas l'a sye la sogs pas mchod cing rdo rje bsdams pas lcags kyu dang zhags pa dang lcags sgrog dang dril bu rnams kyis dgug ba dang gzhug pa dang bcing pa dang dbang du bya'o //
translated: Having offered water for the feet and the argha, one should worship with Lāsyā and so forth, and with the vajra-bond, one should summon, induct, bind, and control with the hook, the noose, the fetters, and the bell.

original: dza: h'um bam ho: sa ma ya stvam sa ma ya ho: zhes bya bas me lha'i zhal nas dam tshig sems dpa' la rnam pa thams cad du 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: dza: h'um bam ho: sa ma ya stvam sa ma ya ho: zhes bya bas me lha'i zhal nas dam tshig sems dpa' la rnam pa thams cad du 'jug par bya'o //
translated: With JAH HŪM VAM HOḤ, one should cause the pledge-being to enter completely into the face of the fire-god with SAMĀYASATVA, SAMĀYAHOḤ.

original: de nas aom hri h'um zhes bya ba yi ge gsum gyis dkar po dang ser po dang nag pos mgo bo la sogs pa byin gyis brlabs la /
analyzed: de nas aom hri h'um zhes bya ba yi ge gsum gyis dkar po dang ser po dang nag pos mgo bo la sogs pa byin gyis brlabs la /
translated: Then, with the three syllables OṀ HRĪH HŪṀ, one should bless the head and so forth with white, yellow, and black.

original: rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma la sogs pa'i phyag rgyas dbang bskur la snga ma bzhin du khrus byas nas dar dpyangs dang me tog gi phreng ba bcings la /
analyzed: rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma la sogs pa'i phyag rgyas dbang bskur la snga ma bzhin du khrus byas nas dar dpyangs dang me tog gi phreng ba bcings la /
translated: Having conferred initiation with the mudra of Vajradhātvīśvarī and so forth, one should bathe as before, and tie on the silk streamer and flower garland.

original: ye shes sems dpa'i snying gar rang gi phyag mtshan rdo rje'i @113a * //
analyzed: ye shes sems dpa'i snying gar rang gi phyag mtshan rdo rje'i @113a * //
translated: In the heart of the awareness-being, one’s own implement is a vajra.

original: chang gzungs la rang gi chos kyi yi ge dkyil 'khor ba'i lha ma lus pa'i ngo bo bltas la /
analyzed: chang gzungs la rang gi chos kyi yi ge dkyil 'khor ba'i lha ma lus pa'i ngo bo bltas la /
translated: In the dhāraṇī of the liquor, one should look at the essence of all the deities of the maṇḍala, one’s own Dharma letters.

original: yang aargha dbul zhing snga ma bzhin du sbyin sreg gi yo byad thams cad bsang gtor byas la /
analyzed: yang aargha dbul zhing snga ma bzhin du sbyin sreg gi yo byad thams cad bsang gtor byas la /
translated: Again, one should offer the argha, and as before, one should sprinkle all the articles for the burnt offering.

original: de bzhin du dgang gzar blangs la ji snyed pa'i dgang blugs me lha de'i zhal du dbul lo ;
analyzed: de bzhin du dgang gzar blangs la ji snyed pa'i dgang blugs me lha de'i zhal du dbul lo ;
translated: In the same way, one should take up the ladle and the funnel and offer as many ladles of ghee as there are into the mouth of the fire god.

original: / de nas blugs gzar gyis brgya rtsa brgyad dam de'i phyed dam /
analyzed: / de nas blugs gzar gyis brgya rtsa brgyad dam de'i phyed dam /
translated: Then, with the ladle, one should offer one hundred and eight or half that number of oblations.

original: sbyin sreg byas nas dgang blugs dbul te /
analyzed: sbyin sreg byas nas dgang blugs dbul te /
translated: Having performed the burnt offering, one should offer the ghee and the funnel.

original: spos gtul ba dang dril bu'i sgra dang lhan cig yi ge brgya pa lan gsum ma ma lan cig brjod la lhag ma sbyin sreg gi yo byad snga ma bzhin du sngags 'dis dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: spos gtul ba dang dril bu'i sgra dang lhan cig yi ge brgya pa lan gsum ma ma lan cig brjod la lhag ma sbyin sreg gi yo byad snga ma bzhin du sngags 'dis dbul bar bya'o //
translated: Together with the sound of incense and a bell, one should recite the hundred-syllable mantra three times and the mama mantra once. The remainder of the articles for the burnt offering should be offered with this mantra, as before.

original: aom badzra dh'a tu ra aa mo ka sya sh'antim ku ru sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom badzra dh'a tu ra aa mo ka sya sh'antim ku ru sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ vajra-dhātu-rasa amoghāya śāntikaṃ kuru svāhā.

original: yang na dzi na dzi ka ces bya bas so //
analyzed: yang na dzi na dzi ka ces bya bas so //
translated: Alternatively, one should say jina jik.

original: de bzhin du rgyas pa la sogs pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyas pa la sogs pa la yang ngo //
translated: In the same way, one should do it for increase and so forth.

original: dri bzang gi me tog ni tshogs gang yang rung ba de dag thams cad dang de bzhin du bdag nyid kyi kha zas la sogs pa phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir bsreg par bya'o //
analyzed: dri bzang gi me tog ni tshogs gang yang rung ba de dag thams cad dang de bzhin du bdag nyid kyi kha zas la sogs pa phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir bsreg par bya'o //
translated: One should offer the flowers of good scent to all of those assemblies, and likewise one's own food and so forth, in order to make them complete.🔽Having performed the fire sacrifice as desired, at the end one should offer the three, seven, or twenty-one essential nectars of all the tathāgatas with the oblation of clarified butter, with the mantra Oṃ āḥ hūṃ hriḥ.

original: ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i sbyin sreg byas la mthar aom a'a: h'um hr'i: zhes bya bas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi snying po gsum mam bdun nam nyi shu rtsa gcig mar gyi dgang blugs kyis sbar du bcug la zhabs bsil dang aargha dang 'thor 'thung
analyzed: ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i sbyin sreg byas la mthar aom a'a: h'um hr'i: zhes bya bas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi snying po gsum mam bdun nam nyi shu rtsa gcig mar gyi dgang blugs kyis sbar du bcug la zhabs bsil dang aargha dang 'thor 'thung
translated: Having offered the water for the feet, the argha, and the water for the mouth,

original: dang dril bu dkrol ba sngon du 'gro bas byin te mthar dgang blugs phul nas /
analyzed: dang dril bu dkrol ba sngon du 'gro bas byin te mthar dgang blugs phul nas /
translated: and having rung the bell beforehand, one should offer the oblation at the end.

original: yang aargha la sogs pa phul nas mchod cing bstod la mngon par 'dod pa'i don bsgrub pa'i phyir zhus la bzod par gsol te /
analyzed: yang aargha la sogs pa phul nas mchod cing bstod la mngon par 'dod pa'i don bsgrub pa'i phyir zhus la bzod par gsol te /
translated: Again, having offered the argha and so forth, one should worship and praise, and request for the accomplishment of the desired aim.🔽Having made the supplication, one should request forbearance,

original: sems ma rdo rje ma'i phyag rgya bcings nas mu zhes bya bas gyen du dkrol bar bya'o //
analyzed: sems ma rdo rje ma'i phyag rgya bcings nas mu zhes bya bas gyen du dkrol bar bya'o //
translated: and having made the Sems ma vajrī mudra, one should release it upward with the syllable muḥ.

original: khyod kyis sems can don kun mdzad //
analyzed: khyod kyis sems can don kun mdzad //
translated: You accomplish all the aims of sentient beings,

original: ji ltar mthun pa'i dngos grub stsol //
analyzed: ji ltar mthun pa'i dngos grub stsol //
translated: Granting spiritual powers in accordance with the rite.

original: sangs rgyas yul du gshegs nas kyang //
analyzed: sangs rgyas yul du gshegs nas kyang //
translated: Having gone to the realm of the buddhas,

original: slar yang sems can don la gshegs //🔽zhes bya bas /
analyzed: slar yang sems can don la gshegs // zhes bya bas /
translated: Again you go for the sake of sentient beings.

original: ye shes sems dpa' gshegs su gsol ba sbrul pa ni me'i nang du chos kyi dbyings su gyur pa la thim nas slar yang mchod yon la sogs pa phul te lhag ma sbyin sreg gi yo byad dbul lo //
analyzed: ye shes sems dpa' gshegs su gsol ba sbrul pa ni me'i nang du chos kyi dbyings su gyur pa la thim nas slar yang mchod yon la sogs pa phul te lhag ma sbyin sreg gi yo byad dbul lo //
translated: Thus, the wisdom being is requested to depart. The emanation dissolves into the fire, which becomes the realm of reality. Again, offer the libation, and so forth, and offer the remaining articles for the fire offering.

original: sbyin sreg gi mthar slob ma la brten te dgang blugs phul nas /
analyzed: sbyin sreg gi mthar slob ma la brten te dgang blugs phul nas /
translated: At the conclusion of the fire offering, based on the disciples, offer the ladle and funnel.

original: zhabs bsil dang aa rgha dang mchod yon byin te /
analyzed: zhabs bsil dang aa rgha dang mchod yon byin te /
translated: Offer the foot washing, the argha, and the water for the mouth.

original: slob ma'i mngon par 'dod @113b pa'i dngos grub la gsol ba gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: slob ma'i mngon par 'dod @113b pa'i dngos grub la gsol ba gdab par bya'o //
translated: Then supplicate for the disciples’ desired spiritual powers.

original: me lha khyod ni gshegs par mdzod //
analyzed: me lha khyod ni gshegs par mdzod //
translated: O Agni, you should depart,🔽Divine sage, supreme of brahmins,

original: lha yi drang srong bram ze mchog / bdag gi don dang gzhan gyi don //
analyzed: lha yi drang srong bram ze mchog / bdag gi don dang gzhan gyi don //
translated: you have accomplished my aims and those of others.

original: byin za khyod kyis bsgrubs te gshegs //
analyzed: byin za khyod kyis bsgrubs te gshegs //
translated: O Agni, you have accomplished your purpose and should depart.

original: spyan 'dren pa'i phyag rgya'i mthe bong 'grol ba'i tshul gyis me lha gshegs su gsol nas 'bar ba'i ngo bor bltas te /
analyzed: spyan 'dren pa'i phyag rgya'i mthe bong 'grol ba'i tshul gyis me lha gshegs su gsol nas 'bar ba'i ngo bor bltas te /
translated: Having invited the fire god with the gesture of invitation and dismissed him with the gesture of releasing the thumb, one should view him as having the nature of the fire.

original: rang gi yi dam gyi lha'i nga rgyal gyis phyogs skyong la gtor ma sbyin bar bya ste /
analyzed: rang gi yi dam gyi lha'i nga rgyal gyis phyogs skyong la gtor ma sbyin bar bya ste /
translated: With the pride of one's deity, one should give the sacrificial cake to the lords of the directions.

original: rang gi chos kyi yi ge yongs su gyur pa las lha'i dbang po la sogs pa phyogs skyong kha dog dang dbyibs ji ltar bshad pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: rang gi chos kyi yi ge yongs su gyur pa las lha'i dbang po la sogs pa phyogs skyong kha dog dang dbyibs ji ltar bshad pa dang ldan pa /
translated: From the transformation of one's seed syllable, one should imagine the lords of the directions, Indra and so forth, having the colors and shapes as explained,

original: phyogs bcu la 'khor dang bcas pa bsams te /
analyzed: phyogs bcu la 'khor dang bcas pa bsams te /
translated: together with their retinues in the ten directions.

original: snod bcud bza' ba dang chang dang sha la sogs pas bkang ba /
analyzed: snod bcud bza' ba dang chang dang sha la sogs pas bkang ba /
translated: The vessel is filled with the essence of the world, food, beer, meat, and so forth.🔽Having placed it on the water mandala, one should make offerings with the five offerings, burn incense, and ring the bell.

original: chu'i mandala la bzhag nas mchod pa rnam pa lnga yis mchod cing spos gtul ba dang dril bu dkrol bas de rnams bkug bas de rnams bkug la sngon du byas te /
analyzed: chu'i mandala la bzhag nas mchod pa rnam pa lnga yis mchod cing spos gtul ba dang dril bu dkrol bas de rnams bkug bas de rnams bkug la sngon du byas te /
translated: Having summoned them with those, one should summon them and do as before.

original: g-yas brkyang bas 'jigs pa med pa'i sems dang ldan bas sngags 'di rnams kyis gtor ma gtang ngo //
analyzed: g-yas brkyang bas 'jigs pa med pa'i sems dang ldan bas sngags 'di rnams kyis gtor ma gtang ngo //
translated: With the fearless mind of right leg extended, one should give the sacrificial cake with these mantras.

original: aom aaindr'a ya sv'a h'a lha'i dbang ldan po'i'o /
analyzed: aom aaindr'a ya sv'a h'a lha'i dbang ldan po'i'o /
translated: Oṃ indrāya svāhā.

original: aom we w'a sa tv'a ya sv'a h'a gshin rje'o //
analyzed: aom we w'a sa tv'a ya sv'a h'a gshin rje'o //
translated: Oṃ vevaśatvāya svāhā.

original: aom aa bam pa ta ye sv'a h'a chu lha'i'o //
analyzed: aom aa bam pa ta ye sv'a h'a chu lha'i'o //
translated: Oṃ abhaṃpata ye svāhā.

original: aom dksha na we rya d'a re sv'a h'a rnam thos sras kyi'o //
analyzed: aom dksha na we rya d'a re sv'a h'a rnam thos sras kyi'o //
translated: Oṃ dakṣaṇavīryadharāya svāhā.

original: aom aanga ye sv'a h'a me lha'i'o //
analyzed: aom aanga ye sv'a h'a me lha'i'o //
translated: Oṃ aṅgiye svāhā.

original: aom r'a ksha pa te ye sv'a h'a bden bral gyi'o //
analyzed: aom r'a ksha pa te ye sv'a h'a bden bral gyi'o //
translated: Oṃ rākṣapaṭe yai svāhā.

original: aom w'a ya we sv'a h'a rlung lha 'i'o //
analyzed: aom w'a ya we sv'a h'a rlung lha 'i'o //
translated: Oṃ vāyave svāhā.

original: aom ru dra' ya sv'a h'a dbang ldan gyi'o //
analyzed: aom ru dra' ya sv'a h'a dbang ldan gyi'o //
translated: Oṃ rudrāya svāhā.

original: aom bra hma ni sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom bra hma ni sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ brahmanine svāhā.

original: aom s'u rya gra d'a dhi pa ta ye sva' h'a /
analyzed: aom s'u rya gra d'a dhi pa ta ye sva' h'a /
translated: Oṃ sūryagrahadhipataye svāhā.

original: aom tsandra na ksha tra de bi ta ye sv'a h'a steng du'o //🔽aom pri thiv'i sv'a h'a /🔽aom sva ye bhya: sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom tsandra na ksha tra de bi ta ye sv'a h'a steng du'o // aom pri thiv'i sv'a h'a / aom sva ye bhya: sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ candranakṣatradevatāya svāhā.🔽Oṃ prthivī svāhā.🔽Oṃ svāyambhū svāhā.

original: aom n'a gi ni bhya: sv'a h'a 'og tu'o //
analyzed: aom n'a gi ni bhya: sv'a h'a 'og tu'o //
translated: Oṃ nāginībhyaḥ svāhā.

original: de'i 'og tu sngags 'di rnams kyis rang rang gi phyogs dang mtshams su nye ba'i sgrub pa po bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i sngags bzlas pa'i sgrub pa pos gtor ma'i snod shing gcig la sogs pa la gtor bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sngags 'di rnams kyis rang rang gi phyogs dang mtshams su nye ba'i sgrub pa po bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i sngags bzlas pa'i sgrub pa pos gtor ma'i snod shing gcig la sogs pa la gtor bar bya'o //
translated: Then, in the directions and intermediate directions, the practitioner who recites the mantra of Amṛtakuṇḍali, the practitioner who is nearby, should scatter the bali vessel on a tree, etc.

original: blo ldan gang zhig gtor ma gtang //
analyzed: blo ldan gang zhig gtor ma gtang //
translated: The wise one who offers the bali

original: bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i sngags kyis ni //
analyzed: bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i sngags kyis ni //
translated: with the mantra of Amṛtakuṇḍali

original: de la bsang gtor bya ba ste //🔽gzhan du na de de spyod 'gyur //
analyzed: de la bsang gtor bya ba ste // gzhan du na de de spyod 'gyur //
translated: should perform the sprinkling there,

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: otherwise it will be enjoyed by others.

original: de'i 'og tu lha khang la sogs pa'i bsrung ba nag po chen po gdong bzhi lag pa brgyad pa kha dog dmar po dang nag po dang dkar po dang ljang gu'i gdong yod pa /🔽thod pa dang kha tv'am ga dang rgyud mangs dang mdung dang / ral gri dang dbyig @114a * //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu lha khang la sogs pa'i bsrung ba nag po chen po gdong bzhi lag pa brgyad pa kha dog dmar po dang nag po dang dkar po dang ljang gu'i gdong yod pa / thod pa dang kha tv'am ga dang rgyud mangs dang mdung dang / ral gri dang dbyig @114a * //
translated: After that, the protection of the temple, etc. is the four-faced, eight-armed Mahākāla, with red, black, white, and green faces.🔽He holds a skull cup, khaṭvāṅga, lute, spear, sword, mace,

original: pa dang glang po'i lags pa bsnams pa /
analyzed: pa dang glang po'i lags pa bsnams pa /
translated: and elephant hide.

original: g-yon brkyang bas mi mgo gnyis la gnas pa ku tso chen po dang bcas pa'i mkha' 'gro ma'i tshogs kyis yangs su bskor ba /
