analyzed: g-yon brkyang bas mi mgo gnyis la gnas pa ku tso chen po dang bcas pa'i mkha' 'gro ma'i tshogs kyis yangs su bskor ba /
translated: He is surrounded by a vast host of dakinis who stand on two human heads with great gaping mouths.

original: mche ba rnam par gtsigs pa bsgoms te sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa dang ye shes sems dpa' ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' byin gyis brlab pa mngon du byas te tshad chen po bum pa gcig chus bskang pa /
analyzed: mche ba rnam par gtsigs pa bsgoms te sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa dang ye shes sems dpa' ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' byin gyis brlab pa mngon du byas te tshad chen po bum pa gcig chus bskang pa /
translated: He is meditating with bared fangs. He should visualize the consecration of the body, etc., and the consecration of the wisdom-being and concentration-being. He should visualize a great measure, a single pot filled with water.

original: aom lo po la la sogs pa bza' ba dang btud ba dang myang ba dang 'jig pa dang thub pa dang / byis pa'i rtsed mo dang / myos pa dang chang dang / be ne dang dang nag po dang sgog kya'i dbye ba dang tsam po li dang sha ko li la sogs pas bkad bar bya ste /
analyzed: aom lo po la la sogs pa bza' ba dang btud ba dang myang ba dang 'jig pa dang thub pa dang / byis pa'i rtsed mo dang / myos pa dang chang dang / be ne dang dang nag po dang sgog kya'i dbye ba dang tsam po li dang sha ko li la sogs pas bkad bar bya ste /
translated: He should make offerings with the food, drink, and so forth, beginning with “Om. Louse eggs, etc.,” and with the various kinds of food, drink, and so forth, such as “child’s play,” “intoxication,” “beer,” “vinegar,” “black,” “garlic,” “cabbage,” “meat,” “kola,” and so forth.

original: dri bu'i sgra dang spos gtul ba bkug la sngags 'dis dbul lo //
analyzed: dri bu'i sgra dang spos gtul ba bkug la sngags 'dis dbul lo //
translated: He should summon them with the sound of a flute and the burning of incense, and he should offer them with this mantra.

original: aom ma h'a k'a lakshe tra pa'i la sarba du shat'am d'a ki n'm ba lim pra t'i tstsha sa ma ya mnu smar ya h'um phat s'a h'a zhes bya ba 'di dur khrod la gtor bar bya'o //🔽de bzhin du me gtso bor gyur pa gnod sbyin dang srin po dang 'byung po dang yi dags dang / sha za dang smyo byed dang brjed byed dang / mkha' 'gro la sogs pa rang rang gi chos kyi yi ge yongs su gyur pa las byung ba dbyibs 'gyur ba rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i mtshon cha 'dzin pa bsams te /
analyzed: aom ma h'a k'a lakshe tra pa'i la sarba du shat'am d'a ki n'm ba lim pra t'i tstsha sa ma ya mnu smar ya h'um phat s'a h'a zhes bya ba 'di dur khrod la gtor bar bya'o // de bzhin du me gtso bor gyur pa gnod sbyin dang srin po dang 'byung po dang yi dags dang / sha za dang smyo byed dang brjed byed dang / mkha' 'gro la sogs pa rang rang gi chos kyi yi ge yongs su gyur pa las byung ba dbyibs 'gyur ba rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i mtshon cha 'dzin pa bsams te /
translated: This is to be cast into the charnel ground.

original: de bzhin du bkug la mngon du byas te /
analyzed: de bzhin du bkug la mngon du byas te /
translated: Similarly, one should imagine that the yakṣas, rākṣasas, bhūtas, pretas, piśācas, unmādas, apasmāras, and ḍākinīs, and so forth, who are headed by the fire, arise from the transformation of their respective single-lettered Dharmas, holding various weapons with different shapes, and then summon them, and make them appear.

original: snga ma bzhin du snod gcig rdzas thams cad kyis bkad bar byas la /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du snod gcig rdzas thams cad kyis bkad bar byas la /
translated: As before, one should fill a vessel with all the substances,

original: mchod pa rnam pa lnga yis mchod cing dril bu'i sgra dang sbos kyis bkug la sngags 'dis gtor ma gtang ngo //
analyzed: mchod pa rnam pa lnga yis mchod cing dril bu'i sgra dang sbos kyis bkug la sngags 'dis gtor ma gtang ngo //
translated: and having made offerings with the five offerings, and having summoned them with the sound of the bell and the incense, one should offer the bali with this mantra:

original: aom aanga ye sarba bh'u t'a dhi pa ta ye sv'a h'a zhes bya ba brjod nas /
analyzed: aom aanga ye sarba bh'u t'a dhi pa ta ye sv'a h'a zhes bya ba brjod nas /
translated: Having recited Om Anguṣṭhāya Sarvabhūtādhipate Svaha,

original: gzhi mdo la sogs par gtor ma gtang ngo //
analyzed: gzhi mdo la sogs par gtor ma gtang ngo //
translated: one should give the sacrificial cake at the crossroads, etc.

original: de nas gre du wa zhes bya ba la sogs pas gshegs su gsol te /
analyzed: de nas gre du wa zhes bya ba la sogs pas gshegs su gsol te /
translated: Then, with Ghrīdhuva, etc., one should request the departure.

original: rje btsun ma'i yi ge brgya pa lan bdun brjod nas langs te /
analyzed: rje btsun ma'i yi ge brgya pa lan bdun brjod nas langs te /
translated: Having recited the one hundred names of the Venerable Lady seven times, one should rise.

original: aom badzra k'i la ya zhes bya bas phur bu dang mda' rnams bton te /
analyzed: aom badzra k'i la ya zhes bya bas phur bu dang mda' rnams bton te /
translated: With Om Vajra Kilikila, one should extract the daggers and arrows.

original: las thams cad pa'i chu 'o ma dang bcas pas spyan ma'i sngags bzlas bzhin bas mda' rnams btsugs la bskor ba gsum byas te /
analyzed: las thams cad pa'i chu 'o ma dang bcas pas spyan ma'i sngags bzlas bzhin bas mda' rnams btsugs la bskor ba gsum byas te /
translated: With the water of all activities, together with milk, while reciting the mantra of Locanā, one should plant the arrows, circumambulate three times,

original: gar dang glu la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bas ji ltar bde bar gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: gar dang glu la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bas ji ltar bde bar gnas par bya'o //
translated: and then, with dance, song, and so forth, one should remain as is pleasant.

original: gal te yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang dpag bsam gyi nor bu dang dpag bsam gyi shing dang bum pa bzang po dang ral gri dang rdo rje dang rkang mgyogs dang mig sman dang tshangs pa'i skud pa dang @114b khams sbyar ba dang bcud kyis len pa la
analyzed: gal te yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang dpag bsam gyi nor bu dang dpag bsam gyi shing dang bum pa bzang po dang ral gri dang rdo rje dang rkang mgyogs dang mig sman dang tshangs pa'i skud pa dang @114b khams sbyar ba dang bcud kyis len pa la
translated: If one desires to accomplish the great powers such as the wish-fulfilling gem, the wish-granting tree, the excellent vase, the sword, the vajra, the swift feet, the eye medicine, Brahma's thread, the elixir, and so forth,

original: sogs pa'i dngos grub chen po bsgrub pa'i phyir sngags la tshim pa dang sngar ba dang gsol ba ni cho ga 'dis byas nas phyin nas thams cad bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i dngos grub chen po bsgrub pa'i phyir sngags la tshim pa dang sngar ba dang gsol ba ni cho ga 'dis byas nas phyin nas thams cad bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: one should be satisfied with the mantra, make offerings, and supplicate with this ritual, and then accomplish everything.

original: de'i rim pa ni rgya mtsho la rgyu ba'i gtsang po'i gam du phyin nas /
analyzed: de'i rim pa ni rgya mtsho la rgyu ba'i gtsang po'i gam du phyin nas /
translated: The stages of that are as follows: Having gone to the bank of a river flowing into the ocean,

original: de'i 'gram gnyis kyis blangs nas ma 'dres par brdungs te aa ka ru dang tsandan dang padma ge sar gyi phye ma dang 'dres pas gong bu byas te padma'i snal mas bcings la ga pur dang spos kyis bdugs la nyin zhag gcig tu mar dang sbrang rtsis bkang
analyzed: de'i 'gram gnyis kyis blangs nas ma 'dres par brdungs te aa ka ru dang tsandan dang padma ge sar gyi phye ma dang 'dres pas gong bu byas te padma'i snal mas bcings la ga pur dang spos kyis bdugs la nyin zhag gcig tu mar dang sbrang rtsis bkang
translated: Having taken it up with the two hands, one should pound it separately, and having made a ball of it mixed with the powder of aloes, sandalwood, and lotus filaments, one should bind it with lotus thread, fumigate it with camphor and incense, and place it in a vessel filled with ghee and honey for one day and night.

original: ba'i snod la gzhag ste phyi nas zhag gsum gyi bar du dri chu dkar po'i 'jam gyi rgyun gyis sngags 'dis dbang bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: ba'i snod la gzhag ste phyi nas zhag gsum gyi bar du dri chu dkar po'i 'jam gyi rgyun gyis sngags 'dis dbang bskur bar bya'o //
translated: Then, for three days, one should consecrate it with a stream of white sandalwood water with this mantra:

original: aom sarba de ba de bya mu tta re sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom sarba de ba de bya mu tta re sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ sarva deva devī muttare svāhā.🔽 Oṃ hūṃ phaṭ ne svāhā.

original: aom h'um phat ne sv'a h'a rim pa ji ltar bzhu ba de bzhin du de'i tshe rgya mtsho la rgyu ba'i gtsang por phyin nas bskyal bar bya'o //
analyzed: aom h'um phat ne sv'a h'a rim pa ji ltar bzhu ba de bzhin du de'i tshe rgya mtsho la rgyu ba'i gtsang por phyin nas bskyal bar bya'o //
translated: As it melts, one should carry it to a river flowing into the ocean.

original: de ltar sngags kyis lha tshim pas myur du dngos grub ster bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar sngags kyis lha tshim pas myur du dngos grub ster bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the mantra will quickly grant accomplishments by satisfying the gods.

original: blugs gzar gyis kyang mar gyi dgang blugs stong gis sbar ba dang gsal ba aom hri zhes sngags kyis bya'o //
analyzed: blugs gzar gyis kyang mar gyi dgang blugs stong gis sbar ba dang gsal ba aom hri zhes sngags kyis bya'o //
translated: One should also make the libation with the ladle, with a thousand libations of clarified butter, with the mantra “Om hrīḥ” .

original: de ltar tshim pa dang dbul ba'i rim gyis thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar tshim pa dang dbul ba'i rim gyis thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, by the sequence of satisfaction and poverty, everything will be accomplished.

original: de nas phyi'i sbyin sreg gi cho ga bstan to //
analyzed: de nas phyi'i sbyin sreg gi cho ga bstan to //
translated: Then, the rite of external homa is taught.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir sbyin sreg bya zhes pa ni phyi'i sbyin sreg bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir sbyin sreg bya zhes pa ni phyi'i sbyin sreg bya ba'o //
translated: In order to teach just that, “one should perform homa” means one should perform external homa.

original: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub 'dod pa ni zhi ba la sogs pa dang sangs rgyas nyid 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub 'dod pa ni zhi ba la sogs pa dang sangs rgyas nyid 'dod pa'o //
translated: One who desires mundane and supramundane powers desires peace, etc., and buddhahood.

original: sngags pa'o zhes pa ni sbyin sreg gi cho ga la mkhas pa'i rdo rje slob dpon no //
analyzed: sngags pa'o zhes pa ni sbyin sreg gi cho ga la mkhas pa'i rdo rje slob dpon no //
translated: “The mantrin” is the vajra master who is skilled in the rite of homa.

original: gnyi ga'i rgyud ni rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud do //🔽de las gsungs pa'i cho ga ni rim pa ji ltar sngar bshad pa'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i rgyud ni rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud do // de las gsungs pa'i cho ga ni rim pa ji ltar sngar bshad pa'o //
translated: “Both tantras” are the Yoga and the Yoga of Mahāyoga tantras.🔽“The rite taught in those” is the sequence as previously explained.

original: de yan chad kyis phyi'i sbyin sreg bshad do //
analyzed: de yan chad kyis phyi'i sbyin sreg bshad do //
translated: Up to this point, external homa is explained.

original: nang gi zhes bya ba nas go sla ste zhes pa'i bar du ni ji ltar btung ba dang bza' ba ji ltar rnyed pa bdud rtsi lnga'i tshogs legs par sbyangs la lag pa dang mgrin pa sbyangs shing ye shes sems dpa'i me lha bsreg par bya ba dang
analyzed: nang gi zhes bya ba nas go sla ste zhes pa'i bar du ni ji ltar btung ba dang bza' ba ji ltar rnyed pa bdud rtsi lnga'i tshogs legs par sbyangs la lag pa dang mgrin pa sbyangs shing ye shes sems dpa'i me lha bsreg par bya ba dang
translated: The passage from “inner” up to “easy to understand” explains that one should purify whatever drink and food one finds as the assembly of the five nectars, purify one’s hands and throat, and offer the gnosis fire god.

original: / de bzhin du tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i mthar lhag ma thams cad bsdus la /
analyzed: / de bzhin du tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i mthar lhag ma thams cad bsdus la /
translated: Similarly, at the end of the gaṇacakra, one should gather all the leftovers.

original: dbang po gnyis dang snyoms par zhugs pa sngon du 'gro ba'i las kyi dbye bas /🔽dkar po la sogs pa'i kha dog gi rnam pa can gyi me thab kyi nang du shin tu sbar ba'i me'i lta'i zhal nas ye shes @115a * //
analyzed: dbang po gnyis dang snyoms par zhugs pa sngon du 'gro ba'i las kyi dbye bas / dkar po la sogs pa'i kha dog gi rnam pa can gyi me thab kyi nang du shin tu sbar ba'i me'i lta'i zhal nas ye shes @115a * //
translated: With the prior performance of the practice of union with the two organs,

original: kyi me lha sbyin par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: kyi me lha sbyin par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: one should offer the gnosis fire god from the mouth of the fire that is well ignited in the hearth that has the aspect of the color white, and so on.

original: de ni nang gi sbyin sreg go //
analyzed: de ni nang gi sbyin sreg go //
translated: This is the inner fire offering.

original: gzhan yang dngos po med pa'i nang gi mtshan nyid kyi sbyin sreg yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang dngos po med pa'i nang gi mtshan nyid kyi sbyin sreg yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is the inner fire offering of the characteristic of the absence of entity.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: nang gi sbyin sreg las ni rnam par rtog pa'i tshogs //
analyzed: nang gi sbyin sreg las ni rnam par rtog pa'i tshogs //
translated: The inner fire offering is the burning of the host of thoughts.

original: sreg par byed de thub dbang zla bas gsungs //
analyzed: sreg par byed de thub dbang zla bas gsungs //
translated: The Lord of Sages, the Moon, has taught this.

original: bgegs dang dngos grub rnam par rtog pa tsam //
analyzed: bgegs dang dngos grub rnam par rtog pa tsam //
translated: Obstructors and accomplishments are mere concepts.

original: gnyis med de nyid rnam par rtog pas stong //
analyzed: gnyis med de nyid rnam par rtog pas stong //
translated: Nondual reality is empty of concepts.

original: thams cad stong pa'i dbang yid de thab ces bya ba //
analyzed: thams cad stong pa'i dbang yid de thab ces bya ba //
translated: The mind of the power of all things being empty is called the hearth.

original: padma rdo rje dang ldan dngos po thams cad bud shing gis phyug pa //
analyzed: padma rdo rje dang ldan dngos po thams cad bud shing gis phyug pa //
translated: The lotus and vajra endowed with all things are the rich fuel.

original: nam mkha'i dkyil bzhin dri med rgya chen rtog ba tsam ni 'bru dang ldan//
analyzed: nam mkha'i dkyil bzhin dri med rgya chen rtog ba tsam ni 'bru dang ldan//
translated: The mere conception of the vast, stainless sphere of space is the seed syllable.

original: shes rab me yis shin tu 'bar zhing nyon mongs sdig pa rab tu zhi //
analyzed: shes rab me yis shin tu 'bar zhing nyon mongs sdig pa rab tu zhi //
translated: The fire of wisdom blazes, completely pacifying afflictions and misdeeds.

original: sras bcas bde gshegs yum gyi gzi brjid 'bar bas rab tu khyab //
analyzed: sras bcas bde gshegs yum gyi gzi brjid 'bar bas rab tu khyab //
translated: The blazing splendor of the mother of the sugatas and their sons completely pervades.

original: khams gsum srid pa'i thab la 'du byed thams cad bsreg bya yin //
analyzed: khams gsum srid pa'i thab la 'du byed thams cad bsreg bya yin //
translated: In the hearth of the three realms of existence, all formations are to be burned.

original: ngan song lam la nges sbyar phung po khams sogs bud shing rnams kyis ni //
analyzed: ngan song lam la nges sbyar phung po khams sogs bud shing rnams kyis ni //
translated: The heaps of elements and so on, which are connected to the path of the lower realms, are the fuel.

original: rtog pa thams cad las grol zhi ba'i las ni gyis //
analyzed: rtog pa thams cad las grol zhi ba'i las ni gyis //
translated: Perform the peaceful rite that is free from all conceptualization.

original: de bzhin du dpal sangs rgyas ye shes zhabs kyis kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du dpal sangs rgyas ye shes zhabs kyis kyang /
translated: Similarly, the glorious Buddhajñānapāda🔽says:

original: phyi yi sbyin sreg cho ga rtogs bya ba //
analyzed: phyi yi sbyin sreg cho ga rtogs bya ba //
translated: The external rite of fire sacrifice should be understood.

original: yid kyis byas pa nang gi bdag nyid de //
analyzed: yid kyis byas pa nang gi bdag nyid de //
translated: The mental performance is the internal one.

original: phung po la sogs bud shing sreg byed pa //🔽ye shes 'bar ba bla na med par bshad //
analyzed: phung po la sogs bud shing sreg byed pa // ye shes 'bar ba bla na med par bshad //
translated: The fuel of the aggregates and so forth is burned

original: ces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ces 'byung ngo //
translated: by the blazing wisdom, which is said to be unexcelled.

original: sgra ji bzhin ma yin par bshad pa'o zhes pa ni 'jig rten dang bstan bcos las phyi rol du byas pa'i sgra'i sgo nas nang gi sbyin sreg gi brda bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin ma yin par bshad pa'o zhes pa ni 'jig rten dang bstan bcos las phyi rol du byas pa'i sgra'i sgo nas nang gi sbyin sreg gi brda bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The explanation that it is not literal is because the internal fire sacrifice is taught by means of words that are external to the treatises and the world.

original: rnam par snang mdzad ces bya ba nas der 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni rdo rje 'chang chen po yongs su gyur pa las bdag zhe sdang rdo rje nyid bsgoms la mdun du yi ge gsum yongs su gyur pa las 'od dpag tu med pa'i
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad ces bya ba nas der 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni rdo rje 'chang chen po yongs su gyur pa las bdag zhe sdang rdo rje nyid bsgoms la mdun du yi ge gsum yongs su gyur pa las 'od dpag tu med pa'i
translated: Vairocana up to should enter there: Having meditated on oneself as Hatred Vajra, from the transformation of Great Vajradhara, in front, from the transformation of the three syllables, is Amitābha.

original: rnam pa can kha dog dmar po slob mas bsgoms la /
analyzed: rnam pa can kha dog dmar po slob mas bsgoms la /
translated: The disciple meditates on the form of the master as red in color.

original: de'i yan lag thams cad la yi ge aa bkod nas mgo bo dang lkog ma dang snying ga dang rkang pa'i 'og tu yi ge h'um dzheem bkod la /
analyzed: de'i yan lag thams cad la yi ge aa bkod nas mgo bo dang lkog ma dang snying ga dang rkang pa'i 'og tu yi ge h'um dzheem bkod la /
translated: Having arranged the syllable A on all his limbs, he arranges the syllable HUM at the head, throat, heart, and below the feet.

original: yang yi ge dzheem las 'od zer gyi tshogs rkang pa'i khong ston gnas zhugs pas yi ge h'um la sogs pa yongs su gyur pa las bskyed pa'i mi bskyod pa la sogs pa bkus zhing mgul ba la sogs pa gsum po nye bar mtshon nas /
analyzed: yang yi ge dzheem las 'od zer gyi tshogs rkang pa'i khong ston gnas zhugs pas yi ge h'um la sogs pa yongs su gyur pa las bskyed pa'i mi bskyod pa la sogs pa bkus zhing mgul ba la sogs pa gsum po nye bar mtshon nas /
translated: Again, a mass of light rays from the syllable JHEAM enters the soles of the feet, and the syllables HUM and so forth are transformed into Akshobhya and so forth, generated in the head and so forth.

original: de'i lce la aa bkod pa las @115b byung ba'i 'od dpag tu med pa bsgoms te /
analyzed: de'i lce la aa bkod pa las @115b byung ba'i 'od dpag tu med pa bsgoms te /
translated: Having worshipped them, he meditates on Amitabha arisen from the syllable A arranged on his tongue.

original: rdo rje smros shig ces dris nas de'i ngag nas 'das pa la sogs pa shes nas mi bskyod pa la sogs pa la gshegs su gsol bar byas te srung ba'i 'khor los snod bsrung bar bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rdo rje smros shig ces dris nas de'i ngag nas 'das pa la sogs pa shes nas mi bskyod pa la sogs pa la gshegs su gsol bar byas te srung ba'i 'khor los snod bsrung bar bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: Having asked, “Speak vajra,” he knows the past and so forth from his speech, and having requested Akshobhya and so forth to depart, he should protect the vessel with the protection wheel.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba nas sngags kyi rdo rje ni 'di yin no zhes pa'i bar du ni dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa las sngon du dkyil 'khor gyi sgo la gnas pa gos dmar pos mig la bkab pa'i slob ma yi ge lnga pa'i sngags kyis dkyil 'khor🔽du gzhug ste /
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba nas sngags kyi rdo rje ni 'di yin no zhes pa'i bar du ni dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa las sngon du dkyil 'khor gyi sgo la gnas pa gos dmar pos mig la bkab pa'i slob ma yi ge lnga pa'i sngags kyis dkyil 'khor du gzhug ste /
translated: The passage from this is up to this is the mantra vajra teaches that prior to entering the mandala, the disciple who is standing at the mandala door with his eyes covered by a red cloth is caused to enter the mandala with the five-syllable mantra.

original: de nas sngar bshad pa'i rdo rje dbab par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de nas sngar bshad pa'i rdo rje dbab par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: Then, as previously explained, the vajra should be caused to descend.

original: de la zhes bya ba nas bstim par bya'o zhes pa'i bar du ni rdo rje slob dpon gyis slob ma la dbang bskur ba'i don du dkyil 'khor bris la nam mkha' la bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pas mchod cing de
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba nas bstim par bya'o zhes pa'i bar du ni rdo rje slob dpon gyis slob ma la dbang bskur ba'i don du dkyil 'khor bris la nam mkha' la bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pas mchod cing de
translated: The passage from there up to dissolve teaches that the vajra master should draw the mandala for the purpose of conferring empowerment on the disciple, and having invited the tathāgatas dwelling in space with offerings of Vajrarupa and so forth,

original: rnams bkug nas dkyil 'khor la bstim par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rnams bkug nas dkyil 'khor la bstim par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: he should dissolve them into the mandala.

original: rdo rje sku gsum zhes bya ba nas dgod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni rigs pa'i dbang bskur ba'i dus su thabs dang shes rab snyoms par zhugs pa las byung ba'i byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le 'od zer gyi tshogs kyis bskul ba'i de bzhin
analyzed: rdo rje sku gsum zhes bya ba nas dgod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni rigs pa'i dbang bskur ba'i dus su thabs dang shes rab snyoms par zhugs pa las byung ba'i byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le 'od zer gyi tshogs kyis bskul ba'i de bzhin
translated: The vajra three bodies and so on up to one should laugh refers to the bodhicitta bindu that arises from the union of method and wisdom at the time of the empowerment of the family.🔽

original: gshegs pa dang / de bzhin du ye shes kyi chus gang ba'i bum pa bsnams pa spyan la sogs pa rdo rje sems dpa' ring nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i rdo rje slob dpon gyis bsgom la /
analyzed: gshegs pa dang / de bzhin du ye shes kyi chus gang ba'i bum pa bsnams pa spyan la sogs pa rdo rje sems dpa' ring nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i rdo rje slob dpon gyis bsgom la /
translated: The passage from “the vajra three bodies” up to “should be arrayed” teaches that at the time of the empowerment of the knowledge consort, the vajra master who is abiding in the meditative absorption of Vajrasattva should meditate on the light rays that are the bindu of bodhicitta that arises from the union of method and wisdom, which are the tathāgatas, and likewise, the vases filled with the water of gnosis.

original: de rnams kyis slob ma dbang bskur te de'i ba spu'i bu ga'i sgo nas de rnams bcug la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ngo bor bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de rnams kyis slob ma dbang bskur te de'i ba spu'i bu ga'i sgo nas de rnams bcug la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ngo bor bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: Those confer the empowerment on the disciples, and they should be caused to enter through the door of the disciples’ pores and be caused to become the essence of all tathāgatas.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba nas slob mas dbugs dbyung bar bya'o zhes pa'i bar du ni rig pa'i dbang bskur sbyin pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba nas slob mas dbugs dbyung bar bya'o zhes pa'i bar du ni rig pa'i dbang bskur sbyin pa'i phyir ram /
translated: The passage from “in that way” up to “the disciple should be relieved” teaches that the vajra master should meditate on the disciples as the essence of all tathāgatas in order to bestow the empowerment of the knowledge consort.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i dbang sbyin pa'i don du khams gsum pa'i chos kyi rgyal srid la rab tu gzhag par byed pa /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i dbang sbyin pa'i don du khams gsum pa'i chos kyi rgyal srid la rab tu gzhag par byed pa /
translated: In order to bestow the irreversible empowerment, he is established in the sovereignty of the Dharma of the three realms.

original: mi phyed pa rdo rje 'chang che po'i rang bzhin dbang bskur khyod la sbyin na de nas khyod kyis ji lta ba bzhin du nan tan bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: mi phyed pa rdo rje 'chang che po'i rang bzhin dbang bskur khyod la sbyin na de nas khyod kyis ji lta ba bzhin du nan tan bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: “If I give you the empowerment of the nature of the great Vajradhara, who is indivisible, then you should practice accordingly.”

original: de la zhes bya ba nas bla mas dbang bskur sbyin par bya'o zhes pa'i bar du ni ji ltar bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen pos mi bskyod pa la sogs pa @116a * //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba nas bla mas dbang bskur sbyin par bya'o zhes pa'i bar du ni ji ltar bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen pos mi bskyod pa la sogs pa @116a * //
translated: There, the guru should give the empowerment.

original: la dbang bskur ba de bzhin du shin tu bsgral bar dka' ba'i 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho las bsgral ba'i don du bcom ldan 'das rdo rje bla ma de bzhin du bdag la yang stsol lo zhes rdo rje slob mas bla ma la gsol ba gdab par bya ba
analyzed: la dbang bskur ba de bzhin du shin tu bsgral bar dka' ba'i 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho las bsgral ba'i don du bcom ldan 'das rdo rje bla ma de bzhin du bdag la yang stsol lo zhes rdo rje slob mas bla ma la gsol ba gdab par bya ba
translated: Just as Bhagavān Mahāvajradhara gave empowerment to Akṣobhya and so on, in order to liberate from the ocean of saṃsāra, which is very difficult to cross, the vajra disciple should supplicate the guru, “Bhagavān Vajra Guru, please grant me the empowerment.”

original: dang de bzhin du de dang 'dra ba'i zhu bas mgu ba'i rdo rje slob dpon gyis /
analyzed: dang de bzhin du de dang 'dra ba'i zhu bas mgu ba'i rdo rje slob dpon gyis /
translated: And likewise, the vajra master who is pleased by such a request

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i dbang de la sbyin par bya'o zhes bstan to //🔽lha'i gzugs zhes bya ba nas dgod par bya'o zhes pa'i bar du ni phyir mi ldog pa'i dbang bskur gyi mthar nam mkha'i khams na bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa gang gis slob ma dbang bskur ba de rnams gcig tu bsdus te 'od zer gyi
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i dbang de la sbyin par bya'o zhes bstan to // lha'i gzugs zhes bya ba nas dgod par bya'o zhes pa'i bar du ni phyir mi ldog pa'i dbang bskur gyi mthar nam mkha'i khams na bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa gang gis slob ma dbang bskur ba de rnams gcig tu bsdus te 'od zer gyi
translated: should bestow that irreversible empowerment.🔽From “the form of the deity” up to “should be placed,” the disciples who are empowered at the conclusion of the irreversible empowerment are gathered into one and enter through the brahma aperture in the form of a mass of light rays.

original: tshogs kyi tshul du tshangs pa'i sgo nas 'jug cing sku'i dkyil 'khor khyab nas gnas pa bsgoms la /
analyzed: tshogs kyi tshul du tshangs pa'i sgo nas 'jug cing sku'i dkyil 'khor khyab nas gnas pa bsgoms la /
translated: Meditate that they pervade the body maṇḍala and remain there.

original: de'i snying ga'i padmar lhag par mos pa'i dbang gis yi dam gyi lha dgod par bya'o zhes bstan to ;
analyzed: de'i snying ga'i padmar lhag par mos pa'i dbang gis yi dam gyi lha dgod par bya'o zhes bstan to ;
translated: It is taught that the deity of the pledged deity should be placed in the heart lotus through the power of imagination.

original: / de ltar zhes bya ba nas zhes kyang gsungs zhes pa'i bar du ni snang bar gyur pa'i shes rab dang ldan pa'i slob ma la dkyil 'khor gyi de kho na nyid dang // lha'i de kho na nyid dang / le'u lnga pa las gsungs pa'i dam tshig lnga sbyin par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: / de ltar zhes bya ba nas zhes kyang gsungs zhes pa'i bar du ni snang bar gyur pa'i shes rab dang ldan pa'i slob ma la dkyil 'khor gyi de kho na nyid dang // lha'i de kho na nyid dang / le'u lnga pa las gsungs pa'i dam tshig lnga sbyin par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: Thus up to it is also said teaches that the disciple who has the wisdom that has been illuminated should be given the reality of the maṇḍala, the reality of the deity, and the five pledges taught in the fifth chapter.

original: sngags kyis zhes bya ba nas lha'i rnal 'byor byin la zhes pa'i bar du ni slob mas zhus pa'i bla mas /
analyzed: sngags kyis zhes bya ba nas lha'i rnal 'byor byin la zhes pa'i bar du ni slob mas zhus pa'i bla mas /
translated: The mantra up to the yoga of the deity teaches that the guru, requested by the disciple,

original: de'i mos pa spyad cing dris la de dang rjes su mthun pa'i sngags dang de'i brjod par bya bar 'gyur ba'i lha'i ting nge 'dzin la sbyin par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de'i mos pa spyad cing dris la de dang rjes su mthun pa'i sngags dang de'i brjod par bya bar 'gyur ba'i lha'i ting nge 'dzin la sbyin par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: should give the mantra and the deity's meditative stabilization, the object of expression, which is in accord with the disciple's interest and question.

original: gsang ba zhes bya ba nas rnyed par mi dka' ba'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni mchod pa sngon du 'gro bar gsol ba gdab ste /
analyzed: gsang ba zhes bya ba nas rnyed par mi dka' ba'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni mchod pa sngon du 'gro bar gsol ba gdab ste /
translated: The secret up to not difficult to attain teaches that, having made offerings beforehand, one should request🔽the guru to give the secret empowerment.

original: slob mas bla ma la phyag rgya dbul bar bya ba dang / des kyang snyoms par zhugs pa'i rim gyis sangs rgyas thams cad bkug la /
analyzed: slob mas bla ma la phyag rgya dbul bar bya ba dang / des kyang snyoms par zhugs pa'i rim gyis sangs rgyas thams cad bkug la /
translated: The disciple should offer the consort to the master, and he should summon all the buddhas by the process of union.

original: ngag gi lam nas zhugs te snang ba la sogs pa'i rim gyis de kho na nyid myong zhing phyag rgya'i padmar byang chub kyi sems spro zhing de las sa la ma lhung ba dung phor gyis blangs la lhag ma bdud rtsi bzhi dang sbyar te yi ge gsum
analyzed: ngag gi lam nas zhugs te snang ba la sogs pa'i rim gyis de kho na nyid myong zhing phyag rgya'i padmar byang chub kyi sems spro zhing de las sa la ma lhung ba dung phor gyis blangs la lhag ma bdud rtsi bzhi dang sbyar te yi ge gsum
translated: The disciple should enter the path of the consort and experience reality by the process of appearance and so forth. He should emit the bodhicitta into the lotus of the consort and take up with a conch cup the bodhicitta that does not fall to the ground. He should mix it with the four nectars and purify it with the three syllables.

original: gyis sbyangs pa la sogs pa byas nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad bsdus pa'i blos kye ma ho bde ba chen po zhes tshig @116b brjod pa'i slob ma spyod du gzhug go zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gyis sbyangs pa la sogs pa byas nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad bsdus pa'i blos kye ma ho bde ba chen po zhes tshig @116b brjod pa'i slob ma spyod du gzhug go zhes bstan to //
translated: Then, with the thought that all the tathagatas are gathered there, he should make the disciple utter the words, “Oh! Great bliss!”

original: rnyed par mi dka' ba ni rdo rje sems dpa'i go 'phang rnyed par dka' ba ma yin te de'i dus nas brtsams te zhes bya ba nas 'byung bas so //
analyzed: rnyed par mi dka' ba ni rdo rje sems dpa'i go 'phang rnyed par dka' ba ma yin te de'i dus nas brtsams te zhes bya ba nas 'byung bas so //
translated: It is not difficult to attain, because it is not difficult to attain the state of Vajrasattva, as it says, “from that time onward. ”

original: de ltar zhes bya ba nas bar du'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni rig pa'i dbang bskur ba'i 'og tu slob ma la lha'i de kho na nyid bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba nas bar du'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni rig pa'i dbang bskur ba'i 'og tu slob ma la lha'i de kho na nyid bstan par bya ste /
translated: Up to “thus” and “in the middle” indicates that after the initiation of knowledge, the reality of the deity should be taught to the disciple.

original: de la sogs pa khams bzhi'i rang bzhin gyi spyan ma la sogs pa dkyil 'khor du snang ba yin pa de rnams 'dod chags kyi rigs can sems can rjes su gzung ba'i don du rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa yongs su gyur pa las byung ba yin
analyzed: de la sogs pa khams bzhi'i rang bzhin gyi spyan ma la sogs pa dkyil 'khor du snang ba yin pa de rnams 'dod chags kyi rigs can sems can rjes su gzung ba'i don du rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa yongs su gyur pa las byung ba yin
translated: The appearance of the mandala of Locanā and so forth, which are the nature of the four elements and so forth, are for the sake of guiding passionate sentient beings, and they arise from the transformation of Vairocana and so forth.

original: gyi zhi ba la sogs pa'i las kyi tshogs bzhi sgrub par byed pa'i phyir yin par bstan te /
analyzed: gyi zhi ba la sogs pa'i las kyi tshogs bzhi sgrub par byed pa'i phyir yin par bstan te /
translated: They are taught to be for the sake of accomplishing the four collections of pacifying and so forth.

original: de kho na nyid la skyes pa dang bud med kyi dbye ba ni med de tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid la skyes pa dang bud med kyi dbye ba ni med de tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no distinction of male and female in reality, because they are not different.

original: de yang nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin te gzhan yang zhi ba dang drag po dang bar ma'i gzugs can gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dang byang chub sems dpa' dang lha mo dang khro bo rnams ni de dang de rnam par dag pa dang ldan pa rtogs par
analyzed: de yang nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin te gzhan yang zhi ba dang drag po dang bar ma'i gzugs can gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dang byang chub sems dpa' dang lha mo dang khro bo rnams ni de dang de rnam par dag pa dang ldan pa rtogs par
translated: Moreover, this is just an illustration; one should understand that there are also the Tathāgatas, Bodhisattvas, goddesses, and wrathful deities who have the forms of peaceful, wrathful, and intermediate [deities], and who are endowed with the purity of that and that.

original: bya'o // de las zhes bya ba nas mnyes par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i bar du ni mchod pa'i dus dang sbyin sreg gi dus su rdo rje 'chang chen po la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis kha na ma tho ba med pa glang po la sogs pa'i sha sbyang
analyzed: bya'o // de las zhes bya ba nas mnyes par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i bar du ni mchod pa'i dus dang sbyin sreg gi dus su rdo rje 'chang chen po la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis kha na ma tho ba med pa glang po la sogs pa'i sha sbyang
translated: From “From that” up to “will be pleased” is the time of offering and the time of fire sacrifice. The yogis of Great Vajradhara and so forth should purify the meat of elephants and so forth that is free of moral fault.

original: ba la sogs pa'i rim gyis sbyangs bas dkyil 'khor pa rnams tshim pa dang dam tshig gi me lha'i zhal nas ye shes kyi me lha tshim pa dang / de tshim pas ma gu bar gyur pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis sgrub pa po la dngos grub stsol bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: ba la sogs pa'i rim gyis sbyangs bas dkyil 'khor pa rnams tshim pa dang dam tshig gi me lha'i zhal nas ye shes kyi me lha tshim pa dang / de tshim pas ma gu bar gyur pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis sgrub pa po la dngos grub stsol bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: By his satisfaction, the Tathagatas become pleased, and they bestow spiritual powers upon the adept.

original: nyin re zhes bya ba nas zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes pa'i bar du ni gsang ba'i dbang bskur thams cad kyi mthar ram /
analyzed: nyin re zhes bya ba nas zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes pa'i bar du ni gsang ba'i dbang bskur thams cad kyi mthar ram /
translated: Every day up to one should understand teaches that at the end of all the secret initiations,

original: phyi dang nang dang gsang ba'i mchod pas tshogs kyi 'khor lo bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: phyi dang nang dang gsang ba'i mchod pas tshogs kyi 'khor lo bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: or at the end of the feast offering, one should perform the feast offering with outer, inner, and secret offerings.

original: de yang le'u dang po nas rgyas par bstan pas 'dir ma bshad do //
analyzed: de yang le'u dang po nas rgyas par bstan pas 'dir ma bshad do //
translated: Since this is taught extensively in the first chapter, it is not explained here.

original: bdud rtsi lnga zhes bya ba nas bka' stsal to zhes pa'i bar du ni bdud rtsi lnga'i spyod pa'i dus su de nyid sbyang ba la sogs pa'i rim pas sbyangs nas 'bar bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdud rtsi lnga zhes bya ba nas bka' stsal to zhes pa'i bar du ni bdud rtsi lnga'i spyod pa'i dus su de nyid sbyang ba la sogs pa'i rim pas sbyangs nas 'bar bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The five nectars up to he spoke teaches that at the time of the practice of the five nectars, by the process of purifying them and so on, they will blaze.

original: de'i mthus kyang las dang pa po rnams kyis smod pa'i sems bzlog nas rtog pa med pa'i sems kyis spyod pa la rtsol bar @117a * //
analyzed: de'i mthus kyang las dang pa po rnams kyis smod pa'i sems bzlog nas rtog pa med pa'i sems kyis spyod pa la rtsol bar @117a * //
translated: And by the power of that, having turned away from the mind of contempt of actions and agents, one strives in conduct with a non-conceptual mind.

original: 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: Thus it is taught.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa la gnas pa'i rang bzhin gyis dag pa'i chos thams cad yongs su shes pas smod pa'i sems mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa la gnas pa'i rang bzhin gyis dag pa'i chos thams cad yongs su shes pas smod pa'i sems mi 'byung ste /
translated: For one abiding in the completion stage, the mind of contempt does not arise through thorough knowledge of all phenomena that are pure by nature.

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis dag pas kyang rang bzhin gyis dag pa'o zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis dag pas kyang rang bzhin gyis dag pa'o zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is explained that “all phenomena are pure by nature, and also pure by nature.”

original: de yang rigs pa dang lung dag gis sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: de yang rigs pa dang lung dag gis sngar bshad zin to //
translated: And that has been explained above by reasoning and scripture.
