analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba nas go sla'o zhes pa'i bar du ni sngags kyi lam gyis zhi ba dang rgyas pa dang dbang dang dgug pa dang rnam par sdang ba dang / gnas spong ba dang rengs ba zhes bya ba 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub brgyad dang 'khor lo dang rdo rje dang rin chen dang padma dang ral gri dang ri lu dang mig sman dang rkang mgyogs la sogs pa dngos grub chen po brgyad dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub kyang 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to // pha rol phyin pa'i tshul gyis ni ;
translated: The passage from In this way up to easy to understand teaches that the eight mundane accomplishments-pacifying, increasing, controlling, summoning, causing hatred, banishing, and paralyzing-and the eight great accomplishments-the wheel, vajra, jewel, lotus, sword, pill, eye medicine, and fleet foot, and so on-and the supramundane accomplishment of the great seal are accomplished by the mantra path.

original: ; shin tu 'bad pas bsgrub par bya'o //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ; shin tu 'bad pas bsgrub par bya'o //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The passage from The perfection method is accomplished with great effort up to the end of the chapter teaches that the perfection method is accomplished with great effort.

original: pha rol phyin pa'i rnal 'byor pas mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi rim gyis bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis byang chub thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pha rol phyin pa'i rnal 'byor pas mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi rim gyis bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis byang chub thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The yogi of the perfections attains enlightenment in three incalculable aeons by the stages of the paths of seeing and cultivation.

original: 'dir ni 'bad rtsol med pas so //🔽bshang gcis zhes bya ba nas de skad ces gsungs te zhes pa'i bar du ni mar we sho mu dang ku go da ha na cha mnyam par byas nas btags te thod pa kha sbyar du bzhag nas yi ge dgu pa'i sngags kyis byin gyis brlabs nas sbyang
analyzed: 'dir ni 'bad rtsol med pas so // bshang gcis zhes bya ba nas de skad ces gsungs te zhes pa'i bar du ni mar we sho mu dang ku go da ha na cha mnyam par byas nas btags te thod pa kha sbyar du bzhag nas yi ge dgu pa'i sngags kyis byin gyis brlabs nas sbyang
translated: Here, it is effortless.

original: ba la sogs pa'i rim gyis sbyangs la tshes brgyad pa'am bcu bzhi pa'i gang yang rung ba'i zhag la yungs kar gyi 'bru'i tshad tsam gyi ri lu sum brgya drug cu grib ma la bskam par byas nas /
analyzed: ba la sogs pa'i rim gyis sbyangs la tshes brgyad pa'am bcu bzhi pa'i gang yang rung ba'i zhag la yungs kar gyi 'bru'i tshad tsam gyi ri lu sum brgya drug cu grib ma la bskam par byas nas /
translated: From with feces and urine up to he said is as follows: Having made equal parts of maricham and kushtham, having sealed it in a skull cup, having empowered it with the mantra of the nine syllables, having refined it by the stages of refining and so forth, on the eighth or fourteenth day of the month, one should dry in the shade three hundred and sixty pills the size of mustard seeds.

original: nyin re ri lu gcig cig khar bcug nas sgom par byed na de'i tshe rig pa 'dzin pa dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: nyin re ri lu gcig cig khar bcug nas sgom par byed na de'i tshe rig pa 'dzin pa dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: If one places a pill in one's mouth and meditates daily, then at that time one will become like a knowledge holder.

original: de la zhes bya ba nas bka' bsgo pa'i tshig go zhes pa'i bar du ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis kha dog dmar po'i 'od zer lnga'i tshogs dang bcas pa'i yi ge hra nam mkha' la bsams te /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba nas bka' bsgo pa'i tshig go zhes pa'i bar du ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis kha dog dmar po'i 'od zer lnga'i tshogs dang bcas pa'i yi ge hra nam mkha' la bsams te /
translated: With respect to that, from there up to the words of command are as follows: Yogis of Vairocana and so on imagine the syllable hriḥ, together with a group of five red light rays, in space.

original: nam mkha'i khams de yang thugs rdo rje la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang lha mo dang @117b byang chub sems dpa' dang khro bo rnams kyis yongs su gang bar bsgoms la /
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams de yang thugs rdo rje la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang lha mo dang @117b byang chub sems dpa' dang khro bo rnams kyis yongs su gang bar bsgoms la /
translated: That space element is meditated on as completely filled with the tathāgatas such as Cittavajra and so on, the goddesses, bodhisattvas, and wrathful ones.

original: de rnams kyi sku gsung thugs kyi sa bon aa kham dhi zhes bya ba yi ge hri la zhugs te /
analyzed: de rnams kyi sku gsung thugs kyi sa bon aa kham dhi zhes bya ba yi ge hri la zhugs te /
translated: The seed syllables of their body, speech, and mind, namely, a, khaṃ, and dhiḥ, enter into the syllable hriḥ.

original: de yongs su gyur ba las gnod mdzes rgyal po la sogs ba gang yang rung ba'i khro bo bsams la /
analyzed: de yongs su gyur ba las gnod mdzes rgyal po la sogs ba gang yang rung ba'i khro bo bsams la /
translated: That completely transforms into any of the wrathful kings such as Sumbharāja.

original: de la aom zhes bya ba'i sngags kyis bka' sbyin te /
analyzed: de la aom zhes bya ba'i sngags kyis bka' sbyin te /
translated: The mantra of Oṃ is given to him,🔽and when he goes and returns, he grants the adept both mundane and supramundane powers.

original: de song zhing log na sgrub pa po la 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub stsol bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa dang / de bzhin du rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor pas zla ba dang nyi ma la gnas pa'i gshin rje mthar byed dang /
analyzed: de song zhing log na sgrub pa po la 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub stsol bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa dang / de bzhin du rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor pas zla ba dang nyi ma la gnas pa'i gshin rje mthar byed dang /
translated: Similarly, a practitioner of Vairocana should accomplish the messenger of Yamāntaka residing on the moon and sun,

original: 'od dpag tu med pa'i rnal 'byor pas padma dang nyi ma la gnas pa'i rta mgrin dang / mi bskyod pa'i rnal 'byor pas padma dang nyi ma la gnas pa'i gnod mdzes kyi rgyal po 'am gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i bka' nyan bsgrub par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'od dpag tu med pa'i rnal 'byor pas padma dang nyi ma la gnas pa'i rta mgrin dang / mi bskyod pa'i rnal 'byor pas padma dang nyi ma la gnas pa'i gnod mdzes kyi rgyal po 'am gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i bka' nyan bsgrub par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: a practitioner of Amitābha should accomplish Hayagrīva residing on the lotus and sun, and a practitioner of Akṣobhya should accomplish Sumbharāja or Aparājita residing on the lotus and sun.

original: de ltar bdag po zhes bya ba nas gsungs so zhes pa'i bar du ni rigs kyi dbye bas 'dod pa'i rgyal po la sogs pa khro bo drug lag na lcags kyu la sogs ba thogs pa bsgrub par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar bdag po zhes bya ba nas gsungs so zhes pa'i bar du ni rigs kyi dbye bas 'dod pa'i rgyal po la sogs pa khro bo drug lag na lcags kyu la sogs ba thogs pa bsgrub par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: Thus, the passage from “the lord” up to “he spoke” teaches that one should accomplish the six wrathful ones, beginning with Desire King, by the division of the clans, holding hooks, and so on.

original: lcags kyu dbyig ba rtse gsum dang // ral gri grva ru dgod par bya /
analyzed: lcags kyu dbyig ba rtse gsum dang // ral gri grva ru dgod par bya /
translated: The hook, the club, the trident, and the sword are placed in the corners.

original: 'dod pa dbyig pa mi g-yo stobs //
analyzed: 'dod pa dbyig pa mi g-yo stobs //
translated: Desire is the club, Immovable is strength,

original: gnod mdzes gtsug tor steng 'og go //
analyzed: gnod mdzes gtsug tor steng 'og go //
translated: and Sumbha is above and below the uṣṇīṣa.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is stated.

original: des ni khro bo bcu'i bka' nyan bsgrub par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: des ni khro bo bcu'i bka' nyan bsgrub par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: This teaches that one should accomplish the ten wrathful ones who are the attendants.

original: 'o na de bzhin gshegs pa dang lha mo dang byang chub sems dpa'i bka' nyan ci'i phyir ma gsungs she na smras pa /
analyzed: 'o na de bzhin gshegs pa dang lha mo dang byang chub sems dpa'i bka' nyan ci'i phyir ma gsungs she na smras pa /
translated: Well, why is it not stated that the attendants of the tathāgatas, goddesses, and bodhisattvas are to be accomplished?

original: 'dir dngos grub 'dod pa'i sgrub pa pos lo skor gcig gam zla ba drug gam bzhi 'am gsum mam gcig gam zla phyed kyis rtsom pas kyang dngos grub thob par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'dir dngos grub 'dod pa'i sgrub pa pos lo skor gcig gam zla ba drug gam bzhi 'am gsum mam gcig gam zla phyed kyis rtsom pas kyang dngos grub thob par mi 'gyur na /
translated: Here, if the practitioner who desires power does not attain power in one year or six, four, three, or one month or even in a half month, then he should perform the rite of the wrathful ones.

original: de'i tshe zhag bdun gyis dngos grub thob pa'i phyir khro bo'i gzugs can bka' nyan kho na sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: de'i tshe zhag bdun gyis dngos grub thob pa'i phyir khro bo'i gzugs can bka' nyan kho na sgrub par byed de /
translated: At that time, since one attains power in seven days, one should practice only the obedient one with a wrathful form.

original: de'i tshe de'i mthus /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i mthus /
translated: At that time, by the power of that,

original: bzang dang / sbyin pa dang / dbye ba dang / 'chad pa zhes bya ba'i thabs bzhi pos de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la brten te /
analyzed: bzang dang / sbyin pa dang / dbye ba dang / 'chad pa zhes bya ba'i thabs bzhi pos de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la brten te /
translated: one should rely on the Tathagatas with the four methods called good, giving, dividing, and explaining.

original: stobs kyis dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stobs kyis dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will attain power through strength.

original: da yang le'u bcu pa nas rgyas par bshad pas 'dir ma bstan to //
analyzed: da yang le'u bcu pa nas rgyas par bshad pas 'dir ma bstan to //
translated: Now, since it is explained extensively in the tenth chapter, it is not taught here.

original: don ni bshad zin to zhes pa ni le'u bcu gnyis pa @118a * //
analyzed: don ni bshad zin to zhes pa ni le'u bcu gnyis pa @118a * //
translated: The meaning has been explained—this is explained in the twelfth chapter

original: nas drang ba dang nges pa'i don gyi dbye bas bshad do //
analyzed: nas drang ba dang nges pa'i don gyi dbye bas bshad do //
translated: by the division of the provisional and definitive meanings.

original: 'dir zhes pa ni gnas la'o //
analyzed: 'dir zhes pa ni gnas la'o //
translated: Here means in the abode.

original: sangs rgyas ni rdo rje 'chang nyid do //🔽bsgrub par brtsam pa nyid do zhes pa ni 'chad par 'gyur ba bsgrub par bya'o zhes tshig lhag ma ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni rdo rje 'chang nyid do // bsgrub par brtsam pa nyid do zhes pa ni 'chad par 'gyur ba bsgrub par bya'o zhes tshig lhag ma ste /
translated: Buddha is Vajradhara.🔽The undertaking of practice itself—this is the remainder of the sentence, “one should practice what is to be explained.”

original: bka' nyan bskul ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bka' nyan bskul ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is a synonym for “the obedient one.”

original: ri rab ces bya ba nas rdo rje 'chang chen po'o zhes pa'i bar du ni bka' nyan sgrub pa'i sgrub pa po'i grangs med cing tshad med pa bran dang bran mo dang pho nya dang pho nya mo dang bka' nyan dang bka' nyan mo la sogs pa 'khor
analyzed: ri rab ces bya ba nas rdo rje 'chang chen po'o zhes pa'i bar du ni bka' nyan sgrub pa'i sgrub pa po'i grangs med cing tshad med pa bran dang bran mo dang pho nya dang pho nya mo dang bka' nyan dang bka' nyan mo la sogs pa 'khor
translated: From the one called Meru up to Great Vajradhara, the number of practitioners who listen to the teachings and accomplish them is immeasurable and limitless. They are the retinue of servants, female servants, messengers, female messengers, and so forth.

original: rnams dbang du 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin du grangs med cing tshad med pa bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas kyis bzhugs par gyur pa'i zhing gang yin pa de rnams skad cig tsam gyi phyin nas log pa dang / de bzhin du mngon par dga' ba la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing la bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i drung du phyin nas de'i man ngag thos pa'i nus pas mthar bden pa gnyis dbyer med pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnams dbang du 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin du grangs med cing tshad med pa bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas kyis bzhugs par gyur pa'i zhing gang yin pa de rnams skad cig tsam gyi phyin nas log pa dang / de bzhin du mngon par dga' ba la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing la bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i drung du phyin nas de'i man ngag thos pa'i nus pas mthar bden pa gnyis dbyer med pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be brought under control. Likewise, the number of those who go to the buddhafields where the Bhagavān Buddhas reside is immeasurable and limitless. They return in an instant. Likewise, by the power of hearing the intimate instructions in the presence of the tathāgatas who reside in the buddhafields such as Abhirati, in the end, they will attain the stage of Great Vajradhara, the indivisibility of the two truths.

original: de la 'di ni zhes bya ba nas byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes pa'i bar du ni 'jig rten pa'i gnod sbyin la sogs pa'i bka' nyan dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gshin rje mthar byed la sogs pa'i bka' nyan de dag thams cad sngags kyi rgyal po yi ge gsum gyis bskul bar byas te /
analyzed: de la 'di ni zhes bya ba nas byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes pa'i bar du ni 'jig rten pa'i gnod sbyin la sogs pa'i bka' nyan dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gshin rje mthar byed la sogs pa'i bka' nyan de dag thams cad sngags kyi rgyal po yi ge gsum gyis bskul bar byas te /
translated: The passage from thereupon up to should be empowered teaches that all the servants of the mundane yakshas and so forth and the supramundane Yamantakas and so forth are urged by the three-syllable king of mantras,

original: las la nges par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: las la nges par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: and that they are to be definitely employed in the action.

original: de yang le'u bcu pa nas gsungs so //
analyzed: de yang le'u bcu pa nas gsungs so //
translated: This is taught in the tenth chapter.

original: de la zhes bya ba nas gnas skabs shes pa'i bar du ni bka' nyan bskul ba mdor bstan pa bshad do //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba nas gnas skabs shes pa'i bar du ni bka' nyan bskul ba mdor bstan pa bshad do //
translated: The passage from thereupon up to knowing the occasion explains the brief teaching of urging the servants.

original: de yang zhes bya ba nas nges par sbyor ba'o zhes pa'i bar du bzang ba dang sbyin pa dang dbye ba dang 'chad pa'i dbye bas bka' nyan la bskul ba bstan to //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba nas nges par sbyor ba'o zhes pa'i bar du bzang ba dang sbyin pa dang dbye ba dang 'chad pa'i dbye bas bka' nyan la bskul ba bstan to //
translated: The passage from that up to definitely applied teaches the urging of the servants by way of the divisions of good, giving, division, and explanation.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen po'i bka' zhes smos te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen po'i bka' zhes smos te /
translated: The passage from that up to the great Vajradhara teaches the urging of the servants by way of the divisions of good, giving, division, and explanation.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i gzugs can gyi sgrub pa po'i bka'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i gzugs can gyi sgrub pa po'i bka'o //
translated: The order of the practitioner who has the form of Great Vajradhara.

original: gsol ba btab pa'o zhes pa ni bdag po'i bka' nyan nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan sngar phyin te /
analyzed: gsol ba btab pa'o zhes pa ni bdag po'i bka' nyan nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan sngar phyin te /
translated: The request is the arrival in the presence of the Tathagatas after listening to the order of the lord.

original: mchod pa sngon du 'gro ba'i tshig snyan pa'i zhu bas de rnams mnyes par byas nas /
analyzed: mchod pa sngon du 'gro ba'i tshig snyan pa'i zhu bas de rnams mnyes par byas nas /
translated: Having pleased them with the request with sweet words preceded by offerings,

original: sgrub pa po la dngos grub stsol ba'i don du bka' nyan @118b gyis gsol ba gdab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa po la dngos grub stsol ba'i don du bka' nyan @118b gyis gsol ba gdab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: one should request the order for the sake of granting the practitioner the powers.

original: des ni bzang po zhes bya ba thabs dang po bstan to //
analyzed: des ni bzang po zhes bya ba thabs dang po bstan to //
translated: This teaches the first method called “good.”

original: dam tshig stong pa zhes bya bas sbyin pa zhes bya ba thabs gnyis pa bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: dam tshig stong pa zhes bya bas sbyin pa zhes bya ba thabs gnyis pa bstan par bya ste /
translated: The second method called “giving” is taught by “the emptiness of the commitments.”

original: dam tshig de nyid kyis zhes ba ni rdo rje 'chang gis bka' bsgo ba'i bka' nyan gyis so //
analyzed: dam tshig de nyid kyis zhes ba ni rdo rje 'chang gis bka' bsgo ba'i bka' nyan gyis so //
translated: “By that commitment” means by listening to the order of Vajradhara.

original: bya ba rnams la sbyar nas zhes pa ni me tog rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i phyi'i mchod pa dang bdud rtsi dang lcags kyu la sogs pa nang gi mchod pa dang snyoms par zhugs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis gsang ba'i mchod pas mnyes par bya'o zhes sbyin pa
analyzed: bya ba rnams la sbyar nas zhes pa ni me tog rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i phyi'i mchod pa dang bdud rtsi dang lcags kyu la sogs pa nang gi mchod pa dang snyoms par zhugs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis gsang ba'i mchod pas mnyes par bya'o zhes sbyin pa
translated: Having applied to the activities means that one should please with the outer offerings of the flower-vajra, etc., the inner offerings of the elixir, hook, etc., and the secret offerings characterized by union.

original: zhes bya ba'i thabs gnyis pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i thabs gnyis pa bstan to //
translated: The second method is taught: the pledge.

original: dam tshig ni bsgrub par bya ba'i don to zhes pa ni phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub kyi mtshan nyid kyi don zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dam tshig ni bsgrub par bya ba'i don to zhes pa ni phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub kyi mtshan nyid kyi don zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The pledge is the object to be accomplished means that the object characterized by the power of the great seal is called the pledge.

original: de las bod cing ming dang sbyar nas zhes pa ni bka' nyan song nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i drung du phyin nas bsam gtan la chags pa'i thugs dang ldan pa de rnams kyis rdo rje tho bas thugs la brdeg cing che ge mo zhes bya bas sgrub pa
analyzed: de las bod cing ming dang sbyar nas zhes pa ni bka' nyan song nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i drung du phyin nas bsam gtan la chags pa'i thugs dang ldan pa de rnams kyis rdo rje tho bas thugs la brdeg cing che ge mo zhes bya bas sgrub pa
translated: Having applied to that, the name is applied, means that having gone to the Tathagata's presence, having listened to the command, those who have minds attached to concentration are struck on the heart with the vajra hammer, and the name such and such is applied to the one who is to be accomplished.

original: pos khyed rnams kyi bstan pa la dga' ba zhes bya ba'i zhu bas rab tu sad la slar yang bzlog nas sgrub pa po la dbugs dbyung bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: pos khyed rnams kyi bstan pa la dga' ba zhes bya ba'i zhu bas rab tu sad la slar yang bzlog nas sgrub pa po la dbugs dbyung bar bya ba'o //
translated: The one called Delighting in Your Doctrine will awaken you with a request, and then, having turned back, he will comfort the adept.

original: de ni dbye bas zhes bya ba'i thabs bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni dbye bas zhes bya ba'i thabs bstan pa yin no //
translated: That is the teaching of the method called division.

original: dam tshig tu byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang thob ba'i mtshan nyid de 'gro ba'i don byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dam tshig tu byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang thob ba'i mtshan nyid de 'gro ba'i don byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The one called commitment is the characteristic of attaining the state of Great Vajradhara, because he acts for the benefit of the world.

original: de la 'ching zhing nges par sbyar ba zhes pa ni thabs gsum gyis kyang ma grub na bka' nyan gyi lcags kyu dang zhags pas rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi sbyor bas bkug la phyag rgya'i padma la gnas pa'i gru gsum gyi me yis bsreg cing /
analyzed: de la 'ching zhing nges par sbyar ba zhes pa ni thabs gsum gyis kyang ma grub na bka' nyan gyi lcags kyu dang zhags pas rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi sbyor bas bkug la phyag rgya'i padma la gnas pa'i gru gsum gyi me yis bsreg cing /
translated: There, binding and engaging means that if he is not accomplished even by the three methods, then with the hook and noose of the obedient one, having summoned him with the yoga of the wind mandala, he is burned by the fire of the triangle abiding in the lotus of the consort.

original: de'i rnam par shes pa yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs su bskyed la rang gi bdag nyid la 'jug cing ro gcig par bya'o zhes pa 'dis 'chad pa zhes thabs bzhi pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i rnam par shes pa yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs su bskyed la rang gi bdag nyid la 'jug cing ro gcig par bya'o zhes pa 'dis 'chad pa zhes thabs bzhi pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: This teaches the fourth method, called explanation.

original: thabs bzhi po de rnams kyis zhag bdun gyi rnal 'byor pas dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: thabs bzhi po de rnams kyis zhag bdun gyi rnal 'byor pas dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: By means of these four methods, the yogin will attain power in seven days.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba nas bka' stsal par zhes bya ba'i bar du ni sgrub pa pos bskul ba'i bka' nyan gyis nam mkha'i khams gzugs med pa yang gzugs dang ldan @119a * //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba nas bka' stsal par zhes bya ba'i bar du ni sgrub pa pos bskul ba'i bka' nyan gyis nam mkha'i khams gzugs med pa yang gzugs dang ldan @119a * //
translated: Thus and so on up to he spoke means that by the command of the one who listens to the request of the practitioner, the formless realm of space is made to have form.

original: par byed do zhes bya bas phul du phyung ba'i tshig gis ma bsgrubs pa yang grub pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: par byed do zhes bya bas phul du phyung ba'i tshig gis ma bsgrubs pa yang grub pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: By means of the most excellent words teaches that even without practice, one will be accomplished.

original: de ni zhes bya ba nas bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba nas bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: That and so on up to is explained means that

original: re zhig dang po'i rnal 'byor pas stong pa nyid la ting nge 'dzin mngon du byas pa sngon du 'gro ba sna tshogs padma dang nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du yi ge mam las bskyed pa'i yi ge 'bru dang bcas pa'i ral gri yongs su gyur pa
analyzed: re zhig dang po'i rnal 'byor pas stong pa nyid la ting nge 'dzin mngon du byas pa sngon du 'gro ba sna tshogs padma dang nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du yi ge mam las bskyed pa'i yi ge 'bru dang bcas pa'i ral gri yongs su gyur pa
translated: From that, the syllable maṃ becomes a sword with a syllable.

original: las bcom ldan 'das 'jam pa'i rdo rje zhal gsum pa phyag drug pa kha dog dmar po dang dkar po dang nag po'i zhal gsum mnga' ba /
analyzed: las bcom ldan 'das 'jam pa'i rdo rje zhal gsum pa phyag drug pa kha dog dmar po dang dkar po dang nag po'i zhal gsum mnga' ba /
translated: From that, one becomes Bhagavat Mañjuvajra, with three faces—red, white, and black—and six arms.🔽In the two principal hands, one generates a bow and arrow from the transformation of the three syllables.🔽The bowstring is generated from the syllable hūṃ, and the two tips are generated from the syllables oṃ and āḥ.

original: rtsa ba'i phyag gnyis kyis yi ge gsum yongs su gyur ba las bskyed pa'i gzhu dang mda' lnga 'dzin pa de la gzhu'i chang gzungs ni yi ge h'um las byung ba dang / mchog ma gnyis po yang yi ge aom dang a'a: las byung ba gzhu rgyud kyang de bzhin du bsgoms te mda' rnams kyang mde'u aom las bskyed pa dang /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i phyag gnyis kyis yi ge gsum yongs su gyur ba las bskyed pa'i gzhu dang mda' lnga 'dzin pa de la gzhu'i chang gzungs ni yi ge h'um las byung ba dang / mchog ma gnyis po yang yi ge aom dang a'a: las byung ba gzhu rgyud kyang de bzhin du bsgoms te mda' rnams kyang mde'u aom las bskyed pa dang /
translated: One should meditate that the bowstring is also like that. The arrows are generated from the tips of the arrowheads.

original: smyug ma dang ltong a'a: dang h'um gis bskyed par bsams la /🔽bdag nyid kyang rdo rje skyil krung la gnas par bltas nas nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor dang me'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du /
analyzed: smyug ma dang ltong a'a: dang h'um gis bskyed par bsams la / bdag nyid kyang rdo rje skyil krung la gnas par bltas nas nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor dang me'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du /
translated: One should imagine that one is generating the arrows with the syllable om, the bow with the syllable āḥ, and the arrow with the syllable hūṃ.🔽One should visualize oneself seated in the vajra posture, and in front of oneself, on top of a sun maṇḍala and a fire maṇḍala, the person to be subdued, such as a king, and so forth.

original: rgyal po la sogs pa'i bsgrub bya mdun du bzhag nas de'i snying ga dang spyi bo dang lte ba dang gsang ba dang rkang pa gnyis la mda' de rnams cig car du 'phangs par bsgoms te /
analyzed: rgyal po la sogs pa'i bsgrub bya mdun du bzhag nas de'i snying ga dang spyi bo dang lte ba dang gsang ba dang rkang pa gnyis la mda' de rnams cig car du 'phangs par bsgoms te /
translated: Having placed him there, one should imagine that the arrows are simultaneously shot into his heart, head, navel, genitals, and two feet.

original: de rnams kyis mi g-yo ba brgyal bar 'gyur ba skyabs med pa sgrub pa po la zhal bltas pa de'i zhabs la lhung bar bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyis mi g-yo ba brgyal bar 'gyur ba skyabs med pa sgrub pa po la zhal bltas pa de'i zhabs la lhung bar bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine that he, being unconscious and helpless, falls at the feet of the practitioner.

original: de'i tshe rgyal po la sogs pa bdag nyid dang nor gyis dbang du 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de'i tshe rgyal po la sogs pa bdag nyid dang nor gyis dbang du 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: At that time, the king and so forth will be under one’s control through one’s own power and wealth.

original: smyo byed smyos byed pa dang rmongs byed dang // gdung byed pa dang skem byed zhes bya'i mda' //
analyzed: smyo byed smyos byed pa dang rmongs byed dang // gdung byed pa dang skem byed zhes bya'i mda' //
translated: The arrows called “madness,” “driving mad,” “confusion,” “torment,” and “withering”

original: 'dod pa'i lha yi mtshon cha dam pa ni //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i lha yi mtshon cha dam pa ni //
translated: The excellent weapons of the desire gods

original: don dang ldan pa'i lnga po mngon par 'dod //🔽ces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: don dang ldan pa'i lnga po mngon par 'dod // ces 'byung ngo //
translated: are the five that are endowed with meaning.

original: de la mda' dang pos bsgrub bya'i dbang po smyo bar byed pas smyo byed ces bya'o //
analyzed: de la mda' dang pos bsgrub bya'i dbang po smyo bar byed pas smyo byed ces bya'o //
translated: The first arrow is called “driving mad” because it drives mad the sense faculties of the one to be subjugated.

original: de nas de'i dbang po thams cad dga' bar byed pas na smyos par byed pa ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de nas de'i dbang po thams cad dga' bar byed pas na smyos par byed pa ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: Then, because it delights all his sense faculties, the second is called “driving insane.”

original: de dag rnam par shes pa'i dran pa med par rang gis byed pa de ni rmongs par byed pa ste gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de dag rnam par shes pa'i dran pa med par rang gis byed pa de ni rmongs par byed pa ste gsum pa'o //
translated: That which causes them to be without recollection of consciousness and to act on their own is the third, called “driving confused.”

original: dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa nyams pas gang gis shing bzhin du sa la lhung bar byed pa de ni @119b brgyal bar byed pa'i grags pa can te bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa nyams pas gang gis shing bzhin du sa la lhung bar byed pa de ni @119b brgyal bar byed pa'i grags pa can te bzhi pa'o //
translated: That which causes them to fall to the ground like a tree because their sense faculties, objects, and consciousnesses are impaired is the fourth, called “driving unconscious.”

original: ro bzhin du yan lag dang nying lag gang skul bar byed pa de ni mi g-yo bar byed pa de skem byed pa ni lnga pa'o //
analyzed: ro bzhin du yan lag dang nying lag gang skul bar byed pa de ni mi g-yo bar byed pa de skem byed pa ni lnga pa'o //
translated: That which causes the limbs and minor limbs to be like corpses and to be moved is the fifth, called “driving unmoving.”

original: mda' lnga po de dag gzhu las cig car du 'phang bar bya'o zhes kha cig zer ro //
analyzed: mda' lnga po de dag gzhu las cig car du 'phang bar bya'o zhes kha cig zer ro //
translated: Some say that those five arrows should be shot simultaneously from the bow.

original: gzhan dag na re rim gyis 'phang bar bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re rim gyis 'phang bar bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that they should be shot in sequence.

original: de ni 'jam pa'i rdo rje bsgoms pa'i sgo nas rdo rje yan lag med pa'i ting nge 'dzin rab tu bstan to //
analyzed: de ni 'jam pa'i rdo rje bsgoms pa'i sgo nas rdo rje yan lag med pa'i ting nge 'dzin rab tu bstan to //
translated: That teaches the vajra-partless concentration through the meditation on Manjushri.

original: gdul ba'i don gyi zhes bya ba nas sgrub pa pos mthong bar 'gyur ba'o zhes pa'i bar du ni yi ge h'um yongs su gyur pa las sangs rgyas kyi dkyil 'khor nam mkha'i bar snang la bsgoms te /
analyzed: gdul ba'i don gyi zhes bya ba nas sgrub pa pos mthong bar 'gyur ba'o zhes pa'i bar du ni yi ge h'um yongs su gyur pa las sangs rgyas kyi dkyil 'khor nam mkha'i bar snang la bsgoms te /
translated: From for the purpose of taming up to the practitioner will see teaches that the practitioner meditates on the mandala of the Buddha in the sky, from the transformation of the syllable hum.

original: bsgrub par dka' ba'i bsgrub bya rnams kyi mig 'bras la yi ge aom dgod cing khyed rnams kyis nam mkha' mthong bar gyis shig ces bskul bas de rnams kyis mngon sum du sangs rgyas kyi 'khor lo mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsgrub par dka' ba'i bsgrub bya rnams kyi mig 'bras la yi ge aom dgod cing khyed rnams kyis nam mkha' mthong bar gyis shig ces bskul bas de rnams kyis mngon sum du sangs rgyas kyi 'khor lo mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By placing the syllable om in the eyes of those to be accomplished, who are difficult to accomplish, and exhorting them, You should see the sky, they will directly see the mandala of the Buddha.

original: de ltar gyur na de rnams gdul bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar gyur na de rnams gdul bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: It is taught that if that happens, they will be tamed.

original: dkyil 'khor la 'jug pa'i dus su ting nge 'dzin 'di yin nam yang na mig 'phrul gyi sbyor ba yin no //🔽bkres skom zhes bya ba nas rdo rje 'chang chen po'i zhes bya ba'i bar du ni rin chen 'byung ldan gyi ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i ting nge 'dzin las dub na bkres skom bzlog pas tshe dang nad med pa dang lang tsho dang ldan
analyzed: dkyil 'khor la 'jug pa'i dus su ting nge 'dzin 'di yin nam yang na mig 'phrul gyi sbyor ba yin no // bkres skom zhes bya ba nas rdo rje 'chang chen po'i zhes bya ba'i bar du ni rin chen 'byung ldan gyi ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i ting nge 'dzin las dub na bkres skom bzlog pas tshe dang nad med pa dang lang tsho dang ldan
translated: At the time of entering the mandala, is this a meditative stabilization or a magical creation?

original: par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: From “hunger and thirst” up to “great Vajradhara,” it teaches that if the yogi who abides in the meditative stabilization of Ratnasaṃbhava is tired of meditative stabilization, hunger and thirst are averted, and he will have long life, health, and youth.

original: de nas zhes bya ba nas de la de skad ces bya'o zhes pa'i bar du ni re zhig dang po rnal 'byor pas nam mkha'i khams su yi ge dhi bsgoms la /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba nas de la de skad ces bya'o zhes pa'i bar du ni re zhig dang po rnal 'byor pas nam mkha'i khams su yi ge dhi bsgoms la /
translated: From “then” up to “it is called that,” it teaches that the yogi first meditates on the letter dhi in the realm of space,

original: de yongs su gyur pa las kha dog ser po'i rdo rje bsgoms la de las spro ba dang bsdu ba'i rim gyis bcom ldan 'das kha dog ser po zhal gsum pa la sogs pa lta bu sna tshogs padma dang zla ba'i gdan la bzhugs pa zhi ba dang
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa las kha dog ser po'i rdo rje bsgoms la de las spro ba dang bsdu ba'i rim gyis bcom ldan 'das kha dog ser po zhal gsum pa la sogs pa lta bu sna tshogs padma dang zla ba'i gdan la bzhugs pa zhi ba dang
translated: Having meditated on that as a yellow vajra, one should meditate on the various forms of the Bhagavat, such as yellow-colored, three-faced, and so on, seated on a variegated lotus and moon seat, peaceful,

original: sgeg pa'i nyams dang ldan par bdag gis bsgoms te /
analyzed: sgeg pa'i nyams dang ldan par bdag gis bsgoms te /
translated: and endowed with the mood of grace, by the process of emanating and reabsorbing from that vajra.🔽One should abide in the samadhi that is called “satisfying and expanding migrating beings with a mass of yellow light rays and so on that emerge from the empty interior of one’s pores.”

original: rang gi ba spu'i bu ga'i khong stong nas 'byung ba'i 'od zer ser po la sogs pa'i tshogs kyis 'gro ba tshim zhing rgyas par byas nas gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin 'dis zhi ba la sogs pa'i las kyi tshogs 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes
analyzed: rang gi ba spu'i bu ga'i khong stong nas 'byung ba'i 'od zer ser po la sogs pa'i tshogs kyis 'gro ba tshim zhing rgyas par byas nas gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin 'dis zhi ba la sogs pa'i las kyi tshogs 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes
translated: It is taught that the collection of activities such as pacification and so on will be accomplished by this samadhi.

original: bstan to // de nas zhes bya ba @120a * //
analyzed: bstan to // de nas zhes bya ba @120a * //
translated: Then,

original: nas / de ni de skad ces bya'o zhes pa'i bar du ni re zhig dang po stong pa nyid kyi de kho na nyid la dmigs pa sngon du 'gro bas sna tshogs padma dang nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la yi ge h'um bkod pa las bskyed pa'i rdo rje bsgoms la
analyzed: nas / de ni de skad ces bya'o zhes pa'i bar du ni re zhig dang po stong pa nyid kyi de kho na nyid la dmigs pa sngon du 'gro bas sna tshogs padma dang nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la yi ge h'um bkod pa las bskyed pa'i rdo rje bsgoms la
translated: Up to “that is called” indicates that one first visualizes a vajra generated from the syllable hūṃ on a multicolored lotus and sun maṇḍala, preceded by observing the reality of emptiness.

original: / de yongs su gyur ba las bdag nyid zhal gsum phyag drug pa rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa kha dog ser po sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid can de'i bdag nyid dkyil 'khor ma lus pas yongs su bskor ba /
analyzed: / de yongs su gyur ba las bdag nyid zhal gsum phyag drug pa rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa kha dog ser po sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid can de'i bdag nyid dkyil 'khor ma lus pas yongs su bskor ba /
translated: From that completely transforming, one meditates on oneself as having three faces and six arms, adorned by all ornaments, yellow in color, the nature of the three beings, the nature of the entire maṇḍala, surrounded by the retinue.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma skul byed ma'i gzugs bsgoms te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma skul byed ma'i gzugs bsgoms te /
translated: Meditate on the form of Bhagavatī Cundā.

original: 'od zer gyi tshogs spros pas gdug pa thams cad 'joms shing rang gi ting nge 'dzin la gnas par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'od zer gyi tshogs spros pas gdug pa thams cad 'joms shing rang gi ting nge 'dzin la gnas par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: By emanating a mass of light rays, one should destroy all evildoers and abide in one’s samādhi.

original: de nas zhes bya ba nas de la de skad ces bya'o zhes pa'i bar du ni re zhig dang po rnal 'byor pas stong pa nyid la dmigs pa sngon du 'gro bas sna tshogs padma dang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du kha dog ser po dzam bkod
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba nas de la de skad ces bya'o zhes pa'i bar du ni re zhig dang po rnal 'byor pas stong pa nyid la dmigs pa sngon du 'gro bas sna tshogs padma dang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du kha dog ser po dzam bkod
translated: Then, from “Then” up to “it is called that,” the yogi first visualizes emptiness and then on top of a multicolored lotus and moon maṇḍala, the yellow syllable jam becomes a yak-tail fan.🔽

original: nas de las 'od zer spro ba dang bsdu ba'i rim gyis sangs rgyas thams cad kyi tshogs 'jug la /
analyzed: nas de las 'od zer spro ba dang bsdu ba'i rim gyis sangs rgyas thams cad kyi tshogs 'jug la /
translated: The passage from “Then” up to “it is called that” explains that the yogī first visualizes emptiness, and then on top of a multicolored lotus and moon maṇḍala, the syllable JAṃ emits yellow light rays, and through the process of emanating and reabsorbing, all the buddhas enter into it.

original: de yongs su gyur pa las bcom ldan 'das zhal gsum pa phyag drug pa kha dog ser po phyag g-yas pa na ma du lung ga dang lcags kyu dang mda' 'dzin pa /
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa las bcom ldan 'das zhal gsum pa phyag drug pa kha dog ser po phyag g-yas pa na ma du lung ga dang lcags kyu dang mda' 'dzin pa /
translated: From that, the Bhagavat appears with three faces, six arms, and a yellow color, holding in the right hands a maḍula fruit, a goad, and an arrow,

original: g-yon pa na zhags pa dang ne'u le'u gter dang gzhu 'dzin pa /
analyzed: g-yon pa na zhags pa dang ne'u le'u gter dang gzhu 'dzin pa /
translated: and in the left hands a noose, a mongoose, and a bow.

original: de'i gzugs pa dang 'dra bas bcom ldan 'das ma nor rgyun ma dang snyoms par zhugs pa /
analyzed: de'i gzugs pa dang 'dra bas bcom ldan 'das ma nor rgyun ma dang snyoms par zhugs pa /
translated: He is in union with the Bhagavatī Vasudharā, who is similar in appearance to him.

original: sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid can mgo bo la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid can mgo bo la sogs pa la /
translated: He is the nature of the three beings, and on his head, etc.

original: sangs rgyas lnga'i yig 'bru aom la sogs pa lnga yongs su gyur pa las de bzhin gshegs pa lngas brgyan pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas lnga'i yig 'bru aom la sogs pa lnga yongs su gyur pa las de bzhin gshegs pa lngas brgyan pa /
translated: The five seed syllables of the five buddhas, om and so forth, transform into the five transcendent lords.

original: bdag nyid 'phags pa dzam bha lar bsgoms nas rang gi snying ga las de 'dra ba sprul zhing de'i mdun du padma dang zla ba la gnas pa'i spyi bor bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' phyag rgya ma dang snyoms par zhugs par bsams te /
analyzed: bdag nyid 'phags pa dzam bha lar bsgoms nas rang gi snying ga las de 'dra ba sprul zhing de'i mdun du padma dang zla ba la gnas pa'i spyi bor bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' phyag rgya ma dang snyoms par zhugs par bsams te /
translated: Having visualized oneself as noble Jambhala, emanate a similar [Jambhala] from one's heart. In front of that, on a lotus and moon, visualize the transcendent lord Vajrasattva in union with his consort.

original: de snyoms par zhugs pa las byung ba'i byang chub kyi sems kyi chu rgyun aom dzam bha la dza landra'a ya sv'a h'a zhes bya ba'i sngags kyis tshangs pa'i sgo nas bdud rtsi'i rgyun sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de snyoms par zhugs pa las byung ba'i byang chub kyi sems kyi chu rgyun aom dzam bha la dza landra'a ya sv'a h'a zhes bya ba'i sngags kyis tshangs pa'i sgo nas bdud rtsi'i rgyun sbyin par bya'o //
translated: From their union, a stream of bodhicitta water emerges, with the mantra Om Jambhala Jalendraya Svaha. Through this mantra, the stream of nectar should be given through the Brahma aperture.

original: de'i tshe nor dang 'bru la sogs pa 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de'i tshe nor dang 'bru la sogs pa 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: At that time, wealth, grain, and so forth will increase. This is taught.

original: @120b de nas zhes bya ba nas de la de skad ces bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni re zhig dang po rnal 'byor pas stong pa nyid la dmigs pa sngon du 'gro bas bdag nyid 'jam pa'i rdo rje gzhon nu'i dbyibs can bsgoms la /
analyzed: @120b de nas zhes bya ba nas de la de skad ces bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni re zhig dang po rnal 'byor pas stong pa nyid la dmigs pa sngon du 'gro bas bdag nyid 'jam pa'i rdo rje gzhon nu'i dbyibs can bsgoms la /
translated: The passage from Then up to this is what it is called explains that the yogi first visualizes himself as Manjushri, the shape of a youth, preceded by the observation of emptiness.

original: mdun du nam mkhar rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rin po che'i gzhal yas khang pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyi kun du dga' bas bskor ba dpag bsam gyi shing la sogs pa'i me tog gi dris phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams khyab pa de'i nang du rin po
analyzed: mdun du nam mkhar rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rin po che'i gzhal yas khang pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyi kun du dga' bas bskor ba dpag bsam gyi shing la sogs pa'i me tog gi dris phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams khyab pa de'i nang du rin po
translated: The passage from “Then” up to “this is what it is called” explains that the yogi first visualizes himself as Mañjuvajra, the shape of a youth, and then, in front of him in the sky, a jeweled palace of various forms, surrounded by various kinds of delights, with the scent of wish-fulfilling trees and so on pervading the worlds of the ten directions.

original: che ma ra ga ta'i gdan gyi steng du yi ge kshem yongs su gyur ba las gnod sbyin mo'i tshogs bsgoms la /
analyzed: che ma ra ga ta'i gdan gyi steng du yi ge kshem yongs su gyur ba las gnod sbyin mo'i tshogs bsgoms la /
translated: Inside that, on a seat of ruby, he visualizes a group of yakṣiṇīs from the transformation of the syllable kṣe.

original: thams cad yongs su gyur pa las gnod sbyin mo gcig lo bcu drug lon pa nu ma dang smad rgyas pas mdzes pa kha dog sngon po skra phyed bkrol ba chags pa chen po'i mes yan lag thams cad gdung ba lag pa gcig gis gdan mnan pa dang
analyzed: thams cad yongs su gyur pa las gnod sbyin mo gcig lo bcu drug lon pa nu ma dang smad rgyas pas mdzes pa kha dog sngon po skra phyed bkrol ba chags pa chen po'i mes yan lag thams cad gdung ba lag pa gcig gis gdan mnan pa dang
translated: All of them completely transform into a single yakṣiṇī, sixteen years old, beautiful with full breasts and hips, blue in color, with half her hair loose, her entire body tormented by the fire of great passion, pressing down on her seat with one hand,

original: / gnyis pas autpala sngon po rtse gcig pa'i don du bsnams pa bsams te /
analyzed: / gnyis pas autpala sngon po rtse gcig pa'i don du bsnams pa bsams te /
translated: and holding a single-pointed blue utpala flower with the other.

original: de'i snying gar padma'i lte bar yi ge kshem bkod nas /
analyzed: de'i snying gar padma'i lte bar yi ge kshem bkod nas /
translated: In her heart, on a lotus center, she visualizes the syllable kṣe.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i sa bon gyis byin gyis brlabs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i sa bon gyis byin gyis brlabs pa /
translated: It is consecrated by the seed syllables of the five tathāgatas.

original: spyi bor sna tshogs rdo rje'i steng du smin ma sdud pas 'jigs pa'i 'phags pa bdud rtsi 'khyil ba bkod cing des mnan pa sdigs mdzub byed pa bsgoms te /
analyzed: spyi bor sna tshogs rdo rje'i steng du smin ma sdud pas 'jigs pa'i 'phags pa bdud rtsi 'khyil ba bkod cing des mnan pa sdigs mdzub byed pa bsgoms te /
translated: On her head, on a crossed vajra, she visualizes the wrathful Akṣobhya, his eyebrows knitted, pressing down with his foot, and making a threatening gesture.

original: de dang lhan cig snyoms par zhugs pa'i rim gyis mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig snyoms par zhugs pa'i rim gyis mchod par bya'o //
translated: She should make offerings in sequence, entering into union with him.

original: de ltar byas nas gnod sbyin mo rnams dbang du 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar byas nas gnod sbyin mo rnams dbang du 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: Having done so, the yakṣiṇīs will be brought under control.

original: dngos grub ces bya ba nas //
analyzed: dngos grub ces bya ba nas //
translated: The so-called “spiritual powers”🔽

original: gnas pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni 'jig rten pa'i mkha' 'gro ma la bsgrub pa bstan to //
analyzed: gnas pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni 'jig rten pa'i mkha' 'gro ma la bsgrub pa bstan to //
translated: The passage from “the so-called powers” up to “abiding” teaches the practice of the worldly ḍākinīs.

original: de rnams ni 'jig rten pa'i mkha' 'gro ma lus kyi mig 'phrul dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: de rnams ni 'jig rten pa'i mkha' 'gro ma lus kyi mig 'phrul dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: They are worldly ḍākinīs who possess the magic of the body.

original: gzugs sna tshogs len pas zhes pa ni phyugs dang ri dags dang bya dang sbrul gyi gzugs bstan pas so //
analyzed: gzugs sna tshogs len pas zhes pa ni phyugs dang ri dags dang bya dang sbrul gyi gzugs bstan pas so //
translated: “ Taking on various forms” means that they display the forms of cattle, deer, birds, and snakes.

original: sgra sna tshogs kyis zhes pa ni gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i tshig gi bye brag gi rgyun gyis so //
analyzed: sgra sna tshogs kyis zhes pa ni gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i tshig gi bye brag gi rgyun gyis so //
translated: “ With various sounds” means that they have a variety of sounds, both clear and unclear.

original: ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i don thob pas zhes pa ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga lha dang mi'i 'brel pa can 'dod pa tsam gyis thob pas so //🔽de rnams kyi gzugs 'dzin pa ni de dang 'dra'o zhes pa ni rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma @121a * //
analyzed: ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i don thob pas zhes pa ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga lha dang mi'i 'brel pa can 'dod pa tsam gyis thob pas so // de rnams kyi gzugs 'dzin pa ni de dang 'dra'o zhes pa ni rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma @121a * //
translated: “ Having obtained the desired object” means that they obtain the five sense objects of gods and humans just by wishing.

original: dang 'dra ba'i gzugs yin gyis mthu ni mi 'dra'o //
analyzed: dang 'dra ba'i gzugs yin gyis mthu ni mi 'dra'o //
translated: “ Their form is like that” means that they have the form of Vajra ḍāka, but their power is not the same.

original: nye bar mtshon pa'i mtshan nyid kyis zhes pa ni rigs kyi dbye bas kha dog lnga'o //
analyzed: nye bar mtshon pa'i mtshan nyid kyis zhes pa ni rigs kyi dbye bas kha dog lnga'o //
translated: The characteristic of the indication is the five colors by the division of the families.

original: rang gi ngo bo yongs su 'gyur ba zhes pa ni gzugs bsgyur ba dang phra mo dang chen po'i gzugs bstan pa dang / 'bar ba dang snang ba dang 'od spro ba la sogs pa dang / cho 'phrul ston par byed pa de ltar gyur pa bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo yongs su 'gyur ba zhes pa ni gzugs bsgyur ba dang phra mo dang chen po'i gzugs bstan pa dang / 'bar ba dang snang ba dang 'od spro ba la sogs pa dang / cho 'phrul ston par byed pa de ltar gyur pa bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: The transformation of one's own nature is the accomplishment of the transformation of form, the manifestation of subtle and gross forms, the display of miracles such as blazing, shining, radiating light, and so forth.

original: 'dir bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: Here is the summarized meaning:

original: mi bskyod pa'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pa sngar bshad pa'i gzhal yas khang pa'i nang du kha dog nag po'i gnod sbyin mo bskyed la /
analyzed: mi bskyod pa'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pa sngar bshad pa'i gzhal yas khang pa'i nang du kha dog nag po'i gnod sbyin mo bskyed la /
translated: One who is endowed with the yoga of Akṣobhya should generate the black-colored Yakṣiṇī inside the previously explained celestial palace.

original: de'i spyi bor gnod mdzes kyi rgyal po bkod nas bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i spyi bor gnod mdzes kyi rgyal po bkod nas bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Having arranged Ucchuṣma on her head, one should accomplish her.

original: de bzhin du rnam par snang mdzad dang rin chen 'byung ldan dang 'od dpag tu med pa dang don yod grub pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par snang mdzad dang rin chen 'byung ldan dang 'od dpag tu med pa dang don yod grub pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis //
translated: Similarly, those who are practitioners of Vairocana, Ratnasaṃbhava, Amitābha, and Amoghasiddhi

original: snga ma bzhin du gzhal yas khang pa'i nang na dkar po dang ser po dang dmar po dang ljang gu'i gnod sbyin mo rab tu bskyed nas /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du gzhal yas khang pa'i nang na dkar po dang ser po dang dmar po dang ljang gu'i gnod sbyin mo rab tu bskyed nas /
translated: As before, having generated the yakṣiṇīs white, yellow, red, and green inside the celestial palace,

original: de rnams kyi spyi bor gshin rje mthar byed dang shes rab mthar byed dang / padma mthar byed dang / bgegs mthar byed bkod nas snyoms par zhugs pa'i rim pas bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi spyi bor gshin rje mthar byed dang shes rab mthar byed dang / padma mthar byed dang / bgegs mthar byed bkod nas snyoms par zhugs pa'i rim pas bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: one should practice by means of the process of union, having arranged Yama, Prajñā, Padma, and Vighna on their heads.

original: de'i tshe 'bras bu ji lta bu yin zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'bras bu ji lta bu yin zhe na smras pa /
translated: What are the results at that time?

original: rdo rje mkha' 'gro zhes bya ba nas 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma dpal sangs rgyas thams cad mnyam par sbyor ba'i rgyud las gsungs pa'i goo r'i la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: rdo rje mkha' 'gro zhes bya ba nas 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma dpal sangs rgyas thams cad mnyam par sbyor ba'i rgyud las gsungs pa'i goo r'i la sogs pa'am /
translated: The vajra dakini and so on up to “will come” refers to Gaurī and so on, as taught in the glorious Tantra of the Union of All Buddhas.

original: 'dir gsungs pa'i spyan ma la sogs pa gang yin pa de rnams sngar bshad pa'i cho gas bskyed la snyoms par zhugs pa'i rim pas spyod cing rdo rje 'chang dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'dir gsungs pa'i spyan ma la sogs pa gang yin pa de rnams sngar bshad pa'i cho gas bskyed la snyoms par zhugs pa'i rim pas spyod cing rdo rje 'chang dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: Here, whatever is said to be Locanā and so forth, those are generated by the previously explained rite, and by the process of union, one should practice, and one will become like Vajradhara.

original: gnod sbyin zhes bya ba nas khyad par ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni zla ba'i 'od la sogs pa 'jig rten pa'i gnod sbyin mo bsgrubs nas gling thams cad kyi bdag po'am /
analyzed: gnod sbyin zhes bya ba nas khyad par ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni zla ba'i 'od la sogs pa 'jig rten pa'i gnod sbyin mo bsgrubs nas gling thams cad kyi bdag po'am /
translated: From “yakṣiṇī” up to “distinction” teaches that having accomplished the worldly yakṣiṇīs such as Candrakalā, one will become the lord of all continents,

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi bdag po'am /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi bdag po'am /
translated: or the lord of the desire realm,

original: rig pa 'dzin pa'i bdag por 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rig pa 'dzin pa'i bdag por 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: or the lord of the knowledge-holders.

original: de la zhes bya ba nas rdo rjes de skad ces bka' stsal to zhes pa'i bar du ni 'jig rten pa'i mkha' 'gro ma dang 'jig rten las 'das pa gang yin pa de rnams thams cad gtsug tor @121b 'khor los sgyur ba la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor bas
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba nas rdo rjes de skad ces bka' stsal to zhes pa'i bar du ni 'jig rten pa'i mkha' 'gro ma dang 'jig rten las 'das pa gang yin pa de rnams thams cad gtsug tor @121b 'khor los sgyur ba la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor bas
translated: From “there” up to “Vajradhara said this” teaches that all of the worldly and transcendent ḍākinīs are included in the five families, and that the yogin of Uṣṇīṣa Cakravartin and so forth

original: bsgrubs la sangs rgyas nyid dang rdo rje 'chang nyid bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: bsgrubs la sangs rgyas nyid dang rdo rje 'chang nyid bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: One should practice in order to attain buddhahood itself and Vajradharahood itself.

original: lhan cig spyod pa'i phyir dang tha mal ba ma yin pa'i gzugs 'dzin pa'i phyir zhes bstan to //
analyzed: lhan cig spyod pa'i phyir dang tha mal ba ma yin pa'i gzugs 'dzin pa'i phyir zhes bstan to //
translated: This is taught because of engaging in union and because of holding a non-ordinary form.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba nas snyoms par 'jug par bya'o zhes pa'i bar du ni spros pa med pa'i spyod pa dang ldan pa sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba nas snyoms par 'jug par bya'o zhes pa'i bar du ni spros pa med pa'i spyod pa dang ldan pa sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis /
translated: Thus, up to “one should enter into union” teaches that yogins of the vajra body, speech, and mind endowed with unelaborate conduct

original: rang gi shing la sogs pa las byas pa'i gdong dang phyag dang phyag mtshan la sogs pa byas la de dang 'dra ba yang kha dog sbyar te /
analyzed: rang gi shing la sogs pa las byas pa'i gdong dang phyag dang phyag mtshan la sogs pa byas la de dang 'dra ba yang kha dog sbyar te /
translated: should make a face, hands, hand implements, and so on, made of wood and so forth, and also apply color to make it similar to that.

original: bcu gnyis pa dang bcu drug pa dang / lo nyi shu pa sme sha can dang gar mkhan dang khrus mkhan gyi bu mo legs par bslabs pa dam tshig gi phyag rgya spyan ma la sogs pa'i gzugs su sbyar ba blangs te dus bzhin yul nas yul du 'gro zhing snyoms par zhugs par byas te /

translated: The twelfth, sixteenth, and twentieth years, the daughter of a butcher, dancer, or bath attendant, well trained, is taken as a pledge seal consort, in the aspect of Lochana, etc., and one should enter into union with her, moving from place to place as the occasion arises.

analyzed: ji srid de dang lhan cig phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob pa de srid gnas par bya'o //

original: zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The passage from “the ultimate” up to “is praised” teaches that the yogi/nī who practices with a seal should abandon a meager livelihood and sustain the body with just enough food.

original: de rnams kyi le'u dgu pa nas gsungs pa'i dam tshig lnga spyad par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de rnams kyi le'u dgu pa nas gsungs pa'i dam tshig lnga spyad par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: The five pledges taught in the ninth chapter of the Guhyasamaja Tantra should be practiced.

original: bsam gtan zhes pa nas sgra ji bzhin pa'o zhes pa'i bar du ni shin tu spros pa med pa'i spyod pa dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pas ye shes kyi phyag rgya rang gi snang ba'i rang bzhin snying ga nas spros te /
analyzed: bsam gtan zhes pa nas sgra ji bzhin pa'o zhes pa'i bar du ni shin tu spros pa med pa'i spyod pa dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pas ye shes kyi phyag rgya rang gi snang ba'i rang bzhin snying ga nas spros te /
translated: The passage from “meditation” to “is literal” teaches that a yogi who practices the extremely unelaborate mode of conduct emanates the gnosis consort, who is of the nature of his own appearance, from his heart center.

original: de dang lhan cig bde ba chen po myong zhing nags kyi lha mos byin pa'i kha zas spyod pa'am bsam gtan gyi kha zas can gyis ji srid dngos grub thob pa de srid goms par bya'o zhes bstan to //

translated: Together with her, he experiences great bliss and enjoys the food given by the forest goddesses or the food of meditative concentration. He should practice this until he attains the spiritual powers.

original: sgra ji bzhin pa'o zhes pa ni spyod pa gnyis bstan pa ste /🔽spyod pa ji lta ji ltar gsungs //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin pa'o zhes pa ni spyod pa gnyis bstan pa ste / spyod pa ji lta ji ltar gsungs //
translated: The passage from “is literal” to “is taught” teaches the two modes of conduct.

original: zhes bstan pas so //
analyzed: zhes bstan pas so //
translated: The passage from “the modes of conduct” to “are taught” teaches that the modes of conduct are taught in the tantra in accordance with the three types of practitioners.

original: rdo rje zhes bya ba nas dgongs pas bshad pa'o zhes pa'i bar du ni phyag rgya dang lhan cig snyoms par zhugs te tha mal ba'i lus spangs nas rdo rje sku zhes bya ba rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang thob pa'i @122a * //

original: sngar bshad pa'i lhan cig spyod ma rdo rje sa 'og gi rgyud las gsungs pa'i dbang dang dgug pa la sogs pa'i chogs dgug cing bsgrub par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //🔽lha mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i lhan cig spyod ma rdo rje sa 'og gi rgyud las gsungs pa'i dbang dang dgug pa la sogs pa'i chogs dgug cing bsgrub par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //🔽lha mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
