original: lha dang gnod sbyin dang dri za la sogs pa'i bu mo rdo rje 'jigs byed dang 'byung po 'dul ba'i rgyud las gsungs pa'i rim pas bsgrub par bya ba dang / lha ma yin gyi bu mo dang klu'i bu mo rdo rje sa 'og gi rgyud las gsungs pa'i rim pas bsgrub par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: lha dang gnod sbyin dang dri za la sogs pa'i bu mo rdo rje 'jigs byed dang 'byung po 'dul ba'i rgyud las gsungs pa'i rim pas bsgrub par bya ba dang / lha ma yin gyi bu mo dang klu'i bu mo rdo rje sa 'og gi rgyud las gsungs pa'i rim pas bsgrub par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: The daughters of gods, yakshas, gandharvas, and so on, are to be accomplished by the procedure taught in the Vajrabhairava and Bhutadamara Tantras, and the daughters of asuras and nagas are to be accomplished by the procedure taught in the Vajra-adho-bhuvana Tantra.

original: rnal 'byor ba rnams te zhes pa ni sngon gyi sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba rnams te zhes pa ni sngon gyi sangs rgyas so //
translated: The yogis are the former Buddhas.

original: des bsten pa ni de rnams kyi spyod pa'o //
analyzed: des bsten pa ni de rnams kyi spyod pa'o //
translated: Their practice is their conduct.

original: rig pa'i brtul zhugs zhes pa ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya dang lhan cig spyod pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rig pa'i brtul zhugs zhes pa ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya dang lhan cig spyod pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The knowledge observance is the characteristic of the conduct with the pledge seal.

original: thun mong gi cho ga'o zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor ba la thun mong ngo //
analyzed: thun mong gi cho ga'o zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor ba la thun mong ngo //
translated: The common rite is common to the yogis of Vairochana and so on.

original: sgrub pa po thams cad kyi zhes pa ni rim pa gnyis kyi rnal 'byor ba rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa po thams cad kyi zhes pa ni rim pa gnyis kyi rnal 'byor ba rnams kyi'o //
translated: The all adepts are the yogis of the two stages.

original: shin tu gsang ba zhes pa ni bya ba'i rgyud la sogs pa la brten pa la spa bar bya'o //
analyzed: shin tu gsang ba zhes pa ni bya ba'i rgyud la sogs pa la brten pa la spa bar bya'o //
translated: The very secret is to be revealed to those who rely on the Action Tantra, etc.

original: don chen po thob par byed pa zhes pa ni thams cad kyi phul du byung ba'i 'bras bu thob par byed pa'o /
analyzed: don chen po thob par byed pa zhes pa ni thams cad kyi phul du byung ba'i 'bras bu thob par byed pa'o /
translated: The attainer of the great meaning is the attainer of the fruit which is the best of all.

original: sku rdo rje la sogs pa zhes pa ni lus la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo rnam par snang mdzad dang spyan ma la sogs pa'i rgyus so //
analyzed: sku rdo rje la sogs pa zhes pa ni lus la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo rnam par snang mdzad dang spyan ma la sogs pa'i rgyus so //
translated: The body vajra, etc. is by the cause of Vairocana, Locana, etc., which are the essence of the purification of body, etc.

original: rdo rje sku la sogs pa skyed par byed pa ni bden pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid kyi rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang la 'jug par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sku la sogs pa skyed par byed pa ni bden pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid kyi rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang la 'jug par byed pa'o //
translated: The generator of the vajra body, etc. is the introducer to the state of Great Vajradhara, whose nature is the two truths.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that,🔽he says,

original: don dam pa'i bden pa zhes smos te /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa zhes smos te /
translated: the ultimate truth.

original: mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pas thob par byed pa'i 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pas thob par byed pa'i 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: It is the clearlight which is attained by the stage of manifest enlightenment.

original: thos pas te zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba las cig car du byung ba'i zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo bo rdo rje 'chang gi sku skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: thos pas te zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba las cig car du byung ba'i zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo bo rdo rje 'chang gi sku skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: By hearing means that one generates the body of Vajradhara, the essence of the unification samādhi that arises instantaneously from clear light.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just that, [the Bhagavān] declares,

original: 'od gsal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'od gsal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: clear light, and so on.

original: 'od gsal ba ni mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pas rnam par dag pa ni spros ba'o //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba ni mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pas rnam par dag pa ni spros ba'o //
translated: Clear light is the pure aspect by the stage of manifest enlightenment.

original: @122b ye shes kyi sku ni rdo rje'i sku ste zung du 'jug pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: @122b ye shes kyi sku ni rdo rje'i sku ste zung du 'jug pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The jñānakāya is the vajrakāya, called unification.

original: thob par byed pa zhes pa ni de rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: thob par byed pa zhes pa ni de rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: One attains means that one accomplishes that.

original: bar du'o zhes pa ni rdzogs pa rjod par byed pa ni tshig phrad do //
analyzed: bar du'o zhes pa ni rdzogs pa rjod par byed pa ni tshig phrad do //
translated: In between is the expression of completion.

original: bsdu bar byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas le'u nye bar bsdu bar bstan to //
analyzed: bsdu bar byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas le'u nye bar bsdu bar bstan to //
translated: One should gather, and so on, teaches the summary of the chapter.

original: dngos grub thams cad ces pa ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i dngos grub kyi rgyur gyur pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: dngos grub thams cad ces pa ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i dngos grub kyi rgyur gyur pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: All powers are the causes of the powers such as pacification, and so on, of Vairocana, and so on.

original: dkyil 'khor ni mtha' yas pa'i dkyil 'khor bas yongs su bskor ba'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor ni mtha' yas pa'i dkyil 'khor bas yongs su bskor ba'o //
translated: The mandala is surrounded by the infinite mandala.

original: de ni dkyil 'khor te dkyil 'khor de la brten nas //
analyzed: de ni dkyil 'khor te dkyil 'khor de la brten nas //
translated: That is the mandala.

original: sgrub pa po rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi mngon par byang chub pa'i ye shes bskyed pa ni dbang bskur ba la sogs pa'i rim gyis ye shes kyi sku thob pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa po rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi mngon par byang chub pa'i ye shes bskyed pa ni dbang bskur ba la sogs pa'i rim gyis ye shes kyi sku thob pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The generation of the knowledge of manifest enlightenment of the practitioners, the yogis, is the attainment of the body of knowledge by the process of consecration and so on.

original: de'i don gyi gzhung gi tshogs zhes pa ni de ston par byed pa'i tshig gi tshogs so //
analyzed: de'i don gyi gzhung gi tshogs zhes pa ni de ston par byed pa'i tshig gi tshogs so //
translated: The collection of texts of that meaning is the collection of words that teach that.

original: le'u zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: le'u zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: The chapter has been explained previously.

original: sgra ji bzhin pa zhes pa ni le'u'i don tsam so sor bstan pas so //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin pa zhes pa ni le'u'i don tsam so sor bstan pas so //
translated: The literal meaning is the teaching of the mere meaning of the chapter individually.

original: de yang sogs pa'i sgras shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang sogs pa'i sgras shes par bya'o //
translated: And that should be understood by the word and so on.

original: sgron ma gsal bar byed pa'i 'grel pa'i t'ik'a las le'u bcu drug pa'i rgya cher bshad pa'o /
analyzed: sgron ma gsal bar byed pa'i 'grel pa'i t'ik'a las le'u bcu drug pa'i rgya cher bshad pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the sixteenth chapter of the Illuminating Lamp Tika.

original: // / rim pa gnyis khong du chud pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas le'u bcu bdun pa'i bshad pa brtsam par bya ste /🔽rim pa gnyis khong du chud pa zhes pa ni le'u bcu drug gi rim pa gnyis mngon du byas pa'o //🔽'jig rten pa ni mi dge ba bcu las ldog pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: // / rim pa gnyis khong du chud pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas le'u bcu bdun pa'i bshad pa brtsam par bya ste / rim pa gnyis khong du chud pa zhes pa ni le'u bcu drug gi rim pa gnyis mngon du byas pa'o // 'jig rten pa ni mi dge ba bcu las ldog pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The commentary on the seventeenth chapter begins with Having understood the two stages, etc.🔽Having understood the two stages means having realized the two stages of the sixteen chapters.🔽The mundane is characterized by turning away from the ten non-virtues.🔽

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni dam tshig dang sdom pa'i bsrung bar bya ba dang bza' bar bya ba'i dbye bas phye ba de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i dam tshig dang bdud rtsi lnga dang lcags kyu lnga la sogs pa'i spyod pa'o //🔽nyams su ma blangs na zhes pa ni de dag thams cad mi srung zhing spong bas so //🔽dngos grub ni phyag rgya chen po'i mtshan nyid do //🔽ring bar 'gyur ba ni 'grub par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni dam tshig dang sdom pa'i bsrung bar bya ba dang bza' bar bya ba'i dbye bas phye ba de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i dam tshig dang bdud rtsi lnga dang lcags kyu lnga la sogs pa'i spyod pa'o //🔽nyams su ma blangs na zhes pa ni de dag thams cad mi srung zhing spong bas so //🔽dngos grub ni phyag rgya chen po'i mtshan nyid do //🔽ring bar 'gyur ba ni 'grub par mi 'gyur ba'o //

original: de ni le'u bcu bdun pa dam tshig dang sdom pa ston par byed pa sdud pa pos bstan to //
analyzed: de ni le'u bcu bdun pa dam tshig dang sdom pa ston par byed pa sdud pa pos bstan to //
translated: That is taught by the compiler in chapter seventeen, which teaches the commitments and vows.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis gsol ba 'debs pa zhes pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po la mi bskyod pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas lnga pos bstod pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis gsol ba 'debs pa zhes pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po la mi bskyod pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas lnga pos bstod pa'o //
translated: The request of all the transcendent ones is the praise of Great Vajradhara by the five buddhas, Akshobhya and so forth.

original: mi bskyod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa thugs rdo rje 'chang gi sgo nas bstod pa bstan te /
analyzed: mi bskyod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa thugs rdo rje 'chang gi sgo nas bstod pa bstan te /
translated: The praise from the perspective of Vajra Mind is taught by “Akshobhya” and so forth.

original: nyon mongs pa'i tshogs thams cad ni chags pa dang bral ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i tshogs thams cad ni chags pa dang bral ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The entire host of afflictions is attachment, aversion, and so forth.

original: @123a * // da rnams kyi tshogs ni nyin mo dang mtshan mo dang brgya drug cu'i dbye bas 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: @123a * // da rnams kyi tshogs ni nyin mo dang mtshan mo dang brgya drug cu'i dbye bas 'jug pa'o //
translated: The host of these is the engagement by the division of the one hundred and sixty moments of day and night.

original: mi g-yo ba zhes pa ni sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas de rnams spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba zhes pa ni sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas de rnams spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “Immovable” is because of the abandonment of those by the stages of mantra and seal.

original: de ltar gyur ba ni rdo rje thugs dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar gyur ba ni rdo rje thugs dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Thus, he is endowed with the vajra mind.

original: de bzhin du stong pa ni bzhi ste rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dbye bas gnas pa de'i bdag nyid can yang bcom ldan 'das yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du stong pa ni bzhi ste rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dbye bas gnas pa de'i bdag nyid can yang bcom ldan 'das yin te /
translated: Likewise, the empty ones are four, and the Lord is also the identity of that abiding, by the division of cause and effect.

original: khyab byed yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyab byed yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is the pervader.

original: gang gi phyir don dam pa'i bden pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang pa'i rnam par rtog pa khyab par byed pa nyid kyis 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir don dam pa'i bden pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang pa'i rnam par rtog pa khyab par byed pa nyid kyis 'dra ba ste /
translated: Because ultimate reality is similar by the pervasiveness of the concepts of affliction and purification.

original: de la spang bya dang dor bya'i bag chags kyis gos pa mi srid de /
analyzed: de la spang bya dang dor bya'i bag chags kyis gos pa mi srid de /
translated: There, it is impossible to be covered by the latent tendencies of the objects to be abandoned and the objects to be discarded.

original: rtag tu dag ba'i phyir dang / glo bur gyi dri ma rnams rnam par byang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu dag ba'i phyir dang / glo bur gyi dri ma rnams rnam par byang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is always pure and because the adventitious stains are purified.

original: mi bskyod pa la sogs pa ste //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa la sogs pa ste //
translated: Akshobhya and so on

original: zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'o //
translated: are the five tathagatas.🔽Because they hold that,

original: de 'dzin par byed pas na zhes pa ni de rnams bskyed pa'am spro bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: de 'dzin par byed pas na zhes pa ni de rnams bskyed pa'am spro bar byed pa ste /
translated: they generate or emanate them,

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po las rigs thams cad byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po las rigs thams cad byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because all the families arise from Great Vajradhara.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: rnal 'byor thams cad bcom ldan 'das //
analyzed: rnal 'byor thams cad bcom ldan 'das //
translated: All yogas are the Bhagavat,

original: rdo rje sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs //
translated: Vajrasattva, the Tathagata.

original: de yi khams gsum ma lus pa //
analyzed: de yi khams gsum ma lus pa //
translated: His entire three worlds

original: thams cad du ni longs spyod cing //
analyzed: thams cad du ni longs spyod cing //
translated: are enjoyed everywhere.

original: zhes 'byung bas so //
analyzed: zhes 'byung bas so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: bden pa gnyis ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'o //
translated: The two truths are the conventional and the ultimate.

original: de'i dbye bas ni sems rnam par dag pa la sogs pa'i rim pa kho na nyid rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dbye bas ni sems rnam par dag pa la sogs pa'i rim pa kho na nyid rtogs pa'o //
translated: By their division, the reality of the stages of the mind's purification, etc., is understood.

original: de yongs su mkhyen pas zhes pa ni de'i sngon du mdzad pas so //
analyzed: de yongs su mkhyen pas zhes pa ni de'i sngon du mdzad pas so //
translated: The knowledge of that is the performance of that.

original: de la sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pas rang bzhin dang snang ba kun rdzob pa yongs su spangs nas 'od gsal ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi don dam pa'i bden pa sngon du mdzad pa dang / bdag la byin gyis brlabs pa'i rim pas chad pa'i phyogs yongs su spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pas rang bzhin dang snang ba kun rdzob pa yongs su spangs nas 'od gsal ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi don dam pa'i bden pa sngon du mdzad pa dang / bdag la byin gyis brlabs pa'i rim pas chad pa'i phyogs yongs su spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therein, by the stage of the mind's purification, having abandoned the natural and the conventional appearances, the ultimate truth, which is characterized by clear light, is performed first, and by the stage of self-consecration, the extreme position is abandoned.

original: ye shes kyi sku yongs su bzung bas kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i dbye bas sngon du mdzad pa dang / mngon par byang chub kyi rim pas kyang de yongs su sbyangs nas de kho na nyid bzhi pa don dam pa'i bden pa mngon du mdzad pa dang /
analyzed: ye shes kyi sku yongs su bzung bas kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i dbye bas sngon du mdzad pa dang / mngon par byang chub kyi rim pas kyang de yongs su sbyangs nas de kho na nyid bzhi pa don dam pa'i bden pa mngon du mdzad pa dang /
translated: By fully apprehending the jñānakāya, he manifests the ultimate truth, the fourth reality, having purified it by the division of conventional truth and by the stage of manifest enlightenment.

original: rtag pa dang chad pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'i zung du 'jug pa'i rim pas bden pa gnyis dbyer med pas mngon du mdzad pa'o zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa dang chad pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'i zung du 'jug pa'i rim pas bden pa gnyis dbyer med pas mngon du mdzad pa'o zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: By the stage of union, free from permanence, annihilation, and so on, he manifests the inseparability of the two truths.

original: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang gis ni de dag @123b thams cad mngon par rtogs par mdzad do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang gis ni de dag @123b thams cad mngon par rtogs par mdzad do //
translated: The Bhagavān Vajradhara has realized all of those.

original: rdo rje la sogs pa zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i nang na gtso bor gyur pas na bdag por gyur pas so //
analyzed: rdo rje la sogs pa zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i nang na gtso bor gyur pas na bdag por gyur pas so //
translated: Vajra and so on means that he is the lord because he is the principal one among Vairocana and so on.

original: don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor dang zhes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams 'od gsal ba la 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor te snying po len pas so //
analyzed: don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor dang zhes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams 'od gsal ba la 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor te snying po len pas so //
translated: The ultimate maṇḍala is the ultimate maṇḍala characterized by the entry of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases such as form into clear light, because it is the extraction of the essence.

original: de ni rim pa gnyis po la yang yod de /
analyzed: de ni rim pa gnyis po la yang yod de /
translated: That is in both stages,

original: dang po sbyor ba'i yan lag tu gyur pa rnal 'byor gyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir dang / sems rnam pa rdag pa dang mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pas thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang po sbyor ba'i yan lag tu gyur pa rnal 'byor gyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir dang / sems rnam pa rdag pa dang mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pas thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is a part of the yoga that is a branch of the first application and because it is attained by the stage of mental stability and manifest enlightenment.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa la sku nyid dkyil 'khor te lha sum cu rtsa gnyis dgod pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa la sku nyid dkyil 'khor te lha sum cu rtsa gnyis dgod pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the stage of generation, the maṇḍala is the body, because it is the nature of the arrangement of the thirty-two deities.

original: rjes su rnal 'byor dang shin tu rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor chen pos de rdzogs pas na dang po sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: rjes su rnal 'byor dang shin tu rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor chen pos de rdzogs pas na dang po sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: Since that is completed by the subsequent yoga, the great yoga, it is the samādhi of the first application.

original: dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog la phyag rgya 'dus byas pa sngon du 'gro bas phyi rol du lha sum cu rtsa gnyis spro ba ni phyung ba'i dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog la phyag rgya 'dus byas pa sngon du 'gro bas phyi rol du lha sum cu rtsa gnyis spro ba ni phyung ba'i dkyil 'khor te /
translated: The emanation mandala is the emanation of the thirty-two deities outside, preceded by the seal-impression of the supreme victor mandala.

original: de 'gro ba'i don byed pa'i phyir te dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog gi ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: de 'gro ba'i don byed pa'i phyir te dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog gi ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: This is the samadhi of the supreme victor mandala, because it benefits migrating beings.

original: gal te de lta yin na 'dus pa'i phyi ma'i rgyud kyi tshad mas ji ltar 'gal ba ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na 'dus pa'i phyi ma'i rgyud kyi tshad mas ji ltar 'gal ba ma yin zhe na /
translated: If that is so, how is it not contradictory with the valid cognition of the Continuation of the Compendium Tantra?

original: de la byang chub sems ni dkyil 'khor te //🔽bha ga'i dkyil 'khor nyid dang ni //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems ni dkyil 'khor te // bha ga'i dkyil 'khor nyid dang ni //
translated: The bodhicitta is the mandala.🔽The bhaga mandala

original: sku yi dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba //
analyzed: sku yi dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba //
translated: and the body mandala

original: dkyil 'khor gsum ni brtags pa yin //🔽zhes pas mi 'gal te /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gsum ni brtags pa yin // zhes pas mi 'gal te /
translated: are the three mandalas that are imputed.

original: de'i rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no contradiction because this is a synonym.

original: de la byang chub kyi sems ni don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor yin te /
analyzed: de la byang chub kyi sems ni don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor yin te /
translated: The bodhicitta is the ultimate mandala.

original: stong nyid snying rje dbyer med pa'i //
analyzed: stong nyid snying rje dbyer med pa'i //
translated: Emptiness and compassion are inseparable

original: byang chub sems su de bshad do //
analyzed: byang chub sems su de bshad do //
translated: in the explanation of bodhicitta.

original: zhes de nyid las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes de nyid las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is stated in that very [Hevajra Tantra].

original: 'on kyang byang chub kyi sems la cha gnyis te /
analyzed: 'on kyang byang chub kyi sems la cha gnyis te /
translated: However, there are two aspects of bodhicitta:

original: rdzas kyi cha dang bde ba chen po'i cha'o //
analyzed: rdzas kyi cha dang bde ba chen po'i cha'o //
translated: the aspect of substance and the aspect of great bliss.

original: de'ang bde ba chen po'i cha la brten nas byang chub sems nyid ni don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'ang bde ba chen po'i cha la brten nas byang chub sems nyid ni don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, based on the aspect of great bliss, the bodhicitta itself is called the ultimate maṇḍala.

original: sku'i dkyil 'khor ni 'dra ba nyid do //🔽bha ga'i dkyil 'khor ni phyung ba'i dkyil 'khor nyid yin te /
analyzed: sku'i dkyil 'khor ni 'dra ba nyid do // bha ga'i dkyil 'khor ni phyung ba'i dkyil 'khor nyid yin te /
translated: The maṇḍala of the body is similar.🔽The maṇḍala of the bhaga is the maṇḍala that emerges,

original: bha ga las phyung ba'i dkyil 'khor 'byung bas so //
analyzed: bha ga las phyung ba'i dkyil 'khor 'byung bas so //
translated: because the maṇḍala that emerges from the bhaga emerges.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dbyer med pas 'di skad bstan te /🔽nye bar @124a * //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dbyer med pas 'di skad bstan te / nye bar @124a * //
translated: Since cause and effect are inseparable, it is taught like this.

original: brtags pas so //
analyzed: brtags pas so //
translated: It is taught by the examination.

original: gzhan dag na re sku'i dkyil 'khor sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re sku'i dkyil 'khor sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: Others say that the maṇḍala of the body is the nature of thirty-two [deities],

original: gsung gi dkyil 'khor ni dbyangs dang gsal bya'i bdag nyid can gyi yi ge phyi mo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gsung gi dkyil 'khor ni dbyangs dang gsal bya'i bdag nyid can gyi yi ge phyi mo zhes zer ro //
translated: and the maṇḍala of speech is the vowels and consonants, which are the nature of the Sanskrit letters.

original: aa a'a ni rnam par snang mdzad dang spyan ma'o //
analyzed: aa a'a ni rnam par snang mdzad dang spyan ma'o //
translated: A and ā are Vairocana and Locanā.

original: aa a'i ni rin chen 'byung ldan dang m'a ma k'i'o //🔽au a'u ni 'od dpag tu med pa dang gos dkar mo'o //
analyzed: aa a'i ni rin chen 'byung ldan dang m'a ma k'i'o // au a'u ni 'od dpag tu med pa dang gos dkar mo'o //
translated: The vowels a and ā are Ratnasaṃbhava and Māmakī.🔽The vowels u and ū are Amitābha and Pāṇḍaravāsinī.

original: ri r'i ni don yod grub pa dang sgrol ma'o //
analyzed: ri r'i ni don yod grub pa dang sgrol ma'o //
translated: The vowels ri and ri are Amoghasiddhi and Tārā.

original: li l'i ni mi bskyod pa dang reg bya rdo rje ma'o //
analyzed: li l'i ni mi bskyod pa dang reg bya rdo rje ma'o //
translated: The vowels li and li are Akṣobhya and Sparśavajrā.

original: ae aee ao aoo ni gshin rje mthar byed la sogs pa khro bo bzhi'o //
analyzed: ae aee ao aoo ni gshin rje mthar byed la sogs pa khro bo bzhi'o //
translated: The vowels ai, o, au, and aṃ are the four wrathful deities beginning with Yamantaka.

original: ka kha ga gha nga ni lha mo bzhis bskor ba'i rnam par mdzad do //
analyzed: ka kha ga gha nga ni lha mo bzhis bskor ba'i rnam par mdzad do //
translated: The consonants ka, kha, ga, gha, and ṅa are the four goddesses surrounding the principal deity.

original: tsa tsha dza dzha nya ni lha mo bzhis yongs su bskor ba'i rin chen 'byung ldan no //🔽ta tha da dha na ni lha mo bzhis yongs su bskor ba'i 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: tsa tsha dza dzha nya ni lha mo bzhis yongs su bskor ba'i rin chen 'byung ldan no // ta tha da dha na ni lha mo bzhis yongs su bskor ba'i 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: The consonants ca, cha, ja, jha, and ña are Ratnasaṃbhava surrounded by the four goddesses.🔽The consonants ṭa, ṭha, ḍa, ḍha, and ṇa are Amitābha surrounded by the four goddesses.

original: ta tha da dha na ni lha mo bzhis yongs su bskor ba'i don yod grub ba'o //
analyzed: ta tha da dha na ni lha mo bzhis yongs su bskor ba'i don yod grub ba'o //
translated: The consonants ta, tha, da, dha, and na are Amoghasiddhi surrounded by the four goddesses.

original: pa pha ba bha ma zhes pa ni lha mo bzhis yongs su bskor ba'i mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: pa pha ba bha ma zhes pa ni lha mo bzhis yongs su bskor ba'i mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: The consonants pa, pha, ba, bha, and ma are Akṣobhya surrounded by the four goddesses.

original: de dag lnga lnga'i bdag nyid ni dkyil 'khor lnga'o //
analyzed: de dag lnga lnga'i bdag nyid ni dkyil 'khor lnga'o //
translated: These five groups of five are the five maṇḍalas.

original: ya ra la wa sha sha sa ha aam aa: zhes bya ba ni khro bo bcu ste gsung gi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: ya ra la wa sha sha sa ha aam aa: zhes bya ba ni khro bo bcu ste gsung gi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: Ya ra la wa sha sha sa ha aṃ aḥ—these are the ten wrathful ones, the maṇḍala of speech.

original: de bzhin du 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang // gti mug dang / nga rgyal dang / phrag dog rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin ni 'od dpag tu med pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang // gti mug dang / nga rgyal dang / phrag dog rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin ni 'od dpag tu med pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the nature of the complete purification of desire, hatred, ignorance, pride, and jealousy is Amitābha and so forth.

original: bdag tu lta ba dang / bdag tu rmongs pa dang / bdag tu nga rgyal ba dang / bdag tu chags pa rnam par dag pas spyan la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba dang / bdag tu rmongs pa dang / bdag tu nga rgyal ba dang / bdag tu chags pa rnam par dag pas spyan la sogs pa'o //
translated: The complete purification of the view of self, delusion of self, pride of self, and attachment to self is Locanā and so forth.

original: kun gzhi la sogs pa rnam pa shes pa brgyad rnam par dag pas byams pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi la sogs pa rnam pa shes pa brgyad rnam par dag pas byams pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The complete purification of the eight consciousnesses, such as the all-base, is Maitreya and so forth.

original: chu bo bzhi rnam par dag pas gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chu bo bzhi rnam par dag pas gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa'o //
translated: The complete purification of the four rivers is Rūpavajrā and so forth.🔽Shamelessness, lack of conscience, jealousy, stinginess, conceit,🔽remorse, dullness, agitation,

original: ngo tsha med cing khrel med dang // phrag dog ser sna rgyags pa dang // 'gyod pa bying ba rgod pa dang // khro ba dang ni 'chab pa ste //
analyzed: ngo tsha med cing khrel med dang // phrag dog ser sna rgyags pa dang // 'gyod pa bying ba rgod pa dang // khro ba dang ni 'chab pa ste //
translated: anger, and concealment—🔽these ten are the ten wrathful ones.

original: kun du sbyor ba bcu rnam par dag pas gshin rje mthar byed la sogs pa khro bo bcu zhes thugs kyi dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba bcu rnam par dag pas gshin rje mthar byed la sogs pa khro bo bcu zhes thugs kyi dkyil 'khor te /
translated: The ten wrathful ones, Yamantaka and so forth, are the mind mandala, because they purify the ten fetters.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sems sbyong bar byed pas so //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sems sbyong bar byed pas so //
translated: They purify the afflicted mind.

original: yang dag ma yin kun rtog min //🔽sems dang sems byung khams gsum pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag ma yin kun rtog min // sems dang sems byung khams gsum pa'o //
translated: The imagination of what is unreal is not

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: the mind and mental factors of the three realms.

original: dkyil 'khor gsum po de'i rang bzhin bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang yin te /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gsum po de'i rang bzhin bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang yin te /
translated: The nature of those three mandalas is the Bhagavat Vajradhara,

original: de las byung ba'i phyir ro //🔽ji ltar @124b bden pa'i dkyil 'khor ni //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i phyir ro // ji ltar @124b bden pa'i dkyil 'khor ni //
translated: because they arise from him.

original: gang gis rab tu brtag par nus //🔽rang lhag lha yi sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: gang gis rab tu brtag par nus // rang lhag lha yi sbyor ba yis //
translated: How can one imagine the mandala of truth?🔽The accomplishment of imagining the mandala

original: dkyil 'khor brtag pa 'grub pa yin //🔽zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor brtag pa 'grub pa yin // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: is by the yoga of one's own deity.

original: dam tshig de kho na nyid ces bya ba ni bza' ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dam tshig de kho na nyid ces bya ba ni bza' ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The reality of the commitments is eating and so forth.

original: bshad du gsol zhes pa ni ston par mdzad du gsol zhes ba'o //
analyzed: bshad du gsol zhes pa ni ston par mdzad du gsol zhes ba'o //
translated: Please explain means please teach.

original: mi bskyod pa'i sgo nas bstod pa'o zhes pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi ngo bo yin pas so //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa'i sgo nas bstod pa'o zhes pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi ngo bo yin pas so //
translated: The phrase praise through Akṣobhya means that he is the essence of the gnosis of the dharma-dhātu.

original: 'od gsal ba'i mes zhes pa ni me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi mes so //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba'i mes zhes pa ni me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi mes so //
translated: The phrase the fire of clear light means the fire of mirror-like gnosis.

original: 'bar bar gyur bas na zhes pa ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pas mdzes par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'bar bar gyur bas na zhes pa ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pas mdzes par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The phrase having become blazing means that he is beautiful because he has abandoned the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dga' ba che'o zhes pa ni 'bras bu rgyur pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dga' ba che'o zhes pa ni 'bras bu rgyur pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: For that very reason, he is great joy, which indicates the result as the cause.

original: de rnams rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis zhes pa ni nye bar sdud par byed pas so //
analyzed: de rnams rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis zhes pa ni nye bar sdud par byed pas so //
translated: The phrase the essence of their purity means that he is the one who brings them together.

original: drug par 'gyur bas na zhes pa ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa' nyid yin pas so //
analyzed: drug par 'gyur bas na zhes pa ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa' nyid yin pas so //
translated: The phrase having become the sixth means that he is glorious Vajrasattva.

original: mchog tu dga' ba'i bdag nyid yin pas na zhes pa ni spyan ma dang snyoms par zhugs pas bde ba chen po'i ngo bo yin pas so //
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba'i bdag nyid yin pas na zhes pa ni spyan ma dang snyoms par zhugs pas bde ba chen po'i ngo bo yin pas so //
translated: The phrase having the nature of supreme joy means that he is the essence of great bliss because he is in union with Locanā.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis dag pa zhes pa ni gtsang ba dang mi gtsang ba la sogs pa brtags pa yin pas na mi bza' ba dang mi btung ba la sogs pa rtag tu dri ma med pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis dag pa zhes pa ni gtsang ba dang mi gtsang ba la sogs pa brtags pa yin pas na mi bza' ba dang mi btung ba la sogs pa rtag tu dri ma med pa'o //
translated: The pure by nature is the purity and impurity, etc. , and so is the constant stainlessness of the non-eating, non-drinking, etc. .

original: bstod cing zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par snang mdzad kyi sgo nas bstod pa'o //
analyzed: bstod cing zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par snang mdzad kyi sgo nas bstod pa'o //
translated: The praise , etc. is the praise by way of Vairocana.

original: rin po che'i rigs dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba ni m'a ma k'i la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rin po che'i rigs dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba ni m'a ma k'i la sogs pa'o //
translated: The endowed with the jewel family is Māmakī, etc.

original: gsal bar mdzad pa ni spro bar mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: gsal bar mdzad pa ni spro bar mdzad pa'o //
translated: The illuminator is the one who emits.

original: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi bdag nyid yin pas na zhes pa ni nam mkha' mdzod nyid kyis mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi ngo bo yin pas so //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi bdag nyid yin pas na zhes pa ni nam mkha' mdzod nyid kyis mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi ngo bo yin pas so //
translated: The equality wisdom nature is the nature of the equality wisdom by way of the Ākāśagarbha.

original: de nyid kyis na zhes bya ba la sogs pas nam mkha' dang mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na zhes bya ba la sogs pas nam mkha' dang mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid du bstan to //
translated: The just that , etc. teaches the nature of the equality wisdom as the equality of space.

original: gsungs shig pa zhes bya bas rin chen 'byung ldan gyi sgo nas bstod pa'o //
analyzed: gsungs shig pa zhes bya bas rin chen 'byung ldan gyi sgo nas bstod pa'o //
translated: The speak , etc. is the praise by way of Ratnasaṃbhava.

original: padma'i rigs dang ldan pa zhes pa ni byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo yin pas so //
analyzed: padma'i rigs dang ldan pa zhes pa ni byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo yin pas so //
translated: The phrase endowed with the lotus family means that it is the essence of the spirit of enlightenment.

original: de rnams kyi bdag por gyur pas zhes pa ni de rnams skyed par byed pas so //
analyzed: de rnams kyi bdag por gyur pas zhes pa ni de rnams skyed par byed pas so //
translated: The phrase the lord of those means that it is the generator of those.

original: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes pas na zhes pa ni chos rab tu 'byed pa'i bdag nyid can gyis so sor rtog pa'i ngo bo yin pas so //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes pas na zhes pa ni chos rab tu 'byed pa'i bdag nyid can gyis so sor rtog pa'i ngo bo yin pas so //
translated: The phrase because of discerning wisdom means that it is the essence of discerning, which has the nature of the differentiation of things.

original: de nyid kyis na zhes pas 'bras bu bstan to //🔽'khor ba la zhan pa'i mtshan nyid can @125a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na zhes pas 'bras bu bstan to // 'khor ba la zhan pa'i mtshan nyid can @125a * //
translated: The phrase just that indicates the result.

original: zhes pa ni bde ba dang bde ba'i rgyu las mngon par 'dod pa sngon du 'gro bas gzung ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: zhes pa ni bde ba dang bde ba'i rgyu las mngon par 'dod pa sngon du 'gro bas gzung ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The phrase the characteristic of weariness with cyclic existence means that it is characterized by the apprehension that is preceded by the desire for happiness and the causes of happiness.

original: de ltar so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni bcom ldan 'das 'od dpag tu med pa yin no zhes bya ba 'dis snang ba mtha' yas kyi sgo nas bstod pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni bcom ldan 'das 'od dpag tu med pa yin no zhes bya ba 'dis snang ba mtha' yas kyi sgo nas bstod pa'o //
translated: Thus, the perfection of discerning wisdom is the transcendent Bhagavat Amitabha. This is the praise from the point of view of Amitabha.

original: don yod grub pa'i ye shes ni 'khor ba'i btson ra las grol ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: don yod grub pa'i ye shes ni 'khor ba'i btson ra las grol ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The wisdom of Amoghasiddhi is characterized by liberation from the prison of cyclic existence.

original: rab tu rtsol ba na zhes pa ni de ster bas so //
analyzed: rab tu rtsol ba na zhes pa ni de ster bas so //
translated: When one strives means when one bestows that.

original: don yod par grub pa'i rigs so zhes pa ni sgrol ma la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: don yod par grub pa'i rigs so zhes pa ni sgrol ma la sogs pa'o //
translated: The Amoghasiddhi family means Tārā and so forth.

original: des dag cing gtso bor byas pas na zhes pa ni mchod par bya ba ste /
analyzed: des dag cing gtso bor byas pas na zhes pa ni mchod par bya ba ste /
translated: Since they are purified and made primary, they are to be worshipped.

original: de rnams kyi bdag po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyi bdag po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the lords of those.

original: zhi ba la sogs pa'i las rnams kyi zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhi ba la sogs pa'i las rnams kyi zhes pa ni /
translated: With regard to the rites of pacification and so forth,

original: zhi ba dang rgyas pa dang / dbang dang / dgug pa dang / mngon spyod kyis te /
analyzed: zhi ba dang rgyas pa dang / dbang dang / dgug pa dang / mngon spyod kyis te /
translated: it is pacification, increase, power, summoning, and destruction.

original: las lngas so //
analyzed: las lngas so //
translated: It is with the five rites.

original: sgrub pa po'i 'gro ba rnams kyi zhes pa ni pha rol la phan pa la brtson pa sngags pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: sgrub pa po'i 'gro ba rnams kyi zhes pa ni pha rol la phan pa la brtson pa sngags pa rnams kyis so //
translated: With regard to the beings of the adepts, it is the mantra practitioners who strive to benefit others.

original: 'dod pa thams cad skyang pa zhes pa ni nad pa dang dbul po dang gdul dka' ba dang / mtshams med pa byed pa rnams la ji lta ba bzhin du zhi ba la sogs pa'i las mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa thams cad skyang pa zhes pa ni nad pa dang dbul po dang gdul dka' ba dang / mtshams med pa byed pa rnams la ji lta ba bzhin du zhi ba la sogs pa'i las mdzad pa ste /
translated: All desires are satisfied means that he performs the functions of pacifying, etc. in accordance with the sick, the poor, the unruly, and those who have committed the crimes with immediate retribution.

original: don yod grub pa ni las thams cad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don yod grub pa ni las thams cad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Amoghasiddhi is the one who performs all functions.

original: de las byung bas na zhes pa ni rim pa gsum pa dang lnga pa las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las byung bas na zhes pa ni rim pa gsum pa dang lnga pa las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it arises from that means that it arises from the third and fifth stages.

original: de lta bu zhes ba ni lnga'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de lta bu zhes ba ni lnga'i bdag nyid do //
translated: Such means the nature of the five.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes pa ni drug pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes pa ni drug pa'o //
translated: Vajrasattva is the sixth.

original: khyed la phyag 'tshal lo zhes pa ni khyed la lus la sogs pas 'dud de bstod pa nye bar sdud ces pa ni bstod pa'i mchod pa'o //
analyzed: khyed la phyag 'tshal lo zhes pa ni khyed la lus la sogs pas 'dud de bstod pa nye bar sdud ces pa ni bstod pa'i mchod pa'o //
translated: Homage to you means bowing with one's body, etc. The praise is summarized is the offering of praise.

original: dgongs pa ma yin pas bshad pa'o zhes pa ni shin tu gsal ba'i bdag nyid de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid can gyi de kho na nyid bstan pas so //
analyzed: dgongs pa ma yin pas bshad pa'o zhes pa ni shin tu gsal ba'i bdag nyid de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid can gyi de kho na nyid bstan pas so //
translated: The non-intentional explanation is the extremely clear nature, because it teaches the reality that is the nature of the five Tathagatas.

original: dus gsum zhes bya ba nas sgra ji bzhin pa'o zhes pa'i bar du ni tshigs su bcad pa lngas gang zhig rnal 'byor pa rdo rje 'chang la bstod pa ste yang de dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes phan yon bstan te ;
analyzed: dus gsum zhes bya ba nas sgra ji bzhin pa'o zhes pa'i bar du ni tshigs su bcad pa lngas gang zhig rnal 'byor pa rdo rje 'chang la bstod pa ste yang de dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes phan yon bstan te ;
translated: The five verses beginning with “the three times” and ending with “just as it is” teach the benefit of the praise, which is that one becomes just like Vajradhara.

original: bstod pa'i sgo las rdo rje 'chang gi de kho na nyid mngon du gyur pas so //
analyzed: bstod pa'i sgo las rdo rje 'chang gi de kho na nyid mngon du gyur pas so //
translated: The reality of Vajradhara is manifested through the door of praise.

original: sgra ji bzhin pa'o zhes pa ni rtog gi sgras phan yon bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin pa'o zhes pa ni rtog gi sgras phan yon bstan pa'o //
translated: “ Just as it is” is the benefit taught by the word “just as it is.”

original: dgyes nas mngon du phyogs pas bstan to zhes pa ni bstod pa'i tshig las byung ba'i dga' ba nyid do //
analyzed: dgyes nas mngon du phyogs pas bstan to zhes pa ni bstod pa'i tshig las byung ba'i dga' ba nyid do //
translated: “ Joyfully facing” is the joy that arises from the words of praise.

original: nyon mongs pa ni drug go //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni drug go //
translated: The afflictions are six.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ni nyi shu rtsa @125b bzhi'o //
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ni nyi shu rtsa @125b bzhi'o //
translated: The secondary afflictions are twenty-four.

original: de rnams dbye ba dgu bcu rtsa brgyad yin pas na thams cad do //
analyzed: de rnams dbye ba dgu bcu rtsa brgyad yin pas na thams cad do //
translated: Since they are divided into ninety-eight, they are all.

original: nye bar zhi bar mdzad pa na zhes pa ni de rnams mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i rim gyis spong bas so //
analyzed: nye bar zhi bar mdzad pa na zhes pa ni de rnams mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i rim gyis spong bas so //
translated: “ Pacifying” is their abandonment through the processes of seeing and cultivation.

original: yang na nyon mongs pa ni rnam gsum dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ni de las byung ba'i rang bzhin rnams so //
analyzed: yang na nyon mongs pa ni rnam gsum dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ni de las byung ba'i rang bzhin rnams so //
translated: Or else, the afflictions are the three kinds, and the secondary afflictions are those that arise from them.

original: de dag thams cad sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas 'od gsal par mdzad pas na bstan pas so //
analyzed: de dag thams cad sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas 'od gsal par mdzad pas na bstan pas so //
translated: All of them are illuminated by the process of mantra and seal, and so they are taught.

original: phung po lnga'i bdag nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin gyis phung po'i ngo bo'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: phung po lnga'i bdag nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin gyis phung po'i ngo bo'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The nature of the five aggregates is the nature of the self of the Tathāgata.

original: sems can thams cad ces pas ni 'gro ba rigs drug pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad ces pas ni 'gro ba rigs drug pa'o //
translated: All sentient beings refers to the six kinds of living beings.

original: ci rigs par zhes pa ni bsam pa dang bag la nyal ba dang khams dang bag chags kyis dbye bas so //
analyzed: ci rigs par zhes pa ni bsam pa dang bag la nyal ba dang khams dang bag chags kyis dbye bas so //
translated: As is appropriate refers to the distinctions of attitude, latent tendencies, and constituents.

original: mtho ris dang thar pa zhes pa ni bde 'gro dang mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: mtho ris dang thar pa zhes pa ni bde 'gro dang mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Heaven and liberation refers to happy rebirth and nirvāṇa.

original: thob par mdzad pas na zhes bya ba ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bstan pas rim pa ji lta ba bzhin ster bas so //
analyzed: thob par mdzad pas na zhes bya ba ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bstan pas rim pa ji lta ba bzhin ster bas so //
translated: Because they cause attainment refers to the teaching of the accumulations of merit and wisdom, which are given in sequence.

original: dam tshig bzhi'i zhes pa ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa le'u lnga pa las dgongs pas bshad pas so //
analyzed: dam tshig bzhi'i zhes pa ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa le'u lnga pa las dgongs pas bshad pas so //
translated: The four commitments are the commitments of killing and so on, as explained in the fifth chapter with an intended meaning.

original: gzhir gyur ba'o zhes pa ni rten du gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gzhir gyur ba'o zhes pa ni rten du gyur ba'o //
translated: The basis is the support.

original: rnyog pa med pa zhes pa ni kha na ma tho ba med pas te le'u lnga pa nas gsungs pa'i nges par ro //
analyzed: rnyog pa med pa zhes pa ni kha na ma tho ba med pas te le'u lnga pa nas gsungs pa'i nges par ro //
translated: The uncontaminated is the absence of evil, as taught in the fifth chapter.

original: ae ma ho zhes bya ba nas dgongs pa ma yin pas bshad pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i zhu ba rdo rje 'chang gis ngo mtshar bar dgongs so zhes bstan to //
analyzed: ae ma ho zhes bya ba nas dgongs pa ma yin pas bshad pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i zhu ba rdo rje 'chang gis ngo mtshar bar dgongs so zhes bstan to //
translated: The phrase Amazing! up to indirect explanation teaches that Vajradhara thinks it amazing that Akshobhya and so on have asked about the four commitments.

original: dgongs pa ma yin pa'o zhes pa ni dam tshig bzhi pa'i de kho na nyid bstan pas so //
analyzed: dgongs pa ma yin pa'o zhes pa ni dam tshig bzhi pa'i de kho na nyid bstan pas so //
translated: The indirect explanation is the teaching of the reality of the four commitments.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba nas 'di ni go sla'o zhes pa'i bar du ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la dgongs pas bshad pas srog gcod pa la sogs pa srung ba'i dam tshig bzhi dang bshad pa la sogs pa bza' ba'i dam tshig
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba nas 'di ni go sla'o zhes pa'i bar du ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la dgongs pas bshad pas srog gcod pa la sogs pa srung ba'i dam tshig bzhi dang bshad pa la sogs pa bza' ba'i dam tshig
translated: The passage beginning “Thus…” and ending “This is easy to understand” explains the four pledges to guard against taking life and so forth and the pledges to eat meat and so forth, which are taught in the Tantra of the Wheel of Time.🔽

original: lnga bstan te //
analyzed: lnga bstan te //
translated: The passage from “thus” up to “this is easy to understand” teaches the four commitments of protecting killing and so on and the five commitments of eating such as explaining the Dharma.

original: de rnams rgya che ba'i mos pa yin pas sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa drug gi dam tshig 'di yin no //
analyzed: de rnams rgya che ba'i mos pa yin pas sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa drug gi dam tshig 'di yin no //
translated: These are the extensive mode of interest, and so they are the commitments of the six yogins of Vajra Body and so on.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba nas sdom pa'o zhes pa'i bar du ni rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs can gyi sdom pa bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba nas sdom pa'o zhes pa'i bar du ni rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs can gyi sdom pa bstan to //
translated: The passage from “thus” up to “vow” teaches the vow of those of the pratyekabuddha lineage.

original: de la bstan pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la bstan pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Therein, the teaching is threefold:

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi'o //
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi'o //

translated: The teaching of speech is the characteristic of engaging in the teaching of Dharma.🔽The teaching of mind is the characteristic of the power of concentration.

original: gzhan gyi don mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: These three teachings exist because they act for the benefit of others.

original: rang sangs rgyas la sku'i bstan pa yod de /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas la sku'i bstan pa yod de /
translated: The teaching of body exists for pratyekabuddhas

analyzed: cho 'phrul la sogs pa bstan pas 'gro ba'i don mdzad pas so //
translated: because they act for the benefit of migrating beings by displaying miracles and so on.

analyzed: ngag gi bstan pa ni med de ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pas gsung mi 'byung bas so //

analyzed: ba gang yin pa de ni lus kyis mdzad de skyon gang yang med do //

analyzed: dkyil 'khor la 'jug pa'i dus su mi dge ba bcu bzlog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dam tshig sbyin par bya ste /
translated: At the time of entering the mandala, one should give the vow whose characteristic is the reversal of the ten non-virtues.

analyzed: gang gis de rnams rang gi lam dang mthun pa'i slob ma thos pas 'jug cing phyi nas bsgom pa'i lam la brten te 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: By that, the disciples who are suitable for one's own path will enter by means of hearing, and later, by means of the path of meditation, they will be perfected.

translated: Brahma up to will become the very essence of Vajra Body teaches that for the adepts who are devoted to the view of Brahma, after the mandala entry, the three baths and the three changes of clothes, and the burnt offerings, the vow whose characteristic is the fatigue of the body, such as the fasting vow, and so on, are taught.

original: ngag gi lam dang rjes su mthun pa'i brtul zhugs thos pas 'jug cing phyin nas bsgom pa'i lam la bstan to //
analyzed: ngag gi lam dang rjes su mthun pa'i brtul zhugs thos pas 'jug cing phyin nas bsgom pa'i lam la bstan to //
translated: The observances that are suitable for the path of speech are entered by means of hearing, and later, by means of the path of meditation, they are taught.

original: rim gyis sku rdo rje dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rim gyis sku rdo rje dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: One will gradually become like Vajra Body.

original: dbang phyug chen po zhes bya ba nas 'di ni go sla'o zhes pa'i bar du ni gsung rdo rje'i rang bzhin gyis drag po'i gzugs blangs la khams gsum pa thams cad lcags kyu dang zhags pa la sogs pa'i sbyor bas dgug cing dbang du bya'o //

translated: From the great lord up to this is easy to understand means that having taken up the form of Rudra by the nature of the vajra of speech, one should summon and control all the three realms by the method of the hook, the lasso, and so forth.

original: de ni gsung rdo rje dang 'dra bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ni gsung rdo rje dang 'dra bar 'gyur te /
translated: One becomes like the vajra of speech.

analyzed: 'jig rten dang rang gi bdag nyid kyang mi snang bar bya'o //
translated: the world of one's own self disappear by the meditative stabilization of total retention and subsequent destruction as previously explained.

original: des na thugs rdo rje dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na thugs rdo rje dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By that, one becomes like the vajra of mind.

translated: Thus, up to “Brahma, etc.”, the result characterized by the attainment of the vajra body, etc. is taught by the accomplishment of the commitments of Brahma, etc.

analyzed: gti mug gi rang bzhin yin pas na / tshangs pa ni sku'i rdo rje dang / 'dod chags kyi rang bzhin yin pas na //
translated: Since he is of the nature of delusion,🔽Brahma is the vajra body;🔽since he is of the nature of passion, Mahesvara is the vajra speech;

original: dbang phyug chen po ni gsung gi rdo rje dang // zhe sdang gi rang bzhin yin pas na khyab 'jug ni thugs rje nyid de /
analyzed: dbang phyug chen po ni gsung gi rdo rje dang // zhe sdang gi rang bzhin yin pas na khyab 'jug ni thugs rje nyid de /
translated: and since he is of the nature of hatred, Visnu is the vajra mind,

original: de'i sprul ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i sprul ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is an emanation of that.

analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba'i bar du ni dpal 'byung po 'dul ba'i rgyud kyi rim pas /
translated: Thus, up to “etc.”, by the sequence of the Sri-Bhutudama Tantra,

original: rdo rje h'um mdzad pa la sogs pa'i gzugs blangs te klu'i mtsho la sogs pa'i 'gram du 'dug nas sngon gyi bsnyen pa sngon du 'gro bar 'o ma la sogs pa'i lha bshos dbul te /

translated: having taken on the form of Vajra Humkara, etc., and sitting on the bank of the Naga lake, etc., having previously performed the service, one should offer the oblations of milk, etc.

original: sngags brjod cing klu'i mtsho las 'jog bo la sogs pa'i klu'i rgyal po'i bu mo gzugs bzang la sogs pa bkug nas de dang lhan cig tu tshig phra mo la sogs pas spyod par bya'o zhes bstan te /

translated: Having summoned the daughters of the naga kings, such as Subhadra, etc., by reciting the mantra and placing them in the naga lake, etc., one should enjoy them together with them by means of soft words, etc.

original: de rnams la de gtso bo yin pas phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams la de gtso bo yin pas phyir ro //
translated: Since those are the main [means], it is said.

analyzed: gzhan du na rang dbang du mi 'gyur zhes pa ni zhi ba'i tshig gis dbang du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: gang lha ma yin zhes bya ba nas gsungs so zhes pa'i bar du ni rdo rje sa 'og gi rgyud las gsungs pa'i cho gas kha che'i yul la sogs pa'i sa phug gi sgo phye nas bza' dang skar ma'i sbyor bas lha ma yin gyi bu mo 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: As for the asura, etc., up to it is said, by the method taught in the Vajra Underground Tantra, having opened the door of the earth cave in Kashmir, etc., by the combination of the nakṣatra and the bāṣpa, the asura daughters will appear.

analyzed: gal te longs spyod 'dod pa yin na de'i tshe 'jug par bya'o //

analyzed: de nas rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i rim po che'i rang bzhin rgyan @127a * //

translated: The passage from “rākṣasīs” up to “in order to accomplish the purpose” refers to the rākṣasīs such as Karāla, who live on the islands in the ocean, and so on, and to the rākṣasīs such as Hārītī, who are the consorts of the noble Yama, and so on.

analyzed: khro bo'i rgyal po bsgoms pas dgug la /

analyzed: mi rus kyi phye mas spos gtul ba dang / til mar rang rkang dag gis mar me byin nas /

analyzed: khrag gi aargha dang zhabs bsil phul bas mgu bar byas te /

analyzed: spyi bor bkod pa'i sna tshogs rdo rje la sogs pa bsgoms pas mi g-yo bar byas te /

analyzed: de yang rdo rjes 'og dang rdo rje mkha' 'gro dang 'byung po 'dul ba'i rgyud las gsungs te /

translated: The statement the vajra dakini and so forth up to the pledge means the vajra dakini Gaurī and so forth, stated in the glorious Tantra of All Tathāgatas Assembled: The Supreme King of Tantras of Means of Achievement, Secret and Most Secret, Called the Great Buddha.

original: dpal he ru ka'i gzugs kyi bdag nyid kyis bkug la bdud rtsi lnga dang lcags kyu lnga byin nas de rnams dang bdag nyid tshim zhing de dang lhan cig tu snyoms par zhugs par byed pas spros pa med pa'i spyod pas ji srid phyag rgya chen po'i dngos

translated: The passage from “in that way” up to “that is also called that” indicates that just as the Bhagavān Mahāvajradhara was established from the beginning, in the same way, his emanation Brahmā and so on are the lords of the three realms.🔽

translated: Therefore, the tantra of the Web of Magic says, “In the outer iron fence of the circle of the emanation of the Lord, one should place Indra and all the guardians of the directions,

translated: The passage from “Now” up to “he spoke thus” explains that the yogin of the stage of completion should know that the three physical actions such as killing, the four verbal actions such as lying, and the three mental actions such as covetousness

translated: Whoever has conceptual thought will go to the lower realms by engaging in the paths of nonvirtuous action, and by the opposite, to the higher realms.

analyzed: gal te byed na de'i tshe mi 'gal lo //

analyzed: smras pa / don dam pa'i bden pa la mos pa'i rnal 'byor pas dge @128b ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa thams cad 'di / de kho na nyid du yang dag par mthong ba yin gyi kun rdzob tu ni ma yin no // de bas na de kho na nyid mthong ba nyid de'i dam tshig yin gyi byed pa'am mi byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is said: The yogi/nī who is intent on the ultimate truth sees all things, such as virtue and nonvirtue, as🔽thatness, but not as conventional.🔽Therefore, the commitment of that one who sees thatness is just that, and not that he should do or not do anything.

original: de kho na nyid mthong ba nyid ni dam tshig ste mi 'da' ba'i phyir zhes skyon ni cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: de kho na nyid mthong ba nyid ni dam tshig ste mi 'da' ba'i phyir zhes skyon ni cung zad kyang med do //
translated: That very seeing of thatness is the commitment, because it is not transgressed. Thus there is not the slightest fault.

original: da ni zhes bya ba nas 'dod pa'i dngos grub nyams par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i bar du ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa dang po sbyor ba la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum la gnas pas phyi'i shing dang rdo dang 'bag gi sku la sogs pa
analyzed: da ni zhes bya ba nas 'dod pa'i dngos grub nyams par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i bar du ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa dang po sbyor ba la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum la gnas pas phyi'i shing dang rdo dang 'bag gi sku la sogs pa
translated: Now, from “If one does not do this” up to “the desired spiritual powers will be lost” is for the yogi of the creation stage who abides in the three meditative absorptions of the first union and so on.🔽

original: la phyag mi bya ste /
analyzed: la phyag mi bya ste /
translated: Now, from “one should not bow down” up to “one will lose the desired powers” is for the yogī of the creation stage who is abiding in the three meditative stabilizations, such as the first union and so forth, not bowing down to external images such as wood, stone, and clay.

original: gal te phyag byed na de'i tshe de'i g-yeng ba'i sems kyis ting nge 'dzin nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te phyag byed na de'i tshe de'i g-yeng ba'i sems kyis ting nge 'dzin nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one bows down, then at that time, due to the distracted mind, meditative stabilization will be lost.

original: gang gi tshe dkyil 'khor dri ba dang mchod pa dang rab tu gnas pa 'byung na de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe dkyil 'khor dri ba dang mchod pa dang rab tu gnas pa 'byung na de'i tshe /
translated: When the maṇḍala is drawn, worshipped, and consecrated, then at that time,

original: yid ni ting nge 'dzin la bzhag na lus dang ngag gis phyag dang bstod pa byed na skyon med de /
analyzed: yid ni ting nge 'dzin la bzhag na lus dang ngag gis phyag dang bstod pa byed na skyon med de /
translated: if one places the mind in meditative stabilization and bows down and praises with body and speech, there is no fault,

original: sems mnyam par gzhag pa dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: sems mnyam par gzhag pa dang ldan pas so //
translated: because it is endowed with equipoised mind.

original: gal te lus dang ngag dang yid kyis phyag byed na de'i tshe ting nge 'dzin nyams pas g-yeng bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te lus dang ngag dang yid kyis phyag byed na de'i tshe ting nge 'dzin nyams pas g-yeng bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one bows down with body, speech, and mind, then at that time, due to the loss of meditative stabilization, there will be distraction.

original: de'i tshe phyag ste tshangs par 'gyur ba yang 'bras bu dang bcas par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe phyag ste tshangs par 'gyur ba yang 'bras bu dang bcas par mi 'gyur te /
translated: At that time, the worship, i.e., the Brahma, would not have a fruit,

original: ting nge 'dzin dang bral bas so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang bral bas so //
translated: because of being separated from samadhi.

original: bya ba thams cad kyi rtsa ba ni sems yin pas gal te g-yeng na thams cad don med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bya ba thams cad kyi rtsa ba ni sems yin pas gal te g-yeng na thams cad don med par 'gyur te /
translated: Since the mind is the root of all actions, if it is distracted, everything becomes meaningless.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: bzlas pa dang ni dka' thub kun //
analyzed: bzlas pa dang ni dka' thub kun //
translated: All recitations and austerities

original: yun ring du byis pas kun //
analyzed: yun ring du byis pas kun //
translated: are long performed by the childish.

original: gzhan gyi sems kyis de byas na /🔽de nyid rigs pas don med gsungs //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems kyis de byas na / de nyid rigs pas don med gsungs //

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: that is meaningless, it is said by the reasoning of reality.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa la gnas pa //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa la gnas pa //

translated: The yogin of the completion stage takes the gnosis body by the stage of self-consecration, and that also is thought of as inseparable from the three secrets of the body vajra.

analyzed: te / 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis nyin mo dang / mtshan mor 'khrul 'khor bzhin du rdo rje bzlas pa'o //

translated: And that very [vajra repetition] is the attainment of union by the stages of the purification of mind and so on, and all beings, divided into ordinary beings and āryas, should be seen as having the nature of Vajradhara, the indivisibility of the three vajras.

original: chen po'i rang bzhin du blta bar bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: chen po'i rang bzhin du blta bar bya'o zhes bstan to //

original: ; phyag rgya legs par sbyar ba byas nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'jug pa sngon du 'gro ba /
analyzed: ; phyag rgya legs par sbyar ba byas nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'jug pa sngon du 'gro ba /
translated: Having performed the seal-impression well, one should emanate the offering goddesses, and worship the mandala, preceded by the entry of all the Ones-Gone-Thus.

original: mchod pa'i lha mo spro zhing dkyil 'khor mchod par bya'o zhes dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog gi ting nge 'dzin to /
analyzed: mchod pa'i lha mo spro zhing dkyil 'khor mchod par bya'o zhes dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog gi ting nge 'dzin to /
translated: This is the concentration of the Victorious Supreme Mandala.

original: phra mo'i rnal 'byor dang bzlas pa 'od du zhu ba dang / bskul ba dang de las langs par byas nas de bzhin gshegs pa lngas bstod pa'i mchod pa dang / mthar yang mchod pa'i cho ga zhes bya ste las kyi rgyal ba mchog gi ting nge 'dzin zhes bstan to //
analyzed: phra mo'i rnal 'byor dang bzlas pa 'od du zhu ba dang / bskul ba dang de las langs par byas nas de bzhin gshegs pa lngas bstod pa'i mchod pa dang / mthar yang mchod pa'i cho ga zhes bya ste las kyi rgyal ba mchog gi ting nge 'dzin zhes bstan to //
translated: Having performed the subtle yoga, the recitation, the melting through light, the urging, and rising from that, the offering of praise by the five Ones-Gone-Thus, and finally the offering rite, this is called the concentration of the Victorious Supreme Action.🔽Thus, up to the pledge.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba nas dam tshig go zhes pa'i bar du ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pas sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pas stong pa bzhi bsgoms te /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba nas dam tshig go zhes pa'i bar du ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pas sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pas stong pa bzhi bsgoms te /
translated: A yoga practitioner of the stage of completion meditates the four emptinesses through the process of purifying the mind.

original: 'od gsal ba sngon du byas nas yang cig car ram snang ba nye bar thob pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis ye shes kyi sku blangs la /
analyzed: 'od gsal ba sngon du byas nas yang cig car ram snang ba nye bar thob pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis ye shes kyi sku blangs la /
translated: Having first made the clear light, one again takes the exalted wisdom body either instantaneously or by the process of attaining the radiant light and so forth.

original: 'jug pa dang ldang ba ni mngon par byang chub pa'i rim @129b pas ye shes kyi sku sbyangs la /
analyzed: 'jug pa dang ldang ba ni mngon par byang chub pa'i rim @129b pas ye shes kyi sku sbyangs la /
translated: The entering and rising are the process of manifest enlightenment, and one purifies the exalted wisdom body.🔽For the sake of working for the benefit of all sentient beings, one should take the vajra body by rising through the concentration of union.🔽This is the pledge of pleasing all tathagatas, because it is the domain of the complete enjoyment body.🔽The pledge of the complete enjoyment body is taught in the lines beginning:

original: sems can thams cad kyi don bya ba'i phyir zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis ldang ba ni rdo rje'i sku blang bar bya'o zhes de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mnyes par byed pa'i dam tshig yin te rdzogs pa'i spyod yul yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan🔽to ; ; de kho na nyid rtogs pa la //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don bya ba'i phyir zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis ldang ba ni rdo rje'i sku blang bar bya'o zhes de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mnyes par byed pa'i dam tshig yin te rdzogs pa'i spyod yul yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan🔽to ; ; de kho na nyid rtogs pa la //
translated: The pledge of the complete enjoyment body is🔽to always enjoy the five nectars.

original: zhes bya ba nas mnyam par gzhag par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de kho na nyid thob pa'i rnal 'byor pas gang gi tshe rgyun ma chad par sems can gyi don bya bar 'dod na de'i tshe yun ring du lus gnas pa'i phyir rang gi spyi
analyzed: zhes bya ba nas mnyam par gzhag par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de kho na nyid thob pa'i rnal 'byor pas gang gi tshe rgyun ma chad par sems can gyi don bya bar 'dod na de'i tshe yun ring du lus gnas pa'i phyir rang gi spyi
translated: From “thus” up to “becomes equipoised” is the yoga of one who has attained reality. When one wishes to perform the benefit of sentient beings without interruption, then, in order to remain in the body for a long time, one should visualize the moon mandala at one’s crown.

original: bor cha bcu drug yongs su gyur pa las /
analyzed: bor cha bcu drug yongs su gyur pa las /
translated: From the complete transformation of the sixteen parts,

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor bdud rtsi 'dzag pa bsgoms la de nyid gyen du bzlog pa'i lces dgug cing lus thams cad tshim par bya'o //
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor bdud rtsi 'dzag pa bsgoms la de nyid gyen du bzlog pa'i lces dgug cing lus thams cad tshim par bya'o //
translated: one should visualize the moon mandala dripping nectar, and with the tongue turned upward, one should draw it up and satisfy the entire body.

original: de'i tshe rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan las byung ba'i nad 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de'i tshe rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan las byung ba'i nad 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: At that time, diseases arising from wind, bile, and phlegm will not occur.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i lung tshad ma nyid du bstan to //🔽gang zhig bdud rtsi'i rang bzhin rgyun //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i lung tshad ma nyid du bstan to // gang zhig bdud rtsi'i rang bzhin rgyun //
translated: The Bhagavān has taught the validity of the scriptures beginning with “Bhagavān.”🔽“That which is the stream of the nature of nectar”

original: zhes pa ni bdud rtsi 'dzag pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi rnam pa can no //
analyzed: zhes pa ni bdud rtsi 'dzag pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi rnam pa can no //
translated: refers to the form of the moon mandala dripping nectar.

original: spyi bor rtag tu nges 'bab pa //
analyzed: spyi bor rtag tu nges 'bab pa //
translated: It always flows down into the head.

original: zhes pa ni tshangs pa'i sgor gnas shing bdud rtsi'i dba' rlabs 'dzag par byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni tshangs pa'i sgor gnas shing bdud rtsi'i dba' rlabs 'dzag par byed pa'o //
translated: This is the opening of Brahmā, which causes the waves of nectar to flow.

original: rnal 'byor dbang pos de 'thungs na //
analyzed: rnal 'byor dbang pos de 'thungs na //
translated: The lord of yogins drinks that.

original: zhes pa ni 'dus pa'i rnal 'byor bas rgod ma byed pa'i sbyor bas myang bar byas nas so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'dus pa'i rnal 'byor bas rgod ma byed pa'i sbyor bas myang bar byas nas so //
translated: The practitioner of the union drinks it by the practice of the cow, and🔽destroys old age and death.

original: rga dang 'chi ba rnam par 'jig / ces bya ba ni yun ring du gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rga dang 'chi ba rnam par 'jig / ces bya ba ni yun ring du gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that one will live for a long time.

original: dpe bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dpe bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the example, it says:🔽Just as a lotus stalk

original: ji ltar padma'i sdong bu la //
analyzed: ji ltar padma'i sdong bu la //
translated: grows🔽from the water

original: zhes smos te /
analyzed: zhes smos te /
translated: and is not tainted by it,🔽so the one born from the water🔽is not tainted by the water.

original: padma'i sdong bu ni mtsho skyes kyi rtsa ba'o //
analyzed: padma'i sdong bu ni mtsho skyes kyi rtsa ba'o //
translated: The lotus stalk is the root of the lake-born.

original: mi yi chu ni 'dren par byed //
analyzed: mi yi chu ni 'dren par byed //
translated: The man draws up the water.

original: ces pa ni skyes bu kha cig gis chu 'thung bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: ces pa ni skyes bu kha cig gis chu 'thung bar byed pa ste /
translated: This means that a certain man drinks the water.🔽The outside of the hollow inside

original: nang khong stong yin pa'i phyi ro //
analyzed: nang khong stong yin pa'i phyi ro //
translated: is the outside.

original: de bzhin ni de lta bu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin ni de lta bu'o //
translated: So is that.

original: nye bar 'thungs pa zhes bya ba ni spyi bo la gnas pa'i bdud rtsi'i dba' rlabs dgug par byed pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar 'thungs pa zhes bya ba ni spyi bo la gnas pa'i bdud rtsi'i dba' rlabs dgug par byed pa'o //
translated: The phrase having drunk means to summon the waves of nectar that are located in the head.

original: rnal 'byor ba ni sgrub pa pos so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba ni sgrub pa pos so //
translated: The yogin is the adept.

original: stobs chen 'tsho zhes pa ni yun ring 'tsho ba dang rga ba dang 'chi ba dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stobs chen 'tsho zhes pa ni yun ring 'tsho ba dang rga ba dang 'chi ba dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The phrase lives a long life means that one lives a long time, free from old age and death.

original: rtsa ba'i rgyud las zhes pa ni dpal de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i rgyud las so //🔽rnal 'byor @130a * //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rgyud las zhes pa ni dpal de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i rgyud las so // rnal 'byor @130a * //
translated: The phrase in the root tantra means in the glorious Tattvasamgraha Tantra.

original: rgyud thams cad kyi dpal de kho na nyid bsdus pa ni rtsa ba yin no //🔽lce ni rkan la sbyar bya zhing //
analyzed: rgyud thams cad kyi dpal de kho na nyid bsdus pa ni rtsa ba yin no // lce ni rkan la sbyar bya zhing //
translated: The phrase the glorious Tattvasamgraha of all yoga tantras means that it is the root.

original: zhes pa ni rkan gyi phyogs su bzlog nas lces reg par byas nas so //🔽sna'i rtse mor bsam par bya //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rkan gyi phyogs su bzlog nas lces reg par byas nas so // sna'i rtse mor bsam par bya //
translated: The phrase the tongue should be placed on the palate means that one should touch the palate with the tongue, turning it toward the palate.

original: zhes pa ni sna'i rtse mor lta bar dgong bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sna'i rtse mor lta bar dgong bar bya'o //
translated: The phrase at the tip of the nose means that one should focus one's gaze at the tip of the nose.

original: de nas rdo rje phra mo ni lce la dgod par nas kyi 'bru'i tshad tsam gyi rdo rje'o //
analyzed: de nas rdo rje phra mo ni lce la dgod par nas kyi 'bru'i tshad tsam gyi rdo rje'o //
translated: Then, the subtle vajra is a vajra the size of a barley grain that is placed on the tongue.

original: des bde ba ni bde ba'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: des bde ba ni bde ba'i rgyu ste /
translated: The phrase the cause of bliss means the cause of bliss.🔽 The phrase the cause of the supreme means the cause of the supreme.

original: bdud rtsi reg pa'i myang bas rnal 'byor pa ni sgrub pa po'i sems mnyam par gzhag par 'gyur ba'i rtse gcig ba'am /
analyzed: bdud rtsi reg pa'i myang bas rnal 'byor pa ni sgrub pa po'i sems mnyam par gzhag par 'gyur ba'i rtse gcig ba'am /
translated: The yogi, the adept, by the experience of the taste of nectar, will have his mind concentrated, one-pointed,

original: tshim par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshim par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: or satisfied.🔽Thus, etc.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba nas de skad ces bka' stsol to zhes pa'i bar du mi las dang po ba rnam par snang mdzad kyi slob pa pos bza' ba dang bca' ba la sogs pa spyod pa'i dus su sku rdo rje bdag nyid bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba nas de skad ces bka' stsol to zhes pa'i bar du mi las dang po ba rnam par snang mdzad kyi slob pa pos bza' ba dang bca' ba la sogs pa spyod pa'i dus su sku rdo rje bdag nyid bsgom par bya ste /
translated: The beginner, the student of Vairocana, should meditate on the nature of Body-vajra at the time of enjoying food, drink, etc.

original: bza' ba la sogs pa ni gzugs kyi rang bzhin dang sku tshim par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bza' ba la sogs pa ni gzugs kyi rang bzhin dang sku tshim par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because food, etc. are the nature of form and satisfy the body.

original: de bzhin du bza' ba dang bca' ba la sogs pa'i yul nas gzhan dga' ba'i cho ga dang mchod pa la sogs pa'i cho ga'i dus su bdag nyid thugs rdo rje 'chang bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du bza' ba dang bca' ba la sogs pa'i yul nas gzhan dga' ba'i cho ga dang mchod pa la sogs pa'i cho ga'i dus su bdag nyid thugs rdo rje 'chang bsgom par bya ste /
translated: Similarly, he should meditate on the nature of Mind-vajra at the time of enjoying other objects such as food, drink, etc., and at the time of the rite of love and the rite of worship, etc.

original: dga' ba la sogs pa'i spyod pas ni sems mgu bar byed pas so //
analyzed: dga' ba la sogs pa'i spyod pas ni sems mgu bar byed pas so //
translated: Because the conduct of love, etc. satisfies the mind.

original: de bzhin du gsung rab yan lag dgu'i mdo sde la sogs pa klog pa'i dus su bdag nyid gsung rdo rjer bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du gsung rab yan lag dgu'i mdo sde la sogs pa klog pa'i dus su bdag nyid gsung rdo rjer bsgom par bya ste /
translated: Likewise, when reading the scriptures, the nine branches of scripture, the sutra collection, and so forth, one should meditate on oneself as Speech Vajra,

original: gsung rdo rje 'od dpag tu med pa gsung gi rang bzhin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsung rdo rje 'od dpag tu med pa gsung gi rang bzhin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because Speech Vajra is Amitabha, the nature of speech.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis dag pa zhes pa ni thams cad kyi stong pa'i rang bzhin yin pas so //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis dag pa zhes pa ni thams cad kyi stong pa'i rang bzhin yin pas so //
translated: The phrase pure by nature means that all things are by nature empty.

original: rdo rje ni mi phyed pa'i ngo bo yin pa ste /🔽ngo bo nyid dag pa'i rdo rje ste /
analyzed: rdo rje ni mi phyed pa'i ngo bo yin pa ste / ngo bo nyid dag pa'i rdo rje ste /
translated: A vajra is an indivisible entity.🔽 The vajra of pure nature is the great Vajradhara.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen pos 'di skad ces bka' stsal to zhes sdud pa po'i tshig go //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen pos 'di skad ces bka' stsal to zhes sdud pa po'i tshig go //
translated: The phrase thus have I heard is the statement of the compiler.

original: gang 'das pa zhes bya ba nas don to zhes pa'i bar du ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen pos rgyud ma lus pa don dang gzhung gis ston te /
analyzed: gang 'das pa zhes bya ba nas don to zhes pa'i bar du ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen pos rgyud ma lus pa don dang gzhung gis ston te /
translated: The phrase whatever was taught by the Bhagavat up to the meaning indicates that the Bhagavat, the great Vajradhara, teaches the meaning and the words of the entire tantra.

original: 'phags pa dang so so skye bo rnams kyi sems ni 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin mnyam pa nyid kyi ngo bo yin no zhes dgongs nas de nyid la 'jug ste mi gsung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa dang so so skye bo rnams kyi sems ni 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin mnyam pa nyid kyi ngo bo yin no zhes dgongs nas de nyid la 'jug ste mi gsung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: With this in mind, he entered into that state and remained silent.
