original: 'khor na bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis //
analyzed: 'khor na bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis //
translated: The tathāgatas who were present in the retinue

original: don de nyid byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa la @130b gsungs so zhes bstan to //
analyzed: don de nyid byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa la @130b gsungs so zhes bstan to //
translated: taught that very meaning to the bodhisattvas and so forth.

original: don de nyid ces bya ba nas 'di dag go zhes ba'i bar du ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis rdo rje 'chang chen po mi smra bas 'khrul par gyur pa /
analyzed: don de nyid ces bya ba nas 'di dag go zhes ba'i bar du ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis rdo rje 'chang chen po mi smra bas 'khrul par gyur pa /
translated: The phrase “that very meaning” up to “these” indicates that the tathāgatas, seeing that Vajradhara was confused by his silence,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la lus la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni 'das pa la sogs pa'i dus su mi dmigs pa nam mkha'i rang bzhin de bzhin nyid dang 'dra ba yin na yang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la lus la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni 'das pa la sogs pa'i dus su mi dmigs pa nam mkha'i rang bzhin de bzhin nyid dang 'dra ba yin na yang /
translated: taught the bodhisattvas that whatever the body and so forth are, they are the same as suchness, the nature of space, which is not observed in the past and so forth.

original: sems can gyi don bya ba'i phyir sgyu ma'i dpe bcu gnyis kyi sgo nas 'od gsal ba las cig car du spro ba'i ye shes kyi sku la dmigs nas gnas par bya'o zhes the tshom bsal to zhes bstan to //
analyzed: sems can gyi don bya ba'i phyir sgyu ma'i dpe bcu gnyis kyi sgo nas 'od gsal ba las cig car du spro ba'i ye shes kyi sku la dmigs nas gnas par bya'o zhes the tshom bsal to zhes bstan to //
translated: In order to benefit sentient beings, one should abide in the gnosis body, which is instantaneously emanated from clear light by way of the twelve examples of illusion, and one should eliminate doubts.

original: rnal 'byor thams cad ces pa ni rim pa gnyis kyi rnal 'byor dang ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa bcom pas na bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor thams cad ces pa ni rim pa gnyis kyi rnal 'byor dang ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa bcom pas na bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: The one who is called the Bhagavān is the one who has conquered the afflictions by possessing the yoga of the two stages.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes pa ni sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes thob ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes pa ni sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes thob ba'o //
translated: The one who is called Vajrasattva is the one who has attained unobstructed gnosis.

original: de bzhin nyid la gshegs pa'am de las kyang gshegs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la gshegs pa'am de las kyang gshegs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: The one who is called tathāgata is the one who has gone to suchness or who has gone from suchness.

original: de ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: de ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: That is the Bhagavān Vajrasattva.

original: nye bar longs spyod zhes pa la rang dbang du gyur pas te rang la rag lus pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar longs spyod zhes pa la rang dbang du gyur pas te rang la rag lus pa'o //
translated: The one who is called fully enjoying is the one who has become independent, who is self-sufficient.

original: khams gsum ma lus pa ni 'jig rten gsum mo //
analyzed: khams gsum ma lus pa ni 'jig rten gsum mo //
translated: The one who is called the three worlds is the three realms.

original: des ni rdo je sems dpa' khyab pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: des ni rdo je sems dpa' khyab pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: That is the one who is taught to be the pervader, Vajrasattva.

original: log par gzung ba zhes bya ba nas phyin ci log tu ma rtogs shig ces pa'i bar du ni log par gzung ba'i tshig gi don rtogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis rdo rje 'chang chen pos 'od gsal ba'i de kho na
analyzed: log par gzung ba zhes bya ba nas phyin ci log tu ma rtogs shig ces pa'i bar du ni log par gzung ba'i tshig gi don rtogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis rdo rje 'chang chen pos 'od gsal ba'i de kho na
translated: The passage from “wrongly apprehending” up to “do not wrongly understand” is the Tathāgatas’ and Vajradhara’s teaching to bodhisattvas who have wrongly understood the meaning of the words that the reality of clear light is not the emptiness of the ultimate truth.🔽

original: nyid la 'jug pa dang / de las sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pas ldang bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: nyid la 'jug pa dang / de las sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pas ldang bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: The passage from “misapprehension” up to “do not understand it wrongly” teaches that the Tathāgatas, the Great Vajradharas, enter into the reality of clear light in the bodhisattvas who have understood the meaning of the words of misapprehension, and that they arise from that by the process of the purification of mind.

original: de bas na kyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams log par ma bzung shig ces bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na kyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams log par ma bzung shig ces bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it teaches that the bodhisattvas should not misapprehend.

original: gang bshad ma thag pa zhes bya ba nas sbyar ro zhes pa'i bar du ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen pos rim pa gnyis pa dang bzhi ba dag gi 'od gsal ba khong du chud pa'i mtshan nyid kyi zab pa nyid dang / rim pa gsum pa dang lnga pa dag gis ye shes kyi sku dang rdo rje'i sku rgya che ba gzung ba gang yin pa de ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa bden pa gnyis kyi mtshan nyid dbye bas chos thams cad mngon par shes pa thob pa dang🔽sku'i dbang phyug la sogs pa dang ldan @131a * //
analyzed: gang bshad ma thag pa zhes bya ba nas sbyar ro zhes pa'i bar du ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen pos rim pa gnyis pa dang bzhi ba dag gi 'od gsal ba khong du chud pa'i mtshan nyid kyi zab pa nyid dang / rim pa gsum pa dang lnga pa dag gis ye shes kyi sku dang rdo rje'i sku rgya che ba gzung ba gang yin pa de ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa bden pa gnyis kyi mtshan nyid dbye bas chos thams cad mngon par shes pa thob pa dang sku'i dbang phyug la sogs pa dang ldan @131a * //
translated: The division of those two is the knowledge of all phenomena.🔽The dharmatā of Vajrasattva is not known by Brahmā and so on, who possess lordship over the body and so on,

original: pa'i tshangs pa la sogs pas mi shes te rdo rje sems dpa'i chos nyid ni shin tu zab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i tshangs pa la sogs pas mi shes te rdo rje sems dpa'i chos nyid ni shin tu zab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is extremely profound.

original: de bas na rdo rje sems dpa'i chos nyid mi rtogs pa'am rtogs nas rdo rje 'chang 'dis zab pa'i chos ston te zhes the tshom dang ldan pa de rnams kyis the tshom bsal ba dang bdag nyid kyi dbye ba sngon du bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na rdo rje sems dpa'i chos nyid mi rtogs pa'am rtogs nas rdo rje 'chang 'dis zab pa'i chos ston te zhes the tshom dang ldan pa de rnams kyis the tshom bsal ba dang bdag nyid kyi dbye ba sngon du bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, those who have doubts, thinking that Vajrasattva's reality is not realized, or that this Vajradhara teaches the profound Dharma after realizing it, in order to remove their doubts and to make a distinction between themselves,

original: bcom ldan 'das 'od gsal ba la zhugs nas ldang ba bstan to zhes de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis byang chub sems dpa' la lan btab po //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'od gsal ba la zhugs nas ldang ba bstan to zhes de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis byang chub sems dpa' la lan btab po //
translated: the Tathagatas reply to the Bodhisattva, The Blessed One, having entered into clear light, demonstrates rising.

original: des shin tu zab pa de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin rdo rje 'chang yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: des shin tu zab pa de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin rdo rje 'chang yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: That teaches that Vajradhara has the nature of reality, which is extremely profound.🔽Then, from Then up to should be applied, the Tathagatas Akshobhya and so forth say this to the Bodhisattvas Maitreya and so forth:

original: de nas zhes bya ba nas sbyar ro zhes pa'i bar du ni yang me bskyod pa la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis byams pa la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //🔽dgongs pas bshad pas /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba nas sbyar ro zhes pa'i bar du ni yang me bskyod pa la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis byams pa la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //🔽dgongs pas bshad pas /
translated: The Tathagatas have taught the Dharma with an intention.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni tshangs pa la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi lta rnams so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni tshangs pa la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi lta rnams so //
translated: The bodhisattvas are the worldly views such as Brahma.

original: de rnams kyis ji ltar shin tu zab pa'i rdo rje 'chang gi de kho na nyid ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de rnams kyis ji ltar shin tu zab pa'i rdo rje 'chang gi de kho na nyid ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: How could they understand the suchness of Vajradhara, which is very profound?

original: ji srid bdag cag kyang ye shes lnga mngon du byed pas mi shes te /
analyzed: ji srid bdag cag kyang ye shes lnga mngon du byed pas mi shes te /
translated: As long as we do not actualize the five wisdoms, we do not know.

original: rtog pa thams cad kyi ngo bo las zhes pa ni thams cad stong pa'i ngo bo yin pas so //
analyzed: rtog pa thams cad kyi ngo bo las zhes pa ni thams cad stong pa'i ngo bo yin pas so //
translated: The nature of all concepts is the nature of emptiness.

original: dgongs pa 'di yin te /
analyzed: dgongs pa 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is as follows.

original: ji srid shes pa dang shes bya'i rtog pa yod pa de srid de kho na nyid ga las rtogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji srid shes pa dang shes bya'i rtog pa yod pa de srid de kho na nyid ga las rtogs par 'gyur /
translated: As long as there are concepts of consciousness and objects of consciousness, how could suchness be realized?

original: bag chags kyi dri ma thams cad dang bral bas 'ba' zhig dri ma med pa'i nam mkha' dang 'dra ba de kho na nyid ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: bag chags kyi dri ma thams cad dang bral bas 'ba' zhig dri ma med pa'i nam mkha' dang 'dra ba de kho na nyid ces bya ba ste /
translated: Free from all stains of traces, it is like stainless space alone, called “suchness.”

original: ji srid sgom pa'i sbyor ba ldan //
analyzed: ji srid sgom pa'i sbyor ba ldan //
translated: As long as one possesses the yoga of meditation,

original: de srid dang po'i las can yin //
analyzed: de srid dang po'i las can yin //
translated: one is a beginner.

original: yongs su rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor ni //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor ni //
translated: The yoga of perfection

original: da ni bstan par bya ba yin //
analyzed: da ni bstan par bya ba yin //
translated: Now it is to be taught.

original: zhes 'byung bas so //
analyzed: zhes 'byung bas so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de bzhin du //
analyzed: de bzhin du //
translated: And likewise:

original: rkyen gzhan med pa zhi ba ste //
analyzed: rkyen gzhan med pa zhi ba ste //
translated: It is peace, not dependent on another,

original: spros pa yis ni ma spros pa //
analyzed: spros pa yis ni ma spros pa //
translated: not fabricated by mental fabrication,

original: du ma ma yin gcig min te //
analyzed: du ma ma yin gcig min te //
translated: not manifold, not one,

original: de ni de nyid mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de ni de nyid mtshan nyid do //
translated: that is the characteristic of reality.

original: zhes 'byung bas so ;
analyzed: zhes 'byung bas so ;
translated: Thus it is said.

original: ; de bas na shes pa dang shes bya'i dbye ba dang bral ba bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen pos drug pa yin no //
analyzed: ; de bas na shes pa dang shes bya'i dbye ba dang bral ba bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen pos drug pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the Blessed One, Great Vajradhara, is free from the division of knower and known.

original: zhes grangs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes grangs su 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus he is counted as the sixth.

original: de ni de kho na nyid rnyed par dka' ba nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: de ni de kho na nyid rnyed par dka' ba nyid du bstan to //
translated: Thus the difficulty of attaining reality is taught.

original: gal te de lta ma yin na snga ma ni ji ltar grub pa dang / 'grub par 'gyur ba @131b dang // phyis grub pa ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta ma yin na snga ma ni ji ltar grub pa dang / 'grub par 'gyur ba @131b dang // phyis grub pa ji ltar zhe na /
translated: If it were otherwise, how could there be prior, subsequent, and simultaneous accomplishment?

original: smras pa / skye gnas bzhis bsdus pa rigs drug gi sems can ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad ngo bo nyid kyi de kho na nyid thob pa ste /
analyzed: smras pa / skye gnas bzhis bsdus pa rigs drug gi sems can ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad ngo bo nyid kyi de kho na nyid thob pa ste /
translated: It is said: All sentient beings included in the four modes of birth and the six kinds of living beings attain the reality of their own nature,

original: de chos nyid la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de chos nyid la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they abide in reality.

original: 'o na ji ltar thams cad grol bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar thams cad grol bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Well then, how is it that everyone is not liberated?🔽It is said:

original: smras pa / goms pa blang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa / goms pa blang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the cultivation of the practice.

original: glo bur gyi dri ma ldog pa'i don du thos pa la sogs pa'i rim pas goms par byas na de kho na nyid snang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: glo bur gyi dri ma ldog pa'i don du thos pa la sogs pa'i rim pas goms par byas na de kho na nyid snang bar 'gyur te /
translated: If one cultivates the practice through the stages of hearing, etc., in order to stop the adventitious defilements, reality will appear,

original: mar me yod pa bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //🔽des ni de kho na nyid rnyed par dka' bas slob pas ci dgos she na le lo can smras pa gang yin pa de rnams la /
analyzed: mar me yod pa bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no // des ni de kho na nyid rnyed par dka' bas slob pas ci dgos she na le lo can smras pa gang yin pa de rnams la /
translated: just as a pot, etc. appear when there is a lamp.🔽If one has difficulty in finding reality, what is the use of training?

original: de bsal bar bya ba'i don du de kho na nyid rnyed par slab yin no zhes gsal bar bstan to //
analyzed: de bsal bar bya ba'i don du de kho na nyid rnyed par slab yin no zhes gsal bar bstan to //
translated: In order to remove the doubts of the lazy ones who say this, it is clearly taught that it is easy to find reality through training.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: chos kun nang du chud pa'i phyir //
analyzed: chos kun nang du chud pa'i phyir //
translated: Because all phenomena are included within it,

original: ring po ma yin gar du min //
analyzed: ring po ma yin gar du min //
translated: It is not far away, nor is it near.

original: de nyid rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de nyid rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir //
translated: Because it is difficult to realize reality,

original: de yi ngo bo rtogs mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de yi ngo bo rtogs mi 'gyur //
translated: Its nature is not realized.

original: phra bar gzigs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis //
analyzed: phra bar gzigs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis //
translated: The Buddha, who sees the subtle,

original: de nyid rang gis rig pa yin //
analyzed: de nyid rang gis rig pa yin //
translated: Knows reality through his own experience.

original: rang gnas la yang dag 'dra ba'i //
analyzed: rang gnas la yang dag 'dra ba'i //
translated: The one who is similar to the one who is in his own place

original: blo rags pas ni mthong mi 'gyur //
analyzed: blo rags pas ni mthong mi 'gyur //
translated: The coarse mind does not see it.

original: rnal 'byor rig pas nam yang ni //
analyzed: rnal 'byor rig pas nam yang ni //
translated: The yogi/nī, knowing the truth,

original: thar pa'i 'du shes ring mi bya //
analyzed: thar pa'i 'du shes ring mi bya //
translated: never has the idea of liberation.

original: rang gi bdag nyid brtags pa ni //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid brtags pa ni //
translated: When one sees one’s own nature

original: stong par mthong nas mya ngan 'das //🔽zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: stong par mthong nas mya ngan 'das // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: as empty, one attains nirvāṇa.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: And also:

original: goms pa'i sbyor ba ci zhig bya //
analyzed: goms pa'i sbyor ba ci zhig bya //
translated: What is the point of the practice of familiarization?

original: thog mar grub pa'i ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: thog mar grub pa'i ngo bo nyid //
translated: First, the nature of what is to be accomplished

original: rang bzhin gyis ni de 'grub pa //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ni de 'grub pa //
translated: is accomplished by its own nature.

original: de bzhin rtog pa las skyes min //
analyzed: de bzhin rtog pa las skyes min //
translated: It is not born from conceptualization.

original: ye shes gsum rig spangs nas ni //
analyzed: ye shes gsum rig spangs nas ni //
translated: Having abandoned the three knowledges and awareness,

original: gang zhig de ltar rtog byed pas //
analyzed: gang zhig de ltar rtog byed pas //
translated: one who conceptualizes in that way

original: de yi dbye ba mi shes pas //
analyzed: de yi dbye ba mi shes pas //
translated: does not know its divisions,

original: slar yang de rnams slob bzhin 'gyur //🔽zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: slar yang de rnams slob bzhin 'gyur //🔽zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: and so again they are like beginners.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba nas brtags ni mi rnyed pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'i bar du ni de bzhin gshegs pa dang byang chub sems dpa'i 'dri ba dang lan gdab pa'i ngo bo phul du byung ba gsan nas mgu bar gyur pa'i rdo rje 'chang gis don 'di🔽nyid bstan pas te chos nyid kyi ngo bo sems can thams cad stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin yang de bzhin 'ja' tshon la sogs pa dang 'dra bar bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas sems can gyi don rnam pa sna tshogs kyis sangs rgyas kyi
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba nas brtags ni mi rnyed pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'i bar du ni de bzhin gshegs pa dang byang chub sems dpa'i 'dri ba dang lan gdab pa'i ngo bo phul du byung ba gsan nas mgu bar gyur pa'i rdo rje 'chang gis don 'di nyid bstan pas te chos nyid kyi ngo bo sems can thams cad stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin yang de bzhin 'ja' tshon la sogs pa dang 'dra bar bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas sems can gyi don rnam pa sna tshogs kyis sangs rgyas kyi
translated: From “Thus…” up to “…because it is not found when investigated,” Vajradhara, who was pleased after hearing the questions and answers of the Tathāgata and the bodhisattvas, taught this meaning.

original: bya ba @132a * //
analyzed: bya ba @132a * //
translated: Although the nature of reality is that all sentient beings are the nature of emptiness, like a rainbow and so on, through the stage of self-consecration, the activities of the buddhas are performed for the benefit of sentient beings in various ways.

original: byed de / 'on kyang mngon par byang chub kyi rim pas thams cad stong pa thob na /
analyzed: byed de / 'on kyang mngon par byang chub kyi rim pas thams cad stong pa thob na /
translated: However, if everything is attained as empty through the stage of manifest enlightenment,

original: de rnams gang yang dmigs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de rnams gang yang dmigs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: none of those will be observed.

original: chos thams cad 'od gsal pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: chos thams cad 'od gsal pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan to //
translated: This is because the nature of all phenomena is luminosity.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba nas lan gsungs pa'o zhes pa'i bar du ni sangs rgyas kyi dngos grub gang las 'byung ba dang gang las gnas par zhes de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen po la dri ba dang bcom ldan 'das
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba nas lan gsungs pa'o zhes pa'i bar du ni sangs rgyas kyi dngos grub gang las 'byung ba dang gang las gnas par zhes de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen po la dri ba dang bcom ldan 'das
translated: The passage from “Thus” up to “the reply” indicates the question of all the tathāgatas to the Bhagavān, the great Vajradhara, “From what does the power of the buddhas arise, and from what do they abide?”

original: kyis kyang slob pa'i dus nas de kho na nyid thob ba'i bar du sku gsum gyi bdag nyid de kho nyid gang yin pa de nyid las stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / zhi ba la sogs pa'i 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub 'byung zhing de nyid du thim par 'gyur te /
analyzed: kyis kyang slob pa'i dus nas de kho na nyid thob ba'i bar du sku gsum gyi bdag nyid de kho nyid gang yin pa de nyid las stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / zhi ba la sogs pa'i 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub 'byung zhing de nyid du thim par 'gyur te /
translated: The Bhagavān replied, “From the very reality that is the nature of the three bodies, from the time of training up to the attainment of thatness, arise the supramundane powers such as the ten powers and the fearlessnesses, and the mundane powers such as pacification, and they dissolve into that very reality.

original: sems can gyi don bya ba'i phyir zhes lan bstan to //🔽ji ltar chu ni dangs pa las //
analyzed: sems can gyi don bya ba'i phyir zhes lan bstan to // ji ltar chu ni dangs pa las //
translated: For the sake of benefiting sentient beings.”

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung bas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung bas so //
translated: The passage beginning “Just as from clear water” indicates this.

original: de bzhin gshegs ba zhes bya ba nas ci la yang ma yin zhes gsungs pa ni lan no zhes pa'i bar du ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs ba zhes bya ba nas ci la yang ma yin zhes gsungs pa ni lan no zhes pa'i bar du ni /
translated: The reply from “Thus-gone” up to “nothing whatsoever” is the reply.

original: 'jig rten pa la sogs pa'i dngos grub kyi thabs dang gang gis dmigs shing sgrub pa sku la sogs pa de dag dang / de'i rang bzhin gyis khams gsum pa dang / snod kyi 'jig rten gyi ngo bo sa la sogs pa gang du gnas zhes mi bskyod pa la sogs pas zhus pas bcom ldan 'das kyi 'od gsal ba gnas so zhes lan bstan na 'od gsal ba yang gang du gnas zhes zhus pas /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa la sogs pa'i dngos grub kyi thabs dang gang gis dmigs shing sgrub pa sku la sogs pa de dag dang / de'i rang bzhin gyis khams gsum pa dang / snod kyi 'jig rten gyi ngo bo sa la sogs pa gang du gnas zhes mi bskyod pa la sogs pas zhus pas bcom ldan 'das kyi 'od gsal ba gnas so zhes lan bstan na 'od gsal ba yang gang du gnas zhes zhus pas /
translated: The question from “Akṣhobhya” up to “in what do they abide?” is: “The means of accomplishing mundane and supramundane feats, the body and so on that are observed and accomplished by them, the nature of those, the three realms, and the nature of the environment, the earth and so on, in what do they abide?” The reply is: “In the clear light of the Bhagavat.” The question is: “In what does the clear light abide?”

original: gang du mi gnas so zhes so sor nges pa'i gnas med pa'i phyir thams cad du ni de kho na nyid gnas so zhes lan gsungs so //
analyzed: gang du mi gnas so zhes so sor nges pa'i gnas med pa'i phyir thams cad du ni de kho na nyid gnas so zhes lan gsungs so //
translated: The reply is: “It does not abide anywhere.” Because there is no definite place, the reply is: “The reality of all abides.”

original: ring por ma yin gam du min //
analyzed: ring por ma yin gam du min //
translated: Not far, not near,

original: nam mkha' ma yin sa la min //
analyzed: nam mkha' ma yin sa la min //
translated: Not in space, not on earth,

original: 'khor bar ma yin myang 'das min //
analyzed: 'khor bar ma yin myang 'das min //
translated: Not in saṃsāra, not in nirvāṇa,

original: gnas min khyod la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: gnas min khyod la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Not a place, homage to you!

original: zhes 'byung ba dang // kun du kun nas thams cad ni //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba dang // kun du kun nas thams cad ni //
translated: and,🔽All, in every way, in all things,

original: rnam pa thams cad kun rang bzhin //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kun rang bzhin //
translated: In every way, by nature,

original: sangs rgyas kun dngos grub pa ni //🔽des ni rang gi bdag nyid mthong //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun dngos grub pa ni // des ni rang gi bdag nyid mthong //
translated: The attainment of the nature of all Buddhas,

original: zhes 'byung bas so //
analyzed: zhes 'byung bas so //
translated: Is seen by him, by his own nature.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba nas ngo mtshar gyi rgyu'o zhes pa'i bar du ni ngo mtshar dang bcas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis @132b bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa la rjes su yi rang bas sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pas rnam
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba nas ngo mtshar gyi rgyu'o zhes pa'i bar du ni ngo mtshar dang bcas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis @132b bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa la rjes su yi rang bas sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pas rnam
translated: All Tathagatas, etc., up to the cause of wonder, is the wonder of the Blessed One, who, by the process of the purification of mind through rejoicing in the teaching,

original: pa med pa'i 'od gsal ba thob pa gang yin pa de las cig car du /
analyzed: pa med pa'i 'od gsal ba thob pa gang yin pa de las cig car du /
translated: attains the non-conceptual clear light, and from that, simultaneously,

original: rnam pa thams cad mchog dang ldan pa'i lha'i sku gzugs pa dang / des kyang 'gro ba'i don bya ba zhes ngo mtshar ba yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mchog dang ldan pa'i lha'i sku gzugs pa dang / des kyang 'gro ba'i don bya ba zhes ngo mtshar ba yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: the divine body endowed with the highest of all aspects, and by that, the benefit of beings.

original: mtshan ma med pa zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The signless is the characteristic of the realization of clear light.

original: de'i thabs zhes pa 'od gsal ba de thob pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: de'i thabs zhes pa 'od gsal ba de thob pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The means for that is the cause for attaining that clear light.

original: lha'i sku zhes pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pas bsgrub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: lha'i sku zhes pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pas bsgrub par bya ba'o //
translated: The divine body is to be accomplished by the creation stage.

original: lha'i sku grub na rdzogs pa'i rim pa la dbang byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lha'i sku grub na rdzogs pa'i rim pa la dbang byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When the divine body is accomplished, one has control over the completion stage.

original: ji skad du ;
analyzed: ji skad du ;
translated: As it is said:

original: ; bskyed pa'i rim la legs gnas shing //
analyzed: ; bskyed pa'i rim la legs gnas shing //
translated: Dwelling well in the creation stage,

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa 'dod rnams la //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa 'dod rnams la //
translated: those who desire the completion stage

original: thabs ni rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis //
analyzed: thabs ni rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis //
translated: are taught by the perfect Buddha

original: skas kyi rim pa lta bur gsungs //🔽zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: skas kyi rim pa lta bur gsungs // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: the means which are like the steps of a staircase.

original: rdo rje gsum ni sems can thams cad do zhes pa ni sku la sogs pa'i bdag nyid yin pas so //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum ni sems can thams cad do zhes pa ni sku la sogs pa'i bdag nyid yin pas so //
translated: The three vajras are all sentient beings, because they are the nature of the body and so forth.

original: da rnams kyi mchog ni zhes pa ni 'jig rten skyong ba yin pas na mchog go //
analyzed: da rnams kyi mchog ni zhes pa ni 'jig rten skyong ba yin pas na mchog go //
translated: The supreme of those is the guardians of the world, because they are supreme.

original: lha chen po la sogs pa ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi bdag bo'o //
analyzed: lha chen po la sogs pa ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi bdag bo'o //
translated: The great gods and so forth are the lords of the desire realm.

original: de rnams kyi mchog ni nyan thos pa dang rang rgyal ba rnams so zhes pa ni 'dod chags dang bral ba yin pas so //
analyzed: de rnams kyi mchog ni nyan thos pa dang rang rgyal ba rnams so zhes pa ni 'dod chags dang bral ba yin pas so //
translated: The supreme of those is the hearers and solitary realizers, because they are free from attachment.

original: de rnams kyi mchog ni rdo rje 'chang chen po zhes pa ni thams cad la rjes su ston par mdzad pas so //
analyzed: de rnams kyi mchog ni rdo rje 'chang chen po zhes pa ni thams cad la rjes su ston par mdzad pas so //
translated: The best of them is Mahāvajradhara, because he is the one who teaches all of them.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje rnams la zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje rnams la zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa la'o //
translated: The vajras of body, speech, and mind are Vairocana and so forth.

original: khyad par du dbang bskur bas na zhes pa la 'og nas 'chad pa'i dbang phyug nyid kyis so //
analyzed: khyad par du dbang bskur bas na zhes pa la 'og nas 'chad pa'i dbang phyug nyid kyis so //
translated: The special empowerment is by the lordship explained below.

original: sku'i dbang phyug ces pa ni phra bal sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: sku'i dbang phyug ces pa ni phra bal sogs pa la'o //
translated: The lordship of body is with respect to subtlety and so forth.

original: gsung gi dbang phyug ces pa ni gzugs bzhi'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: gsung gi dbang phyug ces pa ni gzugs bzhi'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The lordship of speech is with respect to the nature of the four forms.

original: thugs kyi dbang phyug ni lha la sogs pa'i nye bar 'pho ba la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: thugs kyi dbang phyug ni lha la sogs pa'i nye bar 'pho ba la sogs pa la'o //
translated: The lordship of mind is with respect to the transference of deities and so forth.

original: rdzu 'phrul zhes pa ni 'bar ba dang snang ba la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul zhes pa ni 'bar ba dang snang ba la sogs pa la'o //
translated: Miraculous powers are with respect to blazing, shining, and so forth.

original: kun 'gro ba'i dbang phyug ces pa ni gzugs gcig gis thams cad khyab pa'o //
analyzed: kun 'gro ba'i dbang phyug ces pa ni gzugs gcig gis thams cad khyab pa'o //
translated: The lordship of omnipresence is with respect to pervading all with one form.

original: ci 'dod ni ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i don bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: ci 'dod ni ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i don bskyed pa ste /
translated: Whatever is desired is the production of whatever object is wished for.

original: dpag bsam gyi shing bzhin no //
analyzed: dpag bsam gyi shing bzhin no //
translated: It is like a wish-fulfilling tree.

original: bskyed pa ni sems can gyi don bya ba'i phyir gzugs sna tshogs pas sprul pa nyid de /
analyzed: bskyed pa ni sems can gyi don bya ba'i phyir gzugs sna tshogs pas sprul pa nyid de /
translated: Generation is the emanation of various forms in order to act for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: ro bong stag dang seng ge rnams //
analyzed: ro bong stag dang seng ge rnams //
translated: The lion, tiger, and elephant

original: @133a * // glang po rnams kyi skye gnas so //
analyzed: @133a * // glang po rnams kyi skye gnas so //
translated: are the birthplaces of the six seals.

original: phyag rgya drug kyang skye ba ste /
analyzed: phyag rgya drug kyang skye ba ste /
translated: The six seals are also birth,

original: rdo rje'i thugs dang ldan pas so //🔽zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rdo rje'i thugs dang ldan pas so // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: because they possess the vajra mind.

original: yon tan ni stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan ni stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The qualities are the ten powers, the four forms of fearlessness, and so forth.

original: de dag dbang phyug brgyad yin no //
analyzed: de dag dbang phyug brgyad yin no //
translated: These are the eight masteries.

original: de dang ldan pas na dbang phyug dam pa'o //
analyzed: de dang ldan pas na dbang phyug dam pa'o //
translated: Because he possesses them, he is the supreme lord.

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes pa ni zhi ba la sogs pa dang 'khor lo'i rig pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i dngos grub rnams so //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes pa ni zhi ba la sogs pa dang 'khor lo'i rig pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i dngos grub rnams so //
translated: Mundane and supramundane refers to the powers of pacification and so forth and the powers of the wheel, the awareness holder, and so forth.

original: sgrub par gyur pa zhes pa ni rdzogs par byed pa nyid du thob pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub par gyur pa zhes pa ni rdzogs par byed pa nyid du thob pa'o //
translated: Having become an adept means having attained perfection.

original: rig pa'i rang bzhin zhes pa ni sngags kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rig pa'i rang bzhin zhes pa ni sngags kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of awareness refers to the nature of mantra.

original: skyes bu ni lha'i rnam pa can no //
analyzed: skyes bu ni lha'i rnam pa can no //
translated: The person is the deity form.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa'o zhes pa ni bskyed pa'i go rims gsungs so //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa'o zhes pa ni bskyed pa'i go rims gsungs so //
translated: The generation stage is the teaching of the order of generation.

original: nam mkha' rdo rje zhes bya ba nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so zhes pa'i bar du ni khyad par gyi gnas la dmigs pa sngon du 'gro bar don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi rim pas sems can gyi khams stong par byas nas /
analyzed: nam mkha' rdo rje zhes bya ba nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so zhes pa'i bar du ni khyad par gyi gnas la dmigs pa sngon du 'gro bar don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi rim pas sems can gyi khams stong par byas nas /
translated: From Vajra Space up to the Bhagavat said is as follows: Having made the realm of sentient beings empty by the stage of the ultimate mandala, preceded by the observation of the special place,

original: padma la sogs pa rjes su 'jug pas zla ba'i dkyil 'khor 'ba' zhig bsams la /
analyzed: padma la sogs pa rjes su 'jug pas zla ba'i dkyil 'khor 'ba' zhig bsams la /
translated: one should imagine only the moon mandala by the engagement of the lotus, etc.

original: de'i steng du dgong pa'i rdo rje dang 'khor lo dang padma dang rin chen dang / sna tshogs rdo rje yongs su gyur pa las bskyed pa'i mi bskyod pa dang / rnam par snang mdzad dang / rin chen 'byung ldan dang / 'od dpag tu med pa dang /🔽don yod grub pa'i sku bsams la /
analyzed: de'i steng du dgong pa'i rdo rje dang 'khor lo dang padma dang rin chen dang / sna tshogs rdo rje yongs su gyur pa las bskyed pa'i mi bskyod pa dang / rnam par snang mdzad dang / rin chen 'byung ldan dang / 'od dpag tu med pa dang /🔽don yod grub pa'i sku bsams la /
translated: On top of that, from the transformation of the evening vajra, wheel, lotus, jewel, and crossed vajra, one should imagine the bodies of Akshobhya, Vairochana, Ratnasambhava, Amitabha, and Amoghasiddhi, respectively.

original: rnal 'byor gsum gyi rim gyis dang po sbyor ba rdzogs te phyag rgya legs par sbyong ba sngon du 'gro bar dkyil 'khor spros la des 'gro ba'i don byas te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor gsum gyi rim gyis dang po sbyor ba rdzogs te phyag rgya legs par sbyong ba sngon du 'gro bar dkyil 'khor spros la des 'gro ba'i don byas te /
translated: Having completed the first yoga by stages, having previously well-trained the consort, one emanates the mandala, and having performed the welfare of sentient beings with that,

original: 'khor gyi tshul du bzhag cing las kyi rgyal ba mchog la gnas par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'khor gyi tshul du bzhag cing las kyi rgyal ba mchog la gnas par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: one should abide in the supreme victor's activity, having established the retinue.

original: rnam pa gzhan gyis bsgoms na zhes pa ni log pa'am mtshan ma gcig yongs su gyur pa las so //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan gyis bsgoms na zhes pa ni log pa'am mtshan ma gcig yongs su gyur pa las so //
translated: If one meditates in another way, that is, if one meditates on the transformation of the inverted or single sign,

original: dngos grub kyi rgyur mi 'gyur ro zhes pa ni mngon bar 'dod pa'i lha'i sgrub pa'i rgyur mi 'gyur te mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos grub kyi rgyur mi 'gyur ro zhes pa ni mngon bar 'dod pa'i lha'i sgrub pa'i rgyur mi 'gyur te mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it will not be the cause of power, that is, it will not be the cause of the accomplishment of the desired deity, because it is incompatible.

original: 'bras ni sa bon la nas kyi myu gu bzhin no //
analyzed: 'bras ni sa bon la nas kyi myu gu bzhin no //
translated: The result is like a barley sprout from a barley seed.

original: des ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i mtshan ma'i nges pa bstan te rgyas btab pa bzhin no //
analyzed: des ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i mtshan ma'i nges pa bstan te rgyas btab pa bzhin no //
translated: That explains the ascertainment of the signs of the creation stage, like a seal.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba nas blta bar bya'o zhes pa'i bar du ni dang po sbyor pa'i 'og tu ye shes kyi phyag rgya dang snyoms par zhugs pa nyid du bstan te /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba nas blta bar bya'o zhes pa'i bar du ni dang po sbyor pa'i 'og tu ye shes kyi phyag rgya dang snyoms par zhugs pa nyid du bstan te /
translated: The passage from thus up to should be seen teaches that after the first union, one should enter into union with a wisdom-consort.

original: gang la dmigs nas @133b sngar bshad pa'i dkyil 'khor spro bar bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gang la dmigs nas @133b sngar bshad pa'i dkyil 'khor spro bar bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: It teaches that one should emanate the previously explained mandala, having visualized the wisdom-being.

original: ji ltar 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba nas brtson 'grus kyi brtul ba can zhes pa'i bar du ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i ye shes kyi phyag rgya dang snyoms par zhugs pa'i bsgom pas chags pa la sogs pa gsum rnam par sbyong ba 'od gsal ba rtogs par
analyzed: ji ltar 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba nas brtson 'grus kyi brtul ba can zhes pa'i bar du ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i ye shes kyi phyag rgya dang snyoms par zhugs pa'i bsgom pas chags pa la sogs pa gsum rnam par sbyong ba 'od gsal ba rtogs par
translated: How does one do this? The passage from how? up to one who is diligent teaches that by meditating on the union with a wisdom-consort in the stage of generation, one will realize the clear light that purifies the three, passion and so forth.

original: 'gyur bas / go rims kyis zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'gyur bas / go rims kyis zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: Thus, one will abide in the meditative stabilization of union in stages.

original: zhag bdun zhes bya ba nas sangs rgyas nyid thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gang zhig rnal 'byor pa ye shes kyi phyag rgya bsgom par mi nus pa des legs par sbyangs pa'i shin tu bslabs pa /
analyzed: zhag bdun zhes bya ba nas sangs rgyas nyid thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gang zhig rnal 'byor pa ye shes kyi phyag rgya bsgom par mi nus pa des legs par sbyangs pa'i shin tu bslabs pa /
translated: From “seven days” up to “attains buddhahood” is for one who is unable to cultivate the wisdom consort.

original: dam tshig gi phyag rgya blangs la de dang lhan cig tu chags pa la sogs pa'i dbye ba mtshon zhing 'od gsal ba rtogs na ji srid zhag bdun gyi bar du phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob pa de srid du gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: dam tshig gi phyag rgya blangs la de dang lhan cig tu chags pa la sogs pa'i dbye ba mtshon zhing 'od gsal ba rtogs na ji srid zhag bdun gyi bar du phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob pa de srid du gnas par bya'o //
translated: Having taken the pledge seal, he should remain with her for seven days, indicating the divisions of passion, etc., and realizing the clear light, for that long he should remain, until he attains the great seal siddhi.

original: dbang po rno ba dang 'dod chags kyi shas che ba'i dbang po rno ba'i sgom pa 'di yin no //
analyzed: dbang po rno ba dang 'dod chags kyi shas che ba'i dbang po rno ba'i sgom pa 'di yin no //
translated: This is the meditation for one of sharp faculty and one of sharp faculty with a predominance of passion.

original: zhes bla ma'i bka' lung ngo //
analyzed: zhes bla ma'i bka' lung ngo //
translated: This is the oral instruction of the guru.

original: dang po sbyor ba'i 'og tu phyag rgya legs par sbyang ba ni dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog gi phyogs gcig yin no //
analyzed: dang po sbyor ba'i 'og tu phyag rgya legs par sbyang ba ni dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog gi phyogs gcig yin no //
translated: After the first yoga, the thorough training in the seal is one part of the mandala of the supreme victor.

original: de nas zhes bya ba nas 'da' bar mi mdzad do zhes pa'i bar du ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pas lag pa'i phyag rgya bcing par mi bya ste /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba nas 'da' bar mi mdzad do zhes pa'i bar du ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pas lag pa'i phyag rgya bcing par mi bya ste /
translated: From “Then” up to “does not pass beyond” means that the practitioner of the stage of completion should not bind the hand mudra.

original: de g-yeng bar byed pa yin pas so //
analyzed: de g-yeng bar byed pa yin pas so //
translated: That is because it is a distraction.

original: phyag rgya ni bcom ldan 'das kyi ngo bo mngon du gyur pa'i phyir bcing bar bya ste /
analyzed: phyag rgya ni bcom ldan 'das kyi ngo bo mngon du gyur pa'i phyir bcing bar bya ste /
translated: The mudra is to be bound because it is the actualization of the nature of the Bhagavat.

original: de nyid mngon su byas nas phyag rgyas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: de nyid mngon su byas nas phyag rgyas ci zhig bya /
translated: Having actualized that, what is the use of the mudra?

original: de'i don du glang po rnyed pa zhes bya ba ni dpe yin te skyes pa dang glang po stor ba gal te de tshol bas mdun du de 'phral du rnyed na /
analyzed: de'i don du glang po rnyed pa zhes bya ba ni dpe yin te skyes pa dang glang po stor ba gal te de tshol bas mdun du de 'phral du rnyed na /
translated: The meaning of that is the example called “finding the elephant.” If a man who has lost an elephant finds it immediately in front of him while searching for it,

original: de ci'i phyir glang po de'i rjes tshol ba de mi tshol te de rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir glang po de'i rjes tshol ba de mi tshol te de rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: why would he search for the tracks of that elephant? Because he has found it.

original: de bzhin du gang zhig rnal 'byor pa rang nyid rdo rje sems dpa' yin na des lag pa'i phyag rgyal sogs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du gang zhig rnal 'byor pa rang nyid rdo rje sems dpa' yin na des lag pa'i phyag rgyal sogs pa /
translated: In the same way, if a yogin is himself Vajrasattva, why would he search for the hand mudra, etc.?

original: ci'i phyir tshol te de grub pa yin pas so ;
analyzed: ci'i phyir tshol te de grub pa yin pas so ;
translated: Because he has accomplished that.

original: ; spros pa rnams don med pa'o //
analyzed: ; spros pa rnams don med pa'o //
translated: Elaborations are meaningless.

original: gsang pa 'dus pa ni rnam pa gnyis la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gsang pa 'dus pa ni rnam pa gnyis la gnas pa'o //
translated: The Guhyasamaja is based on two aspects.

original: rtog pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi zhes pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa la gnas pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: rtog pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi zhes pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa la gnas pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: The phrase for yogis who are conceptual refers to those who are based on the stage of generation.

original: sku rdo rje'i rigs dang ldan pa zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi rigs dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sku rdo rje'i rigs dang ldan pa zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi rigs dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The phrase endowed with the vajra family of the body refers to those endowed with the family of Vairochana.

original: @134a * // nyams su blangs pa zhes pa ni sku rdo rje'i dam tshig gsungs ba'o //
analyzed: @134a * // nyams su blangs pa zhes pa ni sku rdo rje'i dam tshig gsungs ba'o //
translated: The phrase practice refers to the pledges of the vajra body.

original: bshang ga ci zhes bya ba la sogs pas bdud rtsi la sbyad ba la sogs pa'i rim gyis spyang nas bza' bar bya ba dang / de bzhin du shes rab la 'khyud pa la sogs pas 'byung ba'i byang chub kyi sems kyi bdud rtsis lus tshim par byed pa spyad par bya'o zhes sku'i rigs kyi dam tshig go //
analyzed: bshang ga ci zhes bya ba la sogs pas bdud rtsi la sbyad ba la sogs pa'i rim gyis spyang nas bza' bar bya ba dang / de bzhin du shes rab la 'khyud pa la sogs pas 'byung ba'i byang chub kyi sems kyi bdud rtsis lus tshim par byed pa spyad par bya'o zhes sku'i rigs kyi dam tshig go //
translated: The phrase the excrement and so forth refers to the practice of the pledge of the vajra body, which is to eat the excrement and so forth by the process of purifying it through the practice of the nectar and so forth. Similarly, the practice of the pledge of the vajra body is to satisfy the body with the nectar of the bodhicitta that arises from the embrace of wisdom and so forth.

original: bshang bas nye bar mtshon pa'i bdud rtsi'i rang bzhin ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: bshang bas nye bar mtshon pa'i bdud rtsi'i rang bzhin ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'o zhes bstan to //
translated: The nature of the nectars exemplified by feces is Vairochana, and so on.

original: mchog ni ye shes kyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: mchog ni ye shes kyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The best is the wisdom seal.

original: 'bring ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: 'bring ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The middling is the pledge seal.

original: tha ma ni las kyi phyag /
analyzed: tha ma ni las kyi phyag /
translated: The lowest is the action seal.

original: rgya'o // yang na mchog ni bram ze mo //
analyzed: rgya'o // yang na mchog ni bram ze mo //
translated: Or, the best is the Brahmin woman.

original: 'bring ni rgyal rigs dang rje rigs ma'o //
analyzed: 'bring ni rgyal rigs dang rje rigs ma'o //
translated: The middling is the Kshatriya or Vaishya woman.

original: tha ma ni dmangs rigs ma'o //
analyzed: tha ma ni dmangs rigs ma'o //
translated: The lowest is the Shudra woman.

original: yang na mchog ni sme sha can gyi bu mo ste mi bskyod pa'i rigs yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽bar ma ni gar mkhan mo ste 'od dpag tu med pa'i rigs dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na mchog ni sme sha can gyi bu mo ste mi bskyod pa'i rigs yin pa'i phyir ro // bar ma ni gar mkhan mo ste 'od dpag tu med pa'i rigs dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, the best is the daughter of an outcaste, because she is of the Akashagarbha family.🔽The middling is the dancer, because she is of the Amitabha family.

original: tha ma ni khrus mkhan ma ste rnam par snang mdzad kyi rigs yin pas so //
analyzed: tha ma ni khrus mkhan ma ste rnam par snang mdzad kyi rigs yin pas so //
translated: The lowest is the washerwoman, because she is of the Vairochana family.

original: de dag thugs dang gsung dang sku'i ngo bo yin no //
analyzed: de dag thugs dang gsung dang sku'i ngo bo yin no //
translated: They are the nature of mind, speech, and body.

original: khams gsum ni sems can rnams so zhes pa ni khams gsum las bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khams gsum ni sems can rnams so zhes pa ni khams gsum las bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The three realms are sentient beings, because they are generated from the three realms.

original: snyoms par zhugs pa'i lam zhes pa ni skye ba byung ba'i sgo'o //
analyzed: snyoms par zhugs pa'i lam zhes pa ni skye ba byung ba'i sgo'o //
translated: The path of union is the door of birth.

original: padma'o zhes pa gru gsum pa mo'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: padma'o zhes pa gru gsum pa mo'i dbang po'o //
translated: The lotus is the triangular organ.

original: 'gro ba thams cad tshim par byed pa'o zhes pa ni sems can gyi rigs rnams la bzhi dga' bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad tshim par byed pa'o zhes pa ni sems can gyi rigs rnams la bzhi dga' bar byed pa ste /
translated: It satisfies all beings, because it delights the four classes of sentient beings.

original: 'dod pa'i khams de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽dregs pa'i gdugs ni rtsa dbus ma'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro // dregs pa'i gdugs ni rtsa dbus ma'o //
translated: This is the nature of the desire realm.🔽The parasol of pride is the central channel.

original: zla ba rdzogs pa ni rtsa g-yon pa'o //
analyzed: zla ba rdzogs pa ni rtsa g-yon pa'o //
translated: The full moon is the left channel.

original: rus sbal ni g-yas pa'o //
analyzed: rus sbal ni g-yas pa'o //
translated: The tortoise is the right channel.

original: sogs pa ni mdun du lha sbyin ma dang rgyab tu nor rgyas ma'o //
analyzed: sogs pa ni mdun du lha sbyin ma dang rgyab tu nor rgyas ma'o //
translated: The others are the front channel Alambana and the rear channel Pushkariini.

original: de dag gal te mi bskyod pa la sogs pa bdud rtsi lnga rgyu ba yin na yang de bzhin du byang chub kyi sems 'dzag pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gal te mi bskyod pa la sogs pa bdud rtsi lnga rgyu ba yin na yang de bzhin du byang chub kyi sems 'dzag pa yin no //
translated: If those are the movements of the five nectars, such as Akshobhya, then the bodhicitta drips in the same way.

original: pha ga'i dbus na nam mkha' gang //
analyzed: pha ga'i dbus na nam mkha' gang //
translated: Space is in the middle of the other side.

original: nam mkha' lnga yis brgyan pa ste //
analyzed: nam mkha' lnga yis brgyan pa ste //
translated: It is adorned with five spaces.

original: lte bar ge sar dang ldan pa'i //
analyzed: lte bar ge sar dang ldan pa'i //
translated: In the center of the navel,

original: 'dab ma brgyad kyis rnam par mdzes //
analyzed: 'dab ma brgyad kyis rnam par mdzes //
translated: it is beautiful with eight petals and a pistil.

original: de la rtag tu gnas pa ni //
analyzed: de la rtag tu gnas pa ni //
translated: One should always abide in that.

original: khu ba'i gzugs su bdud rtsi 'dzag / ces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: khu ba'i gzugs su bdud rtsi 'dzag / ces 'byung ngo //
translated: The nectar flows in the form of semen.

original: rtsa lnga po de dag snyoms par zhugs pa'i sngon du lag pa'i phyag rgyas bskul @134b zhing gsher bar byas te lce bcug la /
analyzed: rtsa lnga po de dag snyoms par zhugs pa'i sngon du lag pa'i phyag rgyas bskul @134b zhing gsher bar byas te lce bcug la /
translated: Prior to entering into union with those five channels, one should stimulate and moisten them with the seal of the hand, and insert the tongue.

original: de las 'dzag pa'i bdud rtsi myang ba gang yin pa de ni gsung gi rdo rje'i dam tshig ste /
analyzed: de las 'dzag pa'i bdud rtsi myang ba gang yin pa de ni gsung gi rdo rje'i dam tshig ste /
translated: That which is tasted, the nectar that flows from that, is the commitment of Vajra Speech,

original: dag gi rang bzhin lce'i bya ba yin pas so //
analyzed: dag gi rang bzhin lce'i bya ba yin pas so //
translated: because the nature of the tongue is the function of speech.

original: de ni dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog gi phyogs gcig dang shes rab kyi dbang bskur gyi phyogs gcig dang / gsang ba'i dbang bskur yang yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de ni dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog gi phyogs gcig dang shes rab kyi dbang bskur gyi phyogs gcig dang / gsang ba'i dbang bskur yang yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: That is taught to be one part of the mandala of Supreme Victorious Ones, one part of the consecration of wisdom, and also the consecration of the secret.🔽Then, the words of the compiler.

original: de nas zhes bya ba nas sdud par byed pa'i tshig go zhes pa ni thugs rdo rje'i rnal 'byor pas padma can la sogs pa'i phyag rgya dang lhan cig tu rol pas de rnams kyi sems mnyes par mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba nas sdud par byed pa'i tshig go zhes pa ni thugs rdo rje'i rnal 'byor pas padma can la sogs pa'i phyag rgya dang lhan cig tu rol pas de rnams kyi sems mnyes par mi bya ba'o //
translated: The yogi/nī of Vajra Mind should not please the minds of those by enjoying with the seal of the lotus lady, etc.

original: 'on kyang phyi'i kha zas dang btung ba dang tshig snyan pa la sogs pas mgu bar byas te /
analyzed: 'on kyang phyi'i kha zas dang btung ba dang tshig snyan pa la sogs pas mgu bar byas te /
translated: But having pleased them with external food and drink, sweet words, and so on,

original: de nas dga' bar 'gyur ba'i sems dang ldan pas /
analyzed: de nas dga' bar 'gyur ba'i sems dang ldan pas /
translated: then, with a mind full of joy,

original: bde ba'i lus dang ldan pa de rnams kyis byang chub kyi sems ster bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bde ba'i lus dang ldan pa de rnams kyis byang chub kyi sems ster bar 'gyur ro //
translated: those who have a blissful body will give the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: gang gi dbang gis bde ba chen po myong ba yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gang gi dbang gis bde ba chen po myong ba yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: It is taught that it is by the power of that that one experiences great bliss.

original: de ni thugs kyi dam tshig ste thugs mnyes par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni thugs kyi dam tshig ste thugs mnyes par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is the mind commitment, because it pleases the mind.

original: spyod pa gsum la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa zhes pa ni spros pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa spyod pa gsum spyod pa'o //
analyzed: spyod pa gsum la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa zhes pa ni spros pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa spyod pa gsum spyod pa'o //
translated: The yogi/nī abiding in the three conducts is one who practices the three conducts, elaborate and so on.

original: spyi'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' mngon par zhes pa zhes pa ni de rnams la kun du chag pa'o //
analyzed: spyi'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' mngon par zhes pa zhes pa ni de rnams la kun du chag pa'o //
translated: The buddhas and bodhisattvas in general are the “manifest ones.”

original: brtsal bar bya ba'i phyir ni de ldog par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtsal bar bya ba'i phyir ni de ldog par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to seek them out is in order to turn away from them.

original: lhag ma'i lha bstan pa'i lha'i ngo bo nyid bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhag ma'i lha bstan pa'i lha'i ngo bo nyid bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The rest is taught in order to teach the nature of the deities.

original: de nas zhes bya ba nas de skad ces bka' stsal to zhes pa'i bar du ni gang zhig so sor nges pa'i rang bzhin la dmigs nas so sor snang ba'i phung po lnga dang / mig la sogs pa'i skye mched drug dang / sa la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po gang yin pa de rnams rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa lnga dang /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba nas de skad ces bka' stsal to zhes pa'i bar du ni gang zhig so sor nges pa'i rang bzhin la dmigs nas so sor snang ba'i phung po lnga dang / mig la sogs pa'i skye mched drug dang / sa la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po gang yin pa de rnams rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa lnga dang /
translated: Then up to he said indicates that one should understand that whatever is the five aggregates that appear individually by observing the individual natures, the six sense bases such as the eyes, and the great elements such as earth are the nature of the five tathagatas such as Vairocana,

original: spyan ma la sogs pa dang rdo rje 'chang chen po dang sa'i snying po la sogs pa drug gi rang bzhin du shes par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: spyan ma la sogs pa dang rdo rje 'chang chen po dang sa'i snying po la sogs pa drug gi rang bzhin du shes par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: and the six such as Lochana, and the nature of Great Vajradhara and the six such as Kshitigarbha.

original: de nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin te ye shes lnga dang yul drug gi ngo bo yang yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin te ye shes lnga dang yul drug gi ngo bo yang yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: That is merely an illustration, one should understand that they are also the nature of the five pristine consciousnesses and the six objects.

original: de yang rigs brgya'i dbye bas sngar gtan la phab pa'o //
analyzed: de yang rigs brgya'i dbye bas sngar gtan la phab pa'o //
translated: That is also determined by the division of one hundred buddha families.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: bdag nyid sangs rgyas kun nyid de //
analyzed: bdag nyid sangs rgyas kun nyid de //
translated: The nature of all buddhas

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad nyid //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad nyid //
translated: and all bodhisattvas.
The first is the🔽cause of the second.🔽

original: phyir 'bad pa thams cad kyis //🔽rang gi bdag nyid mchod par bya //
analyzed: phyir 'bad pa thams cad kyis // rang gi bdag nyid mchod par bya //
translated: Therefore, with all effort

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: one should worship one's own nature.

original: le'u dang po nas rdo rje phreng ba'i rgyud kyi tshad mas /
analyzed: le'u dang po nas rdo rje phreng ba'i rgyud kyi tshad mas /
translated: The first chapter of the Vajra-vali Tantra, by means of the authority of the tantra,

original: sku'i dkyil 'khor de nyid bstan to //
analyzed: sku'i dkyil 'khor de nyid bstan to //
translated: teaches the reality of the body mandala.

original: rgyud phyi ma las kyang /
analyzed: rgyud phyi ma las kyang /
translated: The Uttara Tantra also says:🔽The mandala of the enlightened mind,

original: byang chub sems kyi dkyil 'khor dang / sku yi dkyil 'khor nyid dang ni //
analyzed: byang chub sems kyi dkyil 'khor dang / sku yi dkyil 'khor nyid dang ni //
translated: the mandala of the body itself,

original: bha ga'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba'i //
analyzed: bha ga'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba'i //
translated: and the mandala of the bhaga

original: dkyil 'khor gsum po de dag brtags //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gsum po de dag brtags //
translated: are the three mandalas to be imagined.

original: de yang bskyed pa'i rim pa'i dang po sbyor ba'i phyogs gcig shin tu rnal 'byor zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de yang bskyed pa'i rim pa'i dang po sbyor ba'i phyogs gcig shin tu rnal 'byor zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Moreover, this is the first stage of the creation stage, called the one-sided yoga.

original: dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog la yang sku'i dkyil 'khor la lhag par mos pa sngon du 'gro bar phyi rol tu dkyil 'khor spro ba'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog la yang sku'i dkyil 'khor la lhag par mos pa sngon du 'gro bar phyi rol tu dkyil 'khor spro ba'o //
translated: In the mandala of the supreme Victor, one imagines the body mandala and emanates the external mandala.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba nas bzhugs par gyur to zhes ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba nas bzhugs par gyur to zhes ba'i bar du ni /
translated: The passage from Thus up to they all sat down🔽teaches the mandala of the bhaga.

original: phung po dang khams dang skye mchid kyi rang bzhin rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i tshogs /
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mchid kyi rang bzhin rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i tshogs /
translated: The nature of the aggregates, elements, and sense-fields is the assembly of Vairochana, etc.

original: rang gi phung po la sogs pa dang mtshungs par shes nas khams gsum pa yang de'i ngo bor shes par bya ste /
analyzed: rang gi phung po la sogs pa dang mtshungs par shes nas khams gsum pa yang de'i ngo bor shes par bya ste /
translated: Having understood that they are the same as one's own aggregates, etc., one should understand that the three realms are also of their nature.

original: gnas ji lta ba bzhin du gnas pa'i dkyil 'khor pa rnams gzigs nas sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa 'am mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa la 'jug ste /
analyzed: gnas ji lta ba bzhin du gnas pa'i dkyil 'khor pa rnams gzigs nas sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa 'am mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa la 'jug ste /
translated: Having seen the mandala-residents abiding in their respective places, one enters the stage of the purification of the mind, or the stage of manifest enlightenment.

original: 'khor gyis zhus pa la klags skabs su sbyin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'khor gyis zhus pa la klags skabs su sbyin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan to //
translated: It is taught in the Questions of the Chapter on the retinue that in order to give to the retinue, etc.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba nas shes par bgyi zhes pa'i bar du ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang 'od gsal ba la 'jug na dpal gsang ba 'dus pa rdo rje slob dpon khyod dang bdag cag gis ji ltar shes bar bya zhes byams pas de bzhin🔽gshegs pa rnams la 'dri bar byas so zhes bstan to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba nas shes par bgyi zhes pa'i bar du ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang 'od gsal ba la 'jug na dpal gsang ba 'dus pa rdo rje slob dpon khyod dang bdag cag gis ji ltar shes bar bya zhes byams pas de bzhin🔽gshegs pa rnams la 'dri bar byas so zhes bstan to //
translated: From the Blessed One up to we should understand teaches that when the Blessed Vajradhara enters into clear light, the glorious Guhyasamaja Vajra Master and we should understand how, out of love, he asks the Tathagatas.

original: 'dir 'jig rten gyi spyod pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi chog dang sbyin sreg dang rab tu gnas pa dang zhi ba la sogs pa'i spyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir 'jig rten gyi spyod pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi chog dang sbyin sreg dang rab tu gnas pa dang zhi ba la sogs pa'i spyod pa'o //
translated: Here, worldly conduct is the conduct of mandalas, fire sacrifices, consecrations, pacification, and so on.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i spyod pa ni dam tshig la sogs pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i spyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i spyod pa ni dam tshig la sogs pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i spyod pa'o //
translated: Supramundane conduct is the conduct of commitments and so on and the stage of completion.

original: byams pas bskul ba zhes pa ni 'dri bar byas pa'o //
analyzed: byams pas bskul ba zhes pa ni 'dri bar byas pa'o //
translated: Requested by Maitreya means requested by asking.

original: sa'i snying po la sogs pa gnas kyang byams pas bskul ba ni ma 'ongs chos kyi rgyal srid la dbang byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa'i snying po la sogs pa gnas kyang byams pas bskul ba ni ma 'ongs chos kyi rgyal srid la dbang byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The request of Maitreya and so on, the abode of the essence of the earth, is for the sake of future dominion over the kingdom of the Dharma.

original: ston pa po zhes pa ni 'dir dbang bskur ba'i rdo rje slob dpon no //
analyzed: ston pa po zhes pa ni 'dir dbang bskur ba'i rdo rje slob dpon no //
translated: Teacher here is the vajra master who confers empowerment.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po dang 'dra ba @135b zhes pa ni 'dra ba'i sgra gzhan gyi 'brel pa dang rnam par gcod pa yin te /
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po dang 'dra ba @135b zhes pa ni 'dra ba'i sgra gzhan gyi 'brel pa dang rnam par gcod pa yin te /
translated: Being like Great Vajradhara means the word like is related to another and is an exclusion.

original: des na rdo rje sems dpa' nyid de yin gyi de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na rdo rje sems dpa' nyid de yin gyi de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is Vajrasattva himself, not another tathagata.

original: khyad par gyi sgo nas dam tshig bstan pa'i don du bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: khyad par gyi sgo nas dam tshig bstan pa'i don du bshad par bya ste /
translated: In order to teach the commitments from the point of view of their distinctions, he says:

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes smos te /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes smos te /
translated: Why is that?

original: byang chub kyi sems zhes pa ni stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i bdag nyid ni rdo rje 'chang ngo //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems zhes pa ni stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i bdag nyid ni rdo rje 'chang ngo //
translated: The one called “thought of awakening” is the nature of the indivisibility of emptiness and compassion, which is Vajradhara.🔽The thought of awakening,

original: stong nyid snying rje dbyer med pa'i //🔽byang chub sems de bshad pa yin //
analyzed: stong nyid snying rje dbyer med pa'i // byang chub sems de bshad pa yin //
translated: which is the indivisibility of emptiness and compassion,

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: is explained.

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes 'dzin pas na rdo rje 'chang ngo //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes 'dzin pas na rdo rje 'chang ngo //
translated: He is Vajradhara because he holds the gnosis of nonduality.

original: de bzhin gshegs thams cad kyi gtso bo yin pas na chen po yang yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs thams cad kyi gtso bo yin pas na chen po yang yin la /
translated: He is also great because he is the chief of all transcendent lords.🔽He is also Vajradhara because he is the nature of the gnosis of nonduality.

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin pas rdo rje 'chang yang yin te zhes rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin pas rdo rje 'chang yang yin te zhes rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
translated: Thus he is Great Vajradhara.

original: slob dpon zhes bya ba ni dpal 'dus pa las dbang bskur ba'i bla ma'o //
analyzed: slob dpon zhes bya ba ni dpal 'dus pa las dbang bskur ba'i bla ma'o //
translated: The master is the guru who confers initiation in the glorious Guhyasamaja.

original: shes pa dang shes bya'i bag chags kyis mi g-yo bas na mi bskyod pa ste /
analyzed: shes pa dang shes bya'i bag chags kyis mi g-yo bas na mi bskyod pa ste /
translated: He is Akshobhya because he is unmoved by the habitual tendencies of the knower and the known.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' nyid do //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' nyid do //
translated: He is Vajrasattva himself.

original: de dag ni rdo rje 'chang gi rnam grangs kho na'o //
analyzed: de dag ni rdo rje 'chang gi rnam grangs kho na'o //
translated: These are the synonyms of Vajradhara.

original: dbyer med pa ni rdo rje 'chang dang slob dpon tha mi dad pa'o //
analyzed: dbyer med pa ni rdo rje 'chang dang slob dpon tha mi dad pa'o //
translated: Inseparable means that the master is not different from Vajradhara.

original: rgyu ni slob dpon no //
analyzed: rgyu ni slob dpon no //
translated: The cause is the master.

original: 'bras bu ni rdo rje 'chang ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni rdo rje 'chang ste /
translated: The result is Vajradhara,

original: de'i drin gyis de'i go 'phang thob pa'o //
analyzed: de'i drin gyis de'i go 'phang thob pa'o //
translated: because by his grace one attains his state.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu de dag dbyer med par byas nas slob dpon dang rdo rje 'chang nyid 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu de dag dbyer med par byas nas slob dpon dang rdo rje 'chang nyid 'dra ba'o //
translated: Therefore, having made the cause and result inseparable, the master and Vajradhara are the same.

original: rigs kyi bu zhes pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus su sangs rgyas kyi yul las 'byung ba'i 'gro ba'i slob dpon no //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu zhes pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus su sangs rgyas kyi yul las 'byung ba'i 'gro ba'i slob dpon no //
translated: Son of good family means that in the future he will be the master of beings who emerge from the domain of the Buddha.

original: shar la sogs pa'i phyogs na gnas pa zhes pa ni de la srid pa'i rtse mo'i shar phyogs su ;
analyzed: shar la sogs pa'i phyogs na gnas pa zhes pa ni de la srid pa'i rtse mo'i shar phyogs su ;
translated: Residing in the east and so forth means that in the east of the peak of existence

original: rnam par snang mdzad kyi 'jig rten gyi khams 'og min no //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad kyi 'jig rten gyi khams 'og min no //
translated: is the Akanishtha world of Vairochana.

original: de'i lho phyogs su rin chen 'byung gnas ni rin chen 'byung ldan gyi 'jig rten gyi khams so //🔽de'i nub phyogs su bde ba can zhes bya ba 'od dpag tu med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams so //
analyzed: de'i lho phyogs su rin chen 'byung gnas ni rin chen 'byung ldan gyi 'jig rten gyi khams so // de'i nub phyogs su bde ba can zhes bya ba 'od dpag tu med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams so //
translated: To the south of that is Ratnasaṃbhava, the world system of Ratnasaṃbhava.🔽To the west of that is Sukhāvatī, the world system of Amitābha.

original: de'i byang phyogs su me tog can zhes bya ba don yod grub pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams so //
analyzed: de'i byang phyogs su me tog can zhes bya ba don yod grub pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams so //
translated: To the north of that is Kusumāvatī, the world system of Amoghasiddhi.

original: de rnams kyi dbus su nam mkha' la mngon par dga' ba zhes bya ba mi bskyod pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing ngo //🔽de dang 'dra ba yang stong gsum dang stong chen po la sogs pa la ltos nas mtha' yas pa'i @136a * //
analyzed: de rnams kyi dbus su nam mkha' la mngon par dga' ba zhes bya ba mi bskyod pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing ngo // de dang 'dra ba yang stong gsum dang stong chen po la sogs pa la ltos nas mtha' yas pa'i @136a * //
translated: In the center of those is Abhirati, the buddhafield of Akṣobhya.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams so //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams so //
translated: Like that, there are infinite world systems in dependence on the trichiliocosm, the great trichiliocosm, and so on.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, it is said:

original: grangs med pa na zhes smos te /
analyzed: grangs med pa na zhes smos te /
translated: “in the countless.”

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' grangs med pa zhes bya ba ni rdzogs pa dang ma rdzogs pa'i dbye bas mtha' yas pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' grangs med pa zhes bya ba ni rdzogs pa dang ma rdzogs pa'i dbye bas mtha' yas pa'o //
translated: “Countless buddhas and bodhisattvas” are infinite in terms of the division of complete and incomplete.

original: chos kyi sku zhes pa ni khyab pa med pa'i chos nyid kyi ngo bos so //
analyzed: chos kyi sku zhes pa ni khyab pa med pa'i chos nyid kyi ngo bos so //
translated: The dharmakāya is so called because of the nature of the reality that is not all-pervading.

original: mi g-yo bas na zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyi rtag pas so //
analyzed: mi g-yo bas na zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyi rtag pas so //
translated: It is “unmoving” because of its intrinsic permanence.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skus zhes pa ni mtshan dang dpe byed kyis brgyan pa'i skus so //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skus zhes pa ni mtshan dang dpe byed kyis brgyan pa'i skus so //
translated: The sambhogakāya is so called because of its body adorned with the major and minor marks.

original: 'og min gyi gnas zhes pa ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin te /
analyzed: 'og min gyi gnas zhes pa ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin te /
translated: The Akaniṣṭha realm is merely an illustration;

original: mngon par dga' ba la sogs pa la sogs pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: mngon par dga' ba la sogs pa la sogs pa la yang ngo //
translated: it also refers to Abhirati and so on.

original: ston par mdzad pas zhes pa ni chos kyi bdud rtsi myang bas so //
analyzed: ston par mdzad pas zhes pa ni chos kyi bdud rtsi myang bas so //
translated: It is “taught” because of the experience of the nectar of Dharma.

original: rgyun mi 'chang par zhes pa ni tshim par byed pa ste /
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chang par zhes pa ni tshim par byed pa ste /
translated: It is “unceasing” because of its satisfaction,

original: mi 'jig rten pa'i rtag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'jig rten pa'i rtag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is permanent in the world.

original: sprul pa'i skus zhes pa ni spros pa'i 'khor gyis so //
analyzed: sprul pa'i skus zhes pa ni spros pa'i 'khor gyis so //
translated: The nirmāṇakāya is so called because of its retinue of emanations.

original: mtho ris ni bde 'gro'o //
analyzed: mtho ris ni bde 'gro'o //
translated: “Higher realms” refers to fortunate rebirths.

original: thar pa ni grol ba'o //
analyzed: thar pa ni grol ba'o //
translated: “Liberation” refers to freedom.

original: de dag bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bstan pas thab par mdzad pa ni sems can rnams thob par 'jug par mdzad pas so //
analyzed: de dag bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bstan pas thab par mdzad pa ni sems can rnams thob par 'jug par mdzad pas so //
translated: They are made to be purified by the teaching of the accumulations of merit and knowledge, because they are made to enter into the attainment of the accumulations.

original: rgyun gyi rtag pas na sprul pa'i su ni rtag pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyun gyi rtag pas na sprul pa'i su ni rtag pa yin no //
translated: Since they are continuous, the emanations are permanent.

original: de rnams zhes bya ba nas rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro zhing zhes pa'i bar du ni da lta bu'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpas gsang ba 'dus pa'i slob dpon la phyi'i mchod pa dang rang gi nang gi mchod pa la sogs pas dus🔽gsum du mchod par mdzad do //
analyzed: de rnams zhes bya ba nas rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro zhing zhes pa'i bar du ni da lta bu'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpas gsang ba 'dus pa'i slob dpon la phyi'i mchod pa dang rang gi nang gi mchod pa la sogs pas dus gsum du mchod par mdzad do //
translated: From those up to go to their own buddha-fields indicates that the buddhas and bodhisattvas of the present make offerings to the Guhyasamāja master with outer offerings, inner offerings, and so forth, and with the three times.

original: zhes bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bstan to //
translated: They make offerings to the master of the Guhyasamāja with the three times.

original: 'di skad du zhes bya ba nas go sla'o zhes pa'i bar du ni rdo rje slob dpon 'di bdag cag gi pha 'di bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di skad du zhes bya ba nas go sla'o zhes pa'i bar du ni rdo rje slob dpon 'di bdag cag gi pha 'di bya ba ste /
translated: From thus up to easy to understand indicates that after expressing the words of praise, This vajra master is our father,

original: sangs rgyas kyi theg pa rgyun ma chad par byed pas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bstod pa'i tshig brjod nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi theg pa rgyun ma chad par byed pas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bstod pa'i tshig brjod nas /
translated: because he makes the vehicle of the buddhas uninterrupted, and so forth,

original: yar ldog cing rang rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing du gshegs so zhes bstan to //
analyzed: yar ldog cing rang rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing du gshegs so zhes bstan to //
translated: and they returned to their own buddha-fields.

original: 'jigs shing zhes bya ba nas mi smra bar gyur to zhes pa'i bar du mchod par bya ba la the tshom ci dgos zhes bya bas ngo tsha dang bcas pa'i phyir byams pa cad mi smra bar gyur to zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'jigs shing zhes bya ba nas mi smra bar gyur to zhes pa'i bar du mchod par bya ba la the tshom ci dgos zhes bya bas ngo tsha dang bcas pa'i phyir byams pa cad mi smra bar gyur to zhes bstan to //
translated: From frightened up to remained silent shows that they remained silent out of shame, thinking, What doubt could there be about making offerings?

original: de ltar byams pa zhes bya ba nas pos so zhes pa'i bar du ni dkyil 'khor gyi bdag pos brgyan pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas /
analyzed: de ltar byams pa zhes bya ba nas pos so zhes pa'i bar du ni dkyil 'khor gyi bdag pos brgyan pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas /
translated: Thus, from Maitreya up to spoke shows that the lord of the maṇḍala, having entered into meditative concentration on the ornament,

original: rdo rje @136b 'chang chen po'i ngo bo khong du chung nas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams slar yang ston par mdzad de zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rdo rje @136b 'chang chen po'i ngo bo khong du chung nas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams slar yang ston par mdzad de zhes bstan to //
translated: having understood the essence of Great Vajradhara, again taught the tathāgatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhes bya ba nas shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni bcom ldan 'das kyis sprul pa'i sku gang yin pa de ni gang du gnas zhes byang chub sems dpa' zhu bar byas nas rgyud kyi dkyil 'khor bdag po mi
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhes bya ba nas shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni bcom ldan 'das kyis sprul pa'i sku gang yin pa de ni gang du gnas zhes byang chub sems dpa' zhu bar byas nas rgyud kyi dkyil 'khor bdag po mi
translated: From “The Tathāgatas” up to “in order to know” is the request by the bodhisattvas, “Where does the nirmāṇakāya of the Bhagavān abide?”

original: bskyod pa gang yin pa de'i sku la sogs pa la gnas te /
analyzed: bskyod pa gang yin pa de'i sku la sogs pa la gnas te /
translated: The reply by the tathāgatas is that it abides in the body, and so on, of Akṣobhya, the master of the tantra maṇḍala.🔽It is from him that they emanate.

original: de nyid las de rnams spro ba yin no zhes de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis lan btab pa dang gzhan yang dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po'i sku la sogs pa gang du gnas zhes zhus pa la gang du yang mi gnas so zhes lan btab pa dang /
analyzed: de nyid las de rnams spro ba yin no zhes de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis lan btab pa dang gzhan yang dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po'i sku la sogs pa gang du gnas zhes zhus pa la gang du yang mi gnas so zhes lan btab pa dang /
translated: Furthermore, the request is, “Where does the body, and so on, of the master of the maṇḍala abide?” The reply is, “It does not abide anywhere.”

original: 'od gsal ba zhes brjod par rigs na rang gi rig pa yin pas brjod par mi nus so zhes bya ba gang du yang ni gnas so zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba zhes brjod par rigs na rang gi rig pa yin pas brjod par mi nus so zhes bya ba gang du yang ni gnas so zhes bstan to //
translated: “It is reasonable to say that it is clear light, but because it is one’s vidyā, it cannot be expressed.”
