original: de ni ji ltar thob ce na bla ma'i man ngag las shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes pa ni shes rab ye shes kyi dbang bskur ba'i dus su bla ma'i zhal las 'od gsal ba nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni ji ltar thob ce na bla ma'i man ngag las shes par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes pa ni shes rab ye shes kyi dbang bskur ba'i dus su bla ma'i zhal las 'od gsal ba nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: This teaches that at the time of the wisdom-knowledge initiation, luminosity is obtained from the guru's mouth.

original: des ni rdo rje slob dpon gyi bka' drin gyis gang gi tshe rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang 'od gsal ba dang phyag rgya chen po'i rnam grangs thob na de'i tshe rgyu dang 'bras bu dbyer med pas de nyid rdo rje 'chang chen po yin no zhes
analyzed: des ni rdo rje slob dpon gyi bka' drin gyis gang gi tshe rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang 'od gsal ba dang phyag rgya chen po'i rnam grangs thob na de'i tshe rgyu dang 'bras bu dbyer med pas de nyid rdo rje 'chang chen po yin no zhes
translated: By the kindness of the vajra master, when the state of Great Vajradhara, which is luminosity and a synonym for the great seal, is obtained, at that time, because cause and effect are inseparable, that is Great Vajradhara.

original: bstan to // de ltar zhes bya ba nas 'di'i don ston pa yin no zhes pa'i bar du ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams ston pa rdo rje slob dpon la ngo mtshar du gyur pa dang / rdo rje 'chang gi go 'phang gi de rgyur gyur pa la rmad du gyur pa dang /
analyzed: bstan to // de ltar zhes bya ba nas 'di'i don ston pa yin no zhes pa'i bar du ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams ston pa rdo rje slob dpon la ngo mtshar du gyur pa dang / rdo rje 'chang gi go 'phang gi de rgyur gyur pa la rmad du gyur pa dang /
translated: Thus, from Thus... up to this is the meaning that is taught, the bodhisattvas are amazed at the teacher, the vajra master, and are amazed at the cause of the state of Vajradhara.

original: de bzhin du rdo rje slob dpon sangs rgyas la sogs pas bsnyen bkur du bya ba nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin du rdo rje slob dpon sangs rgyas la sogs pas bsnyen bkur du bya ba nyid du bstan to //
translated: Likewise, the vajra master is taught to be one who is to be honored by the buddhas, etc.

original: de yang 'grel pa mkhan gyis go sla bas na ma bshad do //
analyzed: de yang 'grel pa mkhan gyis go sla bas na ma bshad do //
translated: Moreover, the commentator has not explained it because it is easy to understand.

original: don 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpal sgyu 'phrul dra ba'i tshad ma nyid bstan to //
analyzed: don 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpal sgyu 'phrul dra ba'i tshad ma nyid bstan to //
translated: The phrase this meaning, etc. teaches the validity of the glorious Net of Illusion.

original: slob dpon ni rdo rje slob dpon no ;
analyzed: slob dpon ni rdo rje slob dpon no ;
translated: The master is the vajra master.

original: ; de ji ltar blta zhe na /
analyzed: ; de ji ltar blta zhe na /
translated: How is he to be seen?

original: zhes pa ni ji ltar shes par bya ste zhes 'dri ba la lan no //
analyzed: zhes pa ni ji ltar shes par bya ste zhes 'dri ba la lan no //
translated: This is the reply to the question, How is he to be known?

original: yon tan gyi tshogs dang ldan pas na bla ma'o //
analyzed: yon tan gyi tshogs dang ldan pas na bla ma'o //
translated: He is a guru because he is endowed with a multitude of good qualities.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad nye bar sdud par byed pas na sangs rgyas thams cad ste de dang mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad nye bar sdud par byed pas na sangs rgyas thams cad ste de dang mtshungs pa'o //
translated: He is all the buddhas because he is the same as they are, since he draws all the buddhas near.

original: rdo rje 'chang ni mi bskyod pa'o //🔽las @137a * //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang ni mi bskyod pa'o // las @137a * //
translated: The vajra holder is Akshobhya.

original: thams cad pa yin pas na /🔽kun ni don yod grub pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad pa yin pas na / kun ni don yod grub pa'o //
translated: He is all activities because🔽 he is Amoghasiddhi.

original: rgyal po ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal po ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: The king is Amitabha.

original: rin chen tog ni rin chen 'byung ldan no //
analyzed: rin chen tog ni rin chen 'byung ldan no //
translated: The jewel peak is Ratnasambhava.🔽

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: The Tathagata is Vairocana.

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa lnga dang pa drug pa rdo rje 'chang gi ngo bo rdo rje slob dpon bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa lnga dang pa drug pa rdo rje 'chang gi ngo bo rdo rje slob dpon bstan to //
translated: Thus, the vajra master is taught to be of the nature of the five Tathagatas and the sixth, Vajradhara.

original: de ltar gyur pa'i slob dpon ni rdo rje bla ma'i yon tan ni tshul khrims la sogs pa'i yon tan gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa'i slob dpon ni rdo rje bla ma'i yon tan ni tshul khrims la sogs pa'i yon tan gzung bar bya'o //
translated: The qualities of the vajra guru, such as morality, should be taken up by the master who is such.

original: skyon ni gang yang rung ba'i spyod pa ngan pa gzung bar mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: skyon ni gang yang rung ba'i spyod pa ngan pa gzung bar mi bya ba'o //
translated: The faults, such as any bad conduct, should not be taken up.

original: 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the result, it is said:

original: yon tan gyis ni dngos grub cing //🔽zhes smros te /
analyzed: yon tan gyis ni dngos grub cing // zhes smros te /
translated: By the qualities, there is power.🔽By the faults, there is the loss of power.

original: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub tu 'gyur ro //
translated: There is mundane and supramundane power.

original: skyon ni yod pa'am med pa bzung ba na sngar bshad pa'i dngos grub nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyon ni yod pa'am med pa bzung ba na sngar bshad pa'i dngos grub nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the faults are taken up, whether they exist or not, the previously explained power is lost.

original: de'i phyir ni rgyu de las so //🔽kun nas rab bsgrims te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ni rgyu de las so // kun nas rab bsgrims te /
translated: Therefore, from that cause means from that cause.

original: zhes pa ni lus dag yid kyis so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni lus dag yid kyis so //
translated: One should be completely attentive means with body, speech, and mind.

original: sangs rgyas nyid ni 'bras bu ste thob par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid ni 'bras bu ste thob par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Buddhahood is the result, because it is to be attained.

original: de 'dod pa ni de don du gnyer ba'i skyes bu rnams kyis so //
analyzed: de 'dod pa ni de don du gnyer ba'i skyes bu rnams kyis so //
translated: Those who desire it, i.e., those persons who seek it,

original: dad pas ni dang pa dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: dad pas ni dang pa dang ldan pas so //
translated: through faith, i.e., through possession of faith,

original: de ni rdo rje slob dpon no //
analyzed: de ni rdo rje slob dpon no //
translated: that is, the Vajra Master.

original: mchod cing ni mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: mchod cing ni mchod par bya'o //
translated: One should worship him,

original: gang gi phyir bsam pas 'bras bu ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bsam pas 'bras bu ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: because the result, which is characterized by perfect enlightenment, is produced by him,

original: smin byed pa ni ster bar byed pa de'i phyir mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: smin byed pa ni ster bar byed pa de'i phyir mchod par bya'o //
translated: and because he bestows it.

original: de bzhin du rin chen rgyal po zhes bya ba la sogs pas mdo sde tshad ma nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin du rin chen rgyal po zhes bya ba la sogs pas mdo sde tshad ma nyid du bstan to //
translated: Similarly, by the words “the King of Jewels, etc.” the authenticity of the sutra is taught.

original: au rgyan gyi ri ni byang phyogs kyi gnas kyi ri la'o //
analyzed: au rgyan gyi ri ni byang phyogs kyi gnas kyi ri la'o //
translated: The mountain of Uḍiyana is the mountain of the northern abode.

original: bcom ldan 'das lag na rdo rje zhes pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po de la bzhugs par gyur nas 'khor rnams la 'di skad gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das lag na rdo rje zhes pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po de la bzhugs par gyur nas 'khor rnams la 'di skad gsungs so //
translated: The Blessed One, Vajrapāṇi, i.e., Mahāvajradhara, having dwelt there, spoke to the assembly as follows.

original: rdo rje theg pa la slob par byed pa ni kye byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
analyzed: rdo rje theg pa la slob par byed pa ni kye byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
translated: The trainees in the Vajra Vehicle are the bodhisattvas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni bcom ldan 'das yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni bcom ldan 'das yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so //
translated: The Tathagata is the Lord, the Perfectly Enlightened One.

original: de re zhig yongs su mya ngan las 'das pas ston pa ni mi mthong na yang mngon sum du mi mthong pa'o //
analyzed: de re zhig yongs su mya ngan las 'das pas ston pa ni mi mthong na yang mngon sum du mi mthong pa'o //
translated: Since he has already passed into Nirvana, he is not seen as a teacher, but is not unseen.

original: de bas na rdo rje slob dpon ni 'jig rten pa la ston par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bas na rdo rje slob dpon ni 'jig rten pa la ston par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the Vajra Master is the teacher for the world,

original: des de'i ngo bo bstan ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des de'i ngo bo bstan ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because he reveals his essence.

original: rje btsun stong phrag brgya pa las kyang bya ba 'dis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las kyang lung tshad ma nyid @137b bstan te /
analyzed: rje btsun stong phrag brgya pa las kyang bya ba 'dis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las kyang lung tshad ma nyid @137b bstan te /
translated: In the Bhavanakrama Three, this is taught by the authority of the sutra, the Astasahasrika Prajnaparamita:

original: sangs rgyas kyi byang chub ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub po //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi byang chub ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub po //
translated: Buddha-enlightenment is perfect enlightenment.

original: dge ba ni thar pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba ni thar pa'o //
translated: Virtuous is liberation.

original: de thob par byed pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen te /
analyzed: de thob par byed pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen te /
translated: The spiritual friend who causes one to attain that is the spiritual friend.

original: rdo rje slob dpon no //
analyzed: rdo rje slob dpon no //
translated: He is the Vajra Master.

original: nye bar bsten pa zhes pa ni de la brten nas so //
analyzed: nye bar bsten pa zhes pa ni de la brten nas so //
translated: “Approaching” means in dependence on that.

original: de nas zhes bya ba nas gsungs te zhes pa'i bar du ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen pos dang po 'od gsal ba la bzhugs nas de nas cig car du bdag la byin gyi brlabs pa'i rim pa las langs te /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba nas gsungs te zhes pa'i bar du ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen pos dang po 'od gsal ba la bzhugs nas de nas cig car du bdag la byin gyi brlabs pa'i rim pa las langs te /
translated: Then, the Bhagavān, the Great Vajradhara, first dwelling in the clear light, then instantly rising from the stage of self-consecration,

original: mi bskyod pa phyung zhing rjes su zhugs nas zhe sdang rdo rjer gyur nas /
analyzed: mi bskyod pa phyung zhing rjes su zhugs nas zhe sdang rdo rjer gyur nas /
translated: extracting Akṣobhya, and entering, becoming the Vajra of Hatred,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ro mnyam pa'i bdag nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin la zhugs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ro mnyam pa'i bdag nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin la zhugs te /
translated: entered the samādhi of the nature of the equality of all tathāgatas.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi dkyil 'khor nyan pa'i dus su de bzhin gshegs pa rnams pos so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi dkyil 'khor nyan pa'i dus su de bzhin gshegs pa rnams pos so //
translated: At the time of listening to the maṇḍala of samādhi, the tathāgatas were addressed.

original: de rnams kyang bcom ldan 'das kyi rjes su gzung ba'i gsung gis mgu bas bcom ldan 'das ston cig ces bya ba'i de'i tshig gsan nas de ston pa'i phyir rtsom par gyur to zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de rnams kyang bcom ldan 'das kyi rjes su gzung ba'i gsung gis mgu bas bcom ldan 'das ston cig ces bya ba'i de'i tshig gsan nas de ston pa'i phyir rtsom par gyur to zhes bstan to //
translated: And they, pleased by the speech of the Bhagavān’s acceptance, said, “Bhagavān, teach!” Hearing those words of theirs, he began to teach.

original: nam mkha'i khams zhes bya ba nas bsam gtan gyi dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba'i du ni re zhig dang po rnal 'byor pas bdag la byin gyis brlabs pa'i rim pas bdag nyid rdo rje 'chang chen por bsgoms la mi bskyod pa phyung zhing rjes su zhugs nas thugs
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams zhes bya ba nas bsam gtan gyi dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba'i du ni re zhig dang po rnal 'byor pas bdag la byin gyis brlabs pa'i rim pas bdag nyid rdo rje 'chang chen por bsgoms la mi bskyod pa phyung zhing rjes su zhugs nas thugs
translated: The “realm of space” up to the “maṇḍala of meditative concentration” are the first stage of the yogi/nī who meditates on him/herself as Great Vajradhara through the stage of self-consecration, and then, having extracted Akṣobhya and caused him to enter, the mind

original: rdo rje bsams la /
analyzed: rdo rje bsams la /
translated: vajra is imagined.

original: de nyid phung po lnga'i bdag nyid de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid dang / spyan ma la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi khams bzhi'i ngo bo sku nyid dkyil 'khor du bsams la /
analyzed: de nyid phung po lnga'i bdag nyid de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid dang / spyan ma la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi khams bzhi'i ngo bo sku nyid dkyil 'khor du bsams la /
translated: That is the nature of the five aggregates, the nature of the five tathāgatas, and the nature of the four elements, such as Locanā, imagined as the body maṇḍala.

original: rim pa de nyid dkyil 'khor pa rnams kyang gnas ji lta ba bzhin du 'khor gyi tshul du bsams te /
analyzed: rim pa de nyid dkyil 'khor pa rnams kyang gnas ji lta ba bzhin du 'khor gyi tshul du bsams te /
translated: That very stage is also imagined as the maṇḍala, in the manner of a retinue, in their respective places.

original: rang gi snying ga'i padma'i lte bar rdo rje 'chad chen po bsams la /
analyzed: rang gi snying ga'i padma'i lte bar rdo rje 'chad chen po bsams la /
translated: Having imagined Great Vajradhara at the center of the lotus of one’s heart,

original: reg bya rdo rje mas 'khyud pa'i snyoms par zhugs pa'i bde ba myong zhing de'i padma'i nang du /
analyzed: reg bya rdo rje mas 'khyud pa'i snyoms par zhugs pa'i bde ba myong zhing de'i padma'i nang du /
translated: one experiences the bliss of union with Vajrarūpa, who embraces him.

original: lha sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis dkyil 'khor gyi bdag nyid bsgoms la de'i dbus kyi lte bar mi bskyod pa'i gzugs can slob ma la bcug nas snyoms par zhugs pa las bzhugs pa'i rtsa'i 'khor lo nas 'dzag pa byang chub kyi sems kyi rgyun gyi char dang /🔽de bzhin du srog dang rtsol ba la gnas pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems @138a * //
analyzed: lha sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis dkyil 'khor gyi bdag nyid bsgoms la de'i dbus kyi lte bar mi bskyod pa'i gzugs can slob ma la bcug nas snyoms par zhugs pa las bzhugs pa'i rtsa'i 'khor lo nas 'dzag pa byang chub kyi sems kyi rgyun gyi char dang / de bzhin du srog dang rtsol ba la gnas pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems @138a * //
translated: Having meditated on the nature of the mandala with the thirty-two deities, having placed the disciple, who has the form of Akṣobhya, in the center of the mandala, one should give the consecration of the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas who are in the prāṇa and āyāma, who are in union with the goddesses, in the form of a rain of the stream of bodhicitta, which is the dripping from the wheel of channels in the center of the mandala.

original: dpa' dang snyoms par zhugs pa de rnams slob ma de'i spyi bor dbang bskur sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: dpa' dang snyoms par zhugs pa de rnams slob ma de'i spyi bor dbang bskur sbyin par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should give the consecration of the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas who are in the prāṇa and āyāma, who are in union with the goddesses, on the head of the disciple.

original: dbang bskur ba 'di ni rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa rdzogs pa la nus pa yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba 'di ni rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa rdzogs pa la nus pa yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: This consecration is said to be the ability to perfect one’s own and others’ aims.

original: 'di ni rig pa'i dbang bskur ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni rig pa'i dbang bskur ba yin te /
translated: This is the consecration of knowledge,

original: rig ma'i padma'i nang du rtsol bas so //
analyzed: rig ma'i padma'i nang du rtsol bas so //
translated: because it is in the lotus of the knowledge consort by means of the āyāma.

original: gsang ba'i dbang bskur ba yang yin te /
analyzed: gsang ba'i dbang bskur ba yang yin te /
translated: This is also the secret consecration,

original: byang chub kyi sems kyis dbang bskur bas so //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyis dbang bskur bas so //
translated: because it is the consecration with bodhicitta.

original: shes rab kyi dbang bskur yang yin te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi dbang bskur yang yin te /
translated: It is also the consecration of wisdom,

original: shes rab kyi padma dang reg pas so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi padma dang reg pas so //
translated: because of the lotus of wisdom and the touch.

original: bla na med pa'i de kho na nyid thob pa bzhi pa yang ni de bzhin no zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i de kho na nyid thob pa bzhi pa yang ni de bzhin no zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: The fourth, the attainment of unsurpassed reality, should be understood in the same way.

original: gzhan yang gdug pa rnams zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gzhan yang gdug pa rnams zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Moreover, with regard to the passage beginning “the fierce one” up to

original: sbyor ba phul du byung ba'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba phul du byung ba'o //
translated: “the supreme application,”

original: zhes pa'i bar du ni le'u bcu gsum pa dang bcu bzhi pa'i yan lag tu gyur pa'i cho ga 'dis drag po'i las bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du ni le'u bcu gsum pa dang bcu bzhi pa'i yan lag tu gyur pa'i cho ga 'dis drag po'i las bsgom par bya ste /
translated: one should cultivate fierce activity through this ritual, which is a branch of the thirteenth and fourteenth chapters.

original: re zhig dang po rnal 'byor pas rang gi bdag nyid pags pa dang dus pa dang sha tha dad par bsgoms la yang gcig dang du ma bral bas de nyid stong par bsgoms te /
analyzed: re zhig dang po rnal 'byor pas rang gi bdag nyid pags pa dang dus pa dang sha tha dad par bsgoms la yang gcig dang du ma bral bas de nyid stong par bsgoms te /
translated: First, the practitioner should meditate on their own body as separate skin, flesh, and bones, and then, because of being free from one and many, meditate on that as empty.

original: rkang pa'i dkyil 'khor nas mgo bo'i bar //🔽bshang gci sogs kyis rab tu gang //
analyzed: rkang pa'i dkyil 'khor nas mgo bo'i bar // bshang gci sogs kyis rab tu gang //
translated: From the mandala of the feet up to the head,🔽filled with feces, urine, and so on,

original: rdul phra ba sogs dbye ba yis //
analyzed: rdul phra ba sogs dbye ba yis //
translated: analyzed by the categories of subtle particles,

original: rnam par dpyad na ngo bo med //
analyzed: rnam par dpyad na ngo bo med //
translated: and so on, it has no essence.

original: ces bya ba'i tshig gis de'i 'og tu lus ngag yid kyi bdag nyid yi ge gsum thams cad nag po'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i tshig gis de'i 'og tu lus ngag yid kyi bdag nyid yi ge gsum thams cad nag po'o //
translated: With the words “Then, the three syllables of the nature of body, speech, and mind are all black,”

original: h'um hrim kham zhes bya ba'i 'od zer gyi tshogs spro bar byas la /
analyzed: h'um hrim kham zhes bya ba'i 'od zer gyi tshogs spro bar byas la /
translated: one should emanate a mass of light rays from the hūṃ, hrīḥ, and khaṃ.

original: de yongs su gyur pa las byung ba'i kha dog sngon po drag po rdo rje spro ba dang bsdu ba'i rim gyis /
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa las byung ba'i kha dog sngon po drag po rdo rje spro ba dang bsdu ba'i rim gyis /
translated: Through the process of emanating and gathering the fierce blue-colored vajra that arises from their complete transformation,

original: de yongs su gyur pa las bcom ldan 'das rdo rje mkha' 'gro zhal gcig phyag bzhi pa kha dog sngon po g-yon brkyang ba gdug ba 'dul ba la brtson pa /
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa las bcom ldan 'das rdo rje mkha' 'gro zhal gcig phyag bzhi pa kha dog sngon po g-yon brkyang ba gdug ba 'dul ba la brtson pa /
translated: one should imagine the Bhagavat Vajraḍāka, with one face and four arms, his left leg extended, striving to subdue the wicked,

original: phyag g-yas pa la rtse gsum /
analyzed: phyag g-yas pa la rtse gsum /
translated: with a trident in his right hand,

original: gnyis pa la rdo rje /
analyzed: gnyis pa la rdo rje /
translated: a vajra in the second,

original: g-yon pa'i dang po la thod pa gnyis pa la mdud rtse gcig pa rdo rje phur bu 'dzin pa bsams la /
analyzed: g-yon pa'i dang po la thod pa gnyis pa la mdud rtse gcig pa rdo rje phur bu 'dzin pa bsams la /
translated: a skull cup in the first left hand, and a single-pointed khaṭvāṅga in the second left hand.

original: lce yang rtse lda'i rdo rje'i rnam pa can /
analyzed: lce yang rtse lda'i rdo rje'i rnam pa can /
translated: One’s tongue is in the form of a vajra.

original: lce re rer rlung la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po'i sa bon la ya ra la wa ha'i sa bon bkod nas de las byung pa'i 'od zer ldas bsgrub bya'i yan lag la sdig pa bzhin du zhugs par sbyar bas khrag ma lus pa dgug cing /🔽rang gi snying gar 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: lce re rer rlung la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po'i sa bon la ya ra la wa ha'i sa bon bkod nas de las byung pa'i 'od zer ldas bsgrub bya'i yan lag la sdig pa bzhin du zhugs par sbyar bas khrag ma lus pa dgug cing / rang gi snying gar 'jug par bya'o //
translated: Having arranged the seed syllables of the great elements such as wind and so on, ya ra la wa ha, on each tongue, the light rays from those draw out all the blood of the victim as if it were a sin, and it enters one’s heart.🔽At that time, the enemy dies.

original: de'i tshe dgra bo 'chi bar 'gyur ba @138b dang gzhan yang ting nge 'dzin de nyid kyis bsgrub bya'i snying ga rtse gsum gyis dral la /
analyzed: de'i tshe dgra bo 'chi bar 'gyur ba @138b dang gzhan yang ting nge 'dzin de nyid kyis bsgrub bya'i snying ga rtse gsum gyis dral la /
translated: Moreover, by that very samādhi, the heart of the victim is torn apart with a trident,

original: rdo rjes 'og dang rdo rje phur bus yan lag thams cad kyi tshigs dral la /
analyzed: rdo rjes 'og dang rdo rje phur bus yan lag thams cad kyi tshigs dral la /
translated: the lower part is split with a vajra, and all the joints of the limbs are split with a vajra dagger.

original: sngar bshad pa'i sa bon lnga po'i 'od zer gyis yan lag thams cad la khyab pa'i khrag dgug cing thod pa la bzhag ste de las btung bar bya'o//
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i sa bon lnga po'i 'od zer gyis yan lag thams cad la khyab pa'i khrag dgug cing thod pa la bzhag ste de las btung bar bya'o//
translated: The light rays of the five seed syllables explained above pervade all the limbs, drawing out the blood and placing it in the skull cup, and one should drink from it.

original: de'i tshe dgra bo 'chi bar 'gyur ro /
analyzed: de'i tshe dgra bo 'chi bar 'gyur ro /
translated: At that time, the enemy dies.

original: zhes bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bstan to //
translated: Thus it is explained.

original: de nas zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Then,

original: 'di ni nang gi sbyin sreg go //
analyzed: 'di ni nang gi sbyin sreg go //
translated: this is the inner fire sacrifice.

original: zhes pa'i bar du ni kha zas kyi dus su rnal 'byor pas bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa bdud rtsi lnga'i chogs bskyed la snying gar ye shes sems pa me lce spro ba bsams la /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du ni kha zas kyi dus su rnal 'byor pas bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa bdud rtsi lnga'i chogs bskyed la snying gar ye shes sems pa me lce spro ba bsams la /
translated: Having imagined the wisdom-being at the heart, the flame should be emitted.

original: mgrin par padma 'dab ma brgyad pa dang 'dra ba'i lce'i padma'i 'dab man dang 'dra ba yang kha yang thab dang 'dra ba gang /
analyzed: mgrin par padma 'dab ma brgyad pa dang 'dra ba'i lce'i padma'i 'dab man dang 'dra ba yang kha yang thab dang 'dra ba gang /
translated: The tongue should be imagined as a lotus with eight petals, like the lotus of the throat, with the mouth like a hearth.

original: lag pa gnyis dgang gzar dang blugs gzar du bsams te spyad par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: lag pa gnyis dgang gzar dang blugs gzar du bsams te spyad par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: The two hands should be imagined as the ladle and the spoon, and one should eat.

original: 'dir nye bar dgos pa'i bza' ba dang btung ba dkyil 'khor bzhis dbye bar byas pa sha dang khu bla sogs pa'i rang bzhin ni khams nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i ngo bor yongs su gyur par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir nye bar dgos pa'i bza' ba dang btung ba dkyil 'khor bzhis dbye bar byas pa sha dang khu bla sogs pa'i rang bzhin ni khams nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i ngo bor yongs su gyur par bsam par bya'o //
translated: Here, the food and drink that are necessary should be divided into four maṇḍalas, and the nature of the meat, soup, etc. should be imagined as the essence of the twenty-four elements.

original: lhag ma zhes bya ba ni yongs su gyur pa las 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: lhag ma zhes bya ba ni yongs su gyur pa las 'byung ba'o //
translated: The “remainder” arises from the transformation.

original: bshad pa dang gci ba'i dngos por zhes pa ni me yongs su gtong pa'i thal ba'i ngo bor yongs su gyur par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: bshad pa dang gci ba'i dngos por zhes pa ni me yongs su gtong pa'i thal ba'i ngo bor yongs su gyur par bsam par bya'o //
translated: The words “the substance of feces and urine” should be understood as referring to the ashes that are the result of the fire’s complete consumption of the fuel.

original: lha mo bzhis yongs su zhus pa'i rgyud las kyang /
analyzed: lha mo bzhis yongs su zhus pa'i rgyud las kyang /
translated: The Tantra Requested by the Four Goddesses also says:

original: rlung gis me ni sbar bya ba //
analyzed: rlung gis me ni sbar bya ba //
translated: The wind kindles the fire.

original: chus ni yongs su smin par byed //
analyzed: chus ni yongs su smin par byed //
translated: Water brings it to maturity.

original: dbang chen gyis ni dkyil 'khor gnas //
analyzed: dbang chen gyis ni dkyil 'khor gnas //
translated: The great elements are the site of the maṇḍala.

original: gang du sreg blugs kun du spyod //
analyzed: gang du sreg blugs kun du spyod //
translated: Wherever the fire sacrifice is performed,

original: bza' dang btung ba gang yin pa //
analyzed: bza' dang btung ba gang yin pa //
translated: all the food and drink

original: de dag thams cad 'dzin par byed //🔽kha yi padma bza' ba ste //
analyzed: de dag thams cad 'dzin par byed // kha yi padma bza' ba ste //
translated: are held there.🔽The food is in the lotus of the mouth.

original: mgrin pa'i padma 'jug par byed //
analyzed: mgrin pa'i padma 'jug par byed //
translated: It enters the lotus of the throat.

original: snying ga'i padma las byung zhing //
analyzed: snying ga'i padma las byung zhing //
translated: Arising from the lotus of the heart,

original: lte ba'i padmar 'dzin par byed //
analyzed: lte ba'i padmar 'dzin par byed //
translated: it is held in the lotus of the navel.

original: bshad sgo padma las byung zhing //
analyzed: bshad sgo padma las byung zhing //
translated: Arising from the lotus of the door of explanation,

original: de ni thal bar rtogs par bya //🔽zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de ni thal bar rtogs par bya // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: it is understood as ashes.

original: de ni las kyi rgyal ba mchog go //
analyzed: de ni las kyi rgyal ba mchog go //
translated: This is the supreme victory of action.

original: ting nge 'dzin gso ba'i yan lag go //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gso ba'i yan lag go //
translated: This is the limb of nourishing meditative concentration.

original: de nas zhes bya ba nas 'da' bar mi bya'o zhes pa'i bar du ni sems can thams cad dang bdag nyid kyang rang gi yi dam gyi lha'i rnam par bsgoms la mchod par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba nas 'da' bar mi bya'o zhes pa'i bar du ni sems can thams cad dang bdag nyid kyang rang gi yi dam gyi lha'i rnam par bsgoms la mchod par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: Then up to should not transgress teaches that one should meditate on all sentient beings and oneself in the form of one's pledged deity and make offerings.

original: de ltar nyin re'i dam tshig ni rnal 'byor pa thams cad kyi yin no //🔽las kyi rgyal ba mchog @139a * //
analyzed: de ltar nyin re'i dam tshig ni rnal 'byor pa thams cad kyi yin no // las kyi rgyal ba mchog @139a * //
translated: Thus, the daily commitments are for all yogis.

original: gi ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: gi ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The samadhi of Karma-Uttara-Raja.

original: de ltar thun mong gi mchod pa bstan nas zhes bya ba nas sangs rgyas kyi byang chub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni phyag rgya legs par sbyangs pa sngon pa sngon du 'gro bar rdo rje dang padma snyoms par 'jug par byas la /
analyzed: de ltar thun mong gi mchod pa bstan nas zhes bya ba nas sangs rgyas kyi byang chub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni phyag rgya legs par sbyangs pa sngon pa sngon du 'gro bar rdo rje dang padma snyoms par 'jug par byas la /
translated: Having thus taught the common offerings, from thus up to attains the enlightenment of Buddhahood teaches that one should first train well in the mudra, and then enter into union with the vajra and lotus.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'jug pa yongs su 'gyur pa'i byang chub kyi sems dbus ma'i lam rdo rje'i lam nas 'byung ba phyag rgya'i chos 'byung gi nang du sna tshogs padma dang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du spros pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'jug pa yongs su 'gyur pa'i byang chub kyi sems dbus ma'i lam rdo rje'i lam nas 'byung ba phyag rgya'i chos 'byung gi nang du sna tshogs padma dang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du spros pa /
translated: The bodhicitta of the transformation of the entry of all tathāgatas arises from the middle path of the vajra path and is emanated above the variegated lotus and moon mandala in the interior of the dharma-dhātu-cakra.

original: bu dang tsha bo lta bu sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor bskyod la /
analyzed: bu dang tsha bo lta bu sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor bskyod la /
translated: The maṇḍala of buddhas and bodhisattvas, like sons and grandsons, are invited.

original: srung ba dang rgyas pa la sogs pa'i cho ga zhes pa ni sems dpa' gsum gyi gcig gi bdag nyid dang / dbang bskur ba dang rgyas gdab pa la sogs pa'i bya bas dkyil 'khor du shar phyogs la sogs pa'i rim gyis gzung ba ni gzhag par bya'o zhes bstan to ;
analyzed: srung ba dang rgyas pa la sogs pa'i cho ga zhes pa ni sems dpa' gsum gyi gcig gi bdag nyid dang / dbang bskur ba dang rgyas gdab pa la sogs pa'i bya bas dkyil 'khor du shar phyogs la sogs pa'i rim gyis gzung ba ni gzhag par bya'o zhes bstan to ;
translated: The rite of protection, increase, and so on is taught to be the placement of the maṇḍala by the activity of the consecration and sealing of the identity of one of the three beings and the retention of the maṇḍala in the east and so on.

original: ; de ni dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: ; de ni dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: That is the samādhi called “the supreme victor maṇḍala.”

original: de ltar bdag dang gzhan la mchod pa bstan nas zhes bya ba nas phul du byung ba'o zhes bya ba'i bar du sems can gyi khams rnam pa bzhi dang ldan pa'i sa'i khams ni lus kyi legs par spyod pa mchod pa la sogs pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar bdag dang gzhan la mchod pa bstan nas zhes bya ba nas phul du byung ba'o zhes bya ba'i bar du sems can gyi khams rnam pa bzhi dang ldan pa'i sa'i khams ni lus kyi legs par spyod pa mchod pa la sogs pa dang /
translated: Having thus explained the worship of self and others, up to “excellent” is the samādhi of the supreme victor of action, “The element of earth endowed with four aspects of the realm of sentient beings should be taken as the virtue of the body, such as worship, and so on;

original: ngag gi bde ba la bstan pa dang smin pa la sogs pa dang / yid kyi dge ba byams pa la sogs pa'i tshangs pa'i gnas kyi rjes su gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad sdu bar byed pa 'dus pa'i dam tshig phul du byung yin no zhes las kyi rgyal ba mchog gi ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: ngag gi bde ba la bstan pa dang smin pa la sogs pa dang / yid kyi dge ba byams pa la sogs pa'i tshangs pa'i gnas kyi rjes su gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad sdu bar byed pa 'dus pa'i dam tshig phul du byung yin no zhes las kyi rgyal ba mchog gi ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: the virtue of speech, such as teaching and ripening, and so on; and the virtue of the mind, such as love and so on, the bases of the pure abodes.”

original: de ltar mchod pa'i rnam par zhes bya ba nas dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni ji srid sngar bshad pa'i mchod pa'i cho ga de dag thams cad sbyin par bya ba dang spyin pa po dang / len pa po dang /
analyzed: de ltar mchod pa'i rnam par zhes bya ba nas dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni ji srid sngar bshad pa'i mchod pa'i cho ga de dag thams cad sbyin par bya ba dang spyin pa po dang / len pa po dang /
translated: Thus, from “the form of offering” up to “because it has a reference,” all of these previously explained offering rites are the giving of gifts by the giver to the receiver.

original: mchod par bya ba dang mchod pa po dang mi dmigs pas 'di dag thams cad 'od bsal ba'i rang bzhin yin no zhes lhag par mos par bya'o //
analyzed: mchod par bya ba dang mchod pa po dang mi dmigs pas 'di dag thams cad 'od bsal ba'i rang bzhin yin no zhes lhag par mos par bya'o //
translated: Thus, from “the form of worship” up to “because it has an objective reference,” all of these previously explained ritual forms of worship should be given, and the giver, the receiver,🔽and the worshipper should not be objectified.

original: gzhan du na dmigs pa dang bcas pas bsod nams kyi tshogs su yang mi 'gyur gyi ye shes kyi tshogs @139b la lta ci smos zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gzhan du na dmigs pa dang bcas pas bsod nams kyi tshogs su yang mi 'gyur gyi ye shes kyi tshogs @139b la lta ci smos zhes bstan to //
translated: Otherwise, because it has an objective reference, it would not even be a collection of merit, much less a collection of intuition.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba nas phan yon no zhes pa'i bar du ni bsgoms pas dub pa'i rnal 'byor pas spyi bor mtho gang tsam gyi nam mkha'i kha dog dkar po yi ge wam yongs su gyur pa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor bsams la de'i dkyil du thur
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba nas phan yon no zhes pa'i bar du ni bsgoms pas dub pa'i rnal 'byor pas spyi bor mtho gang tsam gyi nam mkha'i kha dog dkar po yi ge wam yongs su gyur pa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor bsams la de'i dkyil du thur
translated: The passage from “thus” up to “benefit” teaches that a yogin who is tired of meditation should imagine a white space the color of the letter vaṃ one hand span above the crown, which transforms into a moon mandala.🔽In its center he should visualize the syllable oṃ, which is the downward-facing blazing syllable.

original: du 'chang ba 'bar ba'i yi ge aom bkod nas de bzhus par gyur pa de las 'bab chu'i rgyun gyi rnam pa bdud rtsi'i char gyis tshangs pa'i sgo nas rkang pa'i dkyil gyi bar du rtsa kun du spyod pa'i rim gyis tshim par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: du 'chang ba 'bar ba'i yi ge aom bkod nas de bzhus par gyur pa de las 'bab chu'i rgyun gyi rnam pa bdud rtsi'i char gyis tshangs pa'i sgo nas rkang pa'i dkyil gyi bar du rtsa kun du spyod pa'i rim gyis tshim par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: From that, a stream of water in the aspect of a rain of nectar falls from the aperture of Brahmā down to the center of the feet, satisfying the entire body through the channel that pervades the body.

original: 'di yang las kyi rgyal ba'i mchog nyid ngo //
analyzed: 'di yang las kyi rgyal ba'i mchog nyid ngo //
translated: This is also the supreme victorious activity.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa rtog pa zhes bya ba nas dgag pa med do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pas mchod rten gyi las dang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa la phyag 'tshal ba
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa rtog pa zhes bya ba nas dgag pa med do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pas mchod rten gyi las dang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa la phyag 'tshal ba
translated: The stage of completion is not conceptual, up to and not prohibited, for the yogi who abides in the stage of union, the activities of the stupa, prostration to the buddhas and bodhisattvas,

original: dang mandala gyi bya ba dang glegs bam la sogs pa klog par mi bya ste /
analyzed: dang mandala gyi bya ba dang glegs bam la sogs pa klog par mi bya ste /
translated: and the activities of mandala and reading scriptures and so on are not performed.

original: rang gi sku'i dkyil 'khor mchod rten la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir dang / rdo rje bzlas pa la chags pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin la g-yeng bar byed pa 'bras bu med pa de rnams de la ci dgos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang gi sku'i dkyil 'khor mchod rten la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir dang / rdo rje bzlas pa la chags pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin la g-yeng bar byed pa 'bras bu med pa de rnams de la ci dgos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because his body mandala is the nature of the stupa and so on, and because he is attached to vajra repetition, what need does he have for those which distract his concentration and are fruitless?

original: de la btul zhugs ma brtan te //
analyzed: de la btul zhugs ma brtan te //
translated: He is not firm in his vows,

original: bgrang phreng ma yin bsdams pa min //
analyzed: bgrang phreng ma yin bsdams pa min //
translated: not a rosary, not a restraint,🔽not a holder, not a burnt offering, not an activity,

original: 'dzin dang sbyin sreg las rnams dang // gzhan dang gzhan la 'jug pa min //🔽zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'dzin dang sbyin sreg las rnams dang // gzhan dang gzhan la 'jug pa min //🔽zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: not engaged in one thing or another.

original: sems can gyi don bya ba'i phyir yang 'di ngag rjes su bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi don bya ba'i phyir yang 'di ngag rjes su bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: For the sake of benefiting sentient beings, one should also accomplish this speech.

original: rnam pa thams cad du mngon par zhen pas ni ma yin no zhes bstan ta //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du mngon par zhen pas ni ma yin no zhes bstan ta //
translated: But not by any means by attachment.

original: le'u bco lnga pa zhes bya ba nas shes par bya'o zhes pa'i bar du ni yi ge aom yongs su gyur pa las 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor du bstan pa dang g-yo ba la sogs pa'i dug gis zin pa'i bsgrub bya la /
analyzed: le'u bco lnga pa zhes bya ba nas shes par bya'o zhes pa'i bar du ni yi ge aom yongs su gyur pa las 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor du bstan pa dang g-yo ba la sogs pa'i dug gis zin pa'i bsgrub bya la /
translated: Up to the fifteenth chapter, it is taught that from the transformation of the syllable OṀ, one should visualize a wheel maṇḍala, and for a disciple afflicted by moving and so forth poisons,

original: de bzhin du spyi bor kha dog dkar po'i 'khor los mnan par byas te /
analyzed: de bzhin du spyi bor kha dog dkar po'i 'khor los mnan par byas te /
translated: one should visualize a white wheel on the crown of the head, pressing down.

original: kha sbyor gnyis ga las 'byung ba'i 'od zer dkar po'i tshogs kyis de'i lus la kha dog ser po'i dug sel bar bya'o zhes pa ni dug sel ba'o //🔽'khor lo ser po de dag gis dug rengs par bya ba dang 'khor lo nag po de dag gis gcig las dgug cing @140a * //
analyzed: kha sbyor gnyis ga las 'byung ba'i 'od zer dkar po'i tshogs kyis de'i lus la kha dog ser po'i dug sel bar bya'o zhes pa ni dug sel ba'o // 'khor lo ser po de dag gis dug rengs par bya ba dang 'khor lo nag po de dag gis gcig las dgug cing @140a * //
translated: By a mass of white light rays coming from both unions, one should remove the yellow poison from the body. This is the removal of poison.

original: gzhan du 'pho bar bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gzhan du 'pho bar bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: By those yellow wheels, one should paralyze the poison. By those black wheels, one should summon from one place and transfer to another. This is taught.

original: dug bsal ba las 'grub pa'i bka' gzhan bri bar bya ste /🔽ae s'a s'a gha re ne we mi la ra mo ta ki sa dz'a he re bha do aa da khe n'a dhe s'a dz'a he su dzan ka la da thu we sam kh'a me we sam be b'a me we se na ma dza nu li wa nam
analyzed: dug bsal ba las 'grub pa'i bka' gzhan bri bar bya ste / ae s'a s'a gha re ne we mi la ra mo ta ki sa dz'a he re bha do aa da khe n'a dhe s'a dz'a he su dzan ka la da thu we sam kh'a me we sam be b'a me we se na ma dza nu li wa nam
translated: I will write down another proclamation that is accomplished from removing poison.🔽e sāsā ghare ne vimila ra motaka sasā he rebhado a dhakhenādhasā sasā he sujankaladhūbhave samkham evaṃ bhave se na majajñulī vanam

original: ka ru me he le he le mu ta ma tang be sv'a h'a /
analyzed: ka ru me he le he le mu ta ma tang be sv'a h'a /
translated: karume he le he le mutamangave svāhā.

original: de brjod pa tsam gyi dug sel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de brjod pa tsam gyi dug sel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By merely reciting that, poison is removed.

original: de'i sngon gyi bsnyen pa la sogs pa mi dgos te brjod pa tsam gyis grub pa'i phyir ro zhes the tshom med do //
analyzed: de'i sngon gyi bsnyen pa la sogs pa mi dgos te brjod pa tsam gyis grub pa'i phyir ro zhes the tshom med do //
translated: There is no doubt that it is accomplished by mere recitation, without the need for prior service and so forth.

original: rengs pa la dug gi cha lnga pa rang nye bar spyod cing cha drug pa sngags 'dis gang la sbyin pa de la rengs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rengs pa la dug gi cha lnga pa rang nye bar spyod cing cha drug pa sngags 'dis gang la sbyin pa de la rengs par 'gyur te /
translated: For paralysis, one should use one-fifth of the poison for oneself and give the other six parts with this mantra to whomever, and they will be paralyzed.

original: hri wi h'am wi hum tha tha tha stam pa ya stam pa ya /
analyzed: hri wi h'am wi hum tha tha tha stam pa ya stam pa ya /
translated: hṛīṃ hāṃ vī hūṃ tha tha tha tha stampaya stampaya

original: de ni bka'i sngags te brjod pa tsam gyis grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ni bka'i sngags te brjod pa tsam gyis grub pa nyid do //
translated: That is the mantra of the proclamation, which is accomplished by mere recitation.

original: 'pho ba la cho ga 'di nyid yin no //🔽de ltar zhes bya ba nas ba spu bsdus shing btus pa'o zhes pa'i bar du ni bdag nyid bdud rtsi 'khyil par bsams te gi wang dang gur kum gyis dri ma med pa'i gro ga la sogs pa la rdo rje rgya gram gyi cha zungs la rtsibs brgyad
analyzed: 'pho ba la cho ga 'di nyid yin no // de ltar zhes bya ba nas ba spu bsdus shing btus pa'o zhes pa'i bar du ni bdag nyid bdud rtsi 'khyil par bsams te gi wang dang gur kum gyis dri ma med pa'i gro ga la sogs pa la rdo rje rgya gram gyi cha zungs la rtsibs brgyad
translated: This very rite is for transference.🔽As such up to the pores are gathered and collected means that one should imagine oneself as Amṛtakuṇḍali. On stainless birchbark, etc., with guggulu and saffron, one should draw a vajra cross, and in the center, the syllable haṃ together with the name of the person for whom the rite is performed.

original: pa'i 'khor lo bris te dbus su yi ge ham bsgrub bya'i ming dang bcas pa dang / rtsibs rnams la yang aom hu lu hu lu ti shtha bandha bandha ha na ha na da ha da ha aa mri te phat /
analyzed: pa'i 'khor lo bris te dbus su yi ge ham bsgrub bya'i ming dang bcas pa dang / rtsibs rnams la yang aom hu lu hu lu ti shtha bandha bandha ha na ha na da ha da ha aa mri te phat /
translated: On the eight spokes, one should write:🔽oṃ hulu hulu tiṣṭha bandha bandha hana hana daha daha amṛte phaṭ

original: de ltar bris nas srad bu dkar pos bcings la rgya skyegs dang lcags gsum gyis bskor zhing za ma tog la sogs par bzhag nas tshes gcig nas brtsams te nya'i par du mchod pa rnam pa lngas mchod cing de las bton te /
analyzed: de ltar bris nas srad bu dkar pos bcings la rgya skyegs dang lcags gsum gyis bskor zhing za ma tog la sogs par bzhag nas tshes gcig nas brtsams te nya'i par du mchod pa rnam pa lngas mchod cing de las bton te /
translated: Having written that, one should tie it with a white thread and surround it with lac and the three metals. Having placed it in a box, etc., beginning on the first day of the month, one should make offerings with the five offerings until the full moon.

original: bsgrub bya'i dpung pa la btags na de'i tshe rims la sogs pa nad rnams dang bgegs dang dgra rnams gnod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: bsgrub bya'i dpung pa la btags na de'i tshe rims la sogs pa nad rnams dang bgegs dang dgra rnams gnod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: If it is tied to the arm of the one to be protected, then at that time the diseases such as plague and so on, the obstructors, and the enemies will not cause harm.

original: da ni zhes bya ba nas kun du bzang pos gsungs so zhes pa'i bar du ni thod pa'i gdan la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pas srung pa'i 'khor lo'i phyogs bcings la thod pa'i sgyed pu'i steng du zhag gis bkang pa'i thod pa bzhag nas de'i steng du chang
analyzed: da ni zhes bya ba nas kun du bzang pos gsungs so zhes pa'i bar du ni thod pa'i gdan la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pas srung pa'i 'khor lo'i phyogs bcings la thod pa'i sgyed pu'i steng du zhag gis bkang pa'i thod pa bzhag nas de'i steng du chang
translated: Now, up to Samantabhadra has spoken, the yogī who is situated on the skull seat should bind the directions of the protection wheel, place the skull filled with fat on the tripod of skulls, and place the vessel filled with beer

original: gis bkang ba'i snod bzhag la bdud rtsi lngas bskus pa'i shing aa rga dang padma'i snal mas sdod bu byas te /
analyzed: gis bkang ba'i snod bzhag la bdud rtsi lngas bskus pa'i shing aa rga dang padma'i snal mas sdod bu byas te /
translated: on top of that. Having anointed it with the five elixirs, make a wick with the wood of the arka tree and lotus fibers.

original: khro bo'i gzugs kyis mar do'i tshes bcu bzhi'i mtshan phyed kyi dus su du ba blangs nas 'khor lo'i bdag po'i sngags brgya @140b rtsa brgyad bzlas pas sngon du 'gro bar ras la bsdus te /
analyzed: khro bo'i gzugs kyis mar do'i tshes bcu bzhi'i mtshan phyed kyi dus su du ba blangs nas 'khor lo'i bdag po'i sngags brgya @140b rtsa brgyad bzlas pas sngon du 'gro bar ras la bsdus te /
translated: With an angry form, at midnight on the fourteenth of the waning fortnight, take up the wick, and having recited the mantra of the lord of the wheel one hundred and eight times, gather it on the cloth.

original: srung skud dmar pos bcings la /
analyzed: srung skud dmar pos bcings la /
translated: Bind it with a red protection cord.

original: snga ma bzhin du za ma tog la sogs par mchod cing des bsku ba'i dmig dang bcas pa rnam pa gsum gyi dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du za ma tog la sogs par mchod cing des bsku ba'i dmig dang bcas pa rnam pa gsum gyi dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: As before, one should worship in a box, etc., and one will attain the powers of the three kinds of knowledge, which are conferred by that.

original: de las zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam pa gsum gyi dngos grub kyi bshad pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam pa gsum gyi dngos grub kyi bshad pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The explanation of the three kinds of powers beginning with from that is easy to understand.

original: de nas sdud par byed pa zhes bya ba nas mi gsung bar bzhugs so zhes pa ni gang zhig dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po dang par byed par dang thos pa la sogs pa'i rim pas mngon du byed pa /
analyzed: de nas sdud par byed pa zhes bya ba nas mi gsung bar bzhugs so zhes pa ni gang zhig dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po dang par byed par dang thos pa la sogs pa'i rim pas mngon du byed pa /
translated: Then, the one called the compiler, up to he sat down without speaking, is that one who is the king of the glorious Guhyasamaja tantras, and who actualizes it by the stages of hearing, etc.

original: de rnams gang gis byin gyis brlabs pa zhes 'dri ba la /
analyzed: de rnams gang gis byin gyis brlabs pa zhes 'dri ba la /
translated: By whom is he blessed?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gsum gyis zhes lan bstan po //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gsum gyis zhes lan bstan po //
translated: The answer is by the three Tathagatas.

original: yang de rnams gang yin zhe na zhes zhus pa la sku rdo rje la sogs pa zhes lan btab nas the tshom dang bral bas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyang mi gsung bar gyur to zhes bstan to ;🔽; de ltar zhes bya ba nas thams cad mkhyen pa'i phun sum tshogs pa dang lngan par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i bar du ni bskal pa du ma 'das pa'i dus su de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mya ngan las 'das pa gang yin pa de rnams kyi rgyud kyi
analyzed: yang de rnams gang yin zhe na zhes zhus pa la sku rdo rje la sogs pa zhes lan btab nas the tshom dang bral bas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyang mi gsung bar gyur to zhes bstan to ; ; de ltar zhes bya ba nas thams cad mkhyen pa'i phun sum tshogs pa dang lngan par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i bar du ni bskal pa du ma 'das pa'i dus su de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mya ngan las 'das pa gang yin pa de rnams kyi rgyud kyi
translated: Again, if one asks, What are they? the reply is the vajra body and so forth, and thus, being free from doubt, the Tathagatas also became silent.

original: rgyal po 'di ma gsungs te /
analyzed: rgyal po 'di ma gsungs te /
translated: Thus, and so forth up to the perfection of omniscience indicates that in the past, for many eons, the Tathagatas who had attained nirvana did not teach this king of tantras.

original: dus de tsam la mos pa dman pa yin pa sems can gyi khams pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pas 'dul ba yin gyi sngags kyi theg pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dus de tsam la mos pa dman pa yin pa sems can gyi khams pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pas 'dul ba yin gyi sngags kyi theg pas ni ma yin no //
translated: At that time, those of inferior aspiration were the realm of sentient beings to be disciplined by the vehicle of the perfections, but not by the vehicle of mantra.

original: de lta'i dus dang snyigs ma lnga dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug che bas pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul gyis 'grub par mi 'gyur bas /
analyzed: de lta'i dus dang snyigs ma lnga dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug che bas pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul gyis 'grub par mi 'gyur bas /
translated: At that time, sentient beings who have the five degenerations have great attachment, aversion, and confusion, so they will not be able to accomplish [the result] by the method of the perfections.

original: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang gis chags bral gyi dug spangs nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang gis chags bral gyi dug spangs nas /
translated: Therefore, the Bhagavān Vajradhara, having abandoned the poison of detachment,

original: sgeg pa'i nyams gtso bor gyur pa'i sku spros la 'dod chags kyi 'dod chags spong ba'i don du dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud bstan to //
analyzed: sgeg pa'i nyams gtso bor gyur pa'i sku spros la 'dod chags kyi 'dod chags spong ba'i don du dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud bstan to //
translated: taught the glorious Guhyasamāja Tantra for the purpose of abandoning attachment to attachment, with a body in which the experience of grace is primary, emanating in a way that is elaborate.

original: bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyi byang chub sems dpa' byang chub thob pa gang yin pa de ni tshe 'di nyid du skad cig dang thad cig yud tsam dang mig btsums pa dang / thal mo rdebs pa tsam gyis sngags kyi theg pa chen po bas thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyi byang chub sems dpa' byang chub thob pa gang yin pa de ni tshe 'di nyid du skad cig dang thad cig yud tsam dang mig btsums pa dang / thal mo rdebs pa tsam gyis sngags kyi theg pa chen po bas thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: It teaches that what is attained by a bodhisattva in three countless eons is attained in this very lifetime in an instant, a moment, a second, a wink of the eye, or a snap of the fingers, by the method of the Great Vehicle of Mantra.

original: nang gi mngon par byang chub pa'i @141a * //
analyzed: nang gi mngon par byang chub pa'i @141a * //
translated: Inner manifest enlightenment

original: rim gyis zhes pa ni mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa ni rnam pa gnyis te phyi'i mngon par byang chub ba dang / nang gi mngon par byang chub pa'o //
analyzed: rim gyis zhes pa ni mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa ni rnam pa gnyis te phyi'i mngon par byang chub ba dang / nang gi mngon par byang chub pa'o //
translated: The gradual refers to the two kinds of enlightenment: external enlightenment and internal enlightenment.

original: de'i phyi'i mngon par byang chub pa ni srod nas snang ba'i ye shes so //🔽nyin mor snang ba mched pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de'i phyi'i mngon par byang chub pa ni srod nas snang ba'i ye shes so // nyin mor snang ba mched pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The external enlightenment is the knowledge of appearance from dusk until dawn.🔽The knowledge of increase of appearance is from dawn until noon.🔽The knowledge of the attainment of appearance is from noon until sunset.

original: nyi ma nub pa'i dus mtshams la snang ba nye bar thob pa'i ye shes so //🔽tho rangs kyi dus mtshams la 'od gsal ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyi ma nub pa'i dus mtshams la snang ba nye bar thob pa'i ye shes so // tho rangs kyi dus mtshams la 'od gsal ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of clear light is from sunset until dawn.

original: nang gi mngon par byang chub pa ni dang po kha dog lnga pa'i 'od zer gyi rnam pa dang / gnyis pa ni du ba'i rnam pa dang / gsum pa ni srin bu me khyer gyi rnam pa dang / srin bu me khyer ni g-yo ba'i srog chags so //
analyzed: nang gi mngon par byang chub pa ni dang po kha dog lnga pa'i 'od zer gyi rnam pa dang / gnyis pa ni du ba'i rnam pa dang / gsum pa ni srin bu me khyer gyi rnam pa dang / srin bu me khyer ni g-yo ba'i srog chags so //
translated: The internal enlightenment is the first appearance of five-colored light rays, the second appearance of smoke, the third appearance of fireflies, and the fourth appearance of a butter lamp.

original: bzhi pa ni mar me'i rnam pa dang / lnga pa ni sprin med pa'i nam mkha' dang 'dra ba zhes bya bas rtags lnga mthong bas 'od gsal ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni mar me'i rnam pa dang / lnga pa ni sprin med pa'i nam mkha' dang 'dra ba zhes bya bas rtags lnga mthong bas 'od gsal ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: These are the five signs.

original: 'di dag ni nang nas nang gi mngon par byang chub kyi rim pas 'od gsal ba la zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni 'od gsal ba la zhugs nas so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni nang nas nang gi mngon par byang chub kyi rim pas 'od gsal ba la zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni 'od gsal ba la zhugs nas so //
translated: Having entered into clear light by means of the inner stages of manifest enlightenment, he enters into clear light.

original: rnyog pa'i dri ma thams cad ni 'dod chags dang 'dod chags par ma rnams so //
analyzed: rnyog pa'i dri ma thams cad ni 'dod chags dang 'dod chags par ma rnams so //
translated: All the stains of disturbance are desire and the desirous.

original: de dag dkrugs te yang gzhan gyi don bya ba'i phyir rim pa gsum pas ye shes kyi sku blangs nas sgyu ma la sogs pa'i dpe dang ldan pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag dkrugs te yang gzhan gyi don bya ba'i phyir rim pa gsum pas ye shes kyi sku blangs nas sgyu ma la sogs pa'i dpe dang ldan pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having churned them, he again takes up the body of wisdom by means of the third stage in order to act for the benefit of others, and becomes endowed with the perfection of omniscience, possessing the examples of the magical creation, etc.

original: gsang ba 'dus pa 'di la zhes bya ba nas dgongs pa ma yin pas bshad pa'o zhes pa'i bar du ni thos pa la sogs pa'i rim pas dpa' gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud du 'bad rtsol byed pas tshe 'di nyid du grub pa yin gyi pha rol du
analyzed: gsang ba 'dus pa 'di la zhes bya ba nas dgongs pa ma yin pas bshad pa'o zhes pa'i bar du ni thos pa la sogs pa'i rim pas dpa' gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud du 'bad rtsol byed pas tshe 'di nyid du grub pa yin gyi pha rol du
translated: From “This Guhyasamaja” up to “intentional explanation” is the explanation of the chapter.

original: phyin pa'i rnal 'byor pas bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis byang chub thob pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phyin pa'i rnal 'byor pas bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis byang chub thob pa ni ma yin no //
translated: By striving in the Guhyasamaja Tantra through the stages of hearing and so forth, one attains accomplishment in this very life, not by the perfection yogi’s attainment of enlightenment in three incalculable aeons.

original: zhe 'gyod pa skyes pa'i tsandan la sogs pa'i rigs can gyi byang chub sems dpa' mgu bar mi 'gyur ba yang byas so //
analyzed: zhe 'gyod pa skyes pa'i tsandan la sogs pa'i rigs can gyi byang chub sems dpa' mgu bar mi 'gyur ba yang byas so //
translated: And they also made the bodhisattvas of the sandalwood family and so forth who were born with regret not rejoice.

original: de dus rin po che lta bu'i gang zag gi rang bzhin de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis kye dbang po dman pa du ma zhig ces dbugs 'byung ba sbyin par byas so //
analyzed: de dus rin po che lta bu'i gang zag gi rang bzhin de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis kye dbang po dman pa du ma zhig ces dbugs 'byung ba sbyin par byas so //
translated: At that time, the tathagatas gave the gift of relief to those of the nature of a jewel-like person, saying, “Alas, many of you with inferior faculties.”

original: de rnams kyi sdug bsngal gsum gyi rgyu dang ldan pa'i du ba bstan to //
analyzed: de rnams kyi sdug bsngal gsum gyi rgyu dang ldan pa'i du ba bstan to //
translated: They taught the smoke-like cause of their three sufferings.

original: sdug bsngal ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'o //
translated: Suffering is the five appropriated aggregates.

original: de rnams kyi yang @141b sdug bsngal ni nad la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi yang @141b sdug bsngal ni nad la sogs pa'o //
translated: Their suffering is disease, etc.

original: 'gyur ba ni dmyal ba la sogs pa 'gro ba drug tu 'khor ba'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ba ni dmyal ba la sogs pa 'gro ba drug tu 'khor ba'o //
translated: Their change is the transmigration in the six destinies, such as hell.

original: de nyid sdug bsngal te ral bar byed pas so //
analyzed: de nyid sdug bsngal te ral bar byed pas so //
translated: That itself is suffering, because it afflicts.

original: 'du byed ni skye ba snga ma'i bag chags rnams so //
analyzed: 'du byed ni skye ba snga ma'i bag chags rnams so //
translated: Conditioned states are the residual impressions of former births.

original: de nyid sdug bsngal te de'i dbang gis skye ba lan pas so //
analyzed: de nyid sdug bsngal te de'i dbang gis skye ba lan pas so //
translated: That itself is suffering, because one is born under the influence of those.

original: yang na zhes bya ba ni phyogs gzhan sdug bsngal bar byed pa'i tshig phrad do //
analyzed: yang na zhes bya ba ni phyogs gzhan sdug bsngal bar byed pa'i tshig phrad do //
translated: Or, the phrase “or else” introduces another interpretation of suffering.

original: lus kyi sdug bsngal la ni nad la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyi sdug bsngal la ni nad la sogs pa'o //
translated: Suffering of the body is disease, etc.

original: ngag gi sdug bsngal ni rtsub mo'i tshig la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ngag gi sdug bsngal ni rtsub mo'i tshig la sogs pa'o //
translated: Suffering of speech is harsh words, etc.

original: yid kyi sdug bsngal ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyi sdug bsngal ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
translated: Suffering of mind is passion, etc.

original: de dag ji ltar mi myong ba dang ji ltar ming du zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de dag ji ltar mi myong ba dang ji ltar ming du zhes bya ste /
translated: How can they not experience them? How can they not be named?

original: rgyud 'di nyid la snod ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: rgyud 'di nyid la snod ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes 'dri ba'o //
translated: Because this very continuum is not a suitable vessel.

original: sku gsung thugs zhes pa ni tha mal pa'i lus la sogs pa sbyong bar byed pa khyad par gyi lha'i rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs zhes pa ni tha mal pa'i lus la sogs pa sbyong bar byed pa khyad par gyi lha'i rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa ston par byed pa'o //
translated: Body, speech, and mind refers to the manifestation of the special deities, Vairochana, etc., which purify the ordinary body, etc.

original: yi ge'i don no zhes pa ni khyad par gyi sku la sogs pa'i lha ston pas so ;
analyzed: yi ge'i don no zhes pa ni khyad par gyi sku la sogs pa'i lha ston pas so ;
translated: The meaning of the syllables refers to the manifestation of the special deities, body, etc.

original: ; yi ge gsum zhes pa ni aom dang a'a dang cha bzhi pa ston par byed pa'o //🔽spyi'i don zhes bya ba ni yi ge gsum las byung ba'i lha rnams bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ; yi ge gsum zhes pa ni aom dang a'a dang cha bzhi pa ston par byed pa'o // spyi'i don zhes bya ba ni yi ge gsum las byung ba'i lha rnams bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: The three syllables are the teaching of the four parts, Om, Ah, and Hum.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa dang ldan pa'i zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa dang ldan pa'i zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The general meaning is the teaching of the deities arisen from the three syllables, because it is said, endowed with the creation stage.

original: 'jug pa ni dga' ba'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa ni dga' ba'o //
translated: The entry is the joy.

original: gnas pa ni mchog tu dga' ba'o //
analyzed: gnas pa ni mchog tu dga' ba'o //
translated: The abiding is the supreme joy.

original: ldang ba ni dga' bral ba'o //
analyzed: ldang ba ni dga' bral ba'o //
translated: The emergence is the joyless joy.

original: sbas pa'o zhes pa ni 'dod chags kyi chos rab tu bstan pas so //🔽shes rab ni snang ba'i ye shes so //
analyzed: sbas pa'o zhes pa ni 'dod chags kyi chos rab tu bstan pas so // shes rab ni snang ba'i ye shes so //
translated: The hidden is the teaching of the Dharma of passion.🔽Wisdom is the light intuition.

original: thabs ni snang ba mched pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: thabs ni snang ba mched pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Means is the intuition of the light-increase.

original: nye bar thob pa zhes pa ni snang ba nye bar thob pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: nye bar thob pa zhes pa ni snang ba nye bar thob pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The attainment of the threshold is the pristine wisdom of the attainment of light.

original: mthar thug ba zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba'i mthar thug pa bstan pas so //
analyzed: mthar thug ba zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba'i mthar thug pa bstan pas so //
translated: The attainment of the culmination is the teaching of the culmination of clear light.

original: kye byang chub sems dpa' rnams de ltar ma sems shig / sangs rgyas kyi sa thob pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang ldan pa ni bdag cag gis kyang shin tu zab pa yin pas mi rtogs na /
analyzed: kye byang chub sems dpa' rnams de ltar ma sems shig / sangs rgyas kyi sa thob pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang ldan pa ni bdag cag gis kyang shin tu zab pa yin pas mi rtogs na /
translated: “O Bodhisattvas, do not think like that! Even we have not realized the attainment of the Buddha ground, the perfect enlightenment, because it is extremely profound.

original: khyed rnams kyis thob pa de smos ci dgos zhes bya ba de lta bu de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbugs dbyung ba thos nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang mi smra bar 'gyur to zhes bstan to //
analyzed: khyed rnams kyis thob pa de smos ci dgos zhes bya ba de lta bu de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbugs dbyung ba thos nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang mi smra bar 'gyur to zhes bstan to //
translated: How much less could you attain it?” Having heard this exhalation of the Tathagata, the Bodhisattvas will become speechless.

original: dgongs pa yin pas bshad pa zhes bya ba ni shin tu gsal ba'i de kho na nyid bstan pas so //
analyzed: dgongs pa yin pas bshad pa zhes bya ba ni shin tu gsal ba'i de kho na nyid bstan pas so //
translated: The explanation of the intention is the teaching of the extremely clear reality.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba nas 'di'i don @142a * //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba nas 'di'i don @142a * //
translated: Thus, etc.

original: bshad zin to zhes pa'i bar du ni dkyil 'khor ma lus pa sku la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi yi ge gsum la 'jug cing /
analyzed: bshad zin to zhes pa'i bar du ni dkyil 'khor ma lus pa sku la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi yi ge gsum la 'jug cing /
translated: Up to “explained” indicates that all the maṇḍalas enter into the three syllables of the nature of the body, and so on.

original: yi ge gnyis po yang yi ge h'um tsam las zhugs nas bdag gis bya ba byas so zhes dgongs pas snyoms pa'i bde ba'i dbang gis bcom ldan 'das 'od gsal ba la 'jug go zhes bstan to //
analyzed: yi ge gnyis po yang yi ge h'um tsam las zhugs nas bdag gis bya ba byas so zhes dgongs pas snyoms pa'i bde ba'i dbang gis bcom ldan 'das 'od gsal ba la 'jug go zhes bstan to //
translated: The two syllables also enter into the single syllable hūṃ, and the Bhagavān enters into clear light by the power of the bliss of union, thinking, “I have done my work.”

original: de ltar zhes bya ba nas gsan par mdzod cig ces bya ba dgongs so zhes pa'i bar du ni thog ma nas grub pa'i tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi'i ngo bo spyan ma la sogs pas /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba nas gsan par mdzod cig ces bya ba dgongs so zhes pa'i bar du ni thog ma nas grub pa'i tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi'i ngo bo spyan ma la sogs pas /
translated: “ Thus” up to “listen” indicates that Locanā, and so on, who are the nature of the four original abodes of Brahmā,

original: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das thim par gyur pa las bskul bar mdzad pa de bstan to //
analyzed: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das thim par gyur pa las bskul bar mdzad pa de bstan to //
translated: indicate how the Bhagavān is aroused from his dissolution.

original: de ni las kyi rgyal ba mchog gi ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: de ni las kyi rgyal ba mchog gi ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: This is the samādhi of the supreme victorious action.

original: 'dir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag po yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni rnam par snang mdzad de dang por gyur pas so //
analyzed: 'dir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag po yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni rnam par snang mdzad de dang por gyur pas so //
translated: Here, since he is the lord of all the Tathagatas, all the Tathagatas are Vairocana, since he is the first.

original: spyan dga' ba zhes pa ni 'khyud pa la dga' ba'o //
analyzed: spyan dga' ba zhes pa ni 'khyud pa la dga' ba'o //
translated: The joy of the eyes is the joy of embracing.

original: drug ldan la sogs pa zhes pa ni dbyangs kyi khyad par gyis so //
analyzed: drug ldan la sogs pa zhes pa ni dbyangs kyi khyad par gyis so //
translated: The six-fold and so on refers to the particular tones.

original: sgeg cing ni 'jam pa'i dbyangs so //
analyzed: sgeg cing ni 'jam pa'i dbyangs so //
translated: The playful is the sweet voice.

original: de dang bcas pa ni snyan pa'i dbyangs te tshig snyan pa de rnams kyis so //
analyzed: de dang bcas pa ni snyan pa'i dbyangs te tshig snyan pa de rnams kyis so //
translated: With that, the sweet voice, by those sweet words.

original: sems can thams cad ces bya ba ni sa'i khams kyi rang bzhin nam sems can nam snod kyi 'jig rten gyi rang bzhin te de'i bdag nyid ni rnam par snang mdzad de gzugs kyi phung po rnam par dag pa yin pas so //
analyzed: sems can thams cad ces bya ba ni sa'i khams kyi rang bzhin nam sems can nam snod kyi 'jig rten gyi rang bzhin te de'i bdag nyid ni rnam par snang mdzad de gzugs kyi phung po rnam par dag pa yin pas so //
translated: All beings means the nature of the earth element or the nature of the world of sentient beings or the world of the vessel, and its nature is Vairocana, since he is the purification of the form aggregate.

original: khams gsum zhes pa ni 'dod pa la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: khams gsum zhes pa ni 'dod pa la sogs pa la'o //
translated: The three realms are the desire realm and so on.

original: chos kyi rgyal srid ni gti mug rnam par dag pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi rgyal srid ni gti mug rnam par dag pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The dharma kingdom is due to attaining the purification of delusion.

original: mdun ma gnas pa zhes bya ba ni chags pa che bas mdun du bzhugs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mdun ma gnas pa zhes bya ba ni chags pa che bas mdun du bzhugs pa bzhin no //
translated: The one called “the one who remains in front” is like one who remains in front because of great attachment.

original: thugs dbang du gyur pa mnyes pa zhes pa ni me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi thugs kyi rang bzhin nyid mdzad pas so //
analyzed: thugs dbang du gyur pa mnyes pa zhes pa ni me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi thugs kyi rang bzhin nyid mdzad pas so //
translated: The one called “the one who pleases by the power of the mind” is the one who acts by the nature of the mind of mirror-like primordial wisdom.

original: rol pa ni snyoms par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: rol pa ni snyoms par zhugs pa'o //
translated: The one called “the one who plays” is the one who enters into union.

original: tshim par byed pa ni dga' bar byed pas so //
analyzed: tshim par byed pa ni dga' bar byed pas so //
translated: The one called “the one who satisfies” is the one who delights.

original: dga' ba yid 'ong zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: dga' ba yid 'ong zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: The one called “the one who delights in pleasure” is clear light.

original: skyed pas ni de byed pa'o //
analyzed: skyed pas ni de byed pa'o //
translated: The one called “the one who generates” is the one who creates that.

original: 'khyud pa la sogs pa zhes pa ni tsum ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: 'khyud pa la sogs pa zhes pa ni tsum ba la sogs pas so //
translated: The one called “the one who embraces” and so forth is the one who does kissing and so forth.

original: sems can thams cad skyed pa'i rgyud ces pa ni sems can gyi rigs bzhi'i rgyur gyur bas so //
analyzed: sems can thams cad skyed pa'i rgyud ces pa ni sems can gyi rigs bzhi'i rgyur gyur bas so //
translated: The one called “the tantra that generates all sentient beings” is the one who is the cause of the four types of sentient beings.

original: thams cad kyi gzhi nis yin pas gzhi'am rgyu nyid do //
analyzed: thams cad kyi gzhi nis yin pas gzhi'am rgyu nyid do //
translated: The one called “the basis of all” is the basis or cause of all.

original: phan pa dang bde ba byed pas @142b zhes pa ni mthong ba dang mi mthong ba'i bde ba ster ba yin pas so //
analyzed: phan pa dang bde ba byed pas @142b zhes pa ni mthong ba dang mi mthong ba'i bde ba ster ba yin pas so //
translated: The one called “the one who creates benefit and happiness” is the one who bestows seen and unseen happiness.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi nad na thugs kyi ngo bo yin pas thugs ni mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi nad na thugs kyi ngo bo yin pas thugs ni mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: Since he is the essence of the mind of all the Tathagatas, the mind is Akshobhya.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi ngo bo yin pas 'phags pa yang yin la m'a ma k'i yang yin pas 'phags pa m'a ma k'i'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi ngo bo yin pas 'phags pa yang yin la m'a ma k'i yang yin pas 'phags pa m'a ma k'i'o //
translated: Since he is the essence of the wisdom of the Dharmadhatu, he is the Arya, and since he is Mamaki, he is the Arya Mamaki.

original: tha mal pa ma yin pa zhes pa ni lha'i rnam pa'i bsgom pas na khyad par dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: tha mal pa ma yin pa zhes pa ni lha'i rnam pa'i bsgom pas na khyad par dang ldan pa ste /
translated: Not ordinary means that he is distinguished by the meditation on the form of the deity.

original: 'dod chags kyi rnam par dag pa bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi rnam par dag pa bskyed pa'o //
translated: He generates the purification of the aspect of passion.

original: dga' ba ni snyoms par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba ni snyoms par zhugs pa'o //
translated: Delight is the state of union.

original: zhugs pa ste zhes pa ni spyod pa'am rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhugs pa ste zhes pa ni spyod pa'am rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The state of union is the practice or the completion.

original: mi 'jig pa'i sku dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni rdo rje'i sku yin pas so //
analyzed: mi 'jig pa'i sku dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni rdo rje'i sku yin pas so //
translated: Since he possesses the indestructible body, he is the vajra body.

original: bka'i 'khor lo ni sprul ba'i sku spro ba'o //
analyzed: bka'i 'khor lo ni sprul ba'i sku spro ba'o //
translated: The wheel of the command is the emanation of the nirmanakaya.

original: de skor bar mdzad pa ni skyed par mdzad pas sems can mang po la phan pa rjes su brtse ba ni khyod yin no //
analyzed: de skor bar mdzad pa ni skyed par mdzad pas sems can mang po la phan pa rjes su brtse ba ni khyod yin no //
translated: Since he turns that wheel, he generates it, and he is the one who is kind to many beings.

original: phung po lnga zhas pa ni de rnam par dag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po lnga zhas pa ni de rnam par dag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The five aggregates are so called because they are purified.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa zhes pa ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pas sbyor ba bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas ye shes kyi sku'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa zhes pa ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pas sbyor ba bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas ye shes kyi sku'o //
translated: The conventional truth is the body of intuition, which is attained by the process of self-consecration, which is the process of the purification of the mind.

original: don dam pa zhes pa ni rim pa bzhi pas 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: don dam pa zhes pa ni rim pa bzhi pas 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: The ultimate truth is the clearlight transparency, which is attained by the fourth process.

original: de gnyis yang dag par 'dus pa zhes pa ni rim pa gsum pa dang bzhi pa bsdus pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de gnyis yang dag par 'dus pa zhes pa ni rim pa gsum pa dang bzhi pa bsdus pa las byung ba'o //
translated: The union of the two is the great seal, which is attained by the union of the third and fourth processes.

original: bde ba chen po'i sku ste zhes pa ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pas rdo rje sku des ston pas so //
analyzed: bde ba chen po'i sku ste zhes pa ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pas rdo rje sku des ston pas so //
translated: The body of great bliss is the vajra body, which is taught by the process of union.

original: 'dod chags rnam par spyod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'dod chags rnam par spyod pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of the purification of passion,

original: zhes pa ni kun du chags pa'i 'dod chags rnam par sbyangs bas so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni kun du chags pa'i 'dod chags rnam par sbyangs bas so //
translated: because of the purification of the passion of attachment.

original: 'dod chags la spyod pa'i ngo bo nyid ces pa ni de kho na nyid la chags pa'i spyod pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: 'dod chags la spyod pa'i ngo bo nyid ces pa ni de kho na nyid la chags pa'i spyod pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The nature of the practice of passion is the nature of the practice of attachment to reality.

original: 'od dpag tu med pa ni chos bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'od dpag tu med pa ni chos bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Amitābha is the teacher of the Dharma.

original: gsung gi ngo bo yin pas 'gro ba 'dul bar mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsung gi ngo bo yin pas 'gro ba 'dul bar mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since he is the essence of speech, he acts to tame beings.

original: de'i sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'i spyan ni zhes pa ni sku la sogs pa mnyes par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: de'i sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'i spyan ni zhes pa ni sku la sogs pa mnyes par mdzad pa'o //
translated: His vajra eyes of body, speech, and mind are pleased, that is, he is pleased with body, etc.

original: ngag gi dbang phyug mnyes pas zhes pa ni yan lag drug cu'i sku gsung dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: ngag gi dbang phyug mnyes pas zhes pa ni yan lag drug cu'i sku gsung dang ldan pas so //
translated: Since he is pleased with the lord of speech, that is, since he possesses the body and speech of sixty aspects.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mchog tu thugs rje che ba'i bdag nyid do zhes pa ni thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mchog tu thugs rje che ba'i bdag nyid do zhes pa ni thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa ste /
translated: For that very reason, he is the nature of supreme great compassion, that is, he possesses great compassion.

original: dmyal ba la sogs pa las gdon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmyal ba la sogs pa las gdon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he delivers from the hells, etc.

original: de'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the means for that,
