original: tshangs pa'i gnas bzhis zhes pa ni byams pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i gnas bzhis zhes pa ni byams pa la sogs pas so //
translated: he is endowed with the four abodes of Brahmā, that is, with love, etc.

original: @143a * // dgongs pa'i don mdzad pa zhes pa ni sangs rgyas nyid thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @143a * // dgongs pa'i don mdzad pa zhes pa ni sangs rgyas nyid thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He acts for the purpose of the intended meaning, that is, in order to attain buddhahood.

original: dus thams cad ces bya ba ni ma chad pas so //
analyzed: dus thams cad ces bya ba ni ma chad pas so //
translated: At all times means without interruption.

original: shin tu dga' bas zhes pa ni spyod pa dang bcas pas spyod pas so //
analyzed: shin tu dga' bas zhes pa ni spyod pa dang bcas pas spyod pas so //
translated: With great joy means with practice, since he practices.

original: dge ba ni thar pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba ni thar pa'o //
translated: Virtue is liberation.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs ni las thams cad pa yin pas so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs ni las thams cad pa yin pas so //
translated: The body, speech, and mind of all the Tathagatas are all activities.

original: 'phags ma sgrol ma ni dam tshig sgrol ma'o //
analyzed: 'phags ma sgrol ma ni dam tshig sgrol ma'o //
translated: Noble Tara is the pledge Tara.

original: rang bzhin brgya drug cu'i spyod pa zhes pa ni nyin mo dang mtshan mos so //
analyzed: rang bzhin brgya drug cu'i spyod pa zhes pa ni nyin mo dang mtshan mos so //
translated: The conduct of the one hundred and sixty natures is by day and night.

original: 'gags shing zhes pa ni shes rab dang thabs dang nye bar thob pa'i ngo bo sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas spangs nas so //
analyzed: 'gags shing zhes pa ni shes rab dang thabs dang nye bar thob pa'i ngo bo sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas spangs nas so //
translated: Having stopped, by the process of mantra and seal, the nature of wisdom, means, and near attainment, one should give up.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: sgyu ma dag ni thams cad las //
analyzed: sgyu ma dag ni thams cad las //
translated: Among all the illusions,

original: bud med sgyu ma khyad par 'phags //
analyzed: bud med sgyu ma khyad par 'phags //
translated: the illusion of a woman is supreme.

original: snang ba gsum gyi dbye ba ni //
analyzed: snang ba gsum gyi dbye ba ni //
translated: The division of the three appearances

original: 'di nyid las ni mtshon par 'gyur //🔽zhes 'byung bas so //
analyzed: 'di nyid las ni mtshon par 'gyur // zhes 'byung bas so //
translated: is indicated by this very [verse].

original: ye shes kyi nyid kyis zhes pa ni snang ba dang snang ba mched pa dang snang ba nye bar thob pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi nyid kyis zhes pa ni snang ba dang snang ba mched pa dang snang ba nye bar thob pa'o //
translated: The self-appearance of wisdom is the appearance, the great appearance, and the near attainment of appearance.

original: nyid ni de rnams nub pa ste sngar bshad pa'i rim pas so //
analyzed: nyid ni de rnams nub pa ste sngar bshad pa'i rim pas so //
translated: The self is their disappearance, by the process explained above.

original: thams cad stong par zhugs pa zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad stong par zhugs pa zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba la zhugs pa'o //
translated: The phrase having entered into the state of total emptiness means having entered into the state of utter lucidity.

original: stong pa shin tu stong pa dang // gsum pa stong pa chen pa ste //
analyzed: stong pa shin tu stong pa dang // gsum pa stong pa chen pa ste //
translated: The three states of emptiness are the state of emptiness, the state of utter emptiness, and the state of great emptiness.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dbye bas so //
translated: They are distinguished in terms of their causes and results.

original: zhes 'byung bas lta ba ste zhes pa ni sems can rnam par dag pa'i rim pas 'od gsal ba'i ting nge 'dzin la zhugs par gzigs nas so //
analyzed: zhes 'byung bas lta ba ste zhes pa ni sems can rnam par dag pa'i rim pas 'od gsal ba'i ting nge 'dzin la zhugs par gzigs nas so //
translated: Thus, the view means that the transcendent ones see that sentient beings have entered into the state of utter lucidity through the process of their own purification.

original: skul bar byed pa ni sad par byed pa ste /
analyzed: skul bar byed pa ni sad par byed pa ste /
translated: Stimulating means arousing.

original: sems can gyi don byed pa'i phyir skul bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi don byed pa'i phyir skul bar byed pa'o //
translated: Arousing means arousing sentient beings in order to benefit them.

original: gzhan du ni chad pa'i phyogs su thal bar 'gyur ba dang / dbang phyug chen po'i lta ba las ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du ni chad pa'i phyogs su thal bar 'gyur ba dang / dbang phyug chen po'i lta ba las ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the transcendent ones would fall into the extreme of nihilism, and they would not have turned away from the view of a great Īśvara.

original: rtag pa dang ni chad pa'i phyogs //
analyzed: rtag pa dang ni chad pa'i phyogs //
translated: The two extremes are the extreme of eternalism and the extreme of nihilism.

original: gang zhig spangs nas rab 'jug pa //
analyzed: gang zhig spangs nas rab 'jug pa //
translated: Having abandoned them, they enter into the middle way.

original: zhes zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is stated in the Stage of Utterly Pure Reality:

original: don yod grub pa'i sgo nas bos pa zhes pa ni dam tshig sgrol ma ni las kyi rigs yin pa dang / 'khor ba dang bdag po'i 'brel pa dang mtshungs pas bcom ldan 'das bod pa ni rigs so //
analyzed: don yod grub pa'i sgo nas bos pa zhes pa ni dam tshig sgrol ma ni las kyi rigs yin pa dang / 'khor ba dang bdag po'i 'brel pa dang mtshungs pas bcom ldan 'das bod pa ni rigs so //
translated: The phrase invoking through Amoghasiddhi means that Samayatārā is of the action family, and because of the relationship of samsara and ownership, the invocation is of the Bhagavān.

original: rdo rje dang padma mnyam par sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni phyag rgya legs par sbyangs pa sngon du 'gro bar rdo rje dang padma sbyar bas so //
analyzed: rdo rje dang padma mnyam par sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni phyag rgya legs par sbyangs pa sngon du 'gro bar rdo rje dang padma sbyar bas so //
translated: The phrase the union of the vajra and lotus means that the deities of the mandala are emanated by the union of the vajra and lotus, preceded by the training in the mudra.

original: phyung ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams kyis zhes pa ni badzra dhrik ces bya ba la sogs pas phyung ba'i sngags kyi reg bya rdo rje ma'i chos @143b 'byung gi nang na dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor spro ba las 'byung ba mi bskyod pa la sogs pa de
analyzed: phyung ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams kyis zhes pa ni badzra dhrik ces bya ba la sogs pas phyung ba'i sngags kyi reg bya rdo rje ma'i chos @143b 'byung gi nang na dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor spro ba las 'byung ba mi bskyod pa la sogs pa de
translated: The phrase the deities of the mandala that are emanated means that the mantra vajra-dhṛk and so forth emanate the deities Akṣobhya and so forth, who arise from the emanation of the mandala of the pledge beings within the sphere of phenomena of the vajra-touching goddess.

original: bzhin gshegs pa dang byang chub sems dpa' dang lha mo dang khro mo rnams kyis so //
analyzed: bzhin gshegs pa dang byang chub sems dpa' dang lha mo dang khro mo rnams kyis so //
translated: Those deities are the tathāgatas, bodhisattvas, goddesses, and wrathful ones.

original: zhe sdang la sogs pa'i sems can gyi khams rnam par sbyong bas na zhes pa ni padma'i nang du phyir mi ldog pa'i dbang bskur byin nas rgyas btab cing phyi rol du spros te /
analyzed: zhe sdang la sogs pa'i sems can gyi khams rnam par sbyong bas na zhes pa ni padma'i nang du phyir mi ldog pa'i dbang bskur byin nas rgyas btab cing phyi rol du spros te /
translated: Since it purifies the realms of sentient beings with anger and so on, means that after bestowing the empowerment of irreversibility within the lotus, it seals and emanates externally.

original: zhe sdang la sogs pa lngas khyab pa'i sems can gyi khams bstan pa la sogs pa'i rnam par sbyang zhing /
analyzed: zhe sdang la sogs pa lngas khyab pa'i sems can gyi khams bstan pa la sogs pa'i rnam par sbyang zhing /
translated: It purifies the realms of sentient beings pervaded by the five, such as anger, and so on.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing la rab tu 'jug pas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing la rab tu 'jug pas so //
translated: Since it enters the buddhafield,

original: de ni dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog / ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: de ni dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog / ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: this is the samadhi called “Victorious Mandala.”

original: 'dir gal te de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sgo nas sems can gyi don bstan pa de bzhin du yang bya ba nan tan grub pa'i gtso bo yin pas don yod grub pa la dbang ba yin te las kyi rigs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir gal te de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sgo nas sems can gyi don bstan pa de bzhin du yang bya ba nan tan grub pa'i gtso bo yin pas don yod grub pa la dbang ba yin te las kyi rigs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, if the benefit of sentient beings is taught through all the tathagatas, then since it is the principal of successful activities, it is the lord of Amoghasiddhi, because it is the karma family.

original: bstan pa la sogs pa'i bya ba ni las te /
analyzed: bstan pa la sogs pa'i bya ba ni las te /
translated: The activity is the action of teaching and so on.

original: gtso bor gyur pa'i rigs ni las kyi rigs te /
analyzed: gtso bor gyur pa'i rigs ni las kyi rigs te /
translated: The principal family is the karma family.

original: rlung gi khams kyi ngo bo yin pas so //
analyzed: rlung gi khams kyi ngo bo yin pas so //
translated: Because it is the essence of the wind element.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dam tshig gi mchog go //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dam tshig gi mchog go //
translated: And for that very reason, it is the supreme commitment.

original: sems can gyi don bya ba dang dam tshig yin gyi gzhan ni dam tshig tsam mo ste de'i yan lag yin pas so //
analyzed: sems can gyi don bya ba dang dam tshig yin gyi gzhan ni dam tshig tsam mo ste de'i yan lag yin pas so //
translated: It is the commitment of the benefit of sentient beings, but the others are merely commitments, because they are its branches.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:🔽Hatred, delusion, desire,

original: zhe sdang gti mug 'dod chags dang // yid bzhin nor bu dam tshig ste //
analyzed: zhe sdang gti mug 'dod chags dang // yid bzhin nor bu dam tshig ste //
translated: the wish-fulfilling gem, and the commitment,

original: rigs ni de dag lnga po ni //🔽'dod dang thar pa rab sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: rigs ni de dag lnga po ni // 'dod dang thar pa rab sgrub pa'o //
translated: these five families

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: are the means of attaining desire and liberation.

original: 'dod chags la spyod pa'i sems can rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni de'i rigs kyi rang bzhin gyi gang zag rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la spyod pa'i sems can rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni de'i rigs kyi rang bzhin gyi gang zag rnams kyi'o //
translated: The sentient beings who practice desire are those who are of the nature of that family.

original: 'dod chags rnam par dag pa'i thabs kyis zhes pa ni 'dod chags kyi sgras snang ba mched pa'i ye shes kyi 'brel pa can gyi rang bzhin bzhi bcu bstan to //
analyzed: 'dod chags rnam par dag pa'i thabs kyis zhes pa ni 'dod chags kyi sgras snang ba mched pa'i ye shes kyi 'brel pa can gyi rang bzhin bzhi bcu bstan to //
translated: The method of purifying desire is the method of purifying the desire that is related to the gnosis of the increase of appearance.

original: de rnams kyi rnam par dag pa ni sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas spong ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rnam par dag pa ni sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas spong ba'o //
translated: The purification of those is the abandonment by the stages of mantra and seal.

original: de nyid thabs ni gnyen po'i phyogs so //
analyzed: de nyid thabs ni gnyen po'i phyogs so //
translated: That itself is the means, the antidote.

original: des ni gnyen po'i phyogs kyi thabs kyis so //
analyzed: des ni gnyen po'i phyogs kyi thabs kyis so //
translated: By that, by the means of the antidote.

original: byang chub rab tu rtsol bas na //
analyzed: byang chub rab tu rtsol bas na //
translated: By striving for enlightenment,

original: zhes pa ni snang ba mched pa'i rang bzhin spong bas 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid mngon du byed pas so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni snang ba mched pa'i rang bzhin spong bas 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid mngon du byed pas so //
translated: means by abandoning the nature of the increase of appearance, one realizes the reality of clear light.

original: de nyid kyi phyir phan yon che'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir phan yon che'o //
translated: For that very reason, it is of great benefit.

original: phan pa yang yin la chen po yang yin pas na phan chen ni thar pa'i go 'phang ngo //🔽de @144a * //
analyzed: phan pa yang yin la chen po yang yin pas na phan chen ni thar pa'i go 'phang ngo // de @144a * //
translated: Since it is beneficial and great, great benefit is the state of liberation.🔽That itself is the meaning, that which has the purpose.

original: nyid don ni dgos pa gang la yod pa zhes bya ba la 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba'i 'bru mang po bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: nyid don ni dgos pa gang la yod pa zhes bya ba la 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba'i 'bru mang po bsdu ba'o //
translated: In the compound of many grains preceded by grasping,🔽those who have arisen from the Śākya lineage,

original: sh'akya'i rigs las byung ba rnams kyi zhes pa ni nges par gzung ba'i drug pa'o //
analyzed: sh'akya'i rigs las byung ba rnams kyi zhes pa ni nges par gzung ba'i drug pa'o //
translated: the sixth case is for the purpose of specification.

original: sh'akya'i rigs las byung ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa dang byang chub sems dpa' dang lha mo rnams dang khro bo ste dkyil 'khor rnams so //
analyzed: sh'akya'i rigs las byung ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa dang byang chub sems dpa' dang lha mo rnams dang khro bo ste dkyil 'khor rnams so //
translated: Those who have arisen from the Śākya lineage are the maṇḍalas of the tathāgatas, bodhisattvas, goddesses, and wrathful ones.

original: de rnams kyi nang du mchog tu gyur pa ni rgyan dang 'dra bar gyur pas so //
analyzed: de rnams kyi nang du mchog tu gyur pa ni rgyan dang 'dra bar gyur pas so //
translated: Among them, the supreme one is like an ornament.

original: rgyan dang 'dra ba ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i nang na rta mchog ni 'gro ba'i don bya ba la nus pa dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: rgyan dang 'dra ba ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i nang na rta mchog ni 'gro ba'i don bya ba la nus pa dang ldan pas so //
translated: Like an ornament, the supreme horse among the Tathagatas, Akshobhya, etc. , is endowed with the ability to perform the aims of going.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir yang na zhes bya ba ni go sla'o //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir yang na zhes bya ba ni go sla'o //
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says, or else, which is easy to understand.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi rnam par dbye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sems can rnams kyi rang bzhin gyi rnam par rtog pa ji srid yod pa de srid ni 'khor ba'o //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi rnam par dbye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sems can rnams kyi rang bzhin gyi rnam par rtog pa ji srid yod pa de srid ni 'khor ba'o //
translated: The distinction between self and other, etc. , is samsara, as long as there is the natural imagination of beings.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: nga rgyal las ni rab skyes pa //
analyzed: nga rgyal las ni rab skyes pa //
translated: From pride, it is born,

original: bdag gi byed par nye bar 'phel //🔽skye bo phan par nges smra bas //
analyzed: bdag gi byed par nye bar 'phel // skye bo phan par nges smra bas //
translated: and the self-habit increases.🔽The one who speaks for the benefit of beings

original: skye dgu ma lus 'di ltar gsungs //
analyzed: skye dgu ma lus 'di ltar gsungs //
translated: teaches this to all people.

original: 'dod chags zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'dod chags te rang bzhin bzhi bcu mi mthun pa dang / nyi ma'i snang ba dang 'dra ba snang ba mched pa'i ye shes ni gnyen po'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'dod chags te rang bzhin bzhi bcu mi mthun pa dang / nyi ma'i snang ba dang 'dra ba snang ba mched pa'i ye shes ni gnyen po'o //
translated: Attachment and so on. Attachment is the forty natural discordances, and the wisdom of increasing light, which is like the light of the sun, is the antidote.

translated: Freedom from attachment is the thirty-three natural discordances, and the wisdom of light, which is like the light of the moon, is the antidote.

original: 'dod chags par ma ni rang bzhin bdun mi mthun pa dang / mtshams kyi snang ba dang 'dra ba snang ba nye bar thob pa'i ye shes ni gnyen po'o //

translated: The nature of the seven is incompatible with the appearance of the junction, and the pristine consciousness of the appearance of the attainment of appearance is the antidote.

original: 'od gsal ba zhes pa ni ye shes gsum dang bral bas nyi ma dang zla ba dang mtshams kyi snang ba dang 'dra ba sprin med pa'i nam mkha' dang 'dra ba ste de kho na nyid bzhi pa'o //

translated: Since the fourth reality is free from the three pristine consciousnesses, it is like the appearance of the sun, moon, and junction, like a cloudless sky.

original: de nyid ye shes kyi gnyen por gyur pas na ye shes so //
analyzed: de nyid ye shes kyi gnyen por gyur pas na ye shes so //
